Toxic farts will over rule everything else in the end, as the dog sleeps in our bedroom.This one does it for me in everything but price, at least her on Amazon, where the current options are more than double my ideal price point, with shipping, and no subscribe & save option to make it more affordable. Big box pet stores sell the large bag for under $60 with no sales and free shipping, but still a bit rich for me, as our dog goes through about 8-10 lbs of premium food a week, or more of the cheaper (which I typically avoid because of the giant poops).All things being equal, however, I'd get him this, as he really seems to dig it, and he's generally a pretty indifferent eater.

I was super excited to get this and tried it out immediately in my fire pit. I took a branch about an inch in diameter and ran it across the grater several times. It was remarkably easy to get a small pile of tinder, it took me about 10 minutes but after I got the hang of it it went really quick. I then carefully placed the little pile on a log and used the fire starter. It took me 5 tries to light the tinder but I am brand new at this!  Once the little pile caught fire I carefully added to it and voila it grew!  I love this handy little tool! It really made starting the fire both easy and fun. I think these would be perfect for people with fire pits, for campers, or for anyone who lives in a place that gets cold to keep in their car.

This brush is huge but I love it so much! The curve makes it feel so good on my head that it's almost like getting a head massage as you brush! It's sturdy and strong and really works good on my long thick hair. The wide spread bristles work good on tangles without getting caught or pulling out my hair. It's my absolute new favorite brush. I received a free sample in exchange for an unbiased review.

This shampoo and conditioner smell freaking amazing!  Not only that but they work. Wow! I am really impressed with how much different my hair felt after just one wash. I've used them several times now and it just keeps getting better and better! The pump bottles are a generous size and so handy in the shower. They were well packaged to prevent any leakage too which was nice! I received complimentary samples in exchange for my unbiased review and I'm thrilled with them!

This suits our needs perfectly! On the weekends I like to do a lot of prep work for our baby's food so I will do large batches of veggies and fruit. This container is the perfect size and the silicone makes it so easy to just pop out one portion. It makes meal time so much easier. The bright orange color is pretty too! I received this product for free in exchange for my unbiased review.

I was happy to find a tanning lotion that actually turns my skin the correct color so for that alone, this product is awesome! The application was pretty easy, you just have to take your time to get everywhere and spread it evenly. The smell is typical of this type of product and it's a little on the strong side but not really unpleasant. You wouldn't want to leave the house with it on though. I showered after 3 hours and the result was a very nice even tan. Yay! The reason I'm only giving it 4 stars is because I really feel like the price is exorbitant. Other than that, it's great!

I've been using this system for a couple of weeks and I've seen an improvement in my skin. I use it twice a day as needed and occasionally use the spot treatment more often if I have a particularly stubborn blemish. My skin did take a couple days to get used to it and for the first 2-3 days it was redder than normal, but it adjusted pretty quickly. I follow up the treatments with a good moisturizer with sunscreen in it and then apply my make-up.Update: The redness kept showing up and now I'm noticing some very dry patches that I've never had before. Coconut oil is working a little but I have decided to stop using this acne treatment and try something without so many adverse issues.

This is super handy to take to work and tastes the same to me as the creamer I get in the little cups. It's a generous sized container that will last me awhile and the convenience is awesome. I love the French Vanilla flavor, it's not too strong but just adds a slight vanilla taste and makes your coffee creamier. Delicious!

I started taking a vitamin D3 supplement since my doctor told me my level was really low. In my area in the winter time my level always gets low and this is a good way to keep it where it should be. After taking this product for a couple of weeks I could notice some changes in my mood and attitude and just overall well being. It's something I will continue to use until my level is where it should be.

Our little guy is just starting to eat using a spoon and he loves feeding himself. We gave him a bowl of this and he got really excited and ate the whole bowl! It's messy but what isn't at this age?  We like that it's nutritious and that he loves it and can do it himself. This is a win win in our house!

I'm torn with this product because it does work but it tastes so terrible that it makes me dread taking it. It's supposed to be orange flavor and I guess I see why they can call it orange, but wow it's really not what you'd expect. I have tasted other liquid medicine that has managed to disguise the medicinal taste successfully so I know it's possible but this product has just not achieved it. I would use this only if I absolutely needed quicker relief than taking a bill could bring.

This is a very sturdy and well made wallet that is much nicer than I anticipated it to be. The feel is of a nice soft leather, the stitching is nice and there is plenty of space to hold everything you'd need. I like that the logo is subtle and that there are enough pockets to keep things organized. The RFID blocking is an excellent bonus. I received the wallet for free in exchange for an unbiased review and I'm very pleased!

This is a very nice wallet that comes in a great box perfect for gift giving. There are 4 pockets plus a zippered pocket and plenty of spots for lots of credit cards or business cards. The zipper around the outside is substantial and works easily. The quilted wallet feels good in my hand and seems very durable!  I received this wallet for free in exchange for an unbiased review.

This is a really lovely set of very long handled brushes.  They are definitely better suited for adults than for children due to the size. The bristles are pointy and stiff at first and take a bit of working with your fingers to soften them up to use. They do seem securely attached though, I tried to pull some out and couldn't. Overall a very nice set. I received the brushes free in exchange for my unbiased review.

Learning about Rosemary and her life was both heartbreaking and enlightening. The author's research to tell this story is way above and beyond and we learn some things that I'm sure the Kennedy family wishes we didn't know. The story made me so angry towards Joe and Rose, Rosemary's parents, for the way they treated her. Yes, Rosemary was well cared for because the family had money, but she certainly was not well loved by her parents... in fact quite the opposite. They basically wanted to hide her away and forget she existed, as if she were nothing more than a bother to them. It was truly disgraceful.A couple parts of the story were pretty hard to read because of the horror of knowing they'd happened, the first one being the story of Rosemary's birth which left me stunned and horrified and the second was the description of the lobotomy. Both parts were disturbing to say the least and left me feeling very emotional. However, that being said, I am so glad that I read this book and learned Rosemary's story as it certainly deserves to be told and heard. I have the utmost respect for the author for her research and dedication as well.

These cups are awesome! We do use some for drinking purposes and they're great for that especially with all of the kids because you don't have to worry about them breaking, but we use plenty for craft purposes too. They hold water for water-color painting, paint, they're great to draw circles too! The kids have made bells and homemade musical instruments. They've also used them to plant things!  All it takes is some creative imagination and these cups can do lots of things. The price is good for the amount you get too!

These are really handy for training babies!  The size is nice and roomy and they are very absorbing. I like the sides that easy release for number two mistakes. Love these and the kids like to stay with their Huggies brand!

I've been using the slider bags for a long time and I love them! They are so easy to open and close, they're nice and thick, and they keep things fresh a long time. A bonus for us is that they're easy for the kids to use too.

I wanted to try this product because of some knee pain that I have. I talked with my dr and we decided it was safe to try. I've been using it for about 2 weeks and I have actually noticed some relief from the pain and some increased range of motion. I am very hopeful that with continued use it will get even better, but so far so good!

This backpack is really awesome! It's so sturdy and well made. It's so well made and you can tell it's really strong and durable. It fit my laptop and all of my supplies perfectly. The pockets are deep and there are LOTS of them! I love the fact that I can carry all of my gear and be so well organized. As an extra bonus it's really stylish looking and would work well for a male or female. I will get a lot of use out of this product! I received the backpack free in exchange for an unbiased review.

This is the cutest little bucket set!  Each one is sturdy and perfect for tiny hands. The bottoms each have different cut outs to make sand play fun and even water play too. We have used them in the sand box and in the water table. Or sometimes we just use them to sort fruit snacks.

I love the width and the durability of these wipes. The container is very nice too with the snap open lid so you can throw a pack in the car or in the diaper bag without a worry. The wipes I got are sensitive and I scented which works great for my kids. We have had no rashes or discomfort. Excellent wipes.

This is an awesome set of storage containers! They are thick and very well made. The size variety is great and they are actually much bigger than they appear in the picture. I love that they all stack together nicely to save on space and that they are microwave and dishwasher safe. The lids fit nice and tight and I've had them jostling around in my bag with no leakage. I received the product for free in exchange for an unbiased review and I'm really happy with them!

Both our dog and our cat love this toy!  It's really nice and big and very well made. I thought the only way it could be any better would be if it squeaked and then our dog figured out that it does!. Our dog likes to take it in his fort and snuggle with it while our cat like to scratch it's ears and nibble on it. The moose is really bright and colorful. We've named it Monty the Magical Moose. :)

This is a really nice body lotion that works well and smells really lovely.  However, for me, it's also kind of dangerous to use. You should be aware that this will make certain shower floors very slippery. I don't like to be slipping around in the shower so unfortunately this product is not for me but I think other people will really love it.

I couldn't tell a whole lot of difference after using this lotion a few times, but it did seem to keep my fly away strands tamed a bit better. I do like the way it smells and I like the fact that it adds healthy ingredients to my hair. I do color my hair so I figure it can use all the help I can get to keep it healthy. I like the smell of this lotion, it's a clean floral smell that lasts quite awhile.

I received the variety pack which consists of Passionate Rose, a very strong rose scent that was a bit too overpowering for me, Sapphire, a nice clean bar of soap type of scent that is blue with a very fine sparkle to it, and Mango (not Mango Ice Cream), which is a nice mango fruity scent. Of all three, I like the Sapphire best and the Rose least. The gel does later up well and the bottles are a generous size. For the price, you definitely get a lot of product.

I love this shampoo!  I have both aging and color treated hair and I am always on the lookout for products that will keep my hair healthy and this is a win! This leaves my hair noticeably healthier after just a couple of uses and I am in love with the way it smells. I also like the tube which makes it easy to get all of the product out. This is my new favorite shampoo.

The males in our family love this product. The scent is good, but a little on the strong side. The fact that it's both shampoo and conditioner is a plus because it saves them a step. I've tried it in my hair and didn't feel like it worked great with long hair so I think with this one the shorter hair the better.

This lacquer has been working good for me!  I have used it both for a french manicure and for adding design to a darker polish. The color is a really vibrant bold white which I like. The staying power is about average for a lacquer, which for me is 5-6 days. One thing that I've noticed about this brand is that it does take a bit longer than some to dry, so be mindful of that.

This is a good product to use if you're looking for a strong hold but not a stiff feel. I use a very tiny amount, like about the size of a dime and rub it in my hands and then work it through damp hair. It really aids in styling especially when I use a curling iron. It holds the curls great and sets them so that they last longer than they usually would. The scent is nice, it's a good clean smell and not over powering at all.

This is not really an every day product but rather one to use when you want your hair to remain in place all day. The hold is great and really firm which doesn't feel great if people are going to be touching it but is awesome if you want it to stay put. The scent is nice and clean and the gel is easy to use.

A nice pack of razors at a good price! I find these razors suitable for both men and women and with the right shaving gel they work just fine for wherever you need to shave. They are super sharp so be careful but that also means you get a nice smooth shave. Follow it up with a good moisturizer and you're all set.

This cleanser works great for my occasional breakouts. I use it twice a day and find that to be plenty for it to be effective. I use this along with the Benzac refining mask and my skin looks and feels so much better. This is a product I will continue using.

This is a mask that you can actually feel working. The consistency is nice and I love the scent. The mask tingles a little bit but not in a bad way and after using it my skin felt softer and cleaner. I have used it about 6 times now and am really noticing a difference in my skin. I use this in conjunction with other Benzac products and feel that this routine has really improved my occasional acne situation.

This is a huge book all about the Caribbean!  As a frequent Eastern and Western Caribbean cruiser I was particularly excited for this book. I am not at all let down- it is an awesome in depth guide to each island. I rarely get to see more than what the cruise ships show and now I feel better prepared to travel!

These work so well to take off my full face. I can get an entire day of foundation etc off easily. Even mascara comes off!  They leave my skin feeling refreshed and I know that it's breathing better at night. Excellent product!

I very much enjoyed this book. I think the book dealt very realistically with the subject of eating disorders including how they could possibly begin and how they build and gain momentum over time if something is not done to help the person. I liked the main character, Stevie, and found her struggle to be believable and heartbreaking. I thought the therapist was genuine without being sappy or generic. The book flowed well and the writing was really intelligent. I think that this would be a useful and helpful book for not just young people but for everyone to read.

This is a nice, sturdy well made baby carrier that works really well for our little one. I like that it's easy to get on and that the straps are sturdy but soft against our baby's skin. The quality is very nice and it feels l like it will stand up to lots of use and wear. It's comfortable to wear for me as well and I like the fact that the baby can either be facing me or facing forward. We've used it several times with no issue and it's really made our life easier!  I received the carrier for free in exchange for an honest review.

This is an awesome set of lunch boxes! They are much bigger than they appear in the picture and the quality is really nice. The colors are vibrant and the lids all fit well, which is really nice so that I can just toss one in my bag. The spoon/fork bonus is fun too and again, the quality is nice. The boxes stack nicely for easy storage and it's also a great idea for leftovers or making meals in advance which makes my life a lot easier. I received these lunch boxes for free in exchange for an honest review and I'm really very pleased with them!

This is a very fluffy and comfy tissue roll. It's compressed so there is quite a lot on each roll which is nice with kids who sit before verifying tissue availability. No more rushing through the house to deliver a roll!!

When I ordered these, I didn't expect to like them at all as Lee jeans have never fit me very well. These super soft jeans have made me a Lee fan. These jeans look more like velvet and look much more dressy than any other jean I've worn. These jeans are super soft against the skin. I will definitely purchase these again.

This is great for checking your traps on a small creek, also for duck hunting or just exploring a small body of water. My husband and I love it. There's a good amount of room on board, though, I wouldn't personally put more than 2 adults in this although it says 3 people. I guess it depends on the size of the people. I love the camo, it makes this fabulous for hunting use.

Awesome and warm. I love the thickness of this jacket. It is thick enough to wear as a coat on certain days, but thin enough to wear under a heavier coat when the winter gets even colder. I love that it has a lined fleece hood, so the hood is nice and warm. I'd recommend it.

We haven't gotten enough snow to really test these out yet. Though I love that these are not too heavy like most snow shoes, they won't tire my legs out as fast. They have nice ice cleats which will work great in out northern winters. I will update my review as we get more snow. They also fit nicely. These say they are for men, but, I think the lightness and ease of putting these on are great for women like me.
Nice looking belt, has a nice and fairly thick width. The braiding is nicely done and tight, not, too loose so it shouldn't stretch out easily. It looks great with jeans or with my husband's slacks.
Easy to take, it's mostly vitamin C. I wish it was only a one pill a day supplement. Hopefully it will help my legs not to bruise so easily.
My dogs all 9 of them love it! We have a dog rescue and this food looks nearly good enough for a human to eat. Lots of gravy and beefy chunks. I'd definitely buy this again.

Works great for taking pet vomit accident stains off of carpet. I have 5 indoor cats and 2 indoor dogs, so I have a second full time job cleaning up their accidents. One of my cats has a very sensitive stomach and tends to throw up a lot when eating certain dry food. This cleaning solution worked very well to lift the vomit off the carpet and it took the nasty smell right out. I will definitely purchase this after I run out of it.
My nephew loves it, it is larger than I expected. It is mostly made of plastic hopefully it will last with all the off roading that the kids will put it through!

While I did have more energy while using this supplement. I did notice that it made me very hormonal, and very overly emotional. It may not do that to everyone, but, it effected my moods so greatly I had to stop taking it.

This soup is an affordable comparison to Panera's lemon chicken soup. Actually, I like this one better, it has more chicken in it than the Panera brand and it is a lot less expensive (Panera's is $6.00 for about 2 cups of soup at my local supermarket). I take this soup for my lunch at work and I could eat it everyday, that's how much I love it.

I just love this mailbox. I get numerous packages as I only have time to shop online and my mail lady can fit 4 rather good size parcels into this box with my usual mail. The reviews were right, this mailbox is huge! The quality is good to, if I remember correctly it said on box that it was made in the USA as well, which is a big plus.

My dog just loves this dog food he always cleans his bowl and he is picky . My cats even try to steal it out of his dog food bowl. Currently, I feed my dogs a sport dog food as they are hunting/sporting dogs. This one hasn't got as much protein, but, I would definitely buy this food again when and if I ever consider a replacement for my current brand. Highly recommend.

Very disappointed in this movie. There was no end to the "F" words all from a little kid's mouth, there was more than a few jokes about pedophilia or pedophilia was implied which me and my husband found disgusting, there's numerous male genitalia shots shown or implied and also the youngest child character in this movie is very inappropriate. This is definitely NOT a kid or family friendly movie in my opinion. There's a few (very few)  funny parts, but, not worth renting on pay per view as my family did. As we are huge fans of the original Vacation's and this one is very disappointing.
Works great and seems to work very quickly. Baby doesn't mind the taste either. I've used other Hyland's natural baby products too and so far they all have really worked well for us.

The other reviewers have covered the plot numerous times, so I won't go into that. Interesting little book. I loved the cover art and the story itself is well written and I'd recommend it to adults as well as children.
Cats love it. Lots of platforms for big and small cats. Not as big as my other cat tree, but the cats love it.
About time, that this tool has came out. I love having the ease of just having one styling tool instead of one. It works very well. Makes hair nice and shiny with the ionic setting. I'd recommend.
I like the textured finger tips. It makes these easier to use for detailed tasks. Gloves seem to be fairly sturdy and do not rip or bust too easily. I'd recommend this brand.
Perfect size for even a smaller fridge. I like it to filter my drinking water and it's the perfect size, not too big not too small. Love it.

This is the first time I've used headache powders. If you need fast relief of a normal headache (it doesn't work as well on my migraines or sinus headaches) then this will work for you. When I first used these, I almost gagged, as I was expecting a flavor like sugary fruit powders, but, it isn't. It works and fast but, it tastes awful, though it dissolves in the mouth very quickly. I would definitely buy these again and I would suggest them.
Very nice mailing labels. They print nicely on the computer printer and they are great for just writing the address too. The adhesive seems pretty good and sturdy. Highly recommend.
Nice if you like sterling silver. It's a pretty little necklace, would make a great gift. It doesn't look like an expensive necklace, but, it's a nice costume piece.
Looks good, fits well, nice and thick. They wash well too. I'd recommend them.
I love Sherryl Woods and I loved this story. I won't go into the plot as the other reviewers have covered it numerous times. I loved the setting and this is a great beach or pool read.
Nice quality, they wash nicely and they allow light in without an invasion of privacy. I really like them.
I used this to marinade some pork spare ribs overnight. I then grilled them the next day on a charcoal grill. Delicious!

The Memory House is a telling of two stories  one in the past during the Civil War and one in the present taking place in the same location, Peach Orchard Farm. The other reviewers have covered the plot numerous times so I won't go into that. I loved the cover of the book too.
Fluffy read, but enough angst and meddling characters to give it a touch of unpredictability. If you've liked Sherryl Wood's other romances, you will also enjoy this one. I'd recommend it.
A feel good romance, which I enjoyed very much. Set in a small town in the wintertime with a great atmosphere. This is the first book I've read by this author and the start of a promising new series.

This is my first Sherryl Woods in the Sweet Magnolias series (but my second Sherryl Woods book). I thought this book was enjoyable romance with a small- town atmosphere, friendly neighbors all of which made this book enjoyable. This was a book that I enjoyed reading by the pool.
This is a modern-day tale based on Shakespeares famous play, Romeo and Juliet. I enjoyed it.
Good romance with a bit of mystery thrown in. I enjoyed it!
Good locale, good feel good romance. Yes, it's a fantasy and not logical that's what makes it fun to me. I'd recommend.
f won't go into the plot as other's have numerous times. It's a feel good, romance, fairly clean story. I'd read another by this author.
Enjoyable romance with the typical rough around the edges characters. A guilty pleasure.

I won't go into the plot as the other reviewers have covered it. All I will say is that I didn't care for the foul language. It would've been better in my opinion without it. The story is okay and I thought the writing was interesting other than the cursing.

This is the second one in this series that I've read. The reviewers have covered the plot numerous times so I won't go into that. I'll just say that I enjoyed it and recommend it for people that enjoy a light-hearted romance.
This is the second Breena Spector novel that I've read. While I enjoyed this first one more, this one keeps on with the suspense. You cannot help but, to like Breena and root for her. I enjoyed it.
Enjoyable story, some wild characters and some sleazy ones. A southern charmer story.

Good story about finding one's self, love, forgiveness and of finding your way back home. I won't go into the plot too much as the other reviewers have covered it numerous time. I'd highly recommend it.

Great book about the author's search for her family's Jewish roots. She uncovers information about a grandfather who went to a concentration camp and lots of other interesting and sad facts. I won't go into the plot too much, as the other reviewers have covered it. I'll just say that this is an interesting book. I'd recommend it.
Great study guide for any women's Bible study group. Lots great questions using the book of Jeremiah for study. I'd highly recommend it.
Fun, interesting and thought provoking study guide for women. Great for study groups, lots of interesting questions using God's word for discussions.

Great story. If you enjoy books in this genre, you will enjoy. The other reviewers have covered the plot numerous times, so I won't go into that. I thought the story moved nicely, and I found the small town girl gone to Hollywood and adjusting was interesting.
Great suspenseful book. I love the way the author writes. The other reviewers have covered the plot numerous times, so I won't go into that. I'd highly recommend it.
Great book, helps to realize that things don't make the woman. I won't go more into it as the other reviewers have covered it numerous times. I'd recommend it.

I won't go too much into the plot as others have covered that numerous times. I'll just say that this is a sweeter than honey romance between main characters Suzanne and Mitch. At times the romance was so sweet and predictable that I just had a hard time keeping interested. Also there are times when I wondered when Suzanne would ever stand up for herself or keep being a door mat for the people who used her to babysit. I like Mitch's character a bit better than Suzanne.  Overall, this is a good story, is you like stories in this genre though, I just had a hard time relating to Suzanne and that's why it was hard for me to stay interested at times.

I won't go into the plot as the other reviewers have done that numerous times. To be fair this book isn't in my usual reading genre. I'm not much into these types of stories, but this one fairly good. This isn't a romance, though there are subtle hints of a romance to come. This is more of a story about a woman rebuilding her life after her husband leaves her. The main character Jessie is at times comical which helps the story from becoming too depressing.

The other reviewers have covered the plot numerous times, so I won't go too much into that. This story has a nice mixture of suspense and mystery with Christian teachings that worked well. The Christian teachings were not preachy or in your face, they were realistic. I recommend Vines of Entanglement to anyone looking for a Christian based story of this genre. The group discussion guide at the end of the book makes this a perfect choice for a book club read.

Another great book in the "Amish Roads" series. Barbara Cameron is one of my favorite writers in this genre of Amish romance/fiction. I won't go too much into the plot as the other reviewers have covered it numerous times. I'll just say that I did very much enjoy the side of a female's (Rachel's) journey in her rumspringa. Usually, in most of these type of stories that time is usually written of from the man's point of view; I enjoyed reading of a different side this time. The plot moves at a quick pace which keeps you glued to your seat until you have reached the last page. There are many twists and turns that complicate the situations that occur. Just when you think you have figured out all the answers, there is another surprise lurking around the corner.

When I received this book I was surprised that it was fiction; from the excerpt I had gotten the impression that this was a memoir. The other reviewers have covered the plot numerous times so, I won't go too much into that. I'll just say the story is at times sad, but overall an entertaining read.The journey is enjoyable in the way that George and Lewis together are able to help the strangers they encounter. Though it is supposed to be Christian fiction, there is more poetry quoted here than Scripture which was just a little disappointing to me personally.

I enjoyed this mystery very much. I won't go into the plot as the other reviewers have covered it numerous times. If you enjoy a light-hearted mystery with well developed characters than you will enjoy.
Cute little book for a young boy. Has a nice story and even I enjoy it.

I've used these for several years, they used to be a godsend. The last 2 times I have purchased these they have been dry, crumble and if you can get them to go around the pill at all you have to use 2 or 3 of them. They have changed and cheapened something in these. I used to use these with great success and one would cover the pill completely. When I first noticed they had cheapened the product was about 2 years ago when I purchased these from my vet's office (and they were not cheap!). I gave Greenie's the benefit of the doubt as I figured perhaps the vet had sold me old/expired stock, so I ordered more here. The 2 packages I got here were both the same as the one's I got at the vet's, they crumble and are not pliable enough to even go around a small dewormer pill. They do not stick to the pill even if you use 2 or 3, so the cat ends up eating the pocket and spitting out the pill. Very disappointed!

I enjoyed this book much more than I expected. I'm a survivor of violent crime myself and I could identify with so many of Alisa's thoughts and feelings. Although, I never got into hard drugs like she did, I also got into drinking and other things. I also was saved by my faith as was Alisa. I enjoyed and I'd recommend this to fans of memoirs of this sort.

I wanted to like this book more than I did. It just felt choppy, switching storylines constantly and leaving things hanging. I kept hoping things would come together, but it felt sort of incomplete at the end.

A nice story about two women and one man who suffer mental breakdowns and end up in mental hospital/therapy together. Each character has a story and the author brings them all together nicely. Very British characters.
This book was well researched through all the historical accounts. Though, I didn't enjoy it quite as well as I thought I would.

The other reviewers have covered the plot numerous times so I won't go into that. Very sweet chick-lit, good story if not a bit predictable.  If you want a steady, no stress story to read while you set in a lawn chair at the lake then this one is a good one.

Puzzles are a classic for children, and even the very young can enjoy them when made appropriately.  This Baby Genius Wooden Sound Puzzle reminds me of some Melissa & Doug Wooden Sound Puzzles we own, but it seems to be lighter weight, which is nice for everyone.  While the characters tell their own name and instrument as well as give a short sound sample of said instrument, when a caregiver plays with the toddler they can extend learning by talking about the generic names of the animals and colors, while children have to match up the puzzle pieces to their pictures and shapes on the boards.  While large puzzle pieces are easy for small hands to manipulate, the pegs on these pieces promote use of the pincer grip which is a key skill for young children to learn.Each character has his or her own voice and attitude, which I assume were established in Baby Genius' series of DVDs and CDs.  We have a few Baby Genius soft books and this one puzzle, but my kids have not seen any of their programs or music. You can remove each character separately or at once, and they each say their spiel and play their instrument as the piece covers the light sensor.  Unfortunately for us, these sensors are missing for DJ alligator and singing dog Lola.  All seven pieces are differently shaped and sized, if even just a tad. The music may be a bit loud for sensitive ears, but no more than most children's toys, but at least it has an off switch so you don't have sounds going off in the middle of the night if pieces go missing (it's happened).  Warning though - have two AAA batteries and a small Philips screwdriver on hand as batteries are not included.

Our family has used Hyland's products for several years, and we have always been pleased with the results. Hyland's is a trusted brand in our family, and this was our first time to try the Cold and Mucus Congestion syrup (though we have used similar Allergy and Cough & Cold syrups in the past.)  Just last night my seven-year-old woke me up, again, with a persistent cough.  Unlike previous nights, she finally took Highland's Cold and Mucus, if reluctantly.  She claims she doesn't like the taste, though both my three-year-old and I think it's just fine.  It took less than fifteen minutes for my daughter to fall fast asleep again and stay that way through the night.I feel good knowing that she's taking natural ingredients without any dyes or other harmful substances, which makes it an easier choice to give her some as a preventative before school. Some people may be wary of medicines without childproof caps, but I prefer them when I'm half asleep  The one bad thing about clear medicine is making sure you don't dispense too much, but that's easily remedied. All in all, this is another great homeopathic remedy from Hyland's.

I don't know about having "It All," but this Kiddopotamus "Hall It All" fabric ball can be fun for all babies.  There are six sections to provide various forms of sensory opportunities with different colors, textures, and even sides.  On one of the multi-color zig-zag sections you have a child-safe mirror with the warning "Objects seen in mirror are even cuter than they appear," while the other has a yellow bumpy circle to squeeze for squeaking.Two other sections have more bumps in different colors, while the other two have ridges, one horizontal, the other vertical.  Two leaves at the top crinkle while the other two do not, and there's a peek-a-boo monkey that can be pulled up, but is meant to be pushed up by squeezing the ball.  That is more a job for a parent than a baby, though, as it takes some effort and hurts my fingers after doing it just a few times, and the box does state that "Mom squeezes. Monkey pops. Baby squeals. Repeat," so I guess that was their intention.  Also, the ball that makes the monkey squeeze could cause a child to fall over or possibly cry if hit in the head, so keep it gentle while playing.  There are also some short ribbons for children to grasp and tug.  All in all I can see this providing hours of entertainment and sensory development for young babies

I typically enjoy reading first-time novelists at the start of a series because, well, it can only go up from here. I was drawn to this new Timber Creek K-9 series because of the dog, honestly. I really enjoyed James Rollins' Tucker Wayne K-9 series and this seemed similar. All in all, it was a decent read though it's ultimately a formulaic police procedural that could have benefited from stronger characterization, more realistic dialogue, and less by-the-numbers police/K9 procedure exposition.Mattie Cobb is a strong and likeable female detective character, and I doubt that she will be more fleshed out and subsequent novels. Her dog, Robo, is sort of a super police dog, best of the best, perfect specimen type animal. I appreciated the way Rollins' put the reader inside the mind of Tucker Wayne's dog, and I was missing that here. While a strong central character, Robo is just there, being all strong and perfect all the time. I wanted to care more. The plot itself involves drugs, the death of a teenager, and some quirky small town folks. The Killing Trail creates a sort of less interesting, less ironic Twin Peaks environment, but that said I am interested in returning to Timber Creek and learning more.My primary criticisms: The dialogue is a bit wobbly and less authentic than j had hoped, and there is just way to much flat out procedural explanation about police work and K-9 work. Some of it was interesting, but I tired of it quickly.  Hopefully future installments will limit that type of the necessary exposition. The plot, though twisty, was a bit predictable for me and there's only one true action sequence in the novel. Apart from a few brief scares, it's mostly a series of interviews and investigation. Nothing wrong with a procedural, but all in all I do think the series can only get better. A decent start, worth considering as a quick summer read.

Way back, around the time of Return of the Jedi, I collected a lot of Star Wars micro figure sets - the Death Star, Hoth, Bespin. This Force Awakens set brought me right back to that childhood, except the level of detail here is staggering.My seven-year-old daughter is just beginning to explore the world of Star Wars. She has seen the original films and she dressed as princess Leia for Halloween this year. This is a great way to get her excited for the new movie. This is basically a big Star Destroyer that opens up, Transformers-like, into a miniature "battlefield" with lots of opportunities for fun and engagement. My daughter loves this, and she has the smal fingers and the patience to really have fun with this. As an adult, I preferred the simpler pleasures of the old micro figures and their basic sets. Once opened, this looks too complicated (and too fragile) for me. But she loves it and so far nothing has broken or chipped. The main downside, instantly articulated by my daughter, is the lack of figures. In addition to the ships, you get Kylo Ren and Finn mini figures (exceptionally well detailed for truly tiny people). Of course, other figures and ships are available separately.All in all, I can see this being a great set for any little Star Wars fan. Collectors may find list to like here simply because the fun is in the execution of the toy rather than simply looking at it on a shelf. For playtime, this is recommended.

We have used an alarm monitoring system for many years at our home, but this Lorex wireless video surveillance system is really the big next step. Ultimately, I was surprised and very impressed by how easy this was to set up. I had always avoided anything beyond the standard alarm because I figured it would take too long and cost too much to get a full system in place. But this was a simple two-camera/monitor wireless set up that I was able to install without much difficulty right out of the box.One camera in the front of our house, one in the back - very easy. These are indoor/outdoor cameras, and while noticeable, were discreet yet visible enough to please me.  You also get a 7 inch monitor, and there is a free app you can download for your iPhone or Android to monitor the camera feed. The app is great for simple reasons. For example, now I can check at anytime of the day whether or not I have a package on the porch. I often worry, particularly around the holidays, about large packages sitting on my porch all day while I am out.The video quality is high definition, with audio, and exceeded my expectations. I figured at the price point, for an all in one simple system, it might be grainy or poor quality, but not at all. If you are looking for a simple, easy to install, surveillance system to protect your home or small office, this Lorex system is a great setup to consider. I really do feel safer, especially when I'm out and can monitor my home.

Over the past several years, I have tried out a wide variety of Jarrow Formulas supplements, and I tend to like them all even if they do not immediately show their benefits in a concrete way. Jarrow delivers quality, and it has become a trusted brand in our family. I deal with a lot of stress, between work and two kids, and I was interested to see if PS-PA Synergy capsules helped me at all. These pills are supposed to support a healthy stress response, specifically benefiting "cognition, mental performance, attentiveness and reaction time." At the outset I should say that I do take a very low dose (essentially a "children's dose," according to my doctor) of anti-depressant each day for anxiety, and I knew going in that there could possibly be some reaction. I gradually, over the course of a month, worked PS-PA into my daily supplement regimen, and I have to say that the effects were almost instantaneous.  Whether these pills enhanced the functionality of my anti-depressant or worked solely on their own, I suddenly found myself incredibly relaxed during my day. For the month I regularly took this supplement, I did not really experience much stress or at least did not let typical stress impact my daily routine.The downside is that these may have worked a little too well. Rather than enhancing my cognitive abilities, I found myself easily distracted, relaxed, and prone to a bit of uncharacteristic forgetfulness. It was all minor stuff, like leaving milk on the counter instead of putting it back in the fridge or leaving the house without my cell phone. At work, I forgot to do one minor assignment for a day or so. Again, I cannot say that this was due to the PS-PA alone, but this type of distraction is very, very unlike me as I am typically an extremely focused, easily stressed individual. On the plus side, things did not really bother me. My anxiety was better, and I was more relaxed dealing with my children. One other thing I noticed over the past month is that my appetite increased and my anxiety about over-eating went away. The result?  Of course, I did not watch my diet and I gained more weight than I would care to admit. Ultimately, after a month, I felt I had to stop taking PS-PA because, wow, it sort of worked a little too well in terms of eliminating or lessening my reaction to stress. The cons, for me, outweighed the pros, though I suspect it was more a reaction with other medications than anything else. Thus, I can say that I honestly believe this supplement from Jarrow does what it advertises, although your reaction may vary.

My youngest daughter, age three, got the (white) Super Snackin' Sara doll a month or so ago and while it took her a while to warm up to it, because she was a little afraid of the moving mouth, she does play it regularly. She saw that I had the opportunity to try out the African American variation of Snackin' Sara and to my surprise and delight, she asked for a "sister" for her doll. I was happy to comply, curious to see how she would respond to a new doll and whether this one would initially scare her out of the box. And this one did not. These two Baby Alive dolls now live side-by-side, and my daughter seems happier to have a set of "twins" rather than just the one doll she had initially.I wrote a review for the first Snackin' Sara, and I want to share some of that relevant information here as well: My eldest daughter, now age seven, had a Baby Alive doll years ago that she loved very much. I had the chance to try this Super Snacks doll for my youngest, age three, and I hoped she would have a similar reaction. This is a fancier doll than the Baby Alive we had in the past, with a moving mouth, lots of sounds and phrases, food, and a couple of diapers. Obviously the diapers provided are a starter pack as you are supposed to buy more because the more this doll "eats," the more she will release into her diaper, much like a real child.As I mentioned, my three-year-old was a bit scared of it at first, because the doll makes what one might consider almost sinister chomping sounds and there is a real oddness of the rubbery mouth movements. But you get used to it, and my daughter really seems to like this doll now. She took to this African American Sara right out of the box and seems to prefer her to the white doll she got a month ago. She likes to brush this doll's hair quite a lot actually.As with the other doll, my daughter is more into pretend playing with food because, even at age three, she does not like sticky messes, and when we mixed some food and went through the diaper-changing process with the first doll, she constantly asked to wash her hands. We have not mixed food for this Sara, and she seems perfectly fine with that, pretending to feed her while the doll makes that - to a parent, kind of creepy - move movements and sounds. All in all, I still rank this four out of five stars because it is a bit creepy to me though my daughter seems to really enjoy her "sisters."

My two kids are eagerly awaiting the new Star Wars movie, having recently watched the other six movies and becoming increasingly interested in the characters. As a kid who played with Star Wars toys non-stop in the early '80s, I am always interested in new toys that my enchant and interest my kiddos. This Hot Wheels "Escape from Jakku" playset looked like a lot of fun with flying ships and lots of detail. And indeed, the photos do not do the set justice in terms of the detail. From the crashed Star Destroyer to the intricately detailed Millennium Falcon, this set screams "collector," and were it not for my kids, I suspect I might set this up and then relegate it to a high shelf for display purposes. And in fact, that may be the best option for this because as a toy, it does not deliver the thrills and long play that one might hope for.It's a very basic game, where you try to knock down the plastic Tie Fighters with your die-cast Falcon while relevant sound effects play. And that's about it. So long as you know what you're getting, this can be an enjoyable game for two kids to play for a while together, taking turns operating the Falcon. But for adults and even for kiddos, the excitement of this does not last long. The looping Falcon is awesome, the first time or three, but after that it just becomes a very basic knock-em-down game that can be achieved to a degree with three cans and a rubber ball. Playing with my kids, we tried to make stories out of it, talking about Han and Chewie inside the Falcon, trying to get some sort of plans from on board one of the Tie Fighters. But after about ten minutes or so, my kids got a bit bored and moved on to other toys. I am not sure how often they will return to this set, although their enthusiasm for Star Wars in general is still high so I conclude it's this specific toy and not the franchise that they got bored with. For collectors, thumbs up for an awesome showpiece and occasional gimmicky toy. For kids, their attention span may vary.

I took prenatal DHA during both of my pregnancies, and my doctor told me that it's fine to continue taking DHA beyond if I so choose. As a result, I have tried several varieties over the years, though this was my first time to try the Viva Labs brand. I was very impressed. These are very manageable pills to take. Hooray, finally, a prenatal vitamin that is meant for a woman and not a filly. These gel capsules go down easily without any nasty tastes or strong smells, and there's a nice quantity to boot. So often you get DHA vitamins that are either excessively large or taste awful or smell fishy, but remarkably Viva Labs has developed a formula that avoids all of these typical DHA pitfalls and delivers a quality product. I now wish I had had these to take during my pregnancies, but I still enjoy them today as a regular daily vitamin. Easily and highly recommended for pregnant women out there who want the best, most manageable pills available.

With Evalar Seeds of Beauty drink mix, beauty comes at a price. I'm no stranger to powdered drink additives as I've done everything from Crystal Light to teas to fiber mixes. First, let me say that I'd rather drink tasteless fiber than this concoction. The first time I tried Seeds of Beauty I put it in my tumbler that already had ice and water, then stirred as best I could with the hard straw. Not all the pieces got broken up (could still taste it next time I refilled my tumbler), so the next time I poured it into a water bottle and shook it like crazy. It dissolved nicely, no grainy texture or taste, but that didn't improve the overall flavor. It is supposed to be a "natural pineapple" flavoring, but it tastes more like an artificial pina colada mix, but I forced myself to drink it all. I simply cannot recommend this based on the taste, which is too bad as I was hoping to like it.  Fortunately young skin runs in my family, so I'll take my chances on genes rather than subject myself to that taste again.As for the packaging, the box contains square pouches that are easy to open, but you have to be careful when pouring if you have a narrow spout - I love my tea packets that fit into the opening of water bottles - no fuss no muss. If you don't mind the taste of fake flavors and are willing to do anything to keep wrinkles at bay, then enjoy. Otherwise, wait for another flavor or brand.

I eat protein bars every day, and over the years I have tried a wide variety of brands and flavors. But I always end up coming back to Pure Protein, which is simply the best in my opinion, offering not only a fantastic 20 to 21 grams of protein per bar, but tasting the best as well.  I had tried the Chocolate Deluxe flavor before, but this Variety Pack allowed me to also sample the Chocolate Peanut Butter and Chewy Chocolate Chip. There are a total of eighteen bars in this package, providing six of each flavor.  It's a great way to sample the Pure Protein brand for newbies and also a great value buy for people like me who already eat protein bars each day but like to mix it up with different flavors.Pure Protein bars are short and thick little bars, not as long as most other protein bars out there, but they usually pack in about twice the amount of protein. I have found few bars that offer such a substantial amount of protein while keeping the sugar low (2-3 grams per bar) and the saturated fat at no more than 3 grams. Each bar also provides a variety of vitamins, 8% of your daily iron, and 1-2 grams of dietary fiber. I eat one for breakfast with water or occasionally skim milk, and it lasts me through lunchtime with no real hunger issues. These would also be a great afternoon snack, kept in a desk drawer, to fight off hunger and pump up your energy between lunch and dinner. The only real downside to Pure Protein bars, as I mentioned, is that they are shorter (yet thicker) than most other bars. That means that after a couple decent bites, they are gone. If I were to redesign the brand's bars, I might make them longer and thinner, simply to make them last longer. But considering that the protein and nutrients they provide, without unnecessary fat and suger, this is a winner all the way around. Recommended as the best protein bars out there.

This is a very good cat tree, which our fourteen-year-old, slow-moving tabby enjoys quite a lot.  From the photo, I worried that he would have a difficult time climbing up and especially fitting in the little house since he is overweight. But ultimately he had no difficulty and went up there immediately. Our cat enjoys his privacy, and I suspect he'll be spending a lot of time in his little treehouse.My young daughters helped me put it together. It was not terribly difficult, arriving in one box with seven pieces. There are clear instructions enclosed and screws and washers to hold everything together. More than anything, we were all impressed with the softness of the exterior. It is by far the softest pet structure we have had, having had two previous huts/playgrounds covered in a rough carpet material. This is soft like a plush toy, though on the downside I do suspect it'll wear faster and get covered in fur.  For now, however, our cat really likes this tree. And it really does resemble a "tree" with its bark-like trunk rising up to the house, a detail perhaps lost on our cat but appreciated by the rest of us who want his area of the house to look as nice as possible. Recommended.

Our family has tried a number of VTech toys over the years for our two kids (ages seven and three), and we have found them to all be worthwhile fun and educational toys. This Smart Animals Grow and Learn Farm is no exception. There's a lot to do here for a curious child, and my three-year-old has spent a lot of time playing with it as intended and in her own imaginative way. First, as with everything from VTech, there's educational activities built into the toys. My daughter can learn about numbers and colors by pressing various buttons on the farmhouse. The interactive rooster figure can activate several touchpoints to make sounds or play music. Naturally, there are several other animals sold separately if you want full interactivity with this farm set. That, to me, is the biggest shortcoming. This is a big fun farm set that comes with a single rooster as the only animal friend, though the box clearly depicts (all sold separately) a lamb, a cow, and a horse. So far my daughter has not asked for the other critters, but I suspect it's just a matter of time once she gets as much as she can out of her lonely rooster friend.Even with a single figure, you can do lots of things with this set. There's a clever activity where you can "grow" carrots, and the pieces are giant Lego-like blocks that can seemingly fit together in different configurations for at least a little bit of variety. All in all, this is one of the better farm playsets that my daughter enjoys. (She has several, and I would say she has played with this longer than most of them.)  For curious little ones, this is a nifty little set worth considering. Just be aware that you only get one animal, and additional purchases will likely be desired by any child who studies the box carefully enough.

Our family has been using Hyland's homeopathic remedies for years now, and we trust and appreciate this brand. In addition to their allergy and cough and cold syrups, we have found that our two daughters (three and seven) respond well to their little tablets for rest and relaxation.  Those calming tablets - which look exactly the same as these Chamomile tablets - contain Chamomile x6 as well as several other ingredients.  I was glad to try out these Chamomile 30x tablets (with no other ingredients) to see how well they worked by comparison. These are actually quite a bit better and seem to work faster.These are labeled for teething and irritability, but we had success with these on two kids who are no longer teething. Like most kids, our daughters bicker on the weekend and get overly hyper and whiny at times. My eldest, age seven, has mild ADHD and takes daily medication to help her focus and stay calm. These homeopathic tablets help smooth out some of the rougher patches when little things bother her like a missing toy or her little sister knocking something over. Both kids, in fact, respond well to this and they really, really love the taste apparently.  Neither gives me any trouble taking two tiny tablets at a time. These can really be used for all sorts of real or imagined ailments. My daughter requests her "little pills" when she claims to have a mild stomachache or a leg cramp, etc. And a few minutes after taking these apparently magic pills, things are all better and she's playing as usual. But realistically, I have noticed a difference in their attitudes after taking just one dose. The little things don't bother them, and they are not as quick to fight with one another.I would recommend this as an additional supplement for ADHD kids already taking medication. For teething and other minor troubles, these would also likely be helpful. Hyland's is a good brand.

I have not used an HP printer in a while, but I have had mostly good experiences in past with the brand.  This particular printer is medium size all-in-one printer with fax, print, scan, and copy functions.  Scanning is easy and it makes good copies of documents.  The printer is compatible with mobile device printing through AirPrint, Android, and Google Cloud printing.This printer is clearly meant for home or small office use and is best for document printing and copying.  It can be used for photo printing, but you will not get results as good as with an actual photo printer or higher resolution scanner.  That said, I have printer some documents with pictures or charts included and found the colors to be good for what I needed.As with most all in one devices, it was very quick and easy to get the printer setup on my home wireless network.  I have used the printing, copying, and wireless scanning functions.  Based on the prompts at setup and the included quick start guide, the fax function should be easy to setup for those who need that capability. Overall, this a good printer at this price point.  The automatic document feeder holds about 30-35 pages, so it clearly not going to work on larger print jobs.  However, for home use this should be pretty good.  It is compatible with Windows XP - 10 and Apple OS X.

As most dog owners know, bad breath is a constant struggle. These Tropiclean Fresh Breath Drops are the latest in a long line of remedies I have tried including various treats and gels. I found that this products works well and is very easy to use.All of my dogs have had noticeably better breath after a few uses. One problem I have had in the past with other products is getting the dogs to cooperate. They fight gels and toothbrushing, and much like kids, they are very suspicious of any treat that could possible be healthy for them. These drops must have no taste as they drink their water as usual none the wiser that they are being treated for bad breath. All in all, this worked for me. Recommended.

I am always on the lookout for good dishcloths for the kitchen, and I liked the "lemon yellow" color of these New Designs Homespun Dishcloths.  I was a little hesitant since they looked much less sturdy than what I am used to using, and in this case, my concerns were right on the money.  One look at these dish cloths out of the box, and you just know they aren't going to get the job done.  They look rough, which seems to be a helpful quality in a dish cloth, but it's worth noting that they are not hard on the hands.Unfortunately, the material just doesn't get the job done.  I poured a small amount of water on my electric stove and tried to wipe it dry, to no avail, and found streaking in addition. A single paper towel did a better job in the end.  I poured a bit more water into a ceramic dish, and I attempted to dry with the cloth. Once again, it remained wet.  In the end, I suspect we'll use these primarily to dry hands, as they don't really work on dishes (which is odd and unfortunate for a "dishcloth.")  I do like the home style design.  It really does have a homemade quality as opposed to something factory produced, but these were just not that great in function.

In "The Scribe," Matthew Guinn provides a lyrical, haunting study of evil, madness, and racism in a vividly-detailed Atlanta in the fragile decades following the Civil War.  His writing is poetic and descriptive with good characterization throughout as we meet a colorful cast of fictional and historical figures. The plot, in short, involves a disgraced from Atlanta detective who is summoned back to the city to assist in a brutal series of murders. Everything you would expect from a typical mystery/thriller is here - graphic violence, clues, witnesses, and a shadowy organization of officials running the show behind the scenes.While not a perfect novel, it was a swift and engaging read that I completed in a couple of sittings.  That said, the characters', and author's, tendency to dwell at great length on the evil that men do and the nature of evil does get a bit annoying after a while. The specter of the Civil War hangs over the entire story, providing a historical backdrop and context for the crimes being committed.  The Holmes and Watson-like detective duo at the heart of "The Scribe" is a fascinating pair, and I was glad to see a sequel set up in the final pages.  This could be an interesting series of stories across the South in the late 19th Century.

Every so often a toy like this Wonder Workshop Dot robot comes along that makes me wish I was a kid again. Robotic-type toys were incredibly primitive in the 1980s, and never in my wildest dreams did I imagine that my eldest daughter would be able to operate a tiny robot via an app on her smartphone. As soon as Dot arrived, we downloaded the Wonder app for iPhone.  It guides you through slowly and easily, explaining what Dot can do and how - "behaviors" such as lights, sounds, moves, and animations, and how to link them - through visually-based coding.  I tried a little bit of this on my own before handing it over to my daughter.  And honestly, it's a lot of fun (though I suspect the Dash bot is even better than the Dot we tested out).  The app is divided into sections like Scroll Quest which are guided activities, Free Play where you can do your own thing, and the Inventor's Log which keeps track of what you've done and what Dot has "learned."  The challenges -- and there are apparently some 300 on the app -- provide explorations through various locations like space, Africa, and the Arctic.  While we have not yet gotten very far, clearly you can do a lot with Dot using this app.My daughter is currently seven and a half, so she is just under the minimum required age for this toy/learning device.  I was worried that it might be too much for her, but honestly I think any kid who is interested in learning and curious can follow the necessary steps.  My daughter has mild ADHD, and this is a fantastic tool for getting her to focus with intensity on a task with Dot's actions providing an incentive at the end of the coding challenge.  On a Saturday morning, for example, it's a great way to get her brain going before we start to work on her homework for Monday.  My youngest is curious about Dot and said it was "cute," like a blue Mike from Monsters, Inc.  I'm thrilled with this little device, and I would much rather my daughter learn fun coding than play mindless games on her phone.  For the imaginative, curious thinkers out there, this is recommended.

This is a terrific all-in-one outdoor game set that our whole family genuinely enjoys. There's a lot to like about this. First, it's self-contained. Even though there are lots of loose pieces, which is every parent's nightmare, everything fits into place and the entire unit seals shut so there's no mess. Though too big for either of my daughters to carry, it's got a handle for portability. Though this is a big, somewhat heavy set so I doubt we'll take this much further than our backyard.The game system itself is very sturdy and was clearly built to last. There's even a little scoring system for serious play, and of course, the washers and bean bags are separated into team colors. My daughters both said it reminded them of the tailgating games they would play at "Trunk or Treat" festivals at local churches around Halloween, though I can safely say that this is a far more sturdy and professional set. All in all, if you're wanting an outdoor "all weather" and self-contained two-in-one game for the family, this is a rest set. Recommended.

For this review, I was able to try a single 3.52 ounce bar of Cailler L'Ecorce dark chocolate, 70% cocoa. I love dark chocolate and I try as many kinds as I can, though this Swiss company (since 1819) was unfamiliar to me.Their chocolate is fantastically dark and intensely flavorful. It reminded me a little of Ghirardelli 60% which has long been our family's go-to dark chocolate. This, however, is a little stronger, less sweet, and very smooth. It's great chocolate, period.Nutritionally, this is a fattening bar despite its deliciousness. There are 2.5 servings in a bar, each of which has 240 calories, 18 grams of fat (11 of which are saturated), and 11 grams of sugar. The ingredients are all natural, of course, and a full bar does provide 30% of your daily iron. Obviously, rich dark chocolate like this should be a treat, one segment at a time. This is the kind of chocolate bar that one can savor for days.

My family and I have been using reusable grocery bags for several years now.  We have amassed a collection of all shapes and sizes, from expensive insulated zipper bags to one-dollar Trader Joe's bags, and we just grab a few from the trunk whenever we go grocery shopping. This SnapBasket from CleverMade is one of the larger bags we now use, and it is by far the most convenient to store. Most of our bags just get stuffed into the largest of the lot for quick trunk storage, but this SnapBasket nicely folds down flat for storage anywhere. To use you just snap it upright by pressing plastic hinges on either side -- simple yet effective.It provides quite a bit of storage space when opened up, just over 31 quarts according to the packaging. Realistically translated, it'll hold six to eight cereal boxes or cracker boxes of regular size, or two vertical stacks of frozen dinners or any similar combination. For a family of four, we could probably get our week's worth of shopping into three of these, which is better than, say, six or eight of the smaller, cheaper bags.In addition, there's an inside pocket with a zipper that could hold something small and flat-ish like sliced cheese, greeting cards, or similar. The two handles are sturdy and work well, though I do wish there could have been a shoulder strap as well like my (granted, more expensive) insulated zipper bag.If you and your family regularly carry around reusable shopping bags, this is a good, clever bag - large, portable, and sturdy - that's well worth considering.

This Blue Energy X smartphone runs the Android Lollipop v5.1 operating system out of the box.  For existing Android users, this phone offers your typical smartphone options and functions.  The 5 inch screen is on par with various other models available with the Android OS and falls roughly half way between the two sizes available from Apple.  While the display can certainly be considered HD, I was able to compare the home screens side-by-side with my sisters iPhone 6 and noted that the picture resolution is not quite as crisp.I have used the phone for a few days now and find that the battery holds a charge well throughout the day.  Typically, I charge my phone overnight and need it to last all of the next day for phone calls, text messages, games, and some video streaming.  I encountered no problems with this phone and had a fourth of the battery or so to spare.  To preserve battery life, I keep my phone on the middle brightness level and try to routinely close apps left running in the background.In terms of the external design of the phone, a couple of points are worth mentioningalthough in general term there's nothing particularly unique about this model.  The lock and volume buttons are located on the right side of the phone, and the power/USB cord port is on the bottom.  The camera, flash bulb, and headphone jack are all located at the top of the phone.  I found the volume and lock buttons to be comfortable to use, but they are somewhat awkward if you take advantage of the included flexible plastic case.One design element I do not like is the placement of the primary speaker.  It is a thin bar located just below the middle on the back of the phone.  I find that although the volume is good when held, it is considerably muffled when set down on a table.  I suggest especially that if you plan on using the alarm clock function on this phone as I often do, you should leave the phone on the bed side table upside down to be sure you can hear it.  However, I would have to say that the phone design is pretty good.  It is comfortable to hold with smooth edges on the back, and the Gorilla Glass display gives me confidence that even with just using the included case, the phone can stand up to wear and tear from everyday use.  There is nothing about this phone that really jumps out at you to make you think it is a must have device, but if you want a good Android phone this is definitely a model to consider.

This is the second standalone novel I have read by Tess Gerritsen, and it is easily my favorite. Despite being shorter than I would have liked, and as a result wrapping up a little too quickly and nearly for my tastes, "Playing with Fire" is a rare book that sticks with you and makes you think. I finished it over a week ago, and it's been on my mind. It moved me, which is rare for a mystery/thriller.The novel is primarily modern day mystery, which is suitably creepy at times in a way that's  reminiscent of an old Twilight Zone episode. (Anything involving odd or violent behavior in children freaks me out.) I love the idea of music hiding a secret, and for music lovers, there's a lot to like here. Despite the modern story, there are a number of historical flashbacks that tell a fictional, yet heartbreaking love story from the Holocaust. It's painful at times, especially the feeling of dread as you move along in the story already aware of how it is bound to end. The juxtaposition of these two stories is stark and jarring. You sense something almost supernatural at work or at the very least, unexplained.The conclusion felt rushed, and that's my only complaint. Perhaps I was just selfishly wishing that the novel would go on longer because I was enjoying it so much. Either way, "Playing with Fire" is a worthwhile read. As someone who tackles 40-60 books a year, I know when I catch a keeper. Recommended.

I was not sure what to expect from Ocean Spray Pact, concerned that with only one gram of sugar in 16 fluid ounces I would either have an extremely tart drink or one with unnatural artificial sweetness. You see, I love cranberry juice and was told years ago by my doctor to drink it regularly, but I've tried to avoid it in recent years because of the sugar content. Diet cranberry juices, even by Ocean Spray, just taste fake to me and don't deliver the nutritional benefits I desire. Enter Pact, which amazingly meets me halfway, delivering a big concentration of health in a naturally sweetened drink with a single gram of (natural) sugar. But how did it taste?Pact is not the slightest bit tart. It's smooth and subtle, with a slight hint of cranberry dominated by the flavor of raspberry. It is refreshing, no doubt about it. It's not overly sweet, but sadly what  sweetness there is has that artificial taste to it, despite the use of two natural sweeteners. You know in an instant there's no real sugar in this, but it's not an offensive taste. My initial impression was that it was a bit like watered down Diet Snapple, though that does not do justice to it because it really is quite good. Not everyone will like it, I suspect, but it's worth noting that there's just that subtle hint of un-real sweetness. If you like carbonated flavored waters, you'll like this - minus the carbonation, of course.Pact is not cranberry juice - as the label says "Contains no juice." It's water, natural sweeteners, and cranberry extract. Sixteen ounces boasts "the power of 50 cranberries," because it offers 80mg of proanthocyanidins. It claims to cleanse and purify the body, and of course, there's no denying the proven health benefits of cranberries. I would recommend that anyone seeking the nutritional benefits of cranberries without all of the sugar found in cranberry juice give this a serious try. Healthy, subtle, and not shockingly sweet, it's a keeper for me. The best of both worlds.

With multiple family members' health to track, including two small children, I love technological medical apps, and the SmartTemp app not only helps track the progression of fevers but also symptoms (limited to their choices) and medicines given so you can share all this information with a medical professional or babysitters with the parents, whether through the app or via email, which can provide lists and/or charts.The app, which is easy to set up by simply scanning the Redline code on the back of the box, allows you to create multiple profiles and choose how the temperature was taken, so you have three places depending on the age of the child.  You can view the history of each profile and create reminders to take a temperature again at a given time, though it would better be served as an actual alarm than an alert.  There is also a table which helps you know whether a temperature taken is within a safe or dangerous range, again depending on where it was taken, and this provided in both Fahrenheit and Celsius.  Even the light on thermometer will change colors depending on the temperature range.However, the actual temp only shows up on the app, not the thermometer itself.  Not sure this matters for us as the thermometer didn't even take an accurate oral reading out of the three of us.  According to the app we should take a morning and afternoon reading while feeling well and average the two to determine base temperature, but we were all feeling just fine and two of us were determined to have temperatures over 100, so I may just have to test it out some more. But this is something for folks to be wary. Also, the protective cover for the thermometer does not stay on or I simply have to figure out how to snap it on properly. I almost sent the device flying out of my hand before I discovered this.The thermometer can be used with probe covers, but I had unfortunately ran out, so I don't know if that affects readings. At least the thermometer is not heavy and sits easy under the tongue. Also in the app are FAQs, troubleshooting, the manual, and tips on wellness, though some are just advertisements for more Vicks products, but still helpful. Overall, the app is great but the thermometer itself was disappointing, so I'll split the difference.

This Epson Expression Photo XP-960 is designed to be a small home-use printer for photos and documents.  It has the standard features everyone now expects from all-in-one models including wireless connectivity, scanning, copying, and memory card ports.  As part of the "small-in-one" class, a key feature of this printer is its relatively small footprint.  I have a large hutch on my desk with multiple-shelf cabinets built in on either side.  I was comfortably able to fit the printer in the roughly 12 inch high space without having any problems accessing the scanning platform. The printer needs space approximately 18-20 inches wide on a desk as well, so it should not overwhelm most standard computer desks.This printer was clearly designed with photos in mind.  In addition to the memory card ports, the printer features access points for USB drives or an external hard drive as well as connectivity with Epson's smartphone app.  There are also features that would be great for people who do crafts or custom projects.  The printer has a rear feeding slot for card stock as well as a dedicated tray for CD and DVD printing.  Photo and picture quality is excellent as I have come to expect from Epson.  However, as with many newer models, this printer uses six separate ink cartridges.  The box highlights this as a cost saving feature as you only replace the ink you need, but some how I always seem to have to replace two or more at the same time at a higher overall cost.Overall, if you are looking for a small but powerful printer for everyday use, this is definitely a great choice.  It gives you a lot of options for various projects from printing text only documents to professional quality photos.  Due to personal preference, I usually try to make sure that any printer I get has a front loading paper tray.  I am pleased to say that despite its small size, this printer is indeed front loading for standard paper.  Obviously it does not hold as much paper as a larger office style all-in-one model, but it is ideal for everyday home use.

I have taken a statin medication daily for the past decade to help with my high cholesterol. At my doctor's insistence, I started taking 100 mg of Co Q-10 every day to replenish what Co Q-10 my station medication takes away from my body.  Over the last 10 years, I have tried a wide variety of brands, organic boutique and generic store brands. All of them have worked fine, exactly the same, so I tend to go with the cheapest and highest quantity available.These 100mg soft gels from Viva Labs are just fine. They are comparable in size to the current pills I had been taking from Puritan's Pride. They go down smoothly and have caused no issues for me. This bottle contains 150 daily pills, which is less than I usually get when I buy a bulk package. By comparison, my bottle from Puritan's Pride contains 240. Still,  this seems to be a quality, all-natural supplement from a company I had not tried previously. If your body needs Co Q-10, this is a fine brand to try.

My two daughters are big Frozen fans, though I'll say at the outset that we have not yet seen the short "Frozen Fever."
