Cody knows the green-eyed Heather is off limits, but can't stay away from her, while Heather finds her 'no more men' policy going up in flames when Cody is around. Cody believes his dreams of finding his own mate and happy ever after may be within reach. But a vampire is leaving a trail of murdered green-eyed women along the highway headed west toward Arizona, headed straight to Heather.3. All of the books in this series are great, but this is my favorite so far. The lead characters are likeable and engaging, while there is enough suspense that it kept me glued to my reader. Kyle has had a supporting role in previous books as the policeman changed into a shifter by a rogue wolf. Stephanie was forcibly changed by one of the Colorado pack and barely escaped being mated to him, running south to Arizona. When Kyle finds her in the desert, he recognizes a kindred soul, then recognizes her as his next door neighbor from an Army base ten years earlier when they were both teens. But they are both grown up now, different yet the same, and Stef is now the one in danger from the abusive male who wants to claim her, regardless of what she wants. And they know he will be tracking her to the ranch to take her back to the pack that claims her, to a life of slavery

This is an anthology of 15 good to very good, mostly standalone stories. My favorite is Unwrapping Mr. Roth, by Holley Trent. It is filled with humor, banter, double entendres, and innuendos and is a true standalone. Other books I enjoyed were:  Once Upon a Fiery Christmas,by Elianne Adams; Wolf in Exile, part 4.5, Bound, by Amber Ella Monroe; Bear in Heat, by Catherine Vale; Stranded with a Cajun Werewolf, Stormy Weather Book Five, by Selena Blake and Saving Christmas, by Rebekah R Ganiere. The other books in the collection are also good, and there is enough variety for most to find something to like. At the anthology price, it's a steal.

This 212 page addition to the series is a potential standalone with an HEA, but it would be better if read from the first book, Heat, which gives background for the series. I've read the series from book one, recommend it and have it on my reread list.Bryce Connors: member of an MC at seventeen, Marine Corp deserter, drug addict, mercenary, recovering addict and corporate billionaire with a new identity at Archer Holdings.....  Peyton Rivers: daughter of alcoholic mother, killed mother's abusive boyfriend at seventeen, rescued from jail by a half brother she didn't know she had, works for the same billionaire brother, Logan, at Archer holdings, and secret ex girlfriend of Bryce....Bryce and Peyton were ready to take their relationship to the next level when she walked out on him without explanation a year earlier. Now they are at a corporate groundbreaking ceremony when a helicopter with men in black attacks and takes Logan.Blackriver, a mercenary group that works for the DOD, is behind the kidnapping and the Archer extended family wants Logan back. But he is a ghost, a man who doesn't exist and their friend Colonel Lawson can only provide Intel, not send in troops. Bryce volunteers to go after him, but so does Peyton, and when she's told no, she sneaks away to Istanbul anyway.  Their only option now is to work together with a Blackriver insider to rescue Logan, knowing they have to make their move soon or Logan won't survive Benson, the madman running Blackriver. A man who never lets grudges go unpunished.

This is the opener for the Soldiers of Fortune series, about a trio of Marines who walked away after an attack on their convoy in a small Afghanistan village. They make their way across the border into China and hire on as mercenaries in Africa, where they are recruited by William Archer, a billionaire who sees promise in them, not the broken men they've become. Archer gives them new identities, dries them out, and trains them to run his company.Reagan Archer first met Hudson Banks at her high school graduation party. She is angry at her father for being absent for much of her life, and resents the former soldiers he spends his time with, Hudson included. During college, however, she and Hudson become friends, a friendship that ends after her father's memorial service when they kiss and he walks away. Five years later, she has a degree in political science and is running for the state Senate.  After one of her largest contributors pulls their financial backing because of off script remarks she made in a speech, her campaign manager ambushes her at a political event with a new sponsor, one she swore she'd never take finances from, her father's company. And Hudson is the one who will be holding the purse strings and providing personal protection. If she doesn't kill him first.

This ninety page series opener is a quick read, a standalone and it has an HEA. The storyline takes place over several months, but actual contact between the h and H is minimal once he learns she is a virgin. That's because he has one hard and fast rule--he doesn't do virgins. And he would be able to actually stay away from her if only his mind and body were on board.Emerson is a college senior,  the daughter of a heroin addicted prostitute who abandoned her to the neonatal unit at the hospital where she was born. She grew up in the basement of a foster home, but has worked her way through college. Her roommate is her one and only friend, the person who makes sure she gets out and socializes one night a week. And it is on one of those nights out that she sees a tattooed man who looks like he benchpresses trucks, and then she watches him as he watches her watching him get off. They are both completely hooked, they just don't know it yet, and wouldn't admit it if they did. Because he's a SEAL who doesn't do relationships and she's not like any woman he's met before. This was a KU library read.

I received an ARC of this anthology from one of the authors in return for an honest review. Maker, by Holley Trent, is book five of the Norseton Wolves series and a standalone with an HEA. It is different from previous books in the series in that Graciella is not one of the four females who answered the mating call put out by Adam, Alpha of the Norseton pack. She is the younger sister of one of them and was brought to Norseton to save her from a potentially abusive arranged marriage. Likewise, Finn is the brother of another of the four women. He had been cast out of his pack and was on his own for years before being brought in to Norseton. These two are strongly attracted to each other, but are trying to honor Graciella's sister's desire to give her time and freedom before mating. Finn wants to be accepted by his new pack and to honor family wishes, but where he attempts to be an immovable object, Graciella is an irresistible attraction.This is an exceptionally good story and there are others in this collection I know will be as well. I'm looking forward to reading them all.

This is a very good standalone contemporary romance from an author that's new to me. She writes complex, likable characters in a small town setting, with a dash of suspense thrown in. She is an author I will explore further.Harper leaves everything behind when she catches her live-in boyfriend and boss in bed with someone else, running out the door without even her purse or cell phone. She heads for a friend's house, but runs out of gas in the parking lot of a quaint small town bar on the way, just in time to see a man beating a much smaller woman. Harper tries to stop him and is punched in the face, waking up to the face of the most handsome man she has ever seen.Luke came by the bar to make sure Josie, his sister, is safe closing up. He arrives as a blonde  jumps on the back of a big, mean, abusive drunk in the parking lot. When the drunk turns on her, Luke knocks him out, and takes her inside to check out her injuries. Josie talks to Harper, learns she is stranded and comes up with a novel idea to help both Harper and Luke, whose parents are playing matchmaker for him. He has a short term job opening and Harper needs a job. And a place to stay, which he also has. And since he's being deployed in a month, they can add a short term romance to appease the parents to the mix. And everyone wins, as long as nobody falls in love.A KU library read.

One of the many things I love about Erin Kellison's books is the unpredictability. She incorporates multi dimensional characters into a complex storyline, weaving in suspense, romance, impossible odds and strong MC's who steadfastly go after what they want. The author of the Reveler series has another winner in the Shadow Series and to me, this book is one of her best.Death has been searching for Kathleen since she died while giving birth to their daughter, Talia. She isn't in Heaven, which leaves Hell, and he's furious that she would be punished for his crime. So he has abandoned his duties as the Grim Reaper and has built a gate to Hell with a hammer borrowed from an angel. As he reaches completion, he hears footsteps running outside and perceives a woman being pursued by two thugs. Then he sees the Fate Moira clip the woman's lifeline, consigning her to death.Layla grew up in the foster care system, labeled as "different", "special needs", and on medication for paranoid schizophrenia because of the things she sees. She now works for the Global Insight, an online journal, where she is writing an investigative  series on the Segue Institute and wraiths. When she trespasses onto Segue property to get pictures of Talia Thorne, Adam Thorne's mysterious half fae wife, Layla is escorted back home, but is given a lead by a disgruntled resident. She follows it to a warehouse listed as belonging to Adam Thorne, but is chased and attacked by two thugs intent on raping her. She escapes and enters the warehouse, which contains an metal gate that compels her to open it. A stranger instantly recloses it as something surges through. The man keeps calling her Kathleen, even after she gives him her name and tells him why she's there.  She is enticed into going with him back to Segue when he tells her he can get her in to see Talia, who he claims is her daughter. And even as more unusual things happen, Layla is slow to believe the things she sees, much less what she's told, because of her history. But as events accumulate, she realizes there are other worlds besides Mortality, Death has his limits and that she is living on borrowed time, especially with a devil, Fate and a group of angels after her.  A KU library read.

This is a series that started out great and has somehow gotten better with each book. In Cry Wolf, Diesel has gone to Las Vegas to meet with the Alpha there, a wolf of power who has refused his calls. He needs a way into the pack's casino and the Alpha' s office and is scouting the back alley when a sultry voice calls to him, asking if he has a light. A few cliched rounds later, they are struggling to make it to her suite before tearing each other's clothes off.Willow is a country singing star at the end of a Vegas booking and trying to find her inner muse to write new music for an upcoming album. She goes out back after her last set of the night and sees a man built like a bodyguard walking toward her. On impulse she calls out to him, and in the banter and attraction that follows, she has the feeling there is something familiar about him. She wakes the next morning to an empty bed and a missing room key card, but over the next week can't get him out of her head. So she takes the band's old van on a trip to Angels Rest, a place Diesel described to her. Because it's hunting season she can't find a room there.  But Diesel finds her at a local diner and takes her to Maddie's. During introductions they learn each other's given names and realize they know each other from when they were seven, a time when he spent two weeks with his cousin then had to leave. But not before making a blood oath that they would find each other again, a bond that marked her and placed a sleeping wolf inside her, waiting. A bond and sleeping wolf she knows nothing about, any more than she knows about the wolf inside the man she is falling for. A KU library read.

Joker, Wolves of Angel' s Rest #2, is a quick and exciting read. It is mating season and Bastian Villalobos, cousin of the Alpha and son of the former Alpha who was killed by humans, is a large, sigled white wolf. He captures a solitary hunter who attacked their group and places her in confinement, then proceeds to question her. What he discovers is a young woman who is not only his mate, but the granddaughter of Colonel Reynold Jones, the leader of the Jonestown Militia, the extremists who killed his father. But Leela is no ordinary hunter. She has developed a revolver that doesn't miss and was trying out the prototype on his pack. As they talk, each discover new truths and Leela knows she must try to bring peace to the two sides. But when she returns to the compound to confront her grandfather, she learns plans for an attack on the wolves is already underway, so she returns to the pack. Will she be able to turn the tide of events and become the peacemaker her mother and grandmother before her tried to be, or will she, like them, fall to hatred?

Book Five of the Shifter County Bears is a captivating 137 page standalone with an HEA that brings together the bears and the wolves in a way previously thought to be impossible in their world. This has been a great series and I'm looking forward to the next spinoff series featuring the wolves.After losing her job and her boyfriend, Sloan decided to expand the partial Pacific Crest Trail hike she had planned for the future to the full Canada to Mexico length and to go now. Two and a half months later she has nearly reached a waypoint in Cascadia, the Double Moon Ranch, where she is booked for a couple of days to clean-up and rest. But before she gets there she glimpses a flash of blue back in the trees, something out of place. When she investigates, she discovers an unconscious young man with a dart in his neck. At her screams for help, a naked man appears and gives her directions to the ranch before picking the unconscious man up and trotting ahead of her to the ranch. As she thinks on the oddity of a naked man in the forest, though, she remembers where she is and realizes he must be a shifter.  An ambulance is called and the police's questions are answered. But just as one puzzle is resolved, another presents itself. Sloane becomes the primary suspect in the attempted homicide, and only the resources of the shifters she's just met can help her.Copy received in return for an honest review.

This is Hannah and Sean's story. Hannah is the third woman kidnapped by the were-cougar brothers for mates on directions from their goddess. Unlike the first two women, Hannah has refused to accept Sean as her mate, even after being changed into a shifter herself, condemning Sean to the rest of his life in cougar form. A month after the curse kicks in, however, Hannah strikes a bargain with the goddess. If she finds a replacement for herself as his mate, both she and Sean will be free of each other and the curse. All she has to do is find someone worthy, a job that becomes more difficult with each day as her feelings for him grow and her new roll as Avenger presents itself.This is an exciting and captivating series by one of my favorite authors. The Cougar's Bargain is a must read for fans of PNR shifter stories or for those looking to broaden their reading experiences, because this author's H/h relationship dynamics transcend genres.Copy received in return for an honest review.

I have to admit, I purchased this anthology for just one book - Masterson, and it was worth the cost. Bump in the Night is another story I really enjoyed.  Other books were a bonus.*Bump in the Night, by Elianne Adams. This is a great standalone with an HEA featuring Libbie, a half daemon/witch, and Jay, a werewolf with magic, as they fight against goblins and demons, even traveling into the Shadow World for love.* El Lobizon, Book One : The Midnight Effect. A standalone with an HEA in a continuing storyline.* Rumple's Prize, by Marie Hall. From the Kingdom series, featuring Rumpelstiltskin.* Ravenous, the Lake City serial, part one,  by Annie Nichols.* Marked by Temptation, Coven Pointe #1, by Deanna Chase.*Masterson, by Ellis Leigh. I read an excerpt from this story in Dark and Stormy Alpha Nights, a dark and scorching hot dance floor scene, and I was hooked. So I was very excited to find the  story in this anthology. Masterson, the sired son of the ancient vampire Master, is very old school, powerful and he takes what he wants. He has been looking for a special type of woman for 600 years, since the death of his donor Peaches at the hands of his sire. Each day is the same for him, looking for a human whose blood is untainted, who will submit without the use of his thrall, one that he will keep rather than kill. Then he visits a coffee shop outside his usual haunts and scents a woman who smells like plums with an undertone of death, a beautiful woman who flirts with him and isn't afraid of him. One he can't resist. This woman isn't just a human, though, and what she is will stun him.* More Than a Feeling, The Claire Wiche Chronicles, by Cate Dean.

Following on the heels of book two, this book is my favorite of the series so far.  The characters are well developed and likable, the storyline is engaging and suspense filled, and it can standalone and has a solid HEA. Riley is working on her friend's boat harvesting oysters from a remote section of the bayou when they are attacked by vampires and Riley is taken. The pack sends Dag, their best tracker, after her. In book two they discovered she is a blue moon bride and that there's a good chance Dag is her mate. Several days later, Dag finds the old cabin being used to hold her and gets to her just in time to see her shank the vampire tormenting her and save herself. But the ancient vampire who took her isn't around and they know he will be coming back for her. Dag is determined to protect her and to claim her as his mate. But Riley is determined she can protect herself, that she doesn't need a mate, and that Dag is going to learn to ask, not tell. If anyone is a sure bet at getting her message across to a 300 year old werewolf, it would be Riley. But Dag, a loner on the verge of losing himself to his wolf, has too much at stake to go down without a fight. All he has to do is convince her, and to do that, he has to learn to communicate with her.

This standalone prequel to the Wolves of Twin Moon Ranch Series is captivating and beautifully written. I am a fan of Anna Lowe's works, but this story and series remain my favorites. I first read this novella in an anthology, then reread it as part of Masters of the Hunt anthology, then purchased the single for my e-library. It is that good.Zach is a half wolf/half coyote shifter and tracker who lives on the fringe of the Twin Moon Ranch pack. Rae is an unmated she wolf who ran from an abusive Alpha in Colorado to a Nevada pack that traded her to the Twin Moon Ranch pack in Central AZ.  She comes from a long line of she wolves with a special ability, one that is highly coveted for it's rarity and one she has kept secret to maintain her freedom and independence. But Zach triggers something she has never felt toward an alpha male and Zach finds he is also drawn to the female he has been ordered to keep the other males away from. Neither knows about the terms of her trade or the plans the TMR Alpha has for Rae that could cost Zach his life. But an abusive alpha pack male from Colorado has tracked Rae to Arizona, and he has his own plans for her, including taking her by force if necessary.

What an amazing conclusion to the series!  Edwards is a master storyteller and I can't wait to read more of her works.In the conclusion to the Black Dog series, Thierry and her father travel to Faerie to subdue the Morrigan, dissolve Thierry' s marriage to Rook and to rescue Shaw. All in a day's work for this magical duo. Except when they reach Black Dog's den in Faerie, they find a near dead Rook inside, a victim of Morrigan's anger and madness. They will need allies to defeat the Morrigan and sever the tethers between Faerie and the mortal realm, but is Rook one they can trust?  Or is he still the trickster he was in the past?

After reading Heir of the Dog, Black Dog Book Two, in the Masters of the Hunt anthology, I couldn't quit the series without knowing the whole addictive story.  In Book Two, Thierry was manipulated into Faerie and a fae marriage with the Morrigan's son, which was on the surface his way of protecting her. Now back in the human realm, she is protected by two powerful fae bodyguards and a sabre tooth sized neon yellow cat. Rook is invading her dreams and Shaw can feed from only her. The conclave magistrates allowed her to return to work as a marshall, but must approve cases before she takes them.  Not being a rule follower, it isn't long before she's on suspension and vacationing in Florida with her roommate Mai. There are those in Faerie who don't want a half breed princess on the throne, though, and they have a long reach into the human realm.  Florida turns out to be a convenient location for them as well, since it is one of the homes of an ancient fae, a collector of death bringers like Thierry. And she is in his sights.

This is the second book in the Highland Shifters series, following book one, The Last Alpha. The story begins with a prologue scene from well into the book, then bounces back and forth from the past to the present before settling in.Skye Parker, a uni environmental and ecological student has fallen for Iain Logan, a wild, partying senior. When school ends, she sets off to visit him unannounced and ends up staying with him and his mom in their small apartment. Iain is moody and temperamental, but Skye sticks with him. The story builds slowly, as Iain takes a job with Jonathan Carr from book one and with him finds the acceptance and approval he craves. But not everything is as it seems and Iain will be faced with some very difficult choices before coming to realize that in some things he has no choice at all.While this book can standalone, it is helpful in understanding the dynamics to have read book one first. And the ending is more of a maybe than an HEA. It gets 3.5 stars.Copy received in return for an honest review.

This is a riveting, suspense filled conclusion of the battle to save Earth from total devastation at the hands of the powerful, evil, manipulative, shapeshifting Morrigan. Victory comes at a cost, however, and our band of friends and family will not go unscathed. This series has an overarching storyline that builds with each book, so it is best to start at the beginning, with Highland Secrets, the story of Angus and Airnrhod, the Virgin Huntress. Even at the end, they are still my favorite couple.Jonathan Shea grew up among witches, but barely tapped the storehouse of powers he held, largely because of watching as his father slipped more and more into the dream  world. Then when his father totally disappeared when Jonathan was seventeen, he focused on computers and game design. That was until he met Britta and her bonded First Born dragon, Tarika, in book three and his life changed irrevocably.  Now Jonathan is fighting to protect those he loves from the Morrigan, the Battle Crow of the Celts, who is subverting the Dragon shifter bond and collecting allies from Hades to defeat those who stand against her.

This book picks up where To Love  Highland Dragon ends, with Lachlan, his bonded dragon Kheladin and their new mate, Maggie. Taking advantage of the new bond that allows him to separate from Lachlan, Kheladin is entertaining a coven of witches in his cave. One is Jonathan, who has a wealth of untrained power and more, but before Kheladin can determine exactly what, there is a disturbance to his wards at the cave's entrance. Another dragon shifter pair arrives--a first born, Tarika, and her bonded mage, Britta. They have been sent by the Celts to assist in sorting out the dark shifters aided by the Battle Crow, the Morrigan. But they have come from the past, a past where dragons and nudity were not an issue. So the first order of business is.....shopping.If you've read the prequel to the series, Highland Secrets, the name Jonathan will be familiar, and this is that Jonathan. But things are different than his parents  had hoped and Jonathan is angry and resentful about being abandoned at a young age. This book puts paid to many of his questions about his parentage, while leaving other issues unresolved. But for this HEA junkie it ends fairly well, with lots of material left for the next book.  So I'm now on to Dragon's Dare.

After reading To Love a Highland Dragon, which I loved, in the anthology Flight of Dragons, I purchased this book, it's prequel. It is every bit as good, if not better. Both books can standalone and while this one doesn't end with a HEA, it has a plan and hope for getting there. When dealing with the Celtic pantheon, that may be better than the norm.  But for those of us with a need for closure, it leaves the door to disaster open a little too much. Being an ever hopeful romantic, however, I've purchased book three and am looking forward to seeing more of Lachlan and Maggie from book two, and to meeting Jonathan, the hope for the future.

Things have changed in the town of Glen Vine, Michigan. Because of a mad wolf shifter, there are eight new werewolves in town, and someone is shooting at them.Charlotte Wills is a college student who was dumped and stranded by her ex-boyfriend, resulting in her being attacked and bitten by a wolf. She is in the town's coffee shop when she hears two men talking about going after the wolves that kept them awake howling the night before. Her wolf begins to rise and she runs out of the shop and down the street, right into a brick wall of solid muscle known as the sheriff, another recently turned wolf. Kane Martin is known for his one night stands with waif thin women with augmented features. But there is something about Charlotte bowling him over that catches his attention. And that's her scent. Why has he never noticed she smells so good before?

Hell Squad is a remarkably fresh and riviting series. Each new release brings additional elements to the story and further develops characters introduced in earlier books. To fully appreciate the series, it needs to be read from the beginning.Noah Kim is brilliant, he even has a sign on the computer lab door that says "Shhhh..genius at work". And to former naval intelligence officer, Laura Bladon, or "Captain Dragon", as he calls her, he is a "wayward, arrogant, tech genius". Both had very different lives before the alien Gizzida invasion that obliterated all the major cities on the planet. But like the other survivors at the Blue Mountain Base, they have learned to adapt. And if Lady Luck smiles on them, they may be among the fortunate ones who find love amidst the chaos of preparing the base for evacuation.Copy received in return for an honest review.

I love this series and this book is an excellent addition to it. It has strong lead characters who obviously love each other very much, but are fighting against the odds.Tina, the oldest daughter of the Alpha of Twin Moon Ranch has been in love with Ricardo Rivera since they were teens on adjoining central Arizona Ranches. He left for college, then a career in pro baseball, but returned to visit and to ask her to join him. She turned him down, and will always have to turn him down, because he is human, forbidden. What she doesn't know is that Rick recently moved back after a career ending injury to take over as manager of the neighboring ranch and has given himself twenty days to win her over, and another twenty after that if he needs them, until she agrees to be his. But Atsa, Alpha of the coyote shifters, has brought word of an incursion into the Bitterroot Valley by a hellhound. And it will take the entire Twin Moon Ranch working together if they are to have any chance of defeating the demon, and even then there are still no guarantees, increasing the odds against the fated, but star crossed, mates.Copy received in return for an honest review.

Made up of stories by best selling and emerging authors, this collection is a great value. I found more than one new (to me) author that I will be exploring further, one of whom took my top spot for this book.1. Releasing Her Dragon, by Elianne Adam's, a standalone with an HEA.2. Dragon Reborn, by LC Alleyne. A standalone with an HEA.3. The Dragon's Stolen Bride, by Sadie Haller. A historical standalone with an HEA and a meddling ghost.4. Ice, by Skye Jones. A great menage standalone with a tough MMA cage fighting latent she dragon, the two male dragons who find her and an HEA.5. Forged in Fire, Celtic Dragons, Book One, by Zara Keane. Set in 2158 in a post civil war Ireland, this story is part of a trilogy.6. To Love a Highland Dragon, Dragon Lore, Book One,  by Ann Gimpel. A great time traveling trilogy opener. Highland Secrets is the prequel.7. Demons' Captive, Demons and Dragons, Book One, by Evanne Lorraine. Set in the galactic year 4416 in the Orion Galaxy, this menage is my favorite story in the collection and a great series opener.8. Blue Moon Dragon, by Shelly Munro.9. A Viking's Need, Vikings in Space, Book Three, by Zoe York. A standalone with an HEA between a monk and a woman who loves the natural dragons on his planet.10. Flickering Light, Return to Avalore, Prequel, by Elianne Adams. A short standalone with an HEA.

I read this riveting story in the Flight of Dragons anthology and loved it!  It was my favorite of all of them.  The author provides great character development, world building, and the component that eludes many authors, an emotional hook. Evanne Lorraine is a new author to me, but I will definitely be reading more of her work.A test tube creation, Zaynah has been conditioned from before birth to obey Prado, the Emperor of the Orion Galaxy. At age 25, she is one of his assassins, though she's the smallest and the weakest. So she is surprised when he tells her she is going on a solo mission to infiltrate a rebel mining colony and kill its leaders. But as her space craft nears her target, she is caught in a meteor storm and her craft's systems fail, rendering her injured and near death when a tractor beam pulls her into port.Diablo and his brother, Gunn, are fire demons and  fugitives, falsely accused of murdering their brothers, a crime that was actually  carried out by Prado. They have taken over the empire's mining operation that supplies fuel to the empire and have  forged alliances against Prado, set on avenging their brothers. Because they have interrupted the supply of fuel to the empire for over a year, they expect some kind of retaliation, but not a lone spacecraft piloted by one small woman. One that triggers the mating frenzy in both of them. One that bears the marks of the Emperor's elite assassins, but has no memory of anything before waking in their clinic.Even before she regains full consciousness, Zaynah registers she is in the presence of demons, but is strongly attracted to them in spite of her training.  And when she realizes the attraction is there on their side as well, then lust becomes mating frenzy. A perfect time for the empire to attack.

This is a wacky opener to the new Celebrity Bears Series by Kim Fox, author of the Smoke Jumpers Werebear series. A quick read, it is an easy way to lighten up a day, because it doesn't take anything too seriously. If the next book is anything like this one, Kim will have another winning series on her hands.Mason Maloney is an aging action star who's lost his A-lister status, no longer pulling in prime roles. His bear has started pushing him toward finding a mate and settling down. Little does he know it would be a community college film graduate, Joni Meyer, working on set in 'recycling' who would snag his bear's attention. But little Joni is so much more than "Trash Girl" and she turns it all upside down.Copy received in return for an honest review.

I love Roxie Noir' s take on shifters who have come out and are coexisting, for the most part, with humans and each other. This story takes place in the shifter state of Cascadia, carved out when shifters went public. There are questions left unanswered at the end, a possible conspiracy?  Maybe those will be answered in a later book.  Copy was received in return for an honest review.Charlie, an FBI agent working on a task force with the Dept of Fish and Wildlife, has been assigned to capture or kill a feral grizzly shifter who is believed to have killed two wolf shifters. She stalks him until she gets the perfect shot to tranq him, but before she can fire she is attacked from behind by two wolves.  Kade, not feral at all, chases the wolves away and takes her back to the cabin he shares with Daniel, his mate and they begin the long process of nursing her back to health. In the days to come, after she's able to think clearly again, Charlie begins to question information the task force based their decisions on. Why was Kade targeted, why was she sent in alone, and who really killed the two wolf shifters?
I'm so not a morning person and this fits perfectly. A friend gave me the first one, but the rim chipped, so this one is a replacement. It loses a star for chipping, not once but twice.

This is a 175 page standalone with an HEA that's set in Africa. It had a promising start, but moved a little slowly for me and I found myself skimming pages, especially toward the end.Aurora "Rori" Prescott has been an outsider her whole life. Her father left when she was young, her mother makes her feel she isn't good enough and she has no close friends. But Tori has a dream of studying apex predators and has been accepted to assist a professor for a year in the Serengeti while they track collared lions and she works on her PhD dissertation.Heath Sellers has been hired as their guide. He comes highly recommended, but his experience has come with a price and a big secret. He is a former very successful big game trophy guide to the rich who was cursed three years earlier to become a lion shifter after he was involved in the killing of a lion shifter in lion form. When he meets his new clients, he pegs Tori as a city girl who has no place in the wilds. But when they find carcasses with red arrow shafts nearby, his concern intensifies, because he knows the poacher those arrows belong to, and his job just became much more dangerous.Copy received in return for an honest review.

This standalone single reads like a series opener with much more to come. I'm hoping there is, that it will be affordable and available in electronic format. Please!Ameia just celebrated her 18th birthday on her home planet of Terrea, where her father, Trivent, is sovereign. Because of security concerns, she has never been allowed off planet, so when her step-brother offers to take her for a quick space ride she rebels and accepts. But before they can return, a slavers ship appears and she is told to escape in a capsule programmed to return to Terrea. Something goes horribly wrong, though, and Ameia crashes on a strange planet dressed in a pretty pink dress and ballet flats, having no idea where she is or even  how to operate the controls on the capsule to turn off the freaking alarm. Then a naked, screeching, screaming purple male alien appears and rolls her capsule downhill. And a game of cat and mouse begins, with "Beast" trying to communicate with "Mine" through his broken translator and as much kissing and touching as his skittish, sheltered princess will allow.Copy received in return for an honest review.

I first read Linda Barlow in an anthology and found this book as I explored her other books. It is a great standalone with an HEA, though the two books at the end preceed it chronologically and provide background for Jess, the female lead.Jess, a multiform shifter with Scottish mother and American father, has returned to her grandfather's ranch in Montana from Scotland to get away from her mother's attempts to marry her off to Cameron, another multiform shifter and her second cousin. She soon learns, however, that her grandfather, a wolf shifter, has been keeping secrets when they are involved in an accident and he is  hospitalized.  Before he dies, he alludes to debts and  extracts a promise from her not to contest his will.Cade is Tom's Alpha and long time friend. Jess remembers him from her childhood as the black sheep of his family. His father was Alpha and his older brother was expected to follow as Alpha. But after their deaths, Cade was chosen to lead his pack, winning over another contender, Brandon. Cade's ranch adjoins Tom's and he has made an offer to buy Tom's land. Tom also gains his promise not to contest his will.When Tom's will is read, both Cade and Jess are present, both stunned. Tom has left his ranch and home to both of them. But to claim it, they will have to marry and stay married for six months. Otherwise the ranch will be sold to a land developer and the proceeds will be donated. Both promised to follow his wishes, never expecting to be snared in an arranged marriage. For Jess it's out of the frying pan and into the fire. For Cade it a win win-sex with an end date. But Jess has secrets of her own.

This standalone with an HEA is book four in the Sierra Moon Series and a quick read at 146 pages. It follows Travis as he backpacks through the Sierras, not realizing when he sets out that he has been bitten and turned without his knowledge or consent by a female cougar shifter during a brief hook up. He encounters other shifters on the trail, bear and wolf, with mixed results, getting a brief intro to shifter 101. Then he meets Becka, a human park ranger working a remote camp for the winter, keeping track of snow depths and trying to get on full time for a summer position. He is instantly attracted, but knows natural cougars are loners, just like the shifter that turned him,  and he doesn't want to treat her badly by leaving, an inevitability. The lure is impossible for him to resist, though, and Travis has to learn and come to terms with who he really is, or he will lose his mate forever.Copy received in return for an honest review.

Liam' s Bride, Clan Conroy Brides Series, Book One, 191 pages.This is the first book I've read by Emma Alisyn and I found it to be well written and engaging. She does a good job of character development and world building and provides a quick read that isn't simplistic. It is a standalone series opener with an HEA and I will definitely read more of the series.Meredith has a teaching degree but doesn't want to leave her home town to find a full time job. She works two jobs, barely getting by, but her passion is her job with Teens and Greens, a program for troubled teens at the local YWCA where they learn gardening. So when she learns the building housing her program has been sold to a bear shifter/restaurateur who plans to film a cooking show there, she knows she will have to approach him about letting her program stay.Liam, the Alpha of his Bear Shifter Den, is in a predicament. He has been ordered by the Council to mate with a human to bring in new blood. He strongly believes that there must be a better way to save his race until he meets Meredith on a walk through of the building he just bought. Now he is seeing potential, because he is very interested in this particular human and it appears the interest is mutual. But Meredith has a secret that she is afraid to share with him even as their relationship develops, because she knows it will change his feelings toward her and jeopardize the program for the teens she has come to love.  And as time goes by, the stakes continue to rise.Copy received in return for an honest review.

This is one of the best PNR shifter series I've read.  It has made my reread and recommend lists and this book is an excellent addition to the series.Jameson is a born wolf and a strong member of the Feral Breed MC. A year earlier he found his mate lying among the dead bodies at a massacre and has dreamed of her and grieved her loss ever since.Aoife is an archer, necromancer and deadtalker who helps spirits transition into the afterlife. Overcome by the sheer number of new spirits, she was in a trance between worlds when Jameson found her and thought she was dead. She has dreamed of him every night since then, believing him to be a fantasy.  But when she and Percy, a childhood friend and foreteller, travel to a lighthouse near Merriweather Fields to help witches under attack, she sees a man she thought existed only in her mind. Guided by Percy, her arrows bring down wolves attacking a coven and a man distracted when he sees her, his shock evident.Jameson is confused and temporarily immobilized when he sees the woman he believed dead, opening him to an attack by the enemy.  But when he falls, she comes to his defense, felling wolves with arrows that shouldn't be able to permanently stop them, but do.After the battle ends, it isn't over, though, because the nearby  Merriweather Fields is under siege and Blaze has been challenged by a shifter named King for the presidency of the NALB. And if King defeats Blaze, all of Blaze's supporters will die.

This anthology contains excerpts from fifteen books by favorite authors and rising stars. These "hottest scenes" are sure to help readers find their next exciting read. There are a couple of books in the set that I'd already read in their entirety and I can definitely recommend them. Desert Hunt is from Anna Lowe's Twin Moon Ranch Series and is an excellent read. Call of the Dragon, book one in the Return to Avalore series is also quite good. I haven't yet read Complication, from the Shifters Forever After series, by Elle Thorne, but am intrigued by the excerpt and will be watching for it. I will also be looking into Code Black, book one from the Paranormal Crimes Division series, by Tina Moss. Overall, this anthology is well worth the time and money for the opportunity to sample works by fifteen polished authors.ARC received in return for an honest review.

This is a great boxed set. Through the collaboration of two talented authors, the first three books of the series come to life. In the first, a daughter refuses to believe her father's death was a suicide. No one will take her seriously, though, until she calls the protectors and an attempt is made on her life at the first meeting with her assigned guardian. In Book Two, an actress witnesses the murder of her agent and long time boyfriend, barely escaping with her life. But the police treat her more as a suspect than a witness, and she calls the protectors.  Book Three is my favorite of the set, flowing more seamlessly than the previous two. The tech assistant for the protectors gets a call from her sister asking for help and takes  off to rescue her from a new boyfriend. She doesn't want help, but her boss sends the one guardian she fantasizes about to protect, not her sister, but her.

In a series that started out great and gets better with each book, Jaykun's story is my favorite so far.  And while each of the books can easily standalone and have their own HEA, they are better when read in order because of background and context. I highly recommend this book and the series and will be watching impatiently for book four.The third Immortal brother to be freed by the goddess Weysa from eternal punishment (in his case from burning like a star from the inside out for daring to drink from the fount of life without permission), is in the process of conquering the port city of Kriza in Weysa's name when the story begins. After the city falls, he encounters a naked woman, Jileana, near the beach where he goes each night to burn. Jileana looks nothing like the Krizians, intrigues Jaykun enough to take her back to the castle, and  saves him from an assassin's blade the next morning. He is completely smitten and his brothers are suspicious, but Jileana has asked for three days with him before she has to return home to Serenity, a city on an island concealed by perpetual storms. Jaykun has agreed, but at the end of their time together, he realizes three days isn't enough and impulsively begins a forbidden journey that will change all their lives.Copy received in return for an honest review.

Another great boxed set, the spin-off series from Shifters Forever has moved to Dallas and the Tierro clan of white tigers. Vax, introduced in Seduction when he came to Kane's aid, is the  head of the US arm of the European family's holdings and After Dark, an upscale club designed for shifters. Book One is his story. The next three stories involve his sisters and his head of security. While short, the stories still tic off all the boxes, with a healthy dose of suspense thrown in. I am looking forward to the next spin-off, the Never After Dark series.

This is a great boxed set. It begins with Grant, a bear shifter, and Chelsea, a human. Book Two features Kane, a bear shifter, and Astra,  a human with special abilities. Book Three gives us Teague, a bear shifter and Kelsey, a human from his past. Book Four showcases Teague's brother, Tanner, a bear shifter, and Marti, a human with a secret. Book Five brings us Joe, a Native American with special abilities, and Sara and her cub Ivan, both bear shifters. The final book in the set brings together "Doc", a bear shifter, and Mae, a human with special abilities, and the heart of this growing shifter community. I was sad to see the set end and am excited that there are spinoff series available. I've already bought the next one, and can't wait to get started.

Containing the first three books of the Blood Rose Series, this set is a bargain. After reading Embrace the Dark in the Dark and Dangerous anthology, and the first two shorts from the Blood Rose Tales, I was eager to read Ethan's story in Embrace the Magic. Like the other mastyr vampires, Ethan is very alpha and totally dedicated to protecting his realm from the deadly Invictus. Guilt and betrayal keep him from believing that he will ever bond with a Blood Rose, if he even finds one.  Samantha is a graduate student and jewelry maker in Shreveport. As part of a class assignment she is interviewing 'others' in a bar that caters to them. Then Ethan enters the bar and everything stops. Even the vampires who have been pestering her fade away into the crowd. When he sees Samantha, Ethan is struck by several things: she is a Blood Rose, she is a very powerful part fae, and she has no idea that she is either. Belatedly realizing Samantha is in grave danger from a rogue mastyr, Ry, Ethan takes her to his home in the realm and calls for assistance from the strongest fae he knows to help Samantha learn of her heritage and abilities.In the third book in the Blood Rose Series, Quinlan is in pursuit of a new conquest. Batya is an artist in Lebanon, Tennessee, and mentor and healor to other expats in the area.  Since meeting Batya two months earlier, Quinlan has pursued her relentlessly and is outside her shop when the ancient fae and two supersized Invictus attack. Once Quinlan and Batya realize Batya's assistant was the intended target, and why, they join forces to get her to safety. But of course, nothing simple is ever easy.This book, like the two before it, is beautifully written. The novellas in the series are compelling and impossible to put down.  And while they, along with the Blood Rose Tales shorts, can be read as stand alones, they are much better read in order within the series.  I highly recommend the series and this set is a great way to begin
This is a good collection of shifter stories, with a mix of wolves, bears and cats.  All are standalone, all are book one in a series and they all have an HEA. It's an easy book to recommend.

I loved this book and the way Holley Trent has of writing complex relationships that don't automatically go to an HEA.  She is one of the few authors who is able to  convey emotional highs and lows, strengths and fears, miscommunications and epiphanies that make her characters real and likable and her storyline captivating. This standalone is the first book I've read in the series, but I'll definitely be reading the rest.Megan Scott Coffman Rozhkov is tired of being "Poor Meg", the ex-wife of the cheating, emotionally abusive rock star "Tight Spike" Coffman. Which is why she has entered into an arranged marriage with one of her college circle of friends. Sergei "Seth" Rozhkov is a Russian born, US educated astrophysicist/aerospace engineer raised by his Romani grandmother.  He's reached a stage in his life where he believes he will never have a wife and family. Erica, a mutual friend and matchmaker, sees something in both Meg and Seth that she believes makes them a good match and convinces Seth to go along with the marriage.  But their agreement calls for only a brief marriage, a separation and an end date. And while they find there are some things they are very good at, communication isn't one of them.

Windswept, Serendipity Adventure Romance, Book 3, by Anna Lowe. A standalone with an HEA.This latest book in the Serendipity series is in my opinion the best in series to date. It is set in the small southern Caribbean island of Bonaire, known for it's pristine water and premier scuba diving. Mia Whitman and her sister, Melanie, are taking their turn sailing Serendipity, the 32' sailboat left to them and their cousins by their grandfather so they could 'reconnect'. Mia has taken a temporary job as a scuba instructor on the island and is shocked when one of the divers on the excursion is her ex, Ryan Hayes, a former SEAL and current NYPD diver. He says he has followed her to apologize for his part in a betrayal that ripped them apart weeks earlier. But Mia is on a mission to forget, not forgive, until she witnesses a crime and becomes the target of a rich and powerful consortium. When Ryan saves her life, jeopardizing his own, Mia is more inclined to listen. And as the threat against her continues to escalate, Mia and Ryan find themselves running for their lives in paradise.Copy received in return for an honest review.

Roth: Hell Squad, Book 5, by Anna Hackett.It's been a year and a half since the alien invasion of Earth and a small force of survivors are fighting back from a hidden military installation outside Sydney, Australia. Avery Stillman, a Coalition Central Intelligence Agency agent on the fast track to the top, spearheaded negotiations with the alien Gizzida before being betrayed by a politician on the team. She was handed over to the aliens and placed by them into a genesis tank to change her into an alien raptor. A year later she was pulled from the tank by Roth Masters, leader of Squad Nine from Blue Mountain Base. She has huge holes in her memory and Roth is pushing her hard to remember anything that will help in the fight against the invaders, but his incessant interrogations haven't shaken anything loose. So, just as Roth realizes she really doesn't remember and that he is beginning to care for her,  Avery elects to go through a dangerous memory retrieval procedure.  Success could mean an increased chance of survival for the base's inhabitants, but the procedure could also leave her brain damaged or worse, take her life. Regaining her memory could also clear her to return to active duty and to join the  search for the man who betrayed her and the billions who died because of his cowardice. Roth doesn't like the risk, but is determined to give her something he provides his teammates everyday --backup.Copy received in return for an honest review.

Reed: Hell Squad #4, by Anna Hackett. A suspense filled 205 page standalone with an HEA, better when read in order for the overarcing storyline and addictive enough to make it impossible to put down.Reed MacKinnon, a former Navy SEAL, joined the Hell Squad as a replacement after making a name for himself on another squad. He is an explosives expert, is at home in the water, and carries a mayhem carbine with  mini missle launcher attached.  He has a "brown-eyed girl" in his thoughts and dreams, one who looks alot like his fantasy librarian.Dr. Natalya Vasin is an alien lab survivor and renowned genius energy scientist. Since her rescue she has been working with Blue Mountain Base's  technology team to improve the base's efficiency, when new information about the Gizida's energy systems comes in. At the same time, lethal human raptor hybrids infiltrate the base like Trojan horses and it comes to light that not only is Natalya no longer fully human, but that she can speak and read raptor. As paranoia runs through the base, Reed will have to find a way to keep Natalya safe, both at base and on the missions being planned to disable the Gizida's energy sources, missions that will require Natalya's expertise.

This set is a great rewrite of Norse mythology. If you liked Vikings Unleashed, you will love this anthology, since it contains follow-up stories to a number of books in that anthology. I enjoyed the sense of connectedness and familiarity that brought to the set. And the books are all stand alones with HEAs, another major plus.1. Viking's Desire, Twilight of the Gods, Book 1.5, by Crystal Jordan. Follow-up to Vikings Fire, Twilight of the Gods, Book 1.2. Bound by the Viking, Warriors Unleashed, Book 3, by Anne Marsh. Follow-up to At the Viking's Command, Warriors Unleashed, Book 2.3. A Viking's Bride, Vikings in Space, Book 2, by Zoe York. Follow-up to A Viking's Peace, Vikings in Space, Book One.4. The Wild Fen, Hel's Belles MC, Book 2, by Dayna Hart. Follow-up to Hel's Belles 1.5. A Most Wanted Viking, Sela Carson. A standalone whose prequel, A Wolf to Watch Over Me (SS), was not in Vikings Unleashed.6. Viking's Pride, Afotama Legacy, Book 2.5, by Holley Trent. Book One, The Viking Queen's Men, was in Vikings Unleashed.7. Viking Claimed, The Triad Series, Book 4, by Kate Pearce. Follow-up to Viking Unbound, The Triad Series, Book Three.Copy received from author in return for an honest review.

Gabe: Hell Squad, Book Three, by Anna Hackett, 211 pages. Set in a post alien apocalyptic Sydney, Australia, the books in this series can standalone, with their own HEA, but would be better read in sequence. They are addictive and I can't wait to read the next book, Reed.The very scary Gabe Jackson has been in a tailspin since dinosaur like alien raptors killed his twin brother on a mission three months earlier. He is obsessed with killing as many of the aliens as he can, without regard to his own safety, putting himself in the doghouse with the leader of Hell Squad, Marcus. The only bright spot in Gabe's world now is Dr. Emerson Green, Blue Mountain Base's head of medical services.Emerson has been fighting her own nightmares since being captured and beaten by a raptor on a recent mission to rescue  human survivors held in a lab by the aliens. The bright spots in her sleepless nights are when a silent Gabe slips into her locked room.  Emerson wants more, wants a real relationship, but Gabe is certain she deserves someone better than a genetically altered soldier with an absence of feelings and words.  In this there is no middle ground, especially in a world where the Gizida reign, and each mission could be their last.

Blood Flame, The Flame Series #1, 182 pages, standalone series opener with an HEA.This is a fantastic series opener in the vein of the Blood Rose and Guardian series, but set in Phoenix, or a version of Phoenix. Connor is an Officer with the Border Patrol, an agency that patrols the Five Bridges area, which separates the five paranormal territories from each other and from Phoenix. Ten years earlier Connor's wife died suddenly and in his grief he took the drug Blood Flame, not realizing it was laced with Alter, a serum that changed him into a vampire. While he is a moral man in an agency on the take from drug and sex lords, he also has done things he regrets. And since seeing Iris in action as a Tribunal Public Safety Officer, he has become obsessed with the witch, watching her from the shadows, even though he knows that as a witch she is his mortal enemy.Iris and her sister were kidnapped and given Blood Flame laced with witch serum nine years earlier. Iris was abandoned by her captors, but Violet was forced into slavery and killed by a group of vampires high on Flame. Iris has sensed Connor' s presence as he studies her, and she is likewise interested in him, but wary. Then they are each called out on a reported drug runner, then on a homicide of a TPS witch and border patrol officer.  And it quickly becomes obvious someone is setting Connor and Iris up to die as well, unless they find a way to work together.Copy received in return for an honest review.

Wow! What a ride. The story begins with the Phoenix brothers on a treasure hunt when they are tased and taken captive by Galactic Institute of Historical Preservation agents. Niklas Phoenix, an astro-archeologist and former employee of the Institute, is at first furious, then bewildered when the encounter turns into a job offer. Avril, a young Institute director, wants Nik as part of an expedition she has put together to Dark Earth, a planet destroyed by nuclear war and still highly radioactive. New technology and medical advances will allow the treasure hunters to enter targeted sites to look for treasures left behind by evacuees before the apocalypse. He refuses the offer, but is awakened that night by an intruder who informs him she has been hired for the expedition and that a rare manuscript will be available to the hunters.Nera Darc, a beautiful, ruthless and deadly treasure hunter has intrigued Nik for most of the series. So, of course he calls Avril and accepts her offer, much to the dismay of his brothers.I loved this story. It has been a long wait for Nik and Nera to finally come together, and it's as exciting as it is romantic. There are Institute baddies, treasure hunter baddies, mutant jungle cats, rampaging zombies, a sex slave and surprise characters. Through it all, Nik and Nera hold steady, watching each other's backs as they face off against one surprise after another. But they are up against increasingly overwhelming odds, even for someone with Nera's skill set and Nik's intelligence. For me, this is the best book in the series to date.ARC received in return for an honest review.

This is another good collection of mostly standalone shifter stories with HEA's. Book Six is the exception. My favorite is book ten, Zorth, Witch Way Series, Book One, by Crystal Dawn. It features a witch, Zorth, who is more than a witch, and his mate Arabella, a white wolf with some magical powers of her own. Together they work with other witches, wolf shifters, and vampires to bring down a drug lord that has put a contract out on Arabella in an effort to bring down Zorth.

This anthology is a great mix of shifter stories, most of them standalone, with only books two and eight being serial episodes. Book Seven, Trancing the Tiger, Chinese Zodiac Series #1, is a very good debut novel.  A few others also made my list of authors to watch. But it was book ten, Bear Trapped, Bear Force Series Book One, by Eve Hunter, that took the top spot. Book Two is due out later this month and I'll be watching for news of it's release. Until then, it's on to Grrr #2.

This author is one of the few I will preorder, because she has never disappointed. This book is no exception and is one of my favorites. In the intro, she recommends reading Wolf Claim first, which provides background for Brett, but all of the Willow Bend books are exceptional, so that is no hardship. Reading one will definitely leave you wanting to read more anyway. So enjoy!!Colby Jensen is working her last day of community service as a nurses aid in Maine when she gets a job offer from a surly patient admitted a few weeks earlier after being badly injured by a hit and run driver. Luc Danes is a lone wolf who was tracking a strange scent when hit, resulting in two broken legs, a broken arm, a skull fracture and week long coma. He needs to get out of the hospital immediately to maintain his human form, makes arrangements for an AMA discharge and hires the human Colby to drive him to his former pack in Westchester County, NY.  By the time they arrive at the remote destination, Luc is unconscious and Colby is looking for a phone to call for an ambulance. That's when Brett Dalton, Alpha of the Hudson River Pack, finds her in his kitchen with his landline in hand, smelling of Luc. And when he moves his childhood friend from the car to the house, Luc rouses long enough to tell Brett to keep Colby from leaving. But why? And what's with her confusing scent:  wolf, not wolf;  pack, not pack?

There is so much to love about the Savannah Martin series. The dry humor, the cast of characters, the jabs at prejudice and discrimination, the value of friends and family, and most of all, the tenderness, love and respect  between Rafe and Savannah. It seems the entire series has been leading up to this book, with the happy couple finally getting to their "I do's", before heading to a B&B honeymoon on the Florida coast, a gift from Savannah's sister and brother. But a B&B usually comes with breakfast, not a dead hostess. And when Rafe is taken in for questioning, Savannah begins her quest for the real killer, because she wants her groom to actually be part of the honeymoon, not sitting in a Florida jail.

Passion's Fire, Book Two of the Passion Moon Series, a novella.Beginning this book without reading book one was a little like stepping onto a moving walkway, there was an initial jolt before it smoothed out and time flew by.  Renee Jordan filled in the background well enough and world building was good.  The featured characters are likable and the villainous ex boyfriend is just powerful enough to be a real threat.  The story held my interst and I would be interested in exploring more by this author, and especially in a complete Passion Moon.Copy received in return for an honest review.

This standalone short story is a delightful, quick and easy read. It's a little different than the norm for PNR shifter books and is funny and warm, with some twists from a jealous rival. I can easily recommend it for those wanting a quick read at lunch or before bed, with the caveat that there is a potential emotional trigger in the storyline.Copy received in return for an honest review.

Nathan Kamchatka is the enforcer for the North Star clan's Alpha, Brock, who is traditional, a separatist, and brutal when he believes he needs to be.  They were best friends growing up and Nathan fell into the role when Brock became Alpha.  Because of the things he has done, Nathan doesn't think he will ever have a mate, because he doesn't deserve one  Then Brock orders him to help with security at a bethrothal ceremony between a member of their clan and the Yukon City Alpha's daughter, an alliance Brock badly wants.  But Nathan is shocked when he sees the bride to be, Leah Whitehorse, because he feels things he thought were myth.  If he didn't know better, he'd think she was his mate.Leah hadn't met Ian before the betrothal ceremony, but her father made the arrangements and told her Ian is her mate.  She wonders why he doesn't make her feel the way Nathan does, though.  And as much as she tries to follow her father's orders, all she can think about is Nathan.This is a great addition to the North Star Shifters.  It gives a clearer understanding of the clan and the Alpha, provides good development of primary and secondary characters, and continues the worldbuilding begun in the earlier books.  The book can standalone, but is better as part of the series, and has a very good HEA.  I recommend it for PNR shifter lovers and give it 4.5 stars.Copy received in return for an honest review.

A SEAL' s Temptation, A Harlequin Uniformly Hot! Novel, by Tawny Weber.Lark Sommers moved to Little Lake, Idaho from San Francisco eighteen months earlier to help her mother, who had been diagnosed with terminal cancer.  She now runs her mother's coffee house, The Magic Beans, having given up her career as a potter and her former life. Her new friends see unhappiness under her facade and decide she needs a temporary romance with someone passing through town. As a result, Sara invites her brother home for her birthday, and puts him up in the vacant apartment above the coffee shop. The apartment next door to Lark' s. And then she steps back.The attraction between Lark and Shane is immediate and irresistible. But Shane is called back to base before telling Lark what his job is and he leaves a note on her pillow saying he'll be in touch. Lark was dumped in a similar manner when she left San Francisco, so she tells herself it was just a fling. Then Sara tells her he isn't a traveling salesman, as his family claims, or a male stripper, as Lark had guessed. He's a SEAL and his job is dangerous and unpredictable, which is proven true when Sara gets a call a week later that changes everything. And Lark will have to face her fears and survivors guilt if what they shared is to become more than a two night stand.This addition to the Uniformly Hot! Series is a great standalone with a warm HEA. I enjoyed it a lot.A copy was received in return for an honest review.

As a runner, I am getting a lot of use from Craft Men's Base Layer shirt. Craft is a leader in active wear with its unique three-layer strategy for regulating body temperature in challenging environmental conditions. I believe that everyone who wants the ultimate in comfort, usability and style should give Craft's Base Layer shirt a try.I like how the Base Layer shirt breathes with me as part of my cold weather fitness strategy. Depending on the conditions at the moment, I typically bundle either a cotton shirt and/or a jacket on top of the Base Layer shirt. I find that I can get in the zone and maintain a good running pace without chilling on the outside or overheating on the inside. Fantastic!  To me, the benefit is that the Craft Base Layer shirt will help me achieve my fitness goals.I highly recommend Craft Men's Base Layer shirt to everyone.

I'm loving the look I get with Garnier Curl Stretch Loosening Pudding. Garnier is a quality manufacturer of affordable hair care products. I believe that everyone with curly hair should give this excellent product a try.I like using Garnier Curl Stretch to get the 'surfer dude' look my wife likes. Keep in mind that as a man, I have relatively long hair (not quite to my shoulders) but probably shorter than most women; so I get a lot of style from using just a small amount of Curl Stretch. All I do is apply Curl Stretch to towel-dry hair and massage in. I've found that a little bit of mussing and teasing my hair results in a nice, wavy flow with just the right amount of curl.Anyway, my wife noticed the difference right away.  She commented that it's a great look on me. Sweet!I highly recommend Garnier Curl Stretch to everyone.

I've been a satisfied Vega Sport customer for several years and very pleased to see its new Performance Protein is better than ever. Vega Sport is the leader in plant-based performance supplements using nothing but ingredients of high integrity. I believe that everyone looking for a great performance supplement should give this excellent product a try.I like to stay fit but now that I'm over 50, I need a little extra help. I don't want to consume a lot of red meat so I need an alternative protein source. Vega Sport is exactly what I need. It's a plant-based protein that is free of glutens and soy (a food I need to avoid because I have thyroid issues). Plus there are amino acids and glutamine to provide a complete solution that aids in muscle repair and recovery. For me, it doesn't get any better than this.I also like the vanilla flavor. It's agreeable straight up and is a natural for making smoothies.  Just add any fruit, blend and it's good to go.I highly recommend Vega Sport Performance Protein to everyone.

I believe that Viva Labs Vitamin C is the very best vitamin C on the market.  Viva Labs uses nothing but high quality ingredients and manufactures in an FDA approved. Everyone looking for the benefits of vitamin C should give this excellent product a try.I like that Viva Labs sources its vitamin C from non-GMO corn grown in Scotland (where the threat of cross-contamination with GMO corn is nil). Bioflavonoids from citrus fruit peels and rose hips round out the formulation while improving absorption. A single 1,000 mg capsule comprises 1,667% of the daily value, making it easy to get all the vitamin C I need.I highly recommend Viva Labs Vitamin C to everyone.

Viva Labs Vitamin D3 is the best vitamin D capsule I've ever used.  Viva Labs is a leading supplements manufacturer whose U.S. facility happens to be FDA-approved. I believe that everyone seeking the benefits of vitamin D should give this excellent product a try.This is not your father's vitamin D. The capsule is translucent because the vitamin D is derived naturally from sun-soaked lanolin. As with all of their vitamins, a proprietary formulation helps ensure maximum absorption of the active ingredient. I have no doubt that I will get far better results using Viva Labs when compared with competing brands.With sunlight growing scarce with winter approaching, I expect that Viva Labs Vitamin D3 will help me fight the winter blues and of course, provide other benefits including bone, tooth and heart health.I highly recommend Viva Labs Vitamin D3 to everyone.

The Happiness Industry by William Davies offers a thoughtful, passionate and powerful critique of the capitalist state.  Mr. Davies is a U.K.-based educator and social critic who spent five years writing this exceptionally well-researched book.  I believe that everyone alarmed by the intrusions of capital into our personal psyches will be empowered by this eye-opening book.Mr. Davies believes that Jeremy Benthams conceptualization of money as a proximate measure of happiness set the stage for psychology and capitalism.  The subsequent rise of consumerism has eviscerated the political subject: labor is endured merely to gain the money necessary for purchasing happiness.  Mr. Davies talks about how an increasingly sophisticated marketing industry that is maniacally focused on surveillance, manipulation and profit.Mr. Davies contends that decades of Thatcher-style individualism has produced several generations of insecure workers who have internalized their precarious, impoverished circumstances. The pharmaceutical industry has gained enormously as the powerless seek relief from their depression through medication. An important takeaway from the author's lesson is that competitiveness and the management of happiness go hand in hand.Mr. Davies discusses the exploitation of the individuals social capital for marketing purposes, which he believes is steadily eroding personal friendships and altruism. Problematically, the enormous quantity of data captured by government and industry has allowed the powerful to manipulate individuals with precision; while few of us are capable of fully understanding the invidious media that feeds upon us.  Mr. Davies believes people can fight back only when it is admitted that unhappiness is the product of a coercive capitalist culture that has succeeded in beating down the working class. In fact, the author argues that the relative happiness of workers in employee-owned companies suggests that economic and political rights are keys to achieving real happiness.I highly recommend this excellent book to everyone.

I believe that CoQ10 by Viva Labs is an important whole health solution. Viva Labs is a U.S. based, FDA approved manufacturer of quality nutraceutical products. Everyone interested in the benefits of CoQ10 should give this excellent product a try.I like that Viva Labs has formulated its CoQ10 with BioPerine, a black pepper fruit extract clinically proven to improve bioavailability. Of course, absorption is really important for getting the greatest benefit possible from the active ingredient. This attention to the end user is one of the things that sets Viva Labs apart from other supplements manufacturers.CoQ10 has proven benefits for human health including cellular regeneration, antioxidants, enzymes and cardiovascular health.  CoQ10 alone will not cure anything but I believe it is useful when used as part of an overall wellness strategy. Anyway, my expectation is that Viva Labs CoQ10 will contribute in a small but meaningful way to my health.I highly recommend Viva Labs CoQ10 to everyone.

I am very satisfied with Viva Labs' triple combination of Glucosamine (750 mg), Chondroitin (600 mg) and MSM (500 mg). Viva Labs is an FDA approved manufacturer of high-quality nutraceuticals. I believe that everyone seeking to improve their joint and tissue health should give this excellent product a try.As a consumer, I like that Viva Labs uses quality, natural ingredients in a facility known for adhering to industry best practices. For that reason, I trust that Viva Labs has formulated the three active ingredients in the most optimal way possible.As a practical matter, I take a capsule every other day to help my 55-year old joints keep moving. I like to stay active with a moderate amount of exercise so it's important that I stay ahead of the curve. I find that it works for me. I'm able to maintain a light running schedule without any major discomfort.Obviously, people who have more challenging fitness regimens or physical issues might choose to take more. In fact, the manufacturer's suggestion is two capsules per day to get the best effect.  In that case of course, a consultation with a health care professional is recommended.

I think Garnier SkinActive Moisture Rescue is a very good 2-in-1 sunscreen and moisturizing solution. Garnier is a leader in quality yet affordable hair and skin care products for men and women. I believe that everyone who wants to protect themselves from sun and environment should give this fine product a try.I like that Moisture Rescue is a lightweight formula that can be used every day. It spreads very evenly.  I've found that a little goes a long way, which makes it a good value.At SPF 15, Moisture Rescue is intended for normal everyday use to provide protection from environmental exposure.  I think it works very well at locking in my skin's moisture. I feel better knowing that Moisture Rescue provides a thin but durable protective barrier against the elements including sun, wind, rain and cold.I highly recommend Garnier SkinActive Moisture Rescue to everyone.

"Tickle" by Opus Five is a terrific straight-ahead jazz album comprised of all-original tunes.  The members of Opus Five are among the very best musicians active in the NYC jazz scene today: Seamus Blake on saxophone, Alex Sipiagin on trumpet, David Kikoski on piano, Boris Kozlov on bass and Donald Edwards on drums.What makes this project special is the rapport these five virtuoso musicians have developed due to their frequent collaborations on the Criss Cross Jazz label. In fact, "Tickle" is the fourth collaboration by Opus Five to appear on the label.  Although any one of these musicians is more than capable of riffing for minutes on end, you won't find any egos run amok here. Instead, what you'll find are songs that stretch out just enough to allow each artist time to make their individual statements; and then step aside to allow their band mates to build on their creativity.To my ears, the music on this disc proves that the Opus Five collective has grown stronger with time. All five contribute at least one song to the project - and there are no weaknesses.  The collegiality, respect and professionalism that exists within this group allows for nothing but first-class material to make the cut."Silver Pockets" cleverly plays homage to a Horace Silver riff, setting up a series of tasty improvisations in the pocket. "Tickle" is a dynamic tune kick-started by Edwards and featuring Sipiagin's signature fiery trumpet stylings. "New Old Ballad" is setup very nicely with Kikoski's magnificent piano and followed up with soulful, thoughtful statements from Blake, Sipiagin and Kozlov.  "Five Corners" showcases the five player's telepathy, instincts and good taste to produce an enjoyable upbeat jazz tune.  "Crack to the Crevice" gets the funk out with some great playing by Kikoski among others. "Equilibrium" is yet another fine example of how well the players support and balance each other to achieve a kind of timeless, classic jazz sublimity.  "Murzake" is a classic wine-and-roses tune that surely belongs on a romance playlist.I highly recommend "Tickle" to everyone.

I am very pleased with this excellent blue, button-down collar shirt. Oxford NY is a quality manufacturer of affordable men's clothing. I believe that anyone who needs everyday office wear should give this excellent shirt a try.The cotton/polyester blend shirt feels cool and comfortable. It's also easy to care. I just throw it in the wash and hand-steam to take out the wrinkles. It's a great shirt that helps me get through the work week.I highly recommend Oxford NY to everyone.

I am very pleased with this set of 6 kitchen windowpane cloths. DII is a quality manufacturer of affordable kitchen textiles and home accessories. I believe that homeowners will be pleased with these very useful kitchen cloths.I like using the DII windowpane cloths for everyday cleaning.  The package of six includes three white cloths with yellow pattern; and three yellow cloths with white pattern. For me, that's sufficient to ensure that I've always got at least one clean cloth on-hand between laundry cycles. 100% cotton ensures that these cloths are ready to use after each laundering.I highly recommend DII Kitchen Basic Windowpane cloths to everyone.

Lenovo Y is a great mechanical keyboard for serious gamers. Lenovo is a leader in PC hardware whose product line includes high-performance gaming PCs. I believe that everyone looking to step up their game should give this excellent keyboard a try.Of course, a mechanical keyboard is a must-have due to the improved responsiveness of the keys compared to ordinary plastic keyboards. Anti-ghosting means that you can press multiple keys and the keyboard will send the full, simultaneous input (not just the first key!). You can store up to 18 macros per game to trigger a user-defined series of actions (which is really useful in role playing games).It should be mentioned that the keyboard flat-out looks amazing. It's a serious keyboard that will get you psyched (when it's not putting others on notice that you're a player)!  Red backlighting keys, 3.5mm mic-in and audio-outs, USB, Kailh Red switches and an ergonomic design including a detachable palm rest round out this great product.I highly recommend this excellent product to everyone.

"Philosophy and the Idea of Communism" is a transcript of a conversation recorded on March 23-24, 2012.  The subject is the renowned French philosopher Alain Badiou who was interviewed by Peter Engelmann.  This intellectually challenging short book has moments of value but suffers for being far too esoteric.The book has two chapters.  Chapter one is the interview from March 23rd.  Badiou and Engelmann muse about various fine points made by Hegel, Kierkegaard, Lacan, Nietsche, Sartre and other philosophers.
