While I suppose that this content might be most interesting to philosophy students, as a general interest reader I found value on several points. For example, Badiou's perspective on "the death of God" in the 1960s as a harbinger of late capitalism and its emerging nihilism was helpful to me..Chapter two is the discussion on March 24th.  The conversation is more historically grounded. Badiou has a knack for taking the long view and connecting events in ways that many of us have not considered before. For example, Badiou says that failures of the Paris Commune in 1848 led subsequent generations of revolutionaries to the conclusion that the Party was necessary.  Badiou believes this is why the Russian Revolution of 1917 resulted in the disaster of state-run communism. Badiou goes on to noodle over the issue of a new communist subject who has transcended the limitations of state citizenship. Badiou suggests that people have the potential to be part of something larger; where love, art and democracy have gained full expression.To be sure, this book contains numerous small insights. However, the wide-ranging inquiry leads us from one issue to the next without fully satisfying our curiosity. Problematically, these two brilliant people seem to enjoy discussing esoteric philosophical and historical subjects that frankly aren't of much value to most readers. For these reasons, I came away from this book slightly disappointed. Although there are insights to be gained, it seems to me that a more on-point discussion about the issues that matter to us today would have been far more valuable.

I am very pleased to have discovered DII Bar Mop towels.  DII is a quality manufacturer of affordable household items including these very useful kitchen towels.  I think every household will like using this versatile product - while enjoying the money saved from using fewer paper towels, too.DII Bar Mop towels are packaged in a variety of color schemes.  I like the 'dark' color set.  It suits my contemporary-style kitchen and is a little more resistant to showing wear and tear. After all, the towels are intended for cleaning!  (Having said that, I wouldn't dissuade you from experimenting with some of the other colors if you feel they suit you better.)I've found these towels to be more durable than others I've used.  DII Bar Mop towels are 100% cotton and can be thrown in the wash. In fact, I believe the towels are slightly more absorbent after the first wash.If you're like me, you will quickly become accustomed to using these towels.  For that reason, it might be a good idea to buy two or three sets.  That way, you'll always have a supply available to you during wash cycles.I highly recommend DII Bar Mop towels to everyone.

I'm very pleased to have discovered Move Free Night formula featuring glucosamine and melatonin.  Schiff is a reputable supplements manufacturer known for its affordable products. I believe that everyone like me who's over 50 should give this excellent product a try.It might seem obvious, but blending glucosamine, chondroitin and melatonin into a single pill is an inspired idea. I suppose that other old timers like myself could use a little help with their joint health and benefit from a good night's sleep, too.  There's nothing here that isn't based on safe and sound science: glucosamine and chondroitin are proven solutions for joint relief while melatonin is a proven natural sleep aid. And I think it makes a lot of sense to take these particular supplements at night so that a body can absorb and gain as much benefit as much as possible.Of course, I can only speak for myself but Move Free Night has definitely helped me. I feel more rested than before and ready to take on a new day.I highly recommend Move Night Free to everyone.

My wife  is very pleased with this stylish, high-quality Wrangler denim jacket. Wrangler is well-known for its line of Western attire. I believe that anyone looking to achieve the classic all-American look should give this great denim jacket a try.I like that Wrangler has put technology to use.  This is not your mother's denim jacket (and that's a good thing)!  Wrangler has used a blend of materials to create a more lightweight denim jacket than possible before.  I believe the extra comfort is a major reason why this jacket has become my wife's favorite go-to for casual wear.I highly recommend Wrangler women's denim jacket to everyone.

I am very pleased with this fine set of placemats. John Ritzenthaler is a quality manufacturer and importer of stylish and functional kitchen textiles. I think that everyone looking for quality placemats for their home should give these a try.I've found these attractive placemats look nice in a contemporary-styled kitchen. The weave is tight but the material has a shimmering, slightly translucent look.  For that reason, I think they look really great on a glass table top or similar surface.I highly recommend Ritz TechStyle placemats to everyone.

I am really impressed with these versatile cleaning cloths. DII makes a full line of useful and affordable housewares.  I've found these cleaning cloths to be ideal for use all around the house (not just the kitchen).Of course, the cloths are well-suited for cleaning and polishing stainless steel surfaces. I like to apply cleaner to the fabric side and then polish using the nylon/mesh side. It's an easy way to bring out the shine. My kitchen hasn't looked better!I've found the cloths can be used on glass, plastic and other smooth surfaces, as well. It's a great way to save money on paper towels.  All I have to do is toss the cloths into the wash and they're ready to go again.I highly recommend DII kitchen cleaning cloths to everyone.

I'm glad to have discovered Oxford NY Men's gabardine dress pants. The 100% polyester material is very comfortable yet well-suited for everyday wear.  The modern fit is very flattering - it'll help you catch a few eyes, if you want.It's also worth noting that I found that Oxford NY is exacting: I ordered waist 34 and that's exactly what I got.I highly recommend Oxford NY Men's dress pants to everyone.

I am very pleased with the Oxford NY Men's spread collar shirt. The shirt has a clean, contemporary style that's great for everyday business wear. I like that Oxford NY offers a Trim Fit option which suits me fine.The blend is 60% cotton and 40% polyester. I suppose you could take it to the dry cleaner but I found that putting the shirt in the washer works just fine.  All I do is use a hand steamer to iron out the few wrinkles and I'm ready to go. Of course, the cotton/polyester blend is very comfortable.I highly recommend Oxford NY Men's shirts to everyone.

I think Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed is the best.  Scotts is the leading brand in lawn care and this excellent new grass seed demonstrates why. The WaterSmart coating is an innovative technology that helps the seed absorbs moisture.I like using Scotts to rebuild the areas in my lawn stressed by heat, sun and pets. I aerated the lawn and spread the seed with a light covering of topsoil. After a week of keeping the area moist with frequent watering, the seed sprouted.  Fantastic!  I love the new look of my rejuvenated lawn.I highly recommend Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed to everyone.

I believe this beautiful baguette pendant is a fine choice for the lady in your life. The chain is sterling silver and the baguette is 14 pieces of cubic zirconia. Eye-catching yet affordably priced, I think this pendant will please most any woman.I gifted the pendant to my wife.  She really likes how the stones sparkle with color under bright lights. I think it's a great option for her to wear during the week when just a little splash (but not too much) is the order of the day.I highly recommend this nice piece of jewelry to everyone.

I've found this great set of Bar Mop kitchen towels by Whom White to be very useful everywhere around my house. These 100% cotton towels are well-suited for most everyday cleaning tasks - glass, countertops, furniture and etc. I can't imagine anyone who couldn't do without this excellent product.I highly recommend Whim White Bar Mop Kitchen Towels to everyone.

"Strata" is a terrific contemporary jazz recording by Ivo Neame, an up-and-coming U.K. pianist. The disc features all original tunes written by Neame. The project was championed by Whirlwind Recordings, a musician-owned label that is providing a platform for talented British jazz artists. I believe that jazz fans who are interested in hearing fresh, creative sounds will find a lot to enjoy in this excellent recording.Neame mostly plays acoustic piano but also plays keyboard and accordion on several tunes. Like Neame, all of the very capable supporting players are young, like-minded Brits who are serious about their craft.  The ensemble includes Tori Freestone on saxophone (and flute on one song), Jim Hart on vibraphone, Tom Farmer on bass and Dave Hamblett on drums. I think the quintet format really allows Neame's well-crafted songs to breathe as good jazz music should, allowing many fine moments of interplay, feeling and improvisation.I've come to appreciate the subtleties in this recording that keep me intrigued and wanting to play it again and again. The predominant influence on tunes such as "Personality Clash" is post-bop where the players delight us with their virtuosity, passion and inventiveness. "OCD Blues" and "Crise de Nerfs" feature shifting time signatures, challenging the ensemble to show range, personality and adaptability.  Of course, the title song, "Strata" is a clear standout where the acoustic sound is nicely complemented by light keyboard and sound vibrato effects (in a just world, "Strata" would be a sure-fire Chill radio hit). Suffice to say there are no weaknesses on this recording; just a compelling mix of creative, fresh sounds played by the next generation of jazz musicians. I think the future is in good hands.I highly recommend this excellent album to everyone.

I am pleased to have discovered Viva Labs 100% Chelated Magnesium. Viva Labs is a quality U.S.-based manufacturer of nutritional products including USDA certified organics.  I believe that everyone interested in the health benefits of magnesium should give this excellent product a try.I like to stay fit and value magnesium for its role in cell formation, heart health and blood pressure. 1 tablet equals 50% of the recommended daily value, meaning the 240 tablets in the bottle is sufficient for 4 months if I take the full daily dose.  Chelated magnesium is preferred because it helps improve absorption.I highly recommend Viva Labs 100% Chelated Magnesium to everyone.

I'm very pleased with Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed. To me, Scotts is the gold standard in lawn care products. I believe that everyone who wants to start or replenish their lawns should give this excellent product a try.I have a mature lawn that gets stressed by heat and sun exposure in the front yard and pets in the back yard. I aerated the yard before applying Scotts Grass Seed to the areas that needed it the most. I was impressed with the relatively large size of the individual seeds and their distinctive blue color (which is useful because I can easily see where I've applied seed to the lawn).Care is easy.  I lightly sprinkled to keep the seeds from drifting.  Scotts Grass Seed absorbs the water unlike any other seed I've used. I like that there's very little chance of run-off.At this time, I am waiting for my latest application of seed to lead to regrowth.  However, I have used this product before Depending on weather conditions, I expect the seed will sprout within 1 to 2 weeks. I can't wait!I highly recommend this excellent product to everyone.

As an owner of two small breed dogs, there's nothing I don't like about Solid Gold Star Chaser.  Solid Gold is a specialty pet foods manufacturer who deserves attention for its highly nutritious, holistic dry dog foods. I believe everyone who values their dog's health and wellness should give this excellent product a try.The top ingredients (in order) are chicken, chicken meal, peas, brown rice and pearled barley. This explains the high crude protein (26%) and crude fiber (4%) content. I like that Solid Gold blends eggs, super foods (carrots, pumpkin, cranberries and etc.), vitamins, Alaskan Pollock meal (also a good source of protein), omega fatty acids, probiotics (for digestion), taurine and L-carnitine. It's simply a splendid dry dog food.I find it useful to introduce Solid Gold food incrementally. Although probiotics no doubt helps, this is a very nutrient-rich food so there is a possibility of indigestion. My 25 pounder had no problem but my 12 pounder did get upset, so I cut back on her portions until the food was well-tolerated. But now that the adjustment has been made, I definitely plan to make Solid Gold a cornerstone of my pet's nutrition.I highly recommend Solid Gold to everyone.

I have two small breed dogs (12 and 25 pounds) who wasted no time chewing down these excellent treats!  (It seems they really like the 'filet mignon' taste.)  Of course, the twist is that Nutri Dent offers dental hygiene benefits in addition to great flavor. I believe that everyone interested in maintaining their pet's dental health should give Nutri Dent a try.Nutri Dent is a good value. A single Nylabone can be broken in 3, meaning that 3 treats can be divided into a total of 9 servings. I think that Nutri Dent is a great pet treat that helps their dogs gain better health, too.I highly recommend Nutri Dent to everyone.

The UE Boom 2 is the wireless speaker I've always wanted. Logitech, who is well-known for its quality computer accessories, has applied its engineering skills to create a category-leading Bluetooth speaker. I believe that everyone looking for wireless sound on-the-go should put the UE Boom 2 at the top of their list.I found several things that distinguish the UE Boom 2 from most other wireless speakers I've tried. First, the wrap-around speaker design works really well. It distributes sound all around, filling the room in a way that other speakers cannot. Second, the UE Boom 2 is touch-sensitive.  I can pause and skip songs by tapping once or twice. Third, a free app allows me to customize the EQ settings just the way I want, when streaming music from my iPhone.And yes - as has been suggested elsewhere, the sound output is impressive!  The UE Boom 2 has no problem at all producing rich, deep bass sound (which can often be problematic for small, portable speakers). In fact, I am satisfied with the bass response without pushing the EQ anywhere close to the limit!  The UE Boom 2 handles the treble and mid range sounds just as impressively. All in all, I am very pleased with the full-spectrum sound produced by this great portable speaker.It should also be mentioned that the UE Boom 2 includes a protective case to store the UE Boom 2 and accessories, including instructions, a power plug and USB cable.I highly recommend the UE Boom 2 to everyone.

I am happy to have discovered Nexxus Emergencee shampoo.  Nexxus is a top-of-the-line brand whose hair care products represent quality. I believe that anyone who needs a restorative shampoo should give this excellent product a try.I like that Nexxus Emergencee is formulated with collagen and elastin protein which are scientifically proven to rebuild the hair structure. Of course, the shampoo lathers up very well and does a great job of cleaning, too.  I've found that Nexxus Emergencee has helped me get the best look possible. That's a very good thing for someone with thinning hair, like myself.I highly recommend Nexxus Emergencee to everyone.

Empire of Self by Jay Parini is an authoritative biography of Gore Vidal, one of the giants of postwar American cultural, intellectual and political life.  Mr. Parini is an accomplished writer and English professor who literally spent decades friending Gore.  Written with unsurpassed insight, compassion and perspective, this exceptional book will appeal to everyone interested in Vidal including why his life mattered.To me, Vidal will always be the knowledgeable, empathetic and quick-witted intellectual who faced down the pompous William F. Buckley, Jr. in a series of debates at the 1968 Republican Party Convention. While I was too young to fully appreciate their exchange  which was considered cutting-edge for television at that time - it was easy to admire Vidal as a role model who could forcefully speak truth to power.  Here was a man who put his intellect to work for the people!In fact, reading Mr. Parinis biography has only deepened my appreciation.  Mr. Parini explains that Vidal was a progressive whose work often prefigured or predicted what was to come, including postmodern philosophy, the gay movie subplot, LGBT rights, drug legalization, the commercialization of sex, and the rise of religious fundamentalism versus the national security state (to name but a few).  Put simply, Vidal was a brilliant, well-traveled and exceptionally literate individual whose unique insights into American society have rarely been matched; and certainly, never duplicated.Mr. Parini writes about Vidals colorful social and private lives.  Vidal seemed to know everybody who was somebody in the literary, entertainment and political worlds in at least a half dozen major cities around the world.  Mr. Parini shares many dozens of colorful anecdotes that bring the story to life.  We gain access to amusing, tantalizing and interesting glimpses of a bygone era as witnessed through Vidals trademark wit and wisdom.  Of course, Mr. Parini writes at length about Vidals complicated love life in the most honest, sensitive and respectable way; which has become possible only due to Vidal's passing in 2012.I highly recommend this outstanding book to everyone.

I think that Duru Shower Gel is a good economy-priced shower gel. I ordered the variety pack and split the individual bottles between myself, my son and wife. I suspect that Duru formulates its products with the female consumer in mind given the emphasis on floral-scented fragrances, but I think the Mango scent works for men, just the same.Duru is not an all-natural or organic product but it is cruelty-free (not tested on animals). I can't say that Duru lathered up as well as other soaps I've used. I need to squeeze out quite a lot of liquid whether I was using a loofa or a towel. So while it's inexpensive, the trade off is that I'll probably use more to get the same result.Overall, I think that Duru represents is a good choice for households who are less worried about buying an organic soap (which can easily cost 3 to 4 times as much) than getting a fair deal for the money.

I'm very pleased to have discovered Nexxus Oil Infinite shampoo. The Nexxus Oil Infinite collection includes shampoo, conditioner and hair oil. I believe that anyone struggling with dry, brittle or thin hair should give this excellent shampoo a try.In my case, I suppose you could put me in the category of someone with dry, thin hair. I like to grow it relatively long (at least compared with most other men) so that creates a challenge. Fortunately, it seems to me that Nexxus Oil Infinite is the solution that I've been missing for far too long!The babassu oils, marula oils and elastin proteins blended into Nexxus Oil Infinite shampoo really works to replenish my hair. I find it much easier to style now and I believe my hair holds its shape better, all day long. As I said, I'm glad to have found this excellent product.I highly recommend Nexxus Oil Infinite shampoo to everyone.

I am very pleased to have discovered Healthworks Goji Berries. Healthworks is an organic 'superfoods' manufacturer embodying the highest quality and nutritional standards.  I believe that everyone interested in the health benefits of goji berries should give Healthworks Goji Berries a try.I found the goji berries in the Healthwoks product to be delicious!  I like the taste and texture of the Healthworks Goji Berries. The product arrives double-sealed to ensure freshness. It's difficult to stop once I start snacking, but I know the berries are packed with nutrients so I try to consume only a small amount at a time.The texture is like most any other dried fruit so I have a lot of options for consuming. For example, I've added goji berries to trail mix, topped off my breakfast cereal, and baked into muffins. Healthworks very helpfully includes recipes in the product insert for goji chocolate bars and smoothies, too.I highly recommend Healthworks Goji Berries to everyone.

As we approach the annual cold and flu season, I'm glad to have discovered New Chapter Immune. In my opinion, New Chapter is second to none in the supplements industry, maintaining the highest quality standards using organic ingredients and sustainable business practices. I believe that everyone seeking a 100% herbal solution for immune system support should give this excellent product a try.The two active ingredients are Elderberry and Black Currant, both proven sources for boosting the immune system. I like how New Chapter uses an innovative membrane extraction process to concentrate the fruit - all without the use of solvents or anything else that might cause harm. The result is a potent capsule that delivers exactly what I want; and nothing more.I highly recommend New Chapter Immune to everyone.

Wellness CORE Grain Free is everything I could hope for in a dry dog food. CORE is a premium brand owned by WellPet, a leading specialty manufacturer of natural pet foods. I believe that pet owners who want to feed their dogs the best should give this excellent product a try.It's difficult to imagine a more nutritious formulation. The top ingredients (in order) are deboned turkey, turkey meal and chicken meal. No doubt this is why the crude protein content measures a very impressive 33%. Vegetable ingredients include potatoes, peas, spinach, broccoli, carrots, kale and sweet potatoes. Other nutritious whole foods include ground apples and blueberries. Suffice to say it's all good.But that's not all.  The nutritionists have blended in other things to make this a kind of superfood. A generous 250 mgs. of glucosamine and 200 mgs. of chondroitin for joint health are included in each serving. Flaxseed and salmon oil contribute to skin and coat health. Finally, the kibbles are coated with probiotics to support digestion.Having said this, I found that my two small breed pets needed a little coaxing to appreciate the food. I found it necessary to introduce the food modestly by blending it into their existing mix and then gradually increasing the level over time.  I'm sure they'll thank me later.

I think the Armitron 20/4962BKTI is everything I could want in an everyday watch. Amitron is a well-established manufacturer known for maintaining good quality standards. I believe that everyone seeking an entry-level man's watch should give the Armitron a close look.The black watch is a masculine look that pretty much goes with anything. The ion-plated material helps the watch stand up to wear and tear. Quartz crystal engineering keeps accurate time.  The watch is water resistant which testifies to its engineering.If you plan on gifting the watch (as I do), the presentation box makes a nice impression. Perhaps the only thing you or the recipient needs to do is add/or remove a link to get it to fit properly.

I've just connected my home entertainment system to the Woods surge protector and I'm very pleased with the results. Woods is a brand of Coleman Cable, a highly respected manufacturer of quality electrical products. I believe that anyone who wants to protect their expensive home electronics should take a serious look at this critically important product.I have to admit that I learned the hard way. A lightning strike overwhelmed the bargain-basement surge protector I had connected to my Bose stereo system. I lost several thousand dollars worth of equipment. Since that time, I've been upgrading all of the surge protectors I have around the house.I like that the Woods 041152 plugs right into the wall. It's ideal wherever 6 outlets is sufficient and space is at a premium. In my case, I am using the Woods downstairs where I have four connected components. The Woods has replaced an unsightly power strip that sprawled across the floor. I am very pleased with the more compact configuration (which is easily concealed with a potted plant!). I also like that Woods is rated at 750 joules of protection which allows me to rest a little bit easier.I highly recommend the Woods 041152 to everyone.

I ordered this very attractive Lucien Piccard watch as a gift for my wife and she absolutely loves it. Lucien Piccard is a world-class watchmaker who is respected for bringing Swiss know-how to the quartz watch business. I think that any woman who values style, quality and versatility will be pleased to add the BKSS Mirage to her collection.The key attribute of the BKSS Mirage is the stunning mother of pearl faceplate. It's difficult to appreciate from a photograph just how nicely the watch's mother of pearl faceplate sheens with iridescence. It creates a very pleasing array of ever-changing color effects. Lucien Picard has also subtly etched an oyster contour onto the faceplate, lest there be any doubt that you're looking at the real thing.Everything else about the BKSS Mirage is quality, too.  The case is made of stainless steel and the strap is genuine leather. Japanese quartz is used for precision timekeeping.  Crystals ring the dial and accent the faceplate with artistic flair. The fact that this watch is waterproof and can be worn underwater suggests just how well this beautiful watch is made.  All of this excellence is presented in an impressively plush gift box that helps make the experience of watch ownership more memorable.I highly recommend the Lucien Piccard BKSS Mirage to everyone.

It's all about the software and the app with these things, and this one doesn't work.I tested this on a small table lamp, and could not get it to respond.After installing the app, it took a long time to "find my network".I found the device, no problem, but could not control it with the app.Trying, manual, on / off,  and timer settings, it simply didn't respond.

It's nice, it's soft, it drys water.Originally I thought this was a circular towel, but it has velcro at the top, and that makes it really easy to wrap it, and fit it, just right.Overall, it's very soft, similar to a very fine wash cloth.  It drys quickly and is easy to keep on the back of the bathroom door.I'm worried long term, how the velcro holds up to getting wet, so we will see, but overall, at this price point, nice item.

Wow. I was surprise by this product.I don't normally like the Kellogg's line of light calorie rice bar snacks, but they hit a winner with this one.I purchased this with my own money and was not provide with any samples.Yes, they are small, but that works for me, because they taste great.I often get cravings for snacks before bed, and last night I tried this for the first time, and was satisfied, and thought it tasted like an authentic full brownie.  Most of the other brands, that I normally eat in the morning, are just puffed up, and fall apart in my mouth (and stomach) without really feeling like I ate anything at all.These are worth a try, if you're looking to mix it up and try something different.

If I had to take a "Caleb's" challenge,  I'd say, I'd be able to identify it but don't always prefer it.It's sweet.  Sometimes I like that,  other times I don't really care for it.  Probably better with food, that straight.Would provide a sugar kick if mixing with drinks.  Overall a nice taste, but probably not for every one.I do like the fact that it's make under the fair trade label and is made with natural ingredients.

Who knew I could get flax, broccoli and cauliflower in a tasty chew able vitamin.Nice.  These taste good, and are nice treat to get my day going in the morning.Overall, good.  Will update with longer term report later.

This software was a nice improvement over the previous version.I did recently upgrade my machine to 8GB of RAM and am running it under Windows 10.It has a nice set of features and some great "stock" options that really pop.Overall very nice at a decent price.

I simply like the style of this watch face, with it's cobalt blue color and clearly delineated lines. (in place of numerals)The date is clearly visible and it keeps time accurately.The leather strap is handsome and overall, this watch is not too heavy, but does show some depth in its overall size.Great for jeans or a special color tie in for slightly dressier attire.

This can be both casual and dressy.It's simply beautiful to look at, and very "readable".The only downside is that it is a bit heavy, but that trade off is well worth it for the stylish looks this brings to the table.Great gift idea.

This is the back pack for the devices I use today, and is equipped to keep them protects.This has the padding, where I need it.  To protect the most expensive electronics.The most interior large pocket has thick padded, that also goes through the the back of the pack, so that cushion is on your back.I like the small slot, at the top the best, that is a horizontal way to store your phone, with a nice soft cloth sack, that you could even use to clean the screen.  It's a better option than the vertical pockets on the back, that are more narrow, and require you to dig down to get the phone.  There are 2 mesh compartments that make it easy to see stuff you store.  And the outer most flap is great for pens, and extra memory cards, etc.Water bottle mesh holder on the side, with yet another small zippered pocket.  Finally, the 2 should straps, cross to make an easy to grab handle.This is a great compact and lightweight pack, that has well thought out storage design.  Good show.

Very nice size coffee table book that focus on unique places.This is not your "run of the mill" pictures.  In addition to having unique places and vantage points, even familiar places are taken with a fresh perspective.  The photos are full flossy and are more in a matte finish, but that only lightens the effect slightly.Not a lot of informative text, but that's ok too for what it is.Finally there is a nice index in the back, with a small thumbnail of each photo.This would be a nice gift idea for the young teen who has an interest in travel or photography.

Very nice and soft.  Easy to set up.This has too rather bulky cords,  One that plugs into the blanket, and then that same cord branches off to the controller unit.Heats up quickly, and isn't over powering.  Just a nice, even temperature.  Temps range from 1 to 10.  It also includes a timer for auto-shut off, if you want to set it.Separate cord and controller for both the left and right side of the blanket, so you can enjoy separate temperatures on each side.This fits a queen size bed, very nicely.  Overall, just a nice feel to it, even as a regular blanket.  There did seem to be a small "plastic" odor when originally taking it out of the package, but it has lessened, and I hope will eventually disappear.Overall, nice product.  Nice gift idea.

In the world of digital every thing, it's nice to take a step back and go "manual" on occasion.This allows for 365+ occasions, actually, and does it in a nicely bound, but very thin package.I do wish the block demarcation lines were a bit darker, but that is splitting hairs.  This is nicely tabbed, with the 3 year, one page reference in the front. 2 year - planning note pages in the back, pages for contacts. A 4-year holiday list, and the often now forgotten, time zone/area code map in the back.  There is even a small 2 pocket, clear plastic page in the back, which I'm sure will have this keeper burgeoning before the start of the new year.  Less is more.

This is a nice educational toy, that does have a small learning curve, but is worth the effort.Overall, the concept and design really provide a great perspective on NYC and real estate development during the turn of the century from 1901 forward.2 to 4 players, (8 and up) and a handsome board and piece set up, with a "quick game" start guide, and a more detailed instruction book.Players travel around the blocks of lower Manhattan, and try to aquire new property to either, build, tear down, or improve current buildings.  The crown jewels are several iconic structures, such as the Woolworth building and the Singer building.  It really provides a good overview of the changing landscape in construction techniques and social structure.This is not a "Saturday night" couples game night, but more of a Saturday or Sunday with the kids that provides enough challenge for both kids and adults alike.  Overall a nice game to add to the closet.

I wasn't sure about this, because every time we buy sheets in this price range under $30, from big box discount retailers,  they turn out to be not such a great fit.  These were a nice surprise.These fit, and stay put on our Queen bed, with no problem at all.Even after several washing's, these have kept their form an feel.These are very soft, with a nice feel, but aren't really all that thick, but they are still very comfortable.  There is enough material and the edges stay put, without needing to stretch them like crazy.Finally, I really like all the varied colors that are all priced the same as the basic white.Good value.

I like it.Some features I like are the 5 varied settings for Carpet and Hardwood floor, and the long cord.The bright orange industrial cord, makes it easy to see has a length that can easily cover a small one bedroom apartment, without ever unplugging it.  The unit is very lightweight and easy to just pick up and move.  It has a wide front sweep section.  If you use one of the settings in between carpet and bare floor, the suction is considerably stronger on carpet.  While this isn't too loud, I wouldn't say is was quiet.  It needs that powerful motor to get the job done.The Hepa filter must be working, because I did not smell any airborne dust, when using this unit.Simple, one screw assembly, and comes with one bag, installed.Overall, a nice unit in this price range.

Surprisingly, one of the things that impressed me with this set, when it arrived, was the small box that it came in.That has translated to easy storage in my cabinet space.Otherwise, these are great for small 2 to 3 person meals,  and have decent sturdiness.The handles are steady, when new, but are made of hollow metal, nearest the joints.The lids each have a small steam escape valve, which helps with avoiding over boiling.Overall, this a decent starter set in a reasonable price range.
These are economical and absorbent.  Really convenient to keep in the office, instead of paper towels.Overall good value.

I like several things about the UP as compared to another popular model that I use.It boils down to 2 features.  The more narrow profile/style and the app.The style speaks for itself.  The app, simply EXCELS.With options for Steps/exercise, Food, Mood, Sleep and Weight, you start to develop a picture of the major points in your life, that can affect your health.  The app builds on your history and makes recommendations and observations.  (such as, "when you sleep an extra hour, your avg step count has increased by 400 steps)  Overall I like this as an accurate tool, in a nice price range, with effective app software.

I really like this watch.  It's very stylish and up to date.  I get a lot of compliments on it, when I wear it.  However, it is fairly heavy, so I don't use it as my every day watch.  Great for being sporty or dressy casual.
These actually made my hands cramp up for some reason.That's never happened to me before. I'm sure these are good for someone, but just not for me.

I've used this type of device previously, in rehabilitation of a problem shoulder, and with acupuncture.I believe in it, and it seems to be effective for me.This particular product is not some cheesy gimmick.  A lot of development and thought went into this product.I love the fact that it is rechargeable and when not charging, it is mobile.There are 99 different settings on this, so you can build up to different levels, or whatever you feel comfortable with.When turning it too high, I get what might be described as an arm "cramp",  so be careful how you throttle it.You can set the intensity differently for each arm.  (that was probably a setting of 29 or 30)It has an automatic timer of 10 mins per session, that turns off when it's done.I feel refreshed when it's completed.The biggest downside are the gooey pads that you need to putThe side with the cross hatching, make sure to take the cover off from the middle of the pad, where the arrows indicate. I was trying to pull it up from the side, and that wasn't working.Also save the covers, as you need to cover the gooey pads after you use it.The other downside, is that it has a lot of wires, so it takes a bit getting used to, to put it on, without getting tangled.Otherwise, I've noticed a difference in my arm tone and feeling after a week of use.I like it as a supplement to my regular workout routine.

Very light weight handle and duster.  You definitely need to "fluff it out" to get the maximum circumference on your cleaning area.Otherwise, this is a winner.  It simply picks up dust like a magnet. I did ceiling fan blades, frame tops, door tops, slotted blinds, and it did the job.  Comes with one replacement head, which is a nice deal.  The only downside for me was that I did need to pass over areas more than once to get what was missed on the first pass.

This is a college level textbook.It's very thorough and well put together, however, includes more than traditional "buildings"  (i.e. the Great Wall of China and Greek ruins)Overall, I wasn't expecting that, and was hoping for more details on construction methods and statistics.Overall, it's very expansive and covers buildings in most global regions.  The photography also leaves something to be desired.I know it's not meant to be a coffee table book, but I've seem more spectacular images of most of the buildings in this book.Overall, great on content but light on pictures.

It's ok.  Maybe I just don't have a professional eye, or maybe I'm not taking the right type of pictures to highlight the differences, but after using it for 2 weeks, I don't see a big difference with or without it.  While the quality build does seem very nice, and there is some heft and craftsmanship that went into this, at this price point, I don't see how it would make that much difference over a less expensive model to the average photographer.

I felt obligated to do a review on these, because they have very good sound, but have some challenges in pairing.Simply, these work, as advertised.I had them paired to my phone, and tucked them away, and never realized why I couldn't hear incoming calls.They work.If you don't disconnect the blue tooth connection and then, power off the headphones, you might wake up and the battery is all drained.Figure out the proper shut down and power up sequence and these are much more practical.While better than being tethered,  I still don't like the swinging motion of the cable under my neck, so pop it from behind if that bothers you.Otherwise, very solid product, especially in this price range.

First off, I like the pod concept.  Throw it in your laundry bag with your socks and your underwear and you're set.Dump the entire load into the machine and you're done.I've used a number of the different scents from Tide Pods before,  Ocean mist and Evergreen to name a couple, but scent free is the just great.I didn't really care for the other scents or the after-smell they left on my towels, etc. but these just clean and no smell.Very good product.

I'm not a chef, but I know how to use a knife.  I also know the benefits of a good one.Comparing this side by side to my regular everyday chef's knife, this is slightly heavier, but MUCH easier to hold and grasp.The Mother of Pearl handle is just beautiful to look at and looks classy laying on the counter.The blade is super sharp and goes through stuff with ease and efficiency.  I like the wide backstop on the blade, which let's you get your finger adjacent for fine chopping.Overall a super addition to my kitchen.

This is an ok toy.  I was hoping to do a video review on this, but notice the link for that is no longer offered.I was originally leaning toward 4 stars for this, but after playing with it a while, it seems to jam frequently, and the dual action required to keep the battery operated motor going, while pulling the trigger, gets a little challenging.Other than that, its fun, but I would also recommend safety goggles with this, regardless of how you're going to use it.The other downside is the investment of those 6 AA batteries.  Would be nicer if those were included.

These seem to have a positive effective on overall feeling of pep and strength.They are fairly large so needed to be broken in half to swallow more easily.Otherwise, these seem effective.  One final thing that I really like about this, is the 180 pills.  6 months coverage is nice.

Yes a lot of this is common sense, but we all need reminders now and then.Regardless of the reminders, a lot of us are guilty of falling into the trap of "what's in it for me?". That strategy is short sighted, as it relates to long term satisfaction with what you do, and who you do it with.This book will also help you take the focus away from "monetizing happiness".There are so many good tips within the pages and audio of this book ,that you will come away with something.However, the skills, like the adage applied in so many areas of life,  are like brushing your teeth. If you don't do it, they will decay.If you enjoy books like this, you will love this one.  If you don't enjoy books like this, try it, you'll come away with something.Thank you Mr. Ferrazzi for your effort!

What can you really say about vitamins?  How do you gauge there true effectiveness and efficacy?I've used these in the past, and they simply taste great!  It's a nice way to incorporate something a little sweet into your diet, while taking care of the basics of good vitamin health.  No side effects noticed and I feel fine with a little more pep.

My wife had just purchase a similar product (Dutch oven pot) before we received this, and I was hoping that the added versatility of the lid, doubling as a grilling tool, would be neat, however, it seems that the component of this pot, really creates a lot of smoke, when used in that capacity.Also, this unit, especially with the lid on it, is very heavy.  That's to be expected, but it needs to be taken into consideration, when lugging in and out of the oven/stove.The design of the lid is awkward and doesn't provide a top handle for lifting the lid off, simply the handles of the grill top, lay flush against the handles of the pot.  Just another potential for dropping it.Overall, the pot is ok, for making a roast, or chicken, etc.  but in this price range, there might be other choices available.

Not too heavy.  Strong.  Large enough to lasso any areas of your bike, based on varying bike racks.  Easy to do and undo.The bright yellow color is also unique and most likely a slight deterrent by itself.I have smaller locks that are in a similar price range, but this is the main lock I use every day.
More matches than you'll probably use in a lifetime.Good deal.

Easy install, and decent speed on printing, but not stellar, on even small color jobs, and super slow on full page photos.I also tried printing photos on true glossy paper stock, with several settings, but all came out muddled, and very wet to the touch.Overall, not a big reason for any upgrade to what you might be using already.

2:40 Mins I weight 200 pounds and am 6ft tall.This bike carries me speedily with no problem.Even small hills are not a problem, although slower.I will update my review as I continue to use this.I'm most curious about the battery life.UPDATE 6/14/15:  I use this bike more than any manual bike I've ever owned.I now better understand the handlebar battery level lights.  When you have it at full throttle up a hill it may only show red.The same full throttle on a flat surface might only show yellow or even green if laying off the throttle a bit.In summary, it seems to indicate your available batt life "if you continue at your current pace".The battery does take a FULL 5.5 hours to charge.  I probably get about 15 miles total for a single charge, on varied terrain.

Yes, frustrating to say the least.Never got the streaming working from wireless network. (and I have a powerful wireless network)Did the firmware upgrade, with physical connection to computer and cam to the wireless router.Needed to reconfigure my normal wireless connection to do that...then the java script used to run the cam is not supported in Chrome...really?And using Internet Explorer, is just inconvenient and inconsistent when it runs.Unless mine are stuck in "Night mode" ,  I never got it to show any color video.If I can't get these to work seamlessly on the wireless network and access them through a mobile device, easily, I will be sending these back.

Picked this up on sale recently, because I wanted to update some of the features on my camera. (like wifi).I was also looking for something I could carry around a little easier, than my full size DSLR.This camera exceeded my expectations in both performance and features.It's simply amazing, in this price range.  The only thing that I don't like is that it doesn't have a raised hand grip handle, which makes it slightly more difficult to hold one handed, but it's not really that big of a deal.If you have a wifi ecosystem at home, but more specifically, other Samsung products, this camera pairs nicely and easily with those devices.Another really nice feature of this camera is that the display screen on the back is also "touchscreen", so you can opt for that is an option, if you don't feel like fumbling for which button is the "return" button or the "cancel" button.  It just makes it easier.This model takes the micro-sd cards and it does NOT come with one, so make sure you have one of those before, if you want to save a little bit.The camera takes VERY good quality pictures in low light, but does have a reasonable pop-up flash, for most, close range shots.The other thing that I LOVE about this camera, is that the normal full range picture, has a VERY wide picture angle. Almost the equivalent of a fish-eye lens but not quite, and not with the curve.  The zoom, does sometimes take a few seconds to adjust and zoom in, but when it does, it's worth it.  I will try to update this review as I continue to explore the features, but for the money and the features, this camera is a WINNER!

The setup was easy and quick.  I have the unit plugged directly into my wifi router, so speed is not an issue when on my PC, but files on other tablet devices can be painfully slow.  Overall this a good unit to use as an extra level backup, but not really ready for prime time as a true media server.

These are great but smaller than they look in the picture.These are about the size of a small cupcake or tart.For the bottoms you can either go without the insert, leaving a hole for a little extra browning on the bottom, and  easier popping out the cooked item.  The inserts are small, non-stick circles that are about the size of a silver dollar, which will be a little bit of a pain to store and find quickly.Overall, good product.

Just got one of these in a swag bag at a competition.  They are delicious.  Perfect blend of almondy butter crunchy delicousness with a little bit of honey. I need to own them, but I am hoping to find a better price.

The author has bought into classism, and beats you over the head with it ad nauseum.  Rich people are to blame for all the worlds ills.  She keeps repeating the word rich, like she does not have a thesaurus. It is written very simply and slightly stilted.It aslo stretches into multiple books with the story never completely finishing.1. I hate when people using their books to rant about their political views - regardless of which way they go.2. If you are going to do it - do it well.  Don't beat me over the head with the same words3. Write a whole book at once instead of piece mealing it into 6 little books - I would much prefer to read it all in 1 sitting.Overall a skip.

Had to force myself to read it.  I hated the back and forth with Millie.  I didn't like Millie until over half way through the book and then it felt like it was dragging.High Low Snooks Logan had too many names.  He was one of my leastime liked guys.  This one was just bleh for me.The last Chaos book I thought was 5 stars and great.  I don't know if she is trying to write too fast and give long books, but it just went on and on.  It was incredibly repetetive.Then the interesting parts were kind of glossed over.  More depth with Millie, Deb and the kids.  I will say I loved that Deb was not a raging whack job that needed to be killed off so Millie could be the Mom.Read this one if you are into the series for continuity, but otherwise it is a pass

This was a very well done book, but it didn't do it for me.  It was not a cover to cover read (which most D.B. books are).It is the first book in a series, and I struggled to get into the book.  I think I was 4 chapters in before I wanted to continue.  I persevered b/c of the author.  I pushed myself to finish it, but this book did not have that intangible quality for me that made me want to put the world on hold to finish it.  In fact I had to struggle not to read another book that came out that day instead.  This is not usually the case.I thought Amanda was a little...over the top.  I never really connected with her, and her mission to prove that she could do this was just not plausible for me.  I never saw her drive, or the reason for it.  She wanted to go into the green- but she had been sneaking in anyway.  This might just be first book issues where it is laying out the series, but I guess overall that is what I felt, that this book was a layout and there was still a lot to come that this book did not answer.  A lot of the plot seemed forced so that outcome B could happen so they could move on to next thread of story.This also chemistry wise was a bit flat.  I was glad we were being told they werre attracted to each other b/c did not feel it otherwise.  I am not trying to bash the book.  It was well done, for whatever reason for me the story did just not resonate.My rating system is 5 stars - Need next book now now now, where can I pre order4 stars - definitely getting next book, but have a couple others will read before that b/c sometimes back to back shows flaws3 stars - good book - would buy the author again, maybe not this series unless I liked preview2 stars - finished it1 star - utter crap not worth the downloadFor me this fell right in between auto buying next book b/c I love the author and checking the preview.

So well written, it was riveting.  I put off buying this book because I thought it would be A. political or B. Dry.  This was neither.  You actually can visualize and almost smell what is going on.  They do a great job painting the picture of what they went through.I highly recommend this story if you want an accurate account of what happened without all the speculation that you get from the press.These men have a remarkable story that should be known.  I understand it is now being made into a movie and I look forward to seeing that.  Many re - tellings are hard to picture, or they talk like you need to be in special ops to get it.  This is not that way.  It is a good look into the atmosphere of Libya at the time.

the only thing we dislike about this is the narrow leg - you do have to remove boots/shoes to put these on.Quality is good, they are a little heavier and reflective is nice.  While I do like them, I don't know if I would purchase again due to boot issues.  Small issue, but I hate listening to the guys every time whine about it.

We purchased 2 of these to replace old desk chairs. they tilt and swivel as well as have adjustable height.  Soft leather like product.  Good price point.They are comfortable enough, we like the low back so we can see over them if no one is sitting in them.

I have been using this for a couple weeks now.  I am not a small person - 200lbs and use it at my stand desk.It is perfect.  Requires me to sit up straight and I can bounce and rock on it.  Really sturdy - adjustable height - I am 5'7 and it is great for me.  I also play with the up down as sometimes I just want to lean against it and sometimes i fully sit.  Very comfortable cushion and nice cut outs @ 3 points so even if it swivels you are close to right spot for hopping on.

I purchased 2 of these when I got m Galaxy Edge S6.  I love it. Worked right out of the box, simple no explanation needed.Plop my phone down on it about centered, it flashes to blue underneath and my phone lets off a happy little noise to say it is charging.Charger is light and easily maintains contact.  I have an oldjui case on my phone (only one that works without peeling screen protector off, and that is iffy)  It charges easily through this.  I am going to purchase another one for my car.Love not having to worry about plugging in and possibly messing up the connectors.  I had those go out on an older phone.  Also it is very light and I can set my phone on it and move it around and watch a video while charging or read a book.

Fast engaging story, had the next book been out I would have purchased it right then.  I got into this story and read it from cover to cover.I like Jane - she is strong, smart and loyal.  Locke - well he is just all sorts of Alpha goodness.  They are a good match.  I like the twist and level of tension Jane being what Jane is brings to the storyline as well as future stories.  He was a good alpha with a nice balance of unexpected sweet things and still total "it is my way".This could be a stand alone, but you will want more information on the characters, I can not wait for the next int he series Better off Undead.  Good side characters.  You were guessing a little about who might have done what.The world building was okay, but I am looking forward to knowing more.  Overall a solid story and potentially great series.

I love this series, which is interesting because I had trouble getting started with the first book.  Now it is one of those books where I must own the second they come out and Susan Ilene does not disappoint.When I read the premise of this and what was happening at the beginning it wove a fine tension around me wondering what would happen.  Would this hurt their relationship?  I am not going to answer that because you should feel the same emotions.  I will say the author did a wonderful job pleasing this reader with the outcome.Melena is such a great Heroine - she has a good strong character, she is flawed and she is NOT irritating.  It is so nice to have a strong female lead that doesn't cross into psycho B trying to prove how tough she is.  She is a good balance of smart aleck and responsible adult.  In other words she is real.Lucas is wonderfully arrogant, while still being so great with Melena.  Again, a balance is struck with this Hero, and it makes him really work as a character.Kerbasi - I think he has in some ways become my favorite side character.  He is coming along so well.  He always makes you wonder where he is at as he evolves.  I think it is further than we suspect.The world building is fantastic.  The characters have depth.  You should not read this as a stand a lone, it needs to be read in order.  I will give you the booklist, just so you don't have to search :).  (I hate that)1. Darkness Haunts (Full Book)2. Darkness Taunts (Full Book)3. Chains of Darkness (Novella)4. Tempting the Moon (Short Story)5. Darkness Divides (Full Book)6. Playing with Darkness (Novella)7. Darkness Clashes (Full Book)8. Darkness Shatters (Full Book)9. Darkness Wanes - Coming in October Full BookIf you are a fan of urban fantasy with light romance this is a series for you.  It has romance but it is not over the top, there is too much other stuff going on.Lots of action and family dynamics.  LOVE this series.

My favorite flavor.  I also purchase the Salted Caramel and Almond.It is a firm bar with a consistency like a heavy taffy.  Flavor on every one I have tried is good, but this is my favorite and after trying the sample pack, 2 cases of this one.It is a great meal replacement bar for me.  Keeps me full for a solid 3-3.5 hours.  This is the best bar I have found in the protein bar category, and I am amazed it does not have sugar.  It has dried strawberries in it and Stevia is last ingredient listed to sweeten it up a little

I am so irritated with Claire in this book.I loved the first book, was propping my eyes open with tooth picks b/c I could not set it down @ 4:00 am, and this one started this way.I will not give anything away, but what was she thinking????  What a maroon!!!  She is supposed to be older and smarter than this.  I expect this delusional martyred thinking from a 22 year old not a 40 year old.On the other side of this coin, I was fully invested in the book, I was literally asking my husband, "What is she thinking?"  and he just rolled his eyes and turned up the news b/c I was ranting over a book.The reason this does not get 5 stars is b/c Claire turned into total bridezilla,  I don't understand freaking out of the cost of something minor, but then having crazy over the top stuff that she doesn't bat an eye on b/c she won't "compromise".  Only part of the book I did not really like.  This happened multiple occasions.  It made me dislike her a little tiny bit.  She totally redeems herself, but really??? It must be this, this, this and this, and if it isn't I will pout.  WTH???So book is still amazing, but Claire is a little grating.  Jonathan is perfect as always.  This author has become an auto purchase for me, don't care if it is in lending library, I am buying it, b/c so far they have been keepers.

Glazed DonutIt tastes nothing like a donut - they are a relatively soft bar, they consistency reminds me a little bit of (this is dating myself) food stick's from the 70's. Kind of soft and chewy. The flavor is NOTHING like a donut - if I were to name the flavor it would be maple oatmeal or something like that with out the oats. There is a distinct after taste, not sure what it is - not soapy like someone else said, for me it is more like the flavor after touching your tongue to a battery. The flavor kinda numbs the taste buds or something.Here is the thing - if there was another option out there for being strict paleo, I wouldn't touch these on a bet. Problem is there is not. So if you are willing to choke it down b/c you have trouble getting meals in and want something portable, buy it. Kudos to the company for making these and giving us ANY option. But unless these are a necessity for health reasons of some sort, I would pass.Chocolate Mint - 1 of the most disgusting things I have ever put in my mouth - Definitely got Soapy on this one. My opinion is if Soap and crayons made a baby, this would be it. Ewww, Ewww, EwwwFudge Brownie - Tingly tongue like I touched it to a battery still, but sorta chocolatey. Could be after the mint thing, anything would be better.Cinnamon Roll - Again, tingly tongue - but edible. I have beeen eating 1 a day as lunch meal, and I don't know if I am getting used to them, but I sort of liked this one.Caramel - Not as tingly and I liked it. Maybe they are also brainwashing me, I have noticed that some of the bars when I open them have a white waxy build up on them and they tend to be the most disgusting of the group. So maybe something happened temperature wise to affect some bars???? IDK - but I paid 40 bucks for meal replacements and I will finish them - well all except the other chocolote mint that tastes like waste from a crayon factory.Last 1 in the box was moldy and I was releived. I choked them down and protein wise and that they were fine, but I had to force myself to

OMG!!! So glad I skipped the negative reviews.  I downloaded this at 11:00 last night and could NOT PUT IT DOWN!!!!  I loved it so much I purchased the sequel and finished that at work.Claire is 39, hallelujah - she has life experience and I was hooked on the first page.  She was outspoken, real and believable (if you are anywhere close to this age bracket). She had depth and children, and yes she suffered from martyr syndrome, but she is a Mom, so that was completely real to me.Jonathan is pretty much a walking Orgasm near as I can tell.  Loved him.  He just gets better.  The background on the characters fill them out fully.Side characters are interesting.Plot - pretty good, basically this a like the best smut sandwich anywhere - hawt sex, likeable characters, long story that can stand alone, very reasonable price.  So if you like your smut with a possessive alpha, and a woman that does not roll over and like the whole story behind it - this is the book for you.I have already purchased and read all her other books since reading this last night, haunted her website which after you read the 2nd book - you have got to read the Mocha Monday follow up - PS dying here on that.This was fantastic and I have a new auto purchase author.

I enjoyed the book and will read the sequel (probably)This book was a quick read, but there were inconsistencies in the story.  H only saw in black in white, but then later talked about when she was a little girl watching tv and being in awe of the colors of the wings.  That throws you out of the story a bit.This is one where if the sequel would have been out, I would have downloaded it fairly quickly to read the next book, but the longer I have away from it the less pressing the need feels.  I read a lot and the book really needs to stick with me for me to continue series or I will forget about it.  This one while enjoyable in the now, is not turning out to be memorable for me.If you like Urban Fantasy YA, I would give this one a try.

Enjoyable read.  Lots of plot lines coming together.  This book was very solid and enjoyable, and to date, my favorite of all the Melinda Leigh books.While a couple parts seemed improbable it was put together well and I think it is more probable than I think.  I just can not believe the things people will do sometimes.  There were some unexpected twists which is always nice.  I do like it when it is not completely predictable and this wasn't.  Normally I can figure everything out, and in this a few things took me by surprise.The characters were strong.  There were a couple times I wish Ellie would have trusted Grant sooner, but could understand why she didn't.  Grant is great, and the kids just broke my heart.I will purchase next book in the series.  While, I wont be dying to read it (which is why not 5 stars)  I will definitely get it.

So cool looking.  My friend stained some 2 x 2's and framed them around it. looks like a framed picture.  Lots of compliments and way cheaper than the $50 framed item.It looks like a very clean well preserved old item.  Will order another one.

Great, exactly as described.  So excited.  I like that when I am @ a heavier weight where I am close, but feel I have something left I can go up less than 5 lbs and hit something attainable. And it doesn't hurt my feelings that extra lb or 2 can separate my score from someone else that is getting a score that ends in a 0 or 5. ;)Slide on and off our bars easily.  No issues.

I have had this for about a month now and I love it.  I wear it even when lifting weights and it does not bother me in the slightest.The only thing I have noticed is that my finger under the band developed a slick spot???  Skin is peeling a little and dry from the material. It does not itch, and I do not notice it unless I slide the band around; however, I do have peeling dandriffish type skin that comes off when I remove my ring, or builds up if I leave it on, and that is a little gross.  Don't know if this is a just me thing, but it is the reason I did not give it 5 stars.I also purchased a matching one for my Husband and he is pretty happy with it so far.  He works in automotive, so he feels he can wear this safely.For me this is also a great solution when I travel to other countries.  I get to wear my band but don't need to worry about anyone else wanting it, or when I dive the fish being attracted to the shiny.
Meets all my needs for employment posting and way cheaper than online or even at our state site.

Update - Purchased and started using in September, it is now April, and I am starting to get dark imprints on papers.  I think it is getting low and not performing as well now.  Still think this is a great deal over the cartridge I normally purchase for 150.00.  Just bought my replacement for this and everything is working great again.  We are a light/medium office copy wise as we move more things to digital.  So I would say I probably got 3500 copies out of this before replaced toner.Bought this on a chance and have waited to write a review,  I have had this for over a month now and no issues, is working great.  Even if wasn't working great the price is worth the risk.  If only 1 of these cartridges performs @ 36 bucks I am way better ahead than the single cartridge for 150.00

This book was so repetitive.  The characters didn't grow, they just kept repeating the same immature mistakes.  Lots of yelling, lots of crying. So much immaturity it was no longer adorable or sexy, it was just Grow up already!!!I was in disbelief the longer I read the book because you knew he was going to start clenching his hands and she was going to start getting nervous, and he was going to be a complete and utter publicly embarrassing dipstick and she was going to look like an idiot for putting up with him, and she did and he was.The immaturity was just over the top on this one.  There wasn't a relationship  - there was sex and temper tantrums and little else.  Oh wait, there was also alcohol.  This book felt totally useless to the series.  Best part was the epilogue, would have liked to have seen how he became that person rather than dealing with the same exact issues from previous 2 books.

This was a good read, but I am waiting for T Rex's story.  I really liked Molly and Fox, but he was not THE hero for me.I like my H to be a little more of a jerk.  It makes the sweet moments sweeter and adds a bit of tension that  I just didn't get from this book.  Fox and Molly are a great couple but I was much more interested in Charlie and Gabriel and Noah and Kit.It looks like next book is going to be David and Thea.  I will get it because it is a NS and her books are very solid.  But his one did not leave me dying for the next sequel.  I will get it.  Be interesting to see how that story goes and I will live for glimpses of the other 2couples.

Oh WOW WOW WOW.  Loved this book.  I have tried the Immortal series and did not care for it, but this one.  Holy hawt alpha!  I thinkSevastyn might have tied with Barrons.Goodness.  I could not put this book down.  I tried the sample and bought immediately and then devoured this book.  I have already pre-ordered the second book.I saw in other reviews that this was not a complete story.  It was when I Purchased it, so if it started life as a serial it became a complete book.  And what a book.  Natalie was wonderful.  Strong, smart, funny.  She is fantastic.  And S - oh just, no other way to put it, he is a total panty melter.  Goodness, I haven't read an Alpha that good in a long time, and even when N thought he was being a jerk, you could tell he was torn up about it.Best part of the book is Natalie didn't want to change him, just understand and share the burdens.  Thank you for realizing that when you have a guy like that, he doesn't need to quit being that guy.KEEPER so much I might try that Immortal series again.

I got to chapter 6 and just gave up.  The way Jenna was described mad the guy come across as a pedofile.  Maybe it got better, but the mannerisms of Jenna and way she was described made her sound like a child and it just grossed me out

Got this on kindle unlimited and have to say.  Would gladly purchase this book.  It was very well done and realistic.I am looking forward to reading other books by this author.I thought the way the community broke down and some of the problem faced to be entirely real. I liked the way the author let some people be here just because.  There wasn't a deep reasoning just normal petty jealousy and laziness.The book does a good job of setting a scene in a realistic pandemic.  Nothing was so over the top crazy.Definite keeper.  I will purchase this for other friends. Highly recommend.

I liked he story line but found the writing style a bit stiff.  Persevered imagining the characters better.  Jake could have been great, but he was not fleshed out properly.  He had great alpha potential.  Here was a great base but for me the writing style just lacked something.  Was prepared for a solid 3 star like for the book and got to end.What total bs. Made me hate the book.  Only gave it 2 because I finished it. Read the whole thing. My advice skip it.

Fast paced and enjoyable, a little different twist on the Vampire genre to keep it fresh.I have not read this genre in quite awhile because many books tend to be a rehash of a better book you already read.  Not so with this one.Morgan and Nicholai are already married which adds an interesting dimension in the fact they have been together for centuries and still love each other very much, not only that there relationship continues to grow and evolve.They have an interesting mystery in what and why Morgan is suffering. Good supporting characters. I got this from the Kindle unlimited, but I would have no problem purchasing this book.

While I like the book overall I have some real problem with the heroine.  I like that she isn't some uber survivalist type, but does she have to be so dumb?Freaks out and washes her hands in bleach after touching the Red rain on jacket then sleeps under the same jacket? Kinda in the too stupid to live vein.Lots of dumb things like this happen.  I don't want to give spoilers but this girl doesn't have much common sense.  From food choices to investigating things to almost anything.  With all this I was still curious about what would happen.  I am going to grab next installment because it is available on my kindle unlimited; however, I would not pay to continue.

I will not give spoilers. I will say this book so fat surpassed my expectations that I am in awe.I need to 're read this book again to pick up on possible things I missed.The dynamics are so good. I really enjoyed catching up with Derek.  I missed Julie and I am glad she wasn't involved in this storyline except in abstract way.I love love love the things Kate learned about herself.  She has finally realized what is truly important and grown so much as a character.  She is a better Kate thank we have ever had.CURRAN stays amazing.  Love himPlease read all of the books.  You wouldn't be lost because they do a good job of describing things but you would miss out on nuances.  Can not wait for next book.

I loved and pampered this stupid machine for 2 years.  I only put bottled water in it so it wouldn't get mineral deposits, I faithfully cleansed it with vinegar.It gave me hot coffee.  I like it not super hot, my husband likes it REALLY hot, after about 90 minutes he would need to microwave it and I thought it was finally coming out at a drinkable temperature.  When I pour my first cup out of the pot as it finishes I only pour 1/2 a cup and let it sit for about 5 minutes before I can drink it.Flavor was good.  We really had no issues at all until this am.  We hit the brew button and it gave us a high pitched shriek not unlike an enraged R2 Unit, the only way to shut it up was to unplug it.I do feel a coffee maker should make it more than 2 years which is why it got 4 stars.  That said, because I will have a back up carafe and all the filters already, I will be replacing it with same.  I see that coffee makers have shorter shelf lives these days.  But then we are pickier about our coffee now than we were before.

Oh wow. Awful. Jane is an admitted wretch.  She thinks she is perfect and is the most unlikable arrogant character I have come across.I hated her so much I quit reading on first chapter.  Says she likes to cut through the bs then puts on a phony smile. She also thinks she is smarter, better and prettier than anyone.  What a peach.Total pass.  Try the sample. Also it is shudder not shutter a shutter does not pass through the body, at least in las you are in a tornado.  Then a shutter might pass through you.

I gleaned some great information amongst he science.  I liked the conclusions and hope that he will continue to be able to learn more.I ended up skimming to he interesting bits.  As science is not my strongest suit I did not dwell on the brain bits,more the conclusions and theories.  Liked the book overall, but some parts seemed repetitive.  For instance going over and over how still they needed to stay in MRI.  Got it, don't need it reiterated ever few paragraphs.  A lo of time was spent on this and how they trained the dog.I am glad I read it.  Also glad it was on my unlimited plan.

The book took a while to get anywhere.  Sang a previously invisible girl is all of a sudden befriended by a group of 7 guys and she has tension with all of them.I guess to some girls this would be a dream come true. For me it was just an eye roll.  Nothing good comes from 1girl and 7 guys. Not only that but every guy seems to want her.This was a case of everything being a little too everything.  If you are an adult that reads YA this would be a skip.  It is more of a young person fantasy before they are old enough to realize no way would this work in real life.

I read this all in one, I did not get it in episodes (Thank Goodness) and I will say that there were some timeline and details that got confused which took this from 5 stars to 4 stars.  It pulled me out of the book when the stone went from worth 190K in 1 episode and in another it was 290K, there were also some other inconsistencies.I love the series enough I can overlook it, but it was distracting.  Overall this may have been my favorite story to date, I really liked the addition of more family for Nathan.  I like seeing him round out a bit more.  The other thing that really threw me was when a lady referred to a guy as handsome like Nathan - all the other descriptions have been people flinch when they see him.  Why is this a reference???The editing was the poorest I have seen it; however, this is still a favorite character of mine that I will continue to follow.

I love the characters.  Having McBride be willing to do what he thinks is right , tempered by the way he lets go of anger makes for a great leading character.  He has a complex personality that isn't always found in adventure series.I am racing to download next book in series.This book was fast paced and I could not it it down.  Glad I found a series to replace Mitch Rapp.  (Not that this series is like that, more a character I can like the way I do Mitch.  Not a comparison) Also liked the partner element with Harv.  Many times we have lone hero's and the addition of Harv gives you more insight.Would highly recommend.

I devoured this cover to cover. Good plot with lots of action.I just downloaded the book alluded to before this The Devils Water.  Even though this is a second book in a series it can easily be read as a stand alone.Very good descriptions that let you visualize the action.  The plot seemed very plausible.  It also sounds like there will be another book to this series hopefully keeping Josh as a character.For me to give a book five stars I have to need to immediately download and read another book by the author.  If you have any doubts read the sample, it sucked me right in.  If you enjoy this you should love the book.

I love love love this.  I will say right off I have not been brave enough to try this around water.  I did take it to beach and use it to keep sand out - but haven't ventured into the waves with it.My favorite place to use this is on the back of my husband's motorcycle.  This is best device ever.  I can read without fear of dropping anything.  Sure the wind occasionally bops my hub in the back of the head with this, but that is way better than when I fall asleep and head flies forward clonking him with my helmet.Had a rainstorm and it didn't matter, it was great.

After reading his book I looked into purchasing the next in the series;however,the synopsis did not do anything for me. Then I found the note the author left at the back of the second book chastising readers in advance if they did not like her book.I hope getting that off her chest makes up for lack of continued purchases.The book is fairly solid.  If there is a complaint about it it was the way Syrus was continually compared to a child.  Once or twice fine.  But over and over it becomes hard to see him as a romantic interest.I don't want to give spoilers.  The book is fairly fast paced and moves quickly.  The H/H are strong although I did not quite connect to Syrus. Again I feel that could be the juvenile comparisons.  Forest is a very intriguing character that has a lot of depth.  This would have been 5 stars had Syrus been that way as well and I would have not read synopsis would have just purchased next book.I found the book overall enjoyable and had the synopsis sounded better on the next book I would have eventually purchased it.  Finding out about a rant at the end of the book took that away.If you want to rant get a blog.  Pre whining to readers is very immature. Also I daresay you have returned something in your life.  Get over it. If your writing is good loyal fans will build your reader base.  If people don't like your book they may return it and tell people they didn't like it.  This is the part of life that sucks dealing with customers.  All self employed people are sympathetic but that means vent to friends and other authors not the customer.  Normally I would not get into this, but you out this in the public forum.I found your book to be solid which is why I gave it 4 stars.  I won't take your personality out on your book.My overall opinion of this book is if you like paranormal you should like this.  It is more relationship driven than action.  If that is your thing you should find this enjoyable.

In order to make our son's teeth brushing routine more appealing to him, we got a fun electric toothbrush and these colorful flossers. I'm going to start with the cons because they're are more of those than pros.Cons:-Not really fun animal shapes as I expected-Not sturdy. They are so flimsy that they would kind of lean and bend when trying to floss his teeth-Floss isn't very strong. A couple busted when trying to floss and we weren't doing it very hard-They hurt my son's mouth I'm going back to regular flossers because these are just awful.Pros:-They're colorfulI'm not happy with these at all
