Let's set this straight, this isn't your Epson PowerLite or PowerLite Pro projector for your home cinema use. This projector is built for business applications where static presentations are used and the occasional videos are shown. Let me say that again, occasional videos are shown.At 5.1lbs, this is a projector that is built for portability. Surprisingly, the lack of a storage bag is a disappointment and turn-off for purchasers in this segment. Portability can be intra-office from one meeting room to the next, but do you want to be one of those geeks awkwardly carrying the projector around than having a bag that houses the projector, power cord, cables, remote?While I'm being a Debbie Downer, don't go imagining you can use this as a boom box to impress your clients with that awesome cash register sound effects you inserted in your presentation. Because the built-in 1-watt (mono) speaker will make you wish you brought some portable speakers to the meeting room together with the bag. Oh, wait. There is no bag. So try walking along the hallway bringing that projector with cables and speaker resting on top with the remote in your pocket. Is that a remote in your pocket? Why yes! But you meant to say no. Too late.What it does have is a budget-friendly price tag for an office that does presentations on a seldom basis (i.e. quarterly), classrooms, or a salesman who didn't do his research or is simply on a tight spend allowance.On a positive note, projection is a mere 6 feet for a 50" screen. You have the flexibility of an HDMI, USB (including portable hard drives, cameras, flash drives, etc.), and VGA port.Set up is the usual which I would rather take the time to do it right the first time.PROS:- 3LCD, 3-chip technology- Connections via HDMI, USB, and VGA.- Light and compact.- Better than average among it's price range at 2,700 lumens for both color and white light output. As I said earlier, this projector shines in static presentations where acceptable ambient light is still present . It does well in video applications, but you are losing resolution in displaying wide screen images and you would want total darkness to boost picture quality.CONS:- Very weak 1-watt speaker for a portable projector that needs built-in sound than a professional home theater projector that demands external sound output- No bag included which is a surprise for a compact, portable projector- Could use an HDMI cable to complete the package- A backlit remote would be nice and thoughtful for a projector of this business applicationOVERALLI'm not going to complain the lack of features like a widescreen 16:9 ratio, 3-D capability, Wi-Fi, or Ethernet access. Because this projector is indeed priced right for the value features within the budget constraints of this valu range. For the above features, you need on spend more.I am surprised though of the lack of a storage bag that should be included and an HDMI cable that is standard in video output.While the weak audio output can be a turn-off for people looking for an all-in-one application especially when on the road.For this I have rated at this price range 4 out of 5 stars. If Epson can improve on these two aspects as well as a backlit remote and still retain the price range, it would definitely be a perfect 5 star projector of this intended value series.

I am reviewing the Fugoo Sport model.First impressions:- Great packaging. Definitely adds some class to the product (and cost).- This is the second portable Bluetooth speaker I have owned. I have to admit I was a bit skeptic with the quality of this relative newcomer of this category coming to play along with the big boys.- The overall dimension feels like I'm holding a 6" sub sandwich in my hand. Although it's actually 7.4" in length.- Solid feel and construction.PROS:- Impressive overall sound. You have to take note, these are not studio monitor speakers that aim to replicate sound according to how it was recorded. These and all other Bluetooth speakers in it's category aim to produce ear candy quality audio which means there is a lot of processing going on behind the scene to help compressed audio files produce bass boosting lows and ear popping highs. For outdoor party and beach applications, that's fine by me. With this it is able to claim a frequency response of 60Hz - 20KHz.- Innovative interchangeable jacket to help you not only find your style that suits your environment. Easily removable with a latch and a simple slide out. No complex multiple locks to bother with.- Bluetooth 4.0 Wireless speaker that lasts up to 40 hours on medium volume. This is the manufacturer claim which I haven't tested because I just plug to recharge the unit after every use.- The Sport jacket is the middle of the pack in durability that still is waterproof, snow proof, dust proof, and shock proof.- Also has a 3.5mm audio input should you wish to connect a wired audio source which I welcome because I don't want to waste the batteries (of the audio source and this Fugoo) by transmitting wirelessly.- Six audio drivers (4 active with 2 tweeters and 2 woofers + 2 passive drivers to basically absorb and take up the sound energy from the active drivers) = omni-directional sound so everyone gets the sweet spot.- Button controls and a built-in microphone for your smart phone so you don't have to go fumbling for your phone at all and keep it tucked in your pocket.- Underside mounting which the company sells add-ons for a bike mount, strap mount, and a multi-mount where you can hook up a carabiner in one end.CONS:- I'm still not in love with the SPORT design and teal color choice compounded by the multiple wavy lines along the product. I prefer a clean look but still retain the rubbery grip of the jacket. I hope the company can come up with additional jacket designs.- The price seems a bit steep at first look which strongly needs a live demo for people to be convinced in choosing this over the others. Yes, the replaceable jacket and all-weather capability is a strong selling point in itself. But at the end of the day, you can only buy one Bluetooth speaker so sound quality and sound output matters. The Fugoo demands to be heard.OVERALL:Once you get passed the sticker shock and considering what's in the box as well as the capability of the speaker, you have to appreciate you are paying a premium for this Fugoo Bluetooth speaker. The speaker comes with (apart from the actual speaker core + chosen jacket style) an AC adapter, USB cable, 3.5mm audio cable, and accessories bag. In other words, it comes with the whole shebang to get you started and on the move from the house to the beach.Clean up is easy by removing the speaker core and washing the external jacket in running water and mild soap. Just be wary of not using high pressure water in order not to damage the speaker fabric. Although the TOUGH replacement jacket can take the abuse.I like the design of the speaker core itself and I would rather display it "nude" just like my studio speakers. Of course this is not advisable as curious hands can damage the speaker.I'm not in love with any of the jacket designs from STYLE, SPORT, or TOUGH (which looks like it took a cue from the outdated Panasonic Toughbook laptops). I like a simple, rugged jacket with not much wavy lines. How about an aluminum shell for STYLE and an all-black rubber jacket for SPORT.In any case, I do recommend this product for it's innovative features and sound output that is fit for an outdoor lifestyle. Minus 1 star for the design, but 5 stars for everything else.

I love the design of Salomon shoes and their quick lacing system. It's the easiest and smoothest one pull lacing I've ever experienced that it became my go-to shoes.They make true to size and fits exactly as I expect for my size.There are colors for everyone's taste from loud, eye-catching bright tones to dark, muted tones which is more my style. I like mine to be on the down low, but with killer Ninja moves when the occasion calls for it. Rather than the "hey look at me and my bright awesome shoes" and then when the race starts you trip. In any case, I'm just glad Salomon still makes different colors and hasn't gone all out crazy just making bright neon colors on this shoe, yet.These are my all-season shoes I can count on. I use these from walking on trails with gravel and loosely packed snow. To the parks and malls. Where I live it rains frequently so I don't have fear of getting my feet soaking wet from the rain and the puddles. However don't go Rambo on it as despite having Goretex waterproofing material, the toes do get a bit wet eventually. When I complained at the Salomon stand-alone store, I was told it's normal.The soles are very durable running in them at the gym and have better than average traction. My biggest complain are the cracks that easily form by the force of the outer toe mound. Of course this will depend on how aggressive you use the shoe, but for a trail running shoe then it supposed to be reinforced for this purpose. I even walked into a North Face store and the person said it's a shame it's a nice shoe with the same weakness we all know about. (I did buy a North Face trail running shoe also that day when I saw they had the quick lace system similar to the Salomon, but the fit and lacing is terrible).PROS:1. Design and colors from loud to muted.2. Best quick lacing I've seen.3. Goretex textile for waterproof4. Durable soles5. Great fitCONS:1. For a trail running shoe that should last, the shoe cracks fast by the outer toe mound.2. Despite the Goretex material, it does get wet by the toes when exposed to water longer.3. Goretex lining will make your feet warmer versus non-Goretex lined shoes, obviously.OVERALL:I will not hesitate to recommend these specific shoes for your all season casual go-to shoes. If people use it for the trails, it will definitely survive and last longer at the malls.If only Salomon can listen to the regular users and reinforce the shoe once and for all to prevent the usual cracking on the outer toe mound it would be a perfect 5 star shoe.

I don't know if Manfrotto has a direct hand at manufacturing this bag, but the quality is excellent just like their tripod. The nylon material is thick and the stitching is solid. Not a flimsy bag at all.I was skeptical of pulling the trigger because of it's price. After seeing great reviews on it, I purchased one myself which I think is the best way to store my Manfrotto 055XPROB tripod + 322RC2 ball head combination. Both fit inside just fine.The zipper is fluid. The opening is generous so you can pop the tripod in with no struggle at all.The padding is thick. Of course this comes at a price in terms of making it very bulky to handle, but this bag is not for carrying around of course. It's for storing the tripod and bringing it from storage to your vehicle and onto the shoot. It gives me confidence knowing the tripod is heavily protected from dings and scratches when handling it to and from places.After 7 years of owning this bag and tripod, I don't have any issues at all to date. Definitely recommend.

With Sony phasing out the Move Motion Controllers due to the release of PS4 that doesn't need it, I was looking for a cheap offering of the Move Motion Controller from scouring the web and brick and mortar stores.Amazon was offering the best price for a purported brand new controller. I was skeptical at first since it isn't directly sold by Amazon, but Amazon fulfills the shipment. I purchased mine from a seller called "Direct Distributor" which after reading positive reviews on them, I jumped on it for an experimental one controller first.My package arrived relatively quick in an Amazon box. In it was a plain brown, compact box with a printed sticker that it was new and bulk package. Inside was the controller as well as the lanyard attachment both individually wrapped in their own plastic.Physically looks great. Charged it fully. Plugged it in the PS3 system to pair and off I went using it with no issues.As for the controller, it's a bit archaic in 2014 seeing how both PS4 and XBOX One systems have refined their process through the camera. But I'm still loving my shooting games in the PS3, not for it's authenticity but for it's arcade-style playability. I see the games in the arcade shops and I know I can play the same ones at home without having to keep on purchasing tokens to continue playing.I love how the controller can be adapted to various accessories like a steering wheel and various model guns. I don't like how bright and big the glowing ball can be. A bit obtrusive at first which gets lost once your in the zone gaming.It's a good piece of technology during it's time. I will wait for further price drop and will probably purchase two more so I can get a pair per person for some boxing arcade game this time.If only the PS4 was backward compatible in the PS3 games so I can carry over all existing Move games and accessories for the interim while we are still waiting for similar motion control games using the advanced camera.

I have high hopes for this product. The manufacturer seems to be especially proud of it's expanding hose offering.PROS/ Manufacturer CLAIMS:- Up to 250 PSI- Solid Brass Fittings- Kink-free- made from a "Tuff-Guard" multi-layer core rubber inner hose- Very lightweight. In fact it's the solid brass attachments on both ends that is basically adding the hefty weight to the hose.CONS:- Unlike a regular hose, you will need to wait and pressurize the hose in order to expand. This is the reason why there is an ON/OFF valve at the end. Once the hose has expanded, you can start to release the pressure and if the flow of water is good then the hose remains expanded. If there is not enough pressure flow, the hose may begin to contract.- It claims an up to 250 psi rating, but once you open the package the included instruction sheet specifically states in big bold letters that it cannot be used with a pressure washer. (Although unlike other reviewers on this item, it can be used with a hose attachment like a sprinkler.)- Unlike traditional hoses, there is an elaborate multi-step process in using the hose that is time-consuming in itself just for operating a simple tool - a hose. You have to ensure to expand the hose by SLOWLY opening the water source and letting it flow. This will ensure there are no kinks while the hose expands. Once fully expanded, you let the water out by opening the valve on the end of the hose. Then when you are done, you close the water source and wait for the hose to empty it's water contents as it contracts back to a compact hose.OVERALL:So you see this hose is not for everyone really. If you have a house with a big yard, I would simply go with a traditional big, bulky hose application that can be kept on a plastic reel. I live in a condo building at the heart of a Downtown city. I do not have much space to store or operate the hose. My main purpose is to wash down the car and bicycle when in need. That is why I have accepted the elaborate steps that I have to go through to operate the hose. If I were to regularly use a hose, I would not recommend going this route at all.I believe that the manufacture should, in order to garner more positive reviews and avoid negative due to misunderstanding, not only highlight it's compactness, but to come clean in announcing what it can and cannot do on the feature page as well as on the box itself. This way everything is laid out for the purchaser to see. Why force the purchase when it truly isn't for them. This will avoid returns in the process as well.

This is my second baby bathtub for my second baby. The first was a Safety 1st brand and is very similar in shape. I love how Summer has innovated on the idea by not just offering a basic infant to toddler bathtub, but by including accessories to help occupy the baby which I never had for the first.This bathtub comes with a simple-clip on toy bar with mirror. You have two attachments that hang on the clip-on bar which is a heart shape and a sun shape plastic.There are 3 stages of use for this bathtub and basically solves the problem of having to purchase multiple products throughout your baby's growth..STAGE 1: From 0 monthsIt comes with a clip-on bath sling which acts as a baby hammock. As a result it gently carries the baby on a laying down position.STAGE 2: Contoured Backrest (possibly 6 mos and up; depending on baby's size and weight)This is where you discard the sling at this point in the baby's growth, but retain the clip-on toy bar. At this stage the baby is able to sit upright on it's own and can appreciate the clip-on articles to keep her entertained.STAGE 3: TUB (up to 2 years old; depending on baby's size)You discard the clip-on bar and change the baby's position from the contoured backrest part to an upright sitting position. It now acts like a miniature tub where the length of the tub encompasses the length of the baby's legs.For our first tub, we discarded it earlier than two when our baby could comfortably not just stand but walk by himself. This way he can safely move about on the adult tub without feeling constricted. So at this point, you can use it up to stage 3 until the time you are confident enough to allow your baby to bathe in the actual tub.PROS:- Included bath sling that acts like a baby hammock- Accessories to keep baby entertained during bath time- Drain plug to safely drain water especially when using over the sink. When using over an actual tub, I just tip the whole tub over.- Soft padding on the tub.- The actual tub is made in the USA (everything else is made in China)CONS:- Not BPA-free which should be a standard for baby plastic items- One of the foam pads was not stuck together properly  and was hanging loose. I had to remove the cardboard particles that became stuck underneath the sticker portion of the pad before re-applying it on the actual plastic tub. Time will tell if this will remain stuck.- Accessories: sling pad and clip-on bar + toys are made in China which I have nothing against if the manufacturing is done right and the materials are non-toxic, but the hanging toys are questionable in quality and there is no mention of it's toxicity.OVERALL:My first tub was a blue plastic for my boy. I was excited to see this in person when it was a transparent and sparkly pink tub. Very princess-like and 100% better than that first blue tub I purchased for practically the same price.Too bad the foam pads were loose and the tub plus included accessories are not advertised as BPA free. It could have garnered all 5 stars if they gave much thought into it even at a higher price.

This is a great alternative for my Cybex Stroller to accommodate an Infant Car Seat without having to go back to my full-size stroller. All in all it's just a simple strap with a stopper in one end and velcro in the other to wrap around the rear frame of your umbrella stroller. Based on other reviewers, they buy this for non-Cybex umbrella strollers which will work as long as the frame dimension is similar.It's a little bit archaic, but it's so simple it works. What I'm impressed with is that Cybex can make a simple strap, but can make it look and feel so elegant. I wish other manufacturers can follow suit with the build quality like this.

I've shopped, tried, owned and used a couple of strollers. As a Dad who loves gadgets, I'm also looking for something sturdy, has great design, and is functional.Let's breakdown this stroller's pros and cons:PROS/FEATURES:STROLLER1. Aluminum Frame - For a full-size stroller, it is relatively lightweight and rust-free.2. One-Piece Push Handle - Easier to maneuver with one hand than strollers with two separate handles.3. One-Handed Fold - Just push the button then twist by the middle of the handle and you will be able to fold the stroller4. Drink Holder - Who doesn't appreciate a drink holder these days? In one of my strollers, I even had to buy one separately as an add-on accessory versus being included.5. Self-Standing - Not long ago it was a selling point to be self-standing. I think strollers these days should have a self-standing feature when folded as a given.6. Long and Spacious Footrest with Adjustable angle - As a full-size stroller, I expect the Spectra to have long and spacious footrest to accommodate the growing child. It does not disappoint.7. Large Storage Basket - Again, all full size strollers I expect to have a large basket underneath the stroller seat and this feature does not disappoint. You can toss in a lot of things in there.8. Child Snack/Drink Tray - You have a tray in the center as well as two cup holders for milk and water.9. Built-In Rear Mesh for Ventilation at the Hood - This serves as a ventilation as well as a peek-a-boo window to see your child while pushing around.10. Suspension for all Four Wheels - Helps provide a smoother ride for your child.11. Large Rear Wheel Lock - they call their feature a "pedicure-friendly" lock. It's basically a large foot rest at the rear to help your foot lock and unlock the rear stroller wheels.CAR SEAT + BASE1. SmartScreen Technology - A simple screen at the car seat base to let you know if it's installed properly.2. One-Pull Adjustment Straps - This means no need to re-thread the harness which can be a nightmare for others who need to reach at the back. I've had strollers and car seat harnesses that do both and it's not really a pain to re-thread. Although having this feature is definitely a selling point right now versus others that are not equipped with it.3. Car seat locks into the Spectra stroller without needing any adapter. A very neat feature.CONS:1. The build is crude. On the frame there are too many unsightly welding points that at this day and age I would expect a sleeker and cleaner assembly.2. Cheap plastic parts. I welcome plastic parts where it makes sense and to save on weight. There are plastics that are properly constructed and molded, and then there's those cheap toy plastic materials that gave plastic a bad rap. Unfortunately Summer Infant chose the latter route. It's so cheap that the fit and finish is typical of cheap strollers.3. Bad Build.a. Two wheels snapped on smoothly. The third wheel had to be snapped on with a little bit of force. The fourth wheel would not snap on at all. After applying frustrating force, I examined the piece and saw that the metal part that snaps on the wheel was out of alignment. It would not respond to the twisting of the plastic cap. What I did was to force it to bend with a screwdriver. Then I snapped the wheel into place. Unfortunately at this point you would not be able to remove the wheel any longer for replacement as it's stuck in there. In any case, I've never had to replace a wheel on any of my strollers. Once the wheels are done, I would assume the stroller condition is done as well. So it's not a big problem, but it does speak of the build quality and quality control.b. The plastic parts don't fit properly nor do the locking plastic parts move smoothly. The snack tray locks into place with a plastic lock and it serves as a handle. Many times the plastic tray took off on it's own without unlocking the plastic part. For the two front wheels, you can lock these as with any other stroller so they move in a straight line which is helpful in non-paved paths. Locking the wheels with these plastic parts is a big pain. They don't move down smoothly and you'll have to ensure the wheels are straight first before you are able to properly lock them. This is unlike other strollers that you can just move a switch into place with your foot and then you start to push. When the wheels are straight, they automatically lock. Really bad design and my least favorite feature of the Spectra stroller.4. Short Canopy - This is the shortest canopy I've ever seen in a stroller and is a big no-no these days to protect against the Sun and Rain. My umbrella stroller has a canopy three times as long as this one which has a neat expanding feature with a zipper. The Spectra canopy is a full size stroller and I'm severely disappointed they did not think of having a long one considering the length of the stroller. This impacts my buying decision against choosing this stroller.5. Gimmicky SmartScreen Technology Feature -  This is the first car seat base I've seen that needed batteries in order to tell me that it's installed properly. You'll probably only need the set of batteries included in the purchase for the 6 month that you'll need to use it before switching to a full size Toddler Car Seat. But still, I personally don't feel in awe with this feature and is not a selling point for my purchase. Less appealing is the basic screen that reminds me of V-Tech electronic toys. A bit crude and makes the Infant Car Seat cheap looking that it can possibly be.6. Stroller Folding Can Be Smoother - I wasn't impressed with the one-handed folding as I still needed to aid it with my foot to help bend into place the folding points. And even when it folded, it didn't snap into the plastic lock at the side. I had to force the lock into place unlike my other full-size and umbrella strollers that clicks into place. You need to do the folding action swiftly in order set the lock. If you pause halfway, then the lack of momentum won't make it lock into place as a result.OVERALL:Yes, it's cheap. Unfortunately that's how the stroller reflects in build and operation as well. There's nothing exciting about this stroller that will make me want to choose this over the others at this price point. I know not everyone can afford the top end strollers which is why there are strollers at this pricing level. I'd probably will think about getting a second-hand stroller of something twice as expensive than deal with a brand new stroller like this.I wish Summer Infant went into the stroller scene with a bang showing excellent build with a reasonable price. Instead they went with showcasing cheap strollers with a cheap manufacture.As the saying goes, you get what you pay for, which in this case rings very much true.

Changing out your laptop screen is not the hardest thing on earth. However, please be aware that with this particular model there are several different screens with different boards on them in the back. So please take your screen out of the machine to find the actual part number before you go ordering. Make sure you have the right one!

I actually use this to clean my Wizard of Oz pinball machine because it's what the factory reccomended to keep it clean. This still does an awesome job protecting and rubbing some of the superficial crap off of it. It also puts an amazing shiny glisten on the playfield. Very good stuff.

Yet another good screen bought from amazon. Changing out your own LCD for your laptop is indeed easy. There is really no reason for you to shy away from it unless you are really scared. This laptop model only has one type of screen in it, so feel confident in buying this if your model number matches up. Good luck!

What a terrible speaker for the price. This speaker carries the moniker of "ultimate ears" and you think you may be getting a superior speaker based on that. You end up with quite the opposite. This speaker was never even battery tested as a result of its' awful sound quality. I am not an audio snob, I promise. Decent, loud sound is all I expect. In fact, I use one of those 39.99 logitech sets with two speakers and a woofer as my desktop speakers.However, this speaker sounded more like the thousands of awful speakers available for 12 dollars rather than an expensive premiere speaker. Steer Clear of this inferior product.

First of all: let's be honest about what this is used for 99% of the time. There's no use in hiding from it. It's become so acceptable in this society to admit it, that it's ridiculous to stand around and pretend that these devices are used for something, when they're all used for a different purpose.I love cooking, and sometimes it's impossible to get my Thyme down to a ground, powdery like substance that is easily used in the process. Furthermore, having several pieces, allowing for the kief to fall to the very bottom below a screen so it doesn't get wasted, with a spatula to collect the kief, is amazing.I had a grinder that was almost exactly like this, just bigger, and way more expensive, like 3x the price. The larger one is better if you need herbs for a group of people, but I certainly find that this one is plenty big for my own personal use.I found that the grinder was plenty sharp for my needs, and fit in my pocket very easily.I was given a HomeFlav Heavy Duty Premium Super Shredder in exchange for a fair review.

This monitor fit together easily and has a great picture for a great price I am not using it for photography or anything crazy, so it has been great. The only tip I would give you is to know that the monitor can look like it fits together if you put it in backwards. So don't get frustrated, just flip it around and boom, it snaps into place easily.

I didn't like the fact that this product came rolled up like a poster. After two weeks it still looks wrinkled up like it had been sitting in a warehouse rolled up. It's also very small. I didn't anticipate how small it might be, and that was my fault. However, it does offer a good protection layer. In terms of usefulness I have noticed that it will slide a little bit on me. Overall not too satisfied with this product.

This paper has been excellent. It feels lightweight and is easy to seperate. Some papers that I've used have a tendency to stick together. GP is a great company that makes everything from drywall to paper....excellent company, excellent product.

This is a great machine, and I have a lot positive to say about it, but there is one negative that causes it to lose a complete two stars! This machine can be a bit loud, which is a little bit of a turn off, but how else are you going to pump water at a high pressure? The ends fit on well, and there are plenty. All the way from broad and soft, to what I call "Murder your gums" are the levels that these tips go. The basin fills enough water for a quick once over, but you'll have to fill it twice if you are on a flossing mission.The great news is that flossing with this machine is much easier than conventional flossing methods. Choking your fingers by wrapping floss around your fingers seems terribly archaic. I'm not a savage. The floss picks are great, but even they are hard to get back in the back, and you tend to leave them around, which is gross. This machine makes all of that easier, and according to my dentist is effective.The big problem that I have with this machine is the button to engage the pump. It is extremely difficult to keep the button engaged and you just feel like you're mashing a button to try to keep it going. It is nothing short of a terrible design for the button, and the button alone.

LotFancy keyboards are a must buy. These cheaper keyboards are a total and complete solution. Keyboards have a tendency to have small pits in them where liquid can pool if you spill in your laptop. I'm not 100% sure if that's really by design, as an IT professional, but this is one of the easiest repairs you can do on a laptop. So many people call my company and tell me that they spilled into the keyboard, and everything works except that. There's usually only one or two screws, if any, under the keyboard. Then a lot of times theres some clips at the top of the keyboard that can be tricky. If there's no clips there's always 2 or 3 screws on the top of the keyboard (on the front) that are holding the keyboard down.

For those of you who don't know, a bridge will basically suck in the wireless signal from a router, and push it out into the cables. The primary use for this, these days, is because you may have an ethernet printer, or desktop computer, far away from your entertainment center. The device is billed as an entertainment bridge to hook up your xbox one, ps4, or TV or ROKU, but I use it the other way around. I prefer to have my main router close to my TV so I can hard wire that stuff from the actual source. Then I use a device like this to hook up my main computer and printer. It is flawless. Best. Purchase. Ever.

Don't be fooled by all of the "this is easy" youtube videos that you see. Changing out your ipad screen is difficult! It's NOT EASY. I shattered the old digitizer on its' way out, because I couldn't get a lift on it. Then the screws are so tiny you could swallow a handful and never know...seriously!However, this digitizer works great! It's not the product that stinks, it's the process of using the part!

This is not the first time I've owned a similar product....however, it is the first time I have found something similar to actually be designed properly. In the past I've had a spare cord laying around that was very poorly designed. They used a system where your cords for IDE are attached to this black thing all the time. The black thing basically is machined metal that converts IDE to ATA...wonderful

This stand is UNBELIEVABLE! I love it. There are a lot of adjustments you can make. This is also extremely easy to put together, and it seem ridiculously well mounted with the plates.Clearly this set will only work if your desk is not straight on the back. You need to have a place to clamp it to.The only thing I had some trouble with is tightening down some things with it being close to a wall, but if you finagle around with it long enough you can figure it out without much of a problem. It came with the correct allen wrench to be able to work on it.I feel bad for my former self that did not own a mount like this. ENJOY!

For ten dollars, this set is packaged in some packaging that is allowable to keep it in, which was great. These items are of acceptable quality, and I'm happy. I'd suggest adding a magnetizer to your order to make sure that these tools work to their greatest potential.The wedges worked really really well on an iPad mini....so I'm very accepting of this set...good work guys!

I rarely find a game that captures my attention, and makes me want to play for hours. This game seems to move quickly through the stages, allowing me to find things that are rewarding fairly easy.The game is not tough, and has a cute story.I will say that this game is certainly not for a hardcore gaming audience, but if you're like me you might really enjoy it. I consider myself to be a hardcore casual gamer. I enjoy an escape from reality. I don't want things in a game to be real. I like playing games that are somewhat cartoonish and offer a way to be rewarded while I play.  In this game you collect items while playing through the story that make your character better and better.I think I am about halfway through the game and I am a big fan. In fact: I'm going to go play it now.SHORT AND SWEET: For the casual 32 year old gamer, I love it.

love teh way these scrubs feel. I am a fan of them as well, as they tend to fit her fairly well. the tag is not bothersome at all, and that after a couple of washes they could not be more comfortable. Five stars for sure!

This case offered a wonderful slimline protection for my note 2. There is no protection for the screen, but what a lot of people don't understand is that the films that a lot of companies try to sell you for phones and tablets are not actually protective for any reason other than smudging.The great thing about this case is that it keeps a somewhat slimline profile for the phone comparative to other otterbox products. It also offers about a 16th of an inch buffer from the screen to where it would fall onto a flat surface, offering you a good deal of protection against screen smashing. Obviously if you drop it onto an uneven surface, or maybe a driveway that has a rock on it, your screen is still a goner.The back is a hard shell of plastic...I think this case is wonderful.

I bought this hard-to-find album because I used to love it. After 20 years though it certainly does not stand the test of time, reminding me how accepting a teenager can be of music. The anti-authority feelings that I had listening to "Marijuana in your brain" are now mixed with distaste for the poor mixing of this album. I don't know what I was thinking, but I have fond memories of this album.

I feel like maybe I should tailor my expectations when it comes to such a cheap portable speaker, but the volume that this offered wasn't nearly what I expected. The pairing stayed for as long as you might expect. There really were not any problems other than the volume, and the quality of the speaker. The device does look cool, but meh......

This Paw print Ornament is so adorable. Another beautiful necklace I purchased for a gift.The seller did an exceptional job personalizing  the disc.I have the same one in gold just as pretty .The disc is dainty but thick.I'm sure my Daughter will love this !

Just as described in description. This necklace is so dainty and I love the thickness of the round disc.The seller does a great job hand crafting her line of Jewelry.

This is the best hand sanitizer ever! Out of the two the Pumkin crunch is my favorite, The scent is unbelievably awesome. Have had people ask me what the good smell was! So convenient to take anywhere and everywhere, I don't leave home without it.This goes on easy and absorbs fast into my hands. I  feel confident this is keeping the germs away! LOVE it so much I ordered another.

I'm writting my review here but didn't get this one I was sent the Beachy Frosted Snowflake  instead.This review  is based on what my friend whom I gave this to as a little gift .She liked the fact it's natural since she has stopped using products with chemicals. She said this really didn't  give her any beach waves at all.However it did leave a little shine.By the end of day her hair was  very dry.I am only going by what she told me.She really didn't smell much of a scent which was ok because she is very sensitive to any strong scents and would prefer non at all.As far as the shells at the bottom,she informed me there was none at all again that was fine with her.I did observe that as well before giving this to her.As always Diva Stuff I'm always very happy with if I wasn't I wouldn't keep reordering.They have excellent customer service as well.One reason for the two stars is because I didn't receive this particular one I ordered which is fine because I could have contacted Diva Stuff and I have no doubt they would have exchanged it for this.Two no shells at bottom and three she said it just didn't work the way she was hoping for her hair.Not to say I won't order one and try it out for myself because I may.

I really like everything about this shirt .The colors are really pretty as well.The shirt is well made and no defects at all.The only thing is they run small .Normally I wear  a medium  but I ordered a Xl ,glad I did because this shirt fits just perfect if I had gone a size smaller I wouldn't have been able to wear this.Still I can't dry it because I think it will shrink a little than sleeves will be way to small.I washed it in cold water on gentle cycle than hung dry.I definitely would suggest going up a few sizes if you decide to order one.

This ring is beautifully handcrafted.Looks great in the picture but even better in person.I am very pleased with how well made this is.These rings are very sturdy and you chose the size you want .Plan on ordering more for Gifts.If you haven't checked out this sellers hand crafted jewlery you should.Alot to chose from and shipping was fast.

These Christmas Ornaments are beautifully  hand crafted.I am so happy to have found this seller here on Amazon.I ordered several of these for gifts and I'm very impressed how nice looking these are.You chose the colors and name you want on each one .I am more than happy with these.Definitely recommend this seller !

I love Diva Stuff Laundry Detergent I bought this in the smallest size to see how I would like it.I do like this but Diva is my favorite of all.Still this is nice ,the scent stays on clothes,sheets,towels etc until next washing.I find mixing these little bottles with non scented laundry detergent  works best for more than a few washes.I just add equal parts of non scented detergent.

I'm at my vacation home in Vermont and while I enjoy the wilderness and hiking I don't like unexpected surprises.I rated this 5 stars because when I tested this the bell seemed to be loud enough to let a Bear know someone or something is around.Though I didn't have to use this Thankfully I feel much better knowing I have this on hand along with my Bear Spray when hiking. It's just an extra to give me a little peace of mind.I did read many reviews before I placed order and I am very happy I paid close attention to what others had to say about this Bear bell.Hopefully I won't be needing this or the spray but being up in the mountains you never know what's gonna approach me.Seller was great as well arrived super fast and packaged perfect.Would buy from seller again.

I ordered this Bath Bar as soon as I seen it on the Diva Stuff site.I am hooked on all their Bath stuff and this is just another wonderful addition to their Bath line.This bar is a decent size ,don't be fooled this makes a Bathfull of Bubbles .The scent is amazing ,if you like Candy Cane you will love this.The scent not only smells so good but it has a very relaxing effect.These Bath Bars are not drying in fact they are very moisturizing. I'm definitely placing more orders for this one.Can't wait to see what they will put out next.I'm never disappointed.

These are absolutely gorgeous frosted Christmas light soaps.The colored  light soaps are pretty as well.These are perfect for those who prefer white lights over colored. This is really nice to hold a few sets of earrings, rings and other jewelry. I have nothing negative to say about this cute vintage looking box.Mine arrived in perfect condition ,the latch works fine and I was completely aware of the sizing of this box.That said I'm very happy with this purchase and the price was unbelievably beyond reasonable. I have used many  different Charcoal soaps and this is my least favorite.In fact this soap is waxy like nothing I have ever used.I have to wonder if this is real Charcoal Activated soap.Almost feels like a cheap bar of soap with black dye .I see why this is so cheap in price compared to other brands .Also I took the chance I should have known since there were not many reviews.I used many Bamboo Activated Soaps and this I will not recommended to anyone unless you like the feeling of waxy soap that's also sticky.I gave one star because seller was great ,shipped fast and packaged perfect.

I put these Grip Master Winter gloves through the test and I will say these are thick,flexible,durable  gloves.I live in R.I. though it's Fall in the middle of October it's still been in the 50s.I decided to bring these gloves with me to our vacation rental in Vermont. Yesterday we woke up to the 30s with alot to do .First thing was climb up a ladder and clean the leaves out of the gutter Second project was cut wood and place it where it belonged. These gloves kept my hands not only warm but also protected them from cuts.These are very flexible and easy to grasp wood .Being outside for several hours in the 30s until it finally reached the upper 40s by noon ,my hands stayed nice and warm and I have to say I am surprised these gloves survived without any tears giving that they really took a beaten.These would also work great shoveling snow,and doing simple task as holding a drill.However to pick up little screws or nails would be a pain .Personally I wouldn't use for that .They do wash well in cold water just be sure you don't put them in the dryer of course as you already know the rubber would melt.They look great and plan on using them over and over again.I would recommend these.I recieved this product free in exchange for my honest review.In no way would I ever give a product 5 stars just because I recieved it free .This rating is based on my trial,and how well these gloves performed.

Should of read the reviews.Though these are pretty and color seems accurate to picture they areally way to big for me.I was looking for something inexpensive to match a dress for a party but I just thought they looked rediculas on me .I gave them away and the person loved them.

Great product !This I ordered because I have alot of allergies, sinus issues and daily congestion. This really has helped me breath through my nose especially at bedtime. I haven't had this long but I am very happy I can sleep better at night and I haven't been waken up aa congested or with a stuffy nose every morning.Honey ,Lemon and all the good ingredients in this tube have been a huge relief for me.I also use during the day but most importantly this is a must at night.Will order more when I'm halfway through ,I wouldn't want to be without this product.

Been using this Alterna on and off for a while now.This I like to use weekly not daily as a detox.I do find it does strip some of my color but not a whole bunch which is why I use once a,week.This is great for anyone with thinning hair or those who tend to shed more hair than we would like .Better yet none would be better but unfortunately it happens to some of us .overall I like it and would suggest this .Hair seems to be thicker as well.

2:21 MinsThis is the deluxe kit of the Fastrim Roller and I was pretty excited to test this kit out.  I absolutely love the handle for the smaller rollers. You can adjust this handle to any angle you need by simply snapping out the red piece, positioning the handle to the angle you need and then snapping the red piece back in.  Its really that easy.  At first I was a little afraid to pull it out as I thought I was going to break it, but no worries you wont break it so dont be afraid to pull it out.The roller frame included in this kit is quite possibly the best frame Ive ever used.  Im no professional painter, but both myself and my friend helping me paint agreed that this was a better frame than other ones weve bought from hardware stores.  I like the knock it off system as its really easy to get paint filled rollers off without getting paint all over you.  The rollers included are meant for acrylic paint, so keep that in mind.  We were using latex paint so we chose to use a different roller and save those for our next project with acrylic paint.As for the Fastrim roller system..I cant stress this enough: Watch the videos and follow the instructions!  I did not.  I decided to just test it and go and Ill be honest I wasnt thrilled at first.  But I really really wanted this product to work well so I decided to go back and watch some of the videos on Youtube on how to properly load and use the roller.  This made a world of difference.  I am now completely confident in my ability to use this roller correctly, and when used correctly you really can skip the taping.  There are obviously always going to be some areas that its best to tape off but for the most part you can easily get away without taping off IF you use this correctly.The roller and handle fit in the tray perfectly so you can just snap the lid on and it keeps your paint from drying out.  This is great for me as I often dont finish painting projects all in one go.  Overall, this is a terrific kit as long as you use it properly and I love the knock it off frame!I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest, unbiased review.

So Ive played with a few mini quad copters, but this is the largest one Ive had the chance to use and I have to admit it kind of intimidated me. I have a Samsung Galaxy S5 which is USB 3.0 capable and I absolutely love the cord that come with it.  It charges so much faster, and I've been on the hunt for another cord for work. Now, I did noticed I didn't get any notifications during that 10 minutes, so that may make up for the 3% difference. Definitely a must have if you have USB 3.0 capability for your phone! I'd like to note that the normal cord I used is a nylon usb cord and it charges much quicker than a non nylon cord, so the fact that this cord is still so much faster says a lot about the quality of this cord.

Anyone lucky enough to find a copy of this traditional Hungarian cookbook will indeed discover a treasure chest of great and easy to follow recipes as long as they are already familiar with various cooking techniques. I bought my book in Hungary in 1975 or 1981. It is a paperback with a photo of a roasted suckling pig on the cover that has an apple in its mouth. Mine is a second edition in superb condition published by Corvina Press in Budapest in 1969 (original was published in 1958). The book is a mere 158 pages long, written in English, has a very fine index with well organized chapters. The first chapter explains the history of Hungarian cooking, the next one describes special techniques of the Hungarian kitchen and the main contents of the book are recipes for well known Hungarian dishes, meats, soups, vegetables, scones/muffins and desserts.I enjoyed reading the history of Hungarian cooking as it relates to history. Especially enjoyed reading about the popular, staple foods Hungarians enjoy:  the most famous being gulys (goulash) a type of thick beef soup. The author links  the origins of  stuffed cabbage to "sarma"  a type of  Turkish or Bulgarian dish made of spicey minced meat stuffed into grape leaves. He also explains "tarhonya" (dried pasta) has ancient origins dating back to nomadic tribes originating east of the Caucasian mountains. The brief description of food eaten during King Matthias Corvinus's era (1458 - 1490) is enjoyable: roast and grilled meat, food cooked in cauldrons, use of specific spices, gravies and the tidbit that turkeys were brought over from the Prince of Milan. The author compares Hungarian cooking styles and flavors with that of other countries. He describes a brief history of paprika, as well as the influence of French cooking, which was popular in Vienna during the Austro-Hungarian Empire. Consomms, fricass, and ragout dishes were added to the Hungarian meals.Some cooking methods strongly associated with the Hungarian kitchen are discussed such as using clarified or cooked lard which has been replaced with sunflower, canola or other oils in modern times. Other significant methods are: roux as a thickener made with a high gluten flour,  adding sour cream to specific dishes, and techniques such as "prklt" or braising of meat.  Hungarians add any of these spices: paprika, black pepper, dill, marjoram, savory, thyme, or green celery to sauces or a variety of dishes. It is the specific combination of cooking techniques and spices which creates the unique flavor identified as "Hungarian cooking" or "cuisine".Recipes are provided for these many different foods: soups, vegetables and their garnishes; vegetables; hot and cold entres; hot and cold fish dishes; meats including beef, veal, lamb, pork, game and winged game and poultry; salads;  and cakes, sweets, pastries. Famous Hungarian main meal recipes are described: goulash soup (gulys), fish soup (halsz leves). potatoe soup with sour cream (krumplis leves), bean soup with knuckle of ham, ; garnishes include vermicelli or diced pasta, semolina dumplings; famous sauces include paprika, mushroom, and horse-radish with vinegar. There are side dish recipes for fried potatoes and onions, paprikash potaoes, steamed cabbage, galushka (thimble dumplings0 with scrambled eggs,Hot entre recipes include: pancake stuffed with meat, Hortobgyi pancakes (very excellent!), paprikash mushrooms, and Hungarian omlettes. Fish main meals: Tihany Jack Salmon fillets, Cold Fogas (Pike Perch). Szeged Chowder (looks delicious!),  and Deviled Carp. There are famous main beef dish recipes such as, Peppered Tenderloin Stew (Tokny), Marhaprklt (Beef Paprika Stew), and Braised Rump of Beef. Veal dishes are: Veal Stew and Vegetables, Breast of Veal with Mushrooms and Rice,  Wiener Schnitzel and Veal in Paprika Sauce. Pork dishes included are: Pork Stew, Bcska (Serbian)  Meat with Rice, Stuffed Green Green Peppers, Szkely Stuffed Cabbage, and  basic Pork Cutlets. Desserts included are: various creams such as butter, walnut or chocolate cream; various cakes: chocolate, coffee, walnut and the well known Dobos Torta (Drum cake). Very well known recipes for a variety of biscuits, rolls and scones are given. And last but not least, there is the recipe for Rtes or Strudel which is a Hungarian favorite that includes delicious fillings, such as fried cabbage or cottage cheese or dessert strudels among which are sour cherries or apple strudel. Erika Borsos [pepper flower]

This Remington three headed Rotary ladies shaver is easy to use and provides a very smooth shave. The head and cutter assembly region work in a coordinated fashion by adjusting to the curves of the body such as around and under knees and the underarm areas. The instructions are easy to follow, you must charge the  system for 24 hours before use. You then use the shaver as directed until another recharge is required which is indicated by the red low battery light. After first use, the recharge will take about four hours. Personally, I found this product to be one of the easiest and most satisfying shavers I have ever used. It did the job and did it very well.PROS: you buy the shaver once and can continually reuse it with minimal fuss as it has a recharge system, the product saves you money in the long term and it is environmentally safe as you do not keep buying razors that are thrown away. CONS: there are conscious steps which need to be taken for its use/reuse for optimal results (in other words, follow the directions closely for best results), you may need to concentrate on specific difficult to shave areas, such as around knees and beneath underarms with several attempts for successful results (not a deal breaker for me), you need to clean it properly after use (again not a deal breaker for me).For best performance, tips are provided on how to use the shaver. The shaver head needs to be rinsed thoroughly under water during and after shaving. It is recommended the shaver be used in the shower. First apply water to the area to be shaved, next apply shaving cream, rinse shaver under water and use short, circular strokes to area desired to be free of hair. Rinse the shaver head periodically to avoid build up of residue. Thoroughly rinse the shaver head of gel or shaving cream or foam. There are easy to follow printed instructions, complete with pictures which describe the proper technique of cleaning the shaver to maintain its performance. For smoothest results, instructions are given on stubborn or difficult to shave areas. Some of which are the following: "hold the shaver at a right angle to the skin so the three heads are touching the skin with equal pressure" (when this does not happen, often a few strands of hair are left  unshaved),  "stretch the skin with the free hand so hairs stand upright, making it easier for them to enter the cutting chamber" (this may be a deal breaker for impatient users who want instant results), "use moderate to slow, circular movements  for a closer shave", and "do not press hard against the skin to avoid irritation and/or damage to the rotary heads."

Thomas Mallon has written a fascinating, insider's view of political life as it could have occurred.  The book begins with insights into the home life of Richard Nixon after his fall from glory as President of the United States. The author provides scenes, dialogue and dictated memos which eventually play an important role at a global meeting which could have outcomes no one can fathom. This book is a grand fictional novel which is interesting on so many levels. What is most impressive is how the author builds momentum and suspense as multiple players interact behind the scenes which lead to the world renown global  political meeting between President Reagan and Soviet President Mikhail Gorbachev in Reykjavik. The two super powers engage in secret negotiations on nuclear armaments and astonishingly there is an important controversial outsider whose knowledge informally attempts to influences the results or outcome. While the book is based on a serious subject it is written in a very amusing manner.The author excels at creating intrigue and total engagement, along with suspense and drama  at many political and government departmental levels as the plot and action move forward. The author provides realistic sounding dialogue, creates fictional events and interactions, and describes personal life circumstances of important historical figures, along with their spouses. The book is outstanding because it includes so many famous political figures who in the past had important positions of authority and power on the US political scene. Some of these persons in real life may not have been as important as they are portrayed by the author but the fictional portrayal within Washington political circles makes for great reading. Some of the characters are outstanding for very different reasons as the reader will discover when the story unfolds. Intrigue and twists within the plot arise from unexpected sources.The author's ability to convey the thoughts and feelings of important "who's who" important political figures in Washington politics from the mid 1970s up to and including the mid-1980s makes for a most amazing novel. There are occasional amusing anecdotes and connections, which balance out the novel and make it very interesting. The writing style of the author is such that the reader feels they get an understanding of the personality of the key figures. The book moves at a steady clip as the plot thickens. The book is filled with amusingly underhanded attempts at creating diversions while influencing outcomes during the world important summit meeting which takes place. Erika Borsos [pepper flower]

Rose de Mai French milled soap is an exceptional product which is very fragrant and provides a silky smooth feeling to the skin when used. I was most impressed with the scent which was so evident in the package when it arrived! The fragrance is intoxicating and truly reminds you of a flower garden in the spring. The scent remained in the bubble envelope for quite a long time. When the soap is used, the fragrance permeates the bathroom and leaves a fresh spring feeling. This soap is perfect in a guest bathroom or for anyone who loves roses. It is an ideal soap to use to help relax and feel you are transported into another place and time where everything stands still.  The soap is made from vegetable products and of a perfect variety of rose blends. Also it is very reassuring to know there are no harsh chemicals such as parabens, alcohol, phenoxyethanol and DEA and best of all there is *no* animal testing. Erika Borsos [pepper flower]

Jed Ringel is in his mid-fifties and a recently divorced businessman who has written a personal, revealing and at times intimate and humorous, tongue-in-cheek book about his search for romance using modern technology and the internet.  The book is a memoir of dating and starting life anew which is filled with both funny and serious stories of the author's experiences in the new environment of meeting people.  The book is fast moving and entertaining. He does not hesitate to poke fun at himself  or at some of the odd situations he encounters in his search for reconnecting with the opposite sex. His quest takes on an aura of adventure and travels into areas many would describe as "a fool walks in where angels fear to tread". It seems once he warmed up to the idea of meeting women and choosing them as if at a smorgasboard, the variety of choices became intoxicating. Of course, there is no guarantee the person he selects will agree to talk to him, or  that anyone meets his criteria for looks, personality, or other interests but that is a risk he is willing to take. For that matter, he may not match up to their criteria either!The author seems to plunge into unchartered waters of dating while still waiting for his divorce to come through. He joins a dating system called "Dinner's on Me" which caters to  men willing to pay $1,400 to have a meal with women selected by the agency who come closest to meeting the preferences/criteria the man chooses. The author describes several dinner dates with a wide variety of women, mostly foreign and each of a short duration. The author's first interesting story is about Cara, a mid-thirties attractive divorced woman, who seems to be looking strictly for a physical relationship which the author was initially only too happy to fulfill but after three months decides he could not in good faith continue, so he breaks it off.Eventually, Jed Ringel enters the internet dating scene by completing a profile on Match dot com. He makes few connections but then recognizes how to increase the odds of connecting with different women. Through trial and error, he discovers the etiquette of on-line communication and the incremental step by step method of establishing communication which has the possibility of meeting the true test of something resembling real life. The descriptions are often amusing and the learning experiences he shares are frequently  hilarious. I particularly enjoyed his antics and experiences in pursuing someone calling herself "Funnybunny". After a weekend of frantic back and forth emailing, the author felt he was on solid ground, especially when he was rewarded with her phone number. He left her a carefully worded message but after he got no response back, he felt rejected and was puzzled. Amazingly, after a bit of research on his part, he learned the real identity of  "Funnybunny"  who was a well known costume designer involved in a controversial  well publicized mishap by a celebrity at a sporting event.What surprises me the most in this book is the author's enthusiasm, relentless pursuit, tenacity and faith in the on-line system of making real  life connections through different on-line dating methods. The most daring method the author uses to find romance is via a Russian website.  Against better judgement, Jed Ringel goes full throttle into this adventure. Sounds too good to be true? Right! To my astonishment, the author visited Russia to meet  Larisa, a 39 year old divorcee, who possessed two doctorates one in economics the other in political science and also an eight year old child. Fortunately, he realized their incompatibility and left the situation. One would expect, this to be a lesson learned, be grateful and stop (!) but not for this author! He made another attempt down the same road only the next Russian ingnue, astonishingly  had something very rare and unusual for a Russian: she possessed a green card. The reason is that the father of her son was an American. What should have raised red flags all over the place was that  she as still married to the American geologist. Of course, Jed Ringel goes full speed ahead and pays for Natalya and her son to come to the USA, who naturally live with him until he awakens to his folly! Natalya and her son ended up in Louisiana to reconcile with her husband.Another most fascinating escapade in this author's venturing forth to finding love involves a Chinese woman, Meihua who was born in mainland China and received her doctorate in chemistry at a university in the United States twenty years prior after which she landed a job at a major company. The author and she invest much personal time and energy into building first a friendship which is the solid foundation upon which a lasting relationship is build and then taking their relationship to the next level of physical intimacy, It seems Jed Ringel has at last found the right person after several years of active investigation and experimentation on his part. The reader of this review will have to read the book to learn if *this* was his lasting relationship - or not. Reviewer received a free copy of the book in exchange for the review. I found this book a most interesting reading experience. At times, I was horrified at the risks the author took in his pursuit of finding love but mostly I was entertained. Just a warning, the author does not hold back and uses some crude language in certain sections which may or may not be necessary.  Erika Borsos [pepper flower]

The title of this book and specifically this cover sentence', "troubled dreamers meet at a remote island resort and discover they can run away from everything except themselves" caught my attention and my imagination, enticing me to read this book. My imagination went into overtime and in multiple directions when considering what could be the contents of this book. Forunately the author's writing is far superior to my imagined stories and their outcomes. The book is written with both humor and seriousness. It considers the lives of several groups of very diverse and different people who likely would not otherwise meet and who are forced to socialize and learn about each other's lives. The location of the resort is an "unnamed atoll [island] in the Tuamotu  Archipelago"  which means a Polynesian island located somewhere out in the South Pacific Ocean, which is very remote and removed from modern civilization. There is no internet and technology to interfere with your time and mind. You have sun, sand, a bungalow, hotel services, a restaurant and bar and various local specialized activities, such as scuba diving, fishing and sun bathing. Essentially, the visitors are isolated with their own thoughts and  personal behaviors. They are left to socialize with the other guests if they choose or to engage in their own interests. However, as human beings are social animals, eventually all guests have been introduced and socialize, breaking up into special interest groups and that is when all the real fun and seriousness of the novel takes off.What is truly amazing is how the author manages hold the reader in suspense and spell bound as she reveals the dynamics of very different personal relationships between various key couples lives. The author explores the hearts and minds of individuals and has them do self examinations about the decisions they made and their outcomes. What is most astonishing is how the author ties the novel together into a cohesive novel which includes a very satisfying conclusion to questions and issues of social justice, human rights, and global implications  and the impact of decisions made in the distant past, as well as concluding and resolving the personal problems which were the reasons the individuals and couples chose this resort in the first place.. The book becomes a magnificent human interest  story that examines areas of importance on a universal and yet still very personal level.The guests on the island are a married couple Ann, a successful lawyer and Richard, a highly talented chef whose marriage was rock solid until a business relationship and association rocked their finances and even threatened to break up their marriage. Another guest couple are unmarried but a hot item: an aging rock star named Dex Cooper and his twenty years younger mistress Wende. Another guest was a famous author, whose popularity was declining, and he was trying to reinvent his previous successful authorship and popularity. Loren, an aging French gentleman and former artist is the owner of the resort who came to the island for personal family reasons in the past, who was accepted by the native population not as an outsider but as part of the community and who later became the owner of the resort by winning it in a gambling bet. He has personal issues and demons with which he is wrestling due to his lifestyle which has caught up with him on a health issue, he has AIDS.; Furthermore, he is estranged from his only living daughter who is in France and with whom he has not spoken for many years. TIti is a native Polynesian who is both a housekeeper and cook for the resort. She is engaged to Cooked, a handsome young man of the islands who has secretly been engaging in activist issues which could get him into legal trouble with the French authorities. The author writes a highly engaging story in which she provides and reveals just the right amount of background information about the personalities and characters of key individuals and couples to create drama via a highly creative plot filled with tension and suspense. What is most surprising is the new cause around which the couples and individuals rally and support which becomes the unifying theme that resolves the book a highly satisfactory ending which can not be anticipated. I truly enjoyed this book. Erika Borsos [pepper flower]

Cara Hoffman sensitively portrays the inner struggles of Lauren Clay, a young woman in her early twenties, who was honorably discharged after completing her tour of duty with the Army in Iraq. She returns to her hometown in New York state but deliberately does not tell anyone the exact day of her arrival. She returns a more private person who keeps her feelings tightly wrapped unlike before she went to Iraq.  She served her country well and chose to return to normal life, the word "normal" being a relative term. Nothing to Lauren felt like normal since getting home. She fights unfamiliar feelings of alienation and concerns for her safety which often arise. She makes every effort to remain controlled and keep her feelings hidden but unusual behaviors surface from time to time providing clues to those who pay close attention to her behavior, those who know her very well that all is not right. Everyone who knew Lauren before she entered the Army recognized her outstanding traits of leadership, responsibility and organization. No one was surprised she became a Sergeant and commander of a squadron. It was what they expected for her, it was who she was - only now she needed help, she did not recognize it, and everyone around her wanted to believe she was the same Lauren they knew before.Lauren's arrival to her hometown, she first visits Shane, her boyfriend from high school who was on break from college. His goal was to shake his small town roots, the speech and behavior patterns. They engaged in a physical love fest which help her become more grounded. It was the welcome home she craved after being away for so long. She knew she was different inside but did not know just how different until she later did a physical maneuver on him which surprised the both of them. Lauren attempts to reconnect with her best friend from high school on a similar basis of friendship to return to where they left off but it is difficult to do. Although they shared many experiences while growing up during high school, her friend had a child without benefit of marriage and was now raising Gracie with the help of her mom.  Lauren visits her voice coach and mentor, an organist at the local church who was not well recognized by many locals for his musical genius and talent. He saw Lauren from multiple perspectives and was trying to help her reconnect with her voice and musical talent. It is possible he saw through Lauren's defense mechanisms more clearly than her own family members.Lauren had given up pursuing her own personal goals to fulfill her role as she viewed it, to provide more money to the family. Her family consists of her father, a psychologist by profession but whose background as a former hippie seems to prevail in letting him neglect most of his fatherly duties to Lauren and her younger brother Danny, after his divorce. While still in high school, Lauren took on household duties, such as shopping for food, making meals and doing the laundry. Lauren joined the Army because  she wanted Danny to attend college without worrying about tuition. When in the Army, Lauren received delightful humorous emails from Danny who addressed her as "sistopher" while he pretended she was off on an exotic vacation in an exciting location. After many delaying tactics of avoiding her mother, Lauren at last had spoken with her by phone.  Her mom completed her degree, was teaching at a local college and had gotten her life together. After recalling good memories from the past, Lauren finally agreed to visit with Danny but not quite as discussed.What Lauren deliberately did not share her plan to *first* drive to Canada and from there back down to New York. She wanted to visit Darryl Green, a fellow Army recruit with whom she bonded under very adverse conditions. His deployment was also up and he planned to move his family to Canada where his wife's family lived. Lauren's goal was to introduce Danny to survival in the wild. She wanted him to become strong, to develop new skills and hone skills he did not even suspect he possessed. Lauren became obsessed with visiting the challenging northern climate of  Jeanne d'Arc basin, where an oil field existed. It is there that Lauren faced her personal demons and Danny essentially becomes her source of salvation but on the level she had anticipated.Cara Hoffman has written a very realistic, soul searching novel that explores an inner personal landscape in a very challenging manner. Furthermore, she selected to write about, a 21 year old female Non-Commissioned Officer in the US Army who served her tour in Iraq and was deployed back into civilian life, who faced personal challenges to living she could not imagine or fathom existed. The problems which she did not acknowledge or understand or admit erupted into a full blown life-threatening event, threatening the life of the very person she wanted to protect the most. This is a very well written book on a delicate subject which will hold the reader's attention from start to finish. It is a most excellent reading experience. Erika Borsos [pepper flower]

I usually love books of short stories because most provide a glimpse into a different way of life, a new view or perspective on a life issue, or a surprise twist or unforeseen ending that leaves me thrilled and entertained or learning something new. I wish I could say all of the above for this book of twelve short stories but if I did, it would not be true.  For unknown reasons, the author focuses on people who have not discovered their true self , neither do they possess a solid foundation of beliefs and values upon which they can rely to build satisfying lives. The dissatisfaction in content of these stories could be due to a generational gap, perhaps because most of the stories are about generation Xers or millennials who seem to have lost their direction in life. They make decision mostly on emotion or haphazardly based on uncertain relationships or hoped for results which have little basis for actuality. I found the author's writing style like the staccato rhythm of a hammer driving a nail into wood at an uneven pace. The value system of some of the characters is shallow and usually lacking a solid foundation. Most of the characters seem to be floundering through life, without a core set life principles upon which they rely  There was sense of constant pounding of information, some of it rather interesting but the plot usually developed in a or direction that was not satisfying. There were few real surprises or unforeseen events which made it difficult to read some of stories to the end. Of course, as a reader, you plod through all the intensity and detail, hoping something will turn out for the better in the lives of the characters but in most of the stories it usually does not.To the author's credit, there is a lot of interesting detail to many of the stories, the stories have some direction, although the characters do not always reach their intended destination.  The characters are highly unique but we learn of their individuality by the odd decisions they make and the twisted maze into which their lives seem to fall. Sometimes the path they take on the maze of life seems to be without much effort on their part, they are thrown into events via association with friends from the past, and problems just seem to happen. The individuals do not accept the responsibility they had in making decisions nor do they realize that it is their lack of confronting issues which blow their lives fully off course into unexpected places.A brief introduction and synopsis without spoilers follows of the two stories I enjoyed. "Sungold" I found amusing because it started with the manager of a restaurant in South Florida wearing a mushroom suit outfit which is lent out to different franchises of the restaurant chain. The manager and the owner are good friends who trust each other and that is where the problems begin. The story and plot are very well developed. There is a fun plot, interesting characters whose interactions could take off in either of several directions. Most of the waitresses hired to work at the restaurant are predictably cute and near "look a likes" what the manager refers to as "Mellissa/Jessicas".  The author describes the owner Ethan as follows: "Ethan is a self-sabotaging trust fund maniac whose folks set him up with this franchise for his thirtieth birthday, mostly , I think so he would have somewhere other than the grounds of the family estate - a former plantation, it could have gone without saying - to play 'In Memory of Elizabeth Reed' at blowout volume a dozen times a day. As long as he keeps his annual losses in the mid five figures they'll keep him in business. ..." It is after the manager interviews and hires " Appolinaira Pavlovna Sungold", known as s "Polina",  who is quite a bit different than the usual Melissas/Jessicas,  that things get very interesting at the restaurant. They introduce new recipes on the menu and create a sensational trendy and popular restaurant with unexpected fringe benefits. This is one story which leaves the reader *wanting* to read more to see how the author resolves the unexpected twists and turns. The second outstanding story is called, "Carole Alone." It focuses on a retired couple who live in a beautiful new development in South Florida when unexpectedly her husband Gerald dies. Luckily,  Carol's son Dennis moved down with his family and live twenty minutes away. Although Carol has friends her own age, she feels adrift in life and engages in a potentially serious habit that could be fatal. One must read the story to learn what this maybe. I was captivated and truly enjoyed only these two stories out of the twelve. I felt luke warm to neutral toward eight stories and disliked two stories entirely. Erika Borsos [pepper flower]

Joakim Zander has proven himself to belong to a very distinguished and exclusive class of top writers in the political and global suspense genre. He belongs alongside Tom Clancy, John LeCarr, and Graham Greene. The author creates a climate of suspense based on realistic sounding world events, competing and cooperative spy agencies, and innocent victims who are accidentally caught in the cross fire of cover ups, unscrupulous activities and murders. International politics, global trade, and lobbying for increased leverage are all part of the game to advance and influence world markets and global events. This novel is a fast paced, globe trotting suspense filled thriller in which a chase is on by the C.I.A. to prevent secrets from leaking out related to dark hidden activities that occurred during the Iraq War. Inadvertently, the secrets fell into the wrong hands and the risks of them leaking out increased greatly.
