I also recommend you review many other authors' books that you read, and send a comment too. That usually gets into the author's email.

I just had to read a book written "By Get-Hair-In-Poland!" I suspect there will be some promotional material in this short book. Let's see.First, the author tells us why hair falls out. Somewhere between 50 and 100 hairs are replaced every day by new hair. But losing the follicles is a different matter--those are not replaced. The causes: genetics, hormones, disease or deficiency, drugs or medicines, burns or X-rays, shock or stress, autoimmune diseases, aging, over-styling. Well, that's good to know. But what can we control and/or reverse?DIET -- what to eat to reduce loss of hair follicles. Good standard nutritional advice here.EXERCISE -- for the entire body, including your hair follicles. Scalp massage might help also. Acupressure is worth doing too--not directly on your hair but on your fingernails! Yoga and meditation.HAIR CARE TECHNIQUES -- use of apple cider vinegar, olive oil, baking soda, eggs. Ways these could help.PHARMACOLOGICAL TREATMENTS -- with the advice of a health practitioner. Minoxidil and Finasteride -- pros and cons. Corticosteroid ointments and injections -- worth considering. Psoralen with ultraviolet A-Light therapy -- generally poor results.HAIR TRANSPLANTS -- several different kinds. CELL THERAPY -- one of the newest methods with a lot of promsie.Ah ha! Just a short plug for a clinic in Poland for hair transplantation! Arrive day one -- go home day two with a complete head of hair. But please -- go home with at least one or two weeks of experiencing Polish culture, history, architecture, people -- and FOOD! It'll be worth it. A quick read of this book was well worth my time too. I like it!

First, I did find some good principles of negotiating -- and being negotiated with -- in this short book. His counsel about listening more than talking and releasing the prospect's pressure are excellent. Give your prospect "the right to veto" is on target. About six or seven really strong principles that will help you, as they did me. I've been a writer in several fields over the last 40 years, including copy writing and promotion for an international firm. But I still find some useful advice.But here's the problem. An experienced writer in any field would not make so many common grammatical errors -- he would at least get an editor to correct his copy. The writer wouldn't try so hard yp use what he considers everyday communication, and sometimes winds up just being "cute." "You know of what I speaketh, right?" Uses the "eth" form too many times. Or "methinks" and "stoopid sales tricks" type of cuteness.So this book is an anomaly to me. That is, I can't imagine that the author, the renowned copy writer Ben Settle, wrote and edited it. I've checked into his web site which is much better written. But here's the kicker. This is a short book of 499 "locations" or about 39 pages. About 135 "locations" or 28% of the book is "Disclosures and Disclaimers" -- plus the copyright pages. Much of this is a total waste of words and space. A to-the-point copy writer wouldn't allow such a waste.

We remember Oscar Schindler mainly because of the movie "Schindler's List." We know of the Frank family of Holland because of the the diary of Anne Frank. But there are other heroes who rescued Jews and others from the Holocaust. This book helps us to realize that by setting these "saviors" in the history of their times before, during and sometimes after the Nazi domination.Raoul Wallenberg, for instance, of Sweden, saved 10,000s of Jews from the Holocaust. Born in 1912, he risked his young life for others, and disappeared in 1945, likely because of the Russian invaders. Many of the "saviors" were Christian. But some were of other faiths, such as the Muslims Hamid and Xhemai Veseli of Albania. Why did they do this? They said, "Because of friendship and the holy Koran." Another Muslim couple said of their risky efforts: "To save one life is to enter paradise."The author tells of these "saviors" also in Hungary, Italy, France, and other countries.  Some left their safe homes in USA to become "saviors" of people destined for the Holocaust. I was struck by the amazing story of Varian Mackey Fry, born in New York City in 1907. Sometimes struggling with bi-polar disorder, he still managed to save 1,500 Jews from death and persecution. Many of those were artists and intellectuals who went on to contribute greatly to humanity.This book certainly can't tell of all the heroes involved in saving Jews. But it tells enough in a moving way to inspire us to care for our oppressed fellow human beings in whatever situation they are. Because of that, I recommend it highly.

These summary type of books, highlighting the main points from the original bestseller, have their place  if theyre done well and remain true to the original. Executive Summary books by BookSwift meet that criteria. They are designed to shorten our reading time, hopefully lengthen our thinking time, so we can, as the introduction promises, walk away with the key core concepts.In this book there are over 90 chapters  that means an average of two chapters per page. And what intriguing chapter titles! About half  are about handling Resistance. Many are how a Professional handles the challenges of a creative life. Then a good number targets the power of forces we can use  The Higher Realm, Invoking the Muse, The Authentic Self, and more. Most inspiring.Even this summary refers to some examples the original author uses to make his points  and that is practical, inspiring and ALIVE. However, as I compare this summary to the full book (only 165 pages) I can see that the summary doesnt flesh out the lessons well enough. But it is an excellent way to prepare yourself for Stevem Pressfields masterpiece of self-motivation and development.

Here's another one of those gift ideas for the BBQ or smoker chef. No more hovering at the grill, watching the temperature, while the rest of the party goes on without you.In the box you get the transmitter, the receiver, the sensor probe, and, believe it or not, the AAA batteries. The instructions are well written and explains all of the functions.Use is intuitive and straightforward. First I stuck the probe into the meat and transmitter. On the receiver, you then select the mode (temp or timer). In temp mode you then select the meat type. The choices are PROGram, GroundBEEF, GroundPOULtry, BEEF, VEAL, CHiCKEn, PORK, Poultry, LAMB, and FISH. (Capital letters are what shows in the display for each meat type. I just added the rest of the letters so it is easier to decipher.) Then you choose a "taste" level of RARE, MED RARE, MEDIUM, MED WELL, WELL DONE. I used it on a tri-tip first so I chose MED RARE. The background of the display turns blue once the meat has gone up 10 degrees. I just let it cook away, then once the meat reached 15 degrees away from the perfect temp, the display turns green! Cooking continued, then when it reached MED RARE, the display turned red and an alert beep goes off. Just press stop and the alarm is silenced. I was able to carry the receiver around the house and yard without ever losing signal (maybe 75'). I could go in and out of the house, which is nice since it is already below freezing while I'm grilling. Just clipped it to my belt like a cell phone and off I go. The tri-tip was cooked just right.Maybe you don't want to use the preset temps for your "taste". Then you can easily raise or lower the temp to your liking. For example, MED is set to 150 degrees. I learned to pull meats off of the grill 10 degrees before it hits the "perfect" temp and let it rest, covered. The meat will continue to cook for the rest of the 10 degrees and it won't be overdone. So just set the taste for MED, then press the MIN down arrow button till you reach 140. The display will show that you are now programming. Now you have it set to YOUR preferences, not the USDA guidelines. If you want to change it back to the presets, just press MEAT again and it will reset. Easy.You can also use the timer as well, just in case you have two items cooking. Maybe you want to remember to stir the beans every 5 minutes. You simply set the timer for 5 minutes and it beeps when the time is up. You can set it up to 24 hours, so I think that would cover just about any cooking times!This may look like it belongs on the construction site, but I wouldn't treat it as such. It is not waterproof, so grilling in the rain is out. The plastic is better than I've seen on other thermometers, but dropping it might not be best. The rubber armor surrounding the case should provide enough protection for most incidents.The probe itself, although stainless steel, cannot be immersed, so no dishwasher for this part. You can only wipe it down since you can't throw it in the sink, either. Not a deal breaker for me.I received one of these thermometers in exchange for an honest opinion, and I honestly love this one. I would give this as a gift to any of my grilling friends. I, just like you, rely on reviews in order to make smarter purchases, so I tried not to leave out any details. If I change my mind later, I will change my review.

I was really looking forward to trying this one. Tronfy sent me one of these Mini Bluetooth Headsets in exchange for an honest review. I wish I could say I liked it more, but I could never get it to fit right. I tried every combination of hooks and ear "covers" but the ear bud kept falling out.On the good side, it paired really easy with my Kyocera Hydro XTRM. No issues whatsoever. It was charged in less than an hour with the charging cable attached to my laptop.When I held the ear bud in place, the sound was really good. Nice bass and treble. Sounds more expensive than it is. The single multifunction button makes it easier to use. No more trying to remember combos to press to go between music and phone, etc.The addition of the  extra wired ear bud so you can listen through both ears makes it a step up from your standard single ear headsets for listening to audiobooks or music. You just plug it in to the micro USB charging port and now you can tune out the world!This is a well built, well thought out package. You get everything you need, plenty of covers, ear hooks, charging cable, extra ear bud, all packed in a sturdy box.  I can't even complain about the instructions because they were some of the best I have seen. But still, I can't use it because it won't fit.Like I said, I received one of these in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. Seems like a quality product at a good price, but I still can't use it.

I have a pretty stressful lifestyle. I am a caregiver and I have to be on top of my game all day long. I have so much to remember during the day, the last thing I need is to get brain fog. When Root Down Supplements asked me to review their Focus Max, I couldn't turn them down! I received a bottle of the Focus Max in exchange for an honest review, and honestly, these work for me.Easy to take, just one capsule a day, and it keeps me mentally sharp. I don't get any jitters or stomach upset with these. You really don't notice that you are taking them. You simply go about your day with a feeling of, well, focus! Not a ton of energy boost; not like you downed a gallon of espressos. Just the ability to concentrate on whatever task is at hand. Even if you have to juggle a dozen schedules, it just feels like it's easier to deal with.I have tried taking a few of the ingredients individually in the past; namely Gingko Biloba and St. John's Wort. Neither of them gave me the concentration of the Focus Max.Like I stated above, I received a bottle of the Focus max in exchange for an honest review and bottom line is I would recommend these to anyone who wants to add focus without jitters.

I have had a digital read thermometer since they first came out. They are so much more user-friendly than the old style mercury thermometers I grew up with. When VIVE Health wanted to send me their thermometer in exchange for an honest review, I couldn't help but give them a try.Just like every other product from VIVE, I was very pleased. Yes, it is only a digital thermometer, but they add just the right details to make them a step above. Some of those upgraded details follow:For one, the size of the display is perfect. I already have to use OTC "readers" in order to see most print. Except for this thermometer, that is. The numbers are large enough to ready easily. When a loved one is sick, you want this information now. Not after trying to decipher tiny numbers.Another plus, the tip is bendable. Not a lot, they only recommend no more than a 45 degree angle, but that is more than enough to make this thermometer feel so much more comfortable in your mouth.When you use a thermometer, you typically use it only once every 30 minutes. What you are looking for is an up or down trend in temps. I tend to forget, unless I write it down. With this one, when you turn it on, it automatically tells you the last temp reading. Nice! And after 30 seconds, it automatically shuts itself off.I tested it's accuracy against another brand of digital read thermometer and also a store brand. All of them read within 1 degree of each other. As far as I'm concerned, that is close enough. If I think either myself or a loved one is that sick, especially with a fever, I err on the side of safety anyway and get to the hospital when it gets up there.You know how fussy kids can be, especially when they are feeling ill. This reads temps in only 8 seconds. You get confirmation by a series of 5 beeps, telling you it's ready.Lastly, it's waterproof. I mean, duh. You know you need to keep this thing clean, right? I don't want to only clan the tip, I want the entire thing sanitized. Bingo. Here ya go. I saturate it with alcohol and wipe it dry. Done.This is now my go-to thermometer. Pretty obvious why. Like I stated above, I received this product in exchange for an honest review, so here's my honest opinion: I would recommend this thermometer to anyone.

If you have a barbecue "chef" in your circle, this would make a great Christmas gift! I received one of these in exchange for an honest review, and this one really impressed me.You get everything you need in one nice box. The fork actually comes in two separate pieces. The forks snap onto the handle, and are easily removed by a push of the button. This makes is super easy to make sure the forks are clean, since this end can be thrown in the dishwasher. I've used these at least 6 times over the last couple of weeks and each time the end was thrown in the dishwasher. No problems with reading temps or temps being "off" after washing.I compared this thermometer against another brand of probe thermometer. Both readings came out within one degree of each other, which is good enough for me.The handle fits nicely in your hand, even if they are small like mine. It would have ben nice if it was a little more "slip resistant" when your hands have BBQ sauce on them, but it's not a deal breaker. The smooth surface actually makes it easier to wipe down with a damp cloth to clean it. No dishwashing this end!The handle not only has the built in thermometer, but it also has a timer. I use the timer as a reminder to "check the grill". I have a tendency to get side-tracked while grilling. Next thing I know, the food's on fire. This way, I set the timer for 3 minutes. when it goes off, I go check the grill. Easy.and right on the end of the handle is a metal loop just for hanging.The only "issue" I had, which really isn't, was that you don't have the ability to shut off the display when you are done. It has an automatic shutoff after a few minutes, but I would rather have the ability myself.

Now here is a nice, lightweight kitchen scale. The top is made of smooth glass, making it easy to clean up spills. The size is a little large, but having the bigger footprint makes it easier to use all of my different sized bowls/containers. It measures 6.5" wide, 8" tall and 3/4" deep, so you can see you have plenty of space to use even large bowls.In the box you get the scale and two AAA batteries. Nice touch to get the batteries needed! The instructions are printed right on the back of the box and easy to follow.Super easy and intuitive, you really don't need any directions. If you have had any scales in the past, this is really no different. You have the ability to tare using any container  by simply placing it in the center of the scale and pressing the power-zero button.  The display will read 0:00. Once you add your first ingredient to the bowl, you can simply press power/zero again and it will tare with the new weight. Now you can add the next ingredient, knowing you got the weight perfectly. When baking, I've learned that I always have to use a scale, and after using this one, I found the results were just as good as if I had used my other scales.The scale has 4 weight displays. Each press of the unit button takes you through them: pounds:ounces, fluid ounces, grams and milliliters. The max weight is way more than I personally need. It will hold up to 11 pounds, and I can't imagine trying to weigh anything in my kitchen that weighs that much. A giant prime rib maybe. Or turkey.When you are done, just press and hold the power button for a couple seconds and the display goes out.You need to make sure you place your item in the CENTER of the scale. Just like any other scale, this will read "off" if you just put the item on a corner. I compared this scale to one I had already owned, and the measurements were exact. When I placed a true 1 ounce weight on the scale, it read 1 ounce.I received this scale in exchange for an honest and unbiased opinion. Honestly, it is just as good as my more expensive model. The measurements are right on and it is really easy to use. I would recommend this scale to anyone.

Exactly what they said it was. A giant bag of Nestle Toll House Semi-Sweet Morsels. The bag comes with a pinch-seal type closure so you can keep it fresh without having to put it in another container. There were no clumps of melted-together morsels, nor were there any "white" morsels. These all looked like high-quality Nestle choco-chips just like you find in the store.

I really love the large print edition! The 12 point print makes it so much easier for me to read. I normally read with OTC reading glasses (+1.5). The larger print makes it easier for me to look up passages without looking for my "readers" first.This is a hefty Bible. Coming in at 2.8 pounds, this isn't a lightweight. At 6.5" x 9.5", it is just smaller than standard paper at 8.5 x 11".  It is almost 2 inches thick. With small hands, it takes a bit to maneuver this around. I do better using it on my lap/laptable, laying it out flat, which it does nicely. Open it up to the Book of Genesis 1:1, and it will lay flat without having to hold it open. This makes it a great resource for Bible study, since you can leave it open to any page and it will stay there!My only complaint is the thinness of the paper. It is almost see-through. You can see the print on the back side, but to me it does not interfere with the reading. I understand why they need the paper so thin. If the paper were any thicker, this thing would weigh over 3 pounds, if you could put both the Old and New Testament in one volume! The thin paper makes it hard to add notes/highlights/etc. without affecting the other side of the paper. I keep my notes to pencil only, and not a sharp point!

I recently discovered that the best probiotics for me actually help treat my CIC (Chronic Idiopathic Constipation). This is one of them. When taking these for the last 20 or so days, I have had very little problem with my CIC.Before I tried these, I stopped taking my other probiotic for a couple of days. Not sure if it does any good, but I thought I would try to get a "fresh start" on these in order to really see that they are working. I started taking them following their 2 pill-per-day intense support method for the first 5 days. Then after I realized they were working just fine, I switched to the daily maintenance and took only 1 pill per day. Whether taking 1 or 2 pills made no difference to me, both methods seemed to have relieved a lot of my CIC symptoms. I had no problems with upset stomach, bloating, gas, or any other issue that may have been brought on by the probiotics.The only reason for the loss of one star is the pills themselves. I have trouble taking pills. These are a "grainy" tablet. There is a reason for the graininess. These are made so " When our tablets are moistened by fluids in the stomach, a patented gel matrix forms, creating a protective layer that shields the beneficial bacteria from stomach acids and directs them to release later in their journey. " (I just used their words since they explain it so well.) Makes them work great, but just makes them a bit hard for me to swallow.I was provided a sample of the LoveBug Here's the Skinny Probiotic in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. Bottom line:  I really do like these since they work on my CIC.

I'm going to come right out and just say these are every bit as good as my Fiskars that are an almost identical match to these shears by Gardenite. When you first feel these you know that you are getting a high-quality product. They feel heavy-duty. I've been using this for about 2 weeks on my flowers, vines and roses. It's fall and I'm doing tons of cutting. These shears have held up every day. They are just as sharp as the day they arrived. The tip comes down to a perfect point. You can do some serious detailing with these, even though they are so heavy-duty.The rubber grips work great. Whether I had gloves on or just barehanded, the shears always felt solid in my hand. Not like they were going to slip out of my grip. After a couple weeks of use, the rubber still looks brand new.The "lock" is easily released. After getting used to the feel of these in my hand, I could use it one handed.While trying these out,  I had to cut some 1/2" vines (they only recommend up to 5/16"). Typically I wouldn't have tried this since my Fiskars are more expensive than these. Even after cutting 2-3 heavy vines, the shears did not "spring". You know, when you overdo it and then they never cut straight again? I've ruined more than my share of shears doing that, but these held up. I would not recommend doing it, but I had to give it a try. I now know that if I stick to just the recommended 5/16" stuff these are going to last for years.I use alcohol to clean my shears after using them to remove any contaminants that I might spread through the garden. They shined right up and still look new. A couple drops of oil and they are good for the year.I received a set of these Gardenite Ultra Snip 6.7" shears in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I honestly feel you will be impressed by the quality of these shears. And I would put them up against my Fiskars any day.

I was able to hook this up to my Canon T1i in seconds. The 3 foot cable is heavier than I thought it would be. I was expecting a light, flimsy cable that you would be afraid to bend, especially for the price difference between the actual Canon shutter release and this one by Neewer. Not so. The connections are also solid built. It feels like you can really use this cable without worrying that it will break at connection points.Once connected, press halfway (you can feel it) and the camera will focus, displaying exposures, etc. just as if you had done a half-press on the camera itself. Press the rest of the way and you got your shot. If you have it set for continuous shots, pressing on the button will just keep the camera firing away. I was able to use this for some lunar eclipse shots and it worked flawlessly, just as expected. I set the camera for bulb and used the "lock" on the shutter release to capture photos with no shake or vibration whatsoever.I've used this probably 40 to 50 times and it still is working perfectly.

I'm 50 years old, 5' 6", 130 pounds, 36C. I received the large size and it fits beautifully. The girls are flattened out against my chest, with just a bit of separation. They might be flattened out, but the bra is still comfortable!The Spandex does a great job of holding the girls in place for light aerobics or just wearing around the house.The stitching is all well done. You would expect to pay a lot more for a bra of this quality.The moisture wicking, although I'm not sure of why, works like a champ. Sure, you'll still sweat and it will get wet, but not "soggy".I know you aren't supposed to dry this in the dryer, but I did anyway, on high setting, just to see what would happen. Nothing. The bra still fit as well as before and was just as comfortable. I'm not going to make a habit out of doing that, I just know that eventually those kinds of "accidents" happen where stuff like bras get unknowingly tossed in the dryer.  I'm really glad it came out ok!After wearing this for a few workouts and just lounging around the house, I didn't have any chafing, no itching, no binding, etc. Also, the bottom of the bra does not roll up, like some others do. The band is just wide enough to keep it from rolling, but not as if you have a thick belt wrapped around your chest.I have to disclose that I received this bra in exchange for an honest review. My reviews reflect what I really feel about the product. Just like you, I rely on reviews for all of my purchases, so I'm not going to be giving you bogus info just because I got this for testing purposes.

Just like every other piece of jewelry I have received from Orrous & Co, this one is set to impress! I received a set of these beautiful butterfly earrings in exchange for an honest review. And, as usual, I can't help but give it 5 stars! Here's why:Unless you really know your stones, I can't tell these are CZ. Even when someone would really look at them, they couldn't tell either. They would just ooooh and ahhhhh, then ask if they were real.They are perfectly sized to fool everyone into thinking it could be real diamonds. The stones are not so large that they look like they cost as much as a house! The 40 stones are well defined and stand out. These are more than just "chips".The earrings sit perfectly on your ear. No drooping or pulling.The shape/design of the earrings allows the maximum amount of light behind the stones, making them shine and prism just like real diamonds.The stones are not on some cheap or flimsy setting. The setting is heavy enough to hold the stones securely without being overly large. The setting does not detract from the look of these earrings at all. The 18K white gold actually helps with the shine. The backs hold the earrings in place securely and I never felt like they were going to fall out.These are sized and styled perfectly for either a night on the town or just a casual coffee chat. They go as well with jeans as they do with the little black dress. They measure about 1/2" wide x 1/2" tall, so you can see that they aren't large and "gaudy".The perfect gift for anyone who loves jewelry. Even the box is nicely done. The only markings on the black velvet covered box is on the inside. The Orrous logo stands out and makes the presentation even nicer.The price. When reviewing these, the price is only 16.99. They look like you spent way more than that!  Christmas is only a couple months away...

I must admit that when I first received this item I was skeptical about how well it was going to actually work. It really isn't all that big in size and is just plain white. I pulled out the instructions, filled the tank with water (using the included measuring cup), added some lavender essential oil and plugged it in. One press of the light switch and the colored light show began. One press on the diffuser switch and the mist started shooting out. Instantly I could smell the lavender! I'm impressed!I have used other diffusers before and this is by far the smallest I have seen. Being all white, it just disappears into my dcor, only coming into view if I set the diffuser for the lightshow. You can set it for one color only, or have it rotate through the colors. I leave it on the changing colors. Watching them fade in and out is soothing in itself. You can also turn off the light if needed.You can also set the diffuser itself. One press turns on a green light which will shut off the diffuser after 3 hours. This is the setting I use. Built in safety feature in my opinion. When you start with the max water, there is still enough liquid in the bottom of the tank after 3 hours that you don't have to worry about it running dry. I just make sure to fill it before I turn it on. One more press of the button and the green light turns red. This is continuous mode. I haven't tried it yet, but I think if you left it here it may run the tank dry. The vague instructions make it sound like it will shut off if it runs dry but I cannot confirm that.Another "safety" feature is the bottom-heavy build to avoid tip-overs. The tank, even when filled to the "Max" line, has more than enough volume to contain the liquid if it is bumped or tilted  when taking the top off.This has an amazingly cool mist. You can put your hand right in the mist and barely feel it. I've used it now for at least a week in the same location and I don't see or feel any "residue" from the droplets. If you are concerned about setting it on a piece of furniture, then you might want to just place a small towel in front of the unit while it is on. Another tip would be to angle the nozzle so it is aimed over the edge. That way the mist is directed away from the furniture.A bonus in my situation is that the room I put this in has numerous tillandsias or "air plants". since firing this off, I've seen quite a jump in growth. I live in an area of typically low humidity, so the plants are really loving it too!I received this diffuser in exchange for an honest review. I really loved this diffuser.

I have had a rotator cuff injury going on 6 months now. There's no chance of surgery in my future, so I'm going to need all the support I can get to make sure I don't do any more damage. Here's the stuff to do it: Physix Gear Sport Kinesiology Tape. I received a sample of their ktape in exchange for an honest review.Over the last 6 months, I've tried a lot of different ktapes. I can tell you that this is just as effective as the popular brands out there. I received the same amount of support as the other, more expensive brands. The adhesive is just as strong. It never gave an inch even after a hard days work. No rolling up on the ends, either. There was just a tiny bit of fraying, but that could have been the dull scissors I was using to cut it with.  My advice: save yourself some money and try this stuff.Plus#1: You get an eBook loaded with ways to use this stuff. If you are hesitant about trying it because you aren't sure how to use it, then try this one. This book is more than adequate at teaching you how to do it correctly. I realize there is some skill to this, but hey, I don't consider this rocket science. I tried their way of taping vs. mine. Results: Same-same. I get just as much support. However, their method was easier so I'm switching.Plus#2: You get a set of resistance bands AND the eBook manual on how to use them. Again, if you are a rookie at this, this book will serve you very well. The shoulder exercises mentioned in the book were very similar to what I had been doing during physical therapy, working the same muscle groups.With the quality of the ktape, and all the bonus materials, at a good price, I don't see how you could lose.

Now here is a really nice and light cleanser! I received a sample of the OZ Naturals Facial Cleanser in exchange for my honest review. I must say that I love this just as much as their other products!I have been using this for a couple weeks and my face loves this stuff! I have had no breakouts, reddening, drying, nothing. Just clean, fresh skin. The addition of the Vitamin E and Rose Hip Oil only leave your skin feeling smooth, not greasy or oily like you would assume. Even in my "T Zone", it didn't feel greasy.I don't like cleansers that really foam up. I mean, to me, if it makes big foam, then I'm only getting part of the cleaning properties on my face. The rest of it is just fluff. Not with this. You get  beautiful, tiny, bubbles. You only need a tiny bit, about a large pea-sized amount, and you will get your face squeaky clean in no time.Along with those tiny bubbles comes another great benefit; this stuff rinses off amazingly easy! I wash my face at the sink, like I'm sure a lot of you do. When you have a face load of foam, it seems like it takes forever to get it rinsed off. This rinses off so easily you can end up "over rinsing"!Another plus is no alcohol. Duh. Why irritate your skin while cleansing?Chalk up another winner in the OZ Naturals line of products!

We all know that we need to cut back on our meat consumption with Meatless Mondays, Dairyless Days, etc. but then how do you get the necessary Omegas? Bring on the CLA's!I was given a sample of the Viva Labs Extra Strength CLA in exchange for an honest review and I love these!First reason why I love them: NO BAD BURPS! I take a fish oil capsule as well, and you know how lovely those are. Well most of the CLA supplements out there have a really nasty afterburp to them just like the fish oil. It's not fishy, it's just gross. These don't have the burps! Even on an empty stomach (I know, I'm pushing my luck trying it), it still didn't haunt me later.Second reason: No GMO's. The jury is still out, as far as I'm concerned, as to whether or not GMO's are unhealthy. Why be the guinea pig? Choose products without GMO's.My only complaint, as usual with "oil" supplements, these are big. I have a little bit of trouble swallowing these, but the burpless evenings make it worthwhile!

You know what I love about these? The price. This is the real deal, Hershey's chocolate, at such an amazing price. I have never found a better price for this high quality semi-sweet choco chips. If you find a better price, please leave me a comment!

I have CIC. Chronic Idiopathic Constipation. This just means they can find absolutely no reason for me to have constipation, yet I still do. I have taken probiotics for years, but I just didn't correlate them with my CIC. I have sampled a number of different probiotics over the years and recently noticed that the ones I gravitate back to are the ones that give me the most relief from my CIC. Now I have a reliable test. If they work on my CIC, then they are perfect for me. Viva Labs evidently hit it right on the head with their combination of probiotics because these are working dandy! If you suffer from CIC, give these a try. Maybe this is all you need.I was provided a sample of these probiotics in exchange for an honest review, and I am oh so glad they did!!

Now here is a nice bright light you don't have to worry about getting wet! I received one of these LED diving lights in exchange for an honest review.Here's what you get: 1 flashlight, exactly as shown in the description, 1 18650 battery and charger, 1 sleeve for the 18650 battery to fit into (more on that later), 1 adapter for holding 3 AAA batteries (if you don't want to use the 18650), one Velcro strap (for attaching to yourself or other objects while diving), and a wrist lanyard. All of that comes in a really nice snap lock case made of hard plastic with some foam rubber "egg carton" style padding inside. The case will hold all of the items, plus extra batteries, your car keys... A few other odds and ends that you might want to keep secure.First off I charged the 18650 battery. You get a unique charger with folding prongs. The battery is held in place by a spring loaded bar, then you flip out the electrical plug. The entire unit sits on the wall, with a red light letting you know it's charging.  Charging takes about 2 hours for the initial charge, and the light will turn green on the charging unit. To insert the battery into the flashlight, you must first insert the opaque plastic sleeve that is included. Then the battery sits inside securely. If you don't want to use the 18650 battery, then just fill the AAA adapter with 3 batteries and slide it in. Minus the sleeve adapter, obviously.The flashlight end cap is also the on/off switch. With the battery in place, you simply screw the cap onto the flashlight. The flashlight will come on when you come to the last quarter turn or so of tightening. When the cap is completely tightened, the flashlight is on. A quick counterclockwise turn and the light is off. Don't worry. Even when the flashlight is off and the end cap is not seated all the way, it will still not leak. the light has 3 O-rings placed onto the threads in order to keep any water out of the inside. I don't mind this set-up, but I would rather have a manual switch instead of the twist-on style. One of the reasons for the 4 stars instead of 5. It takes both hands to turn this on.The light is super bright! If you have had any experience with flashlights that use the 18650 batteries, you already know the difference between your typical AA battery flashlight brightness and these. AAA's are only 1.5 volt, 18650's are 4.2. More power per battery. That said, 3 AAA's will pump out 4.5. But for some reason the 18650 just looks brighter. Not an electrical wizard so I can't explain it.My other reason for 4 star instead of 5: it doesn't float. Without the battery in it, yes, it does float. But add that extra weight of the batteries and down it goes. This would have made a great tackle box flashlight, if it floated.

If you have a someone in your life who is a lover of motorcycles or bicycles, here's a perfect gift!I received one of these in exchange for an honest review, and my son is going to love this! He is into BMX biking and loves to wear "heavy" jewelry. This bracelet is not some lightweight, thin, barely noticeable piece of jewelry. This is high shine, in your face, can't miss it! The length/width is just what they say, almost 9 inches by about 3/4 of an inch. So you can see you are getting a substantial piece. If the length is too long, be advised that I don't think you could shorten this at home. Maybe by a jeweler, or if you have some skills, but the pins holding the chain together don't appear to come out easily. Since it isn't an issue, I never pursued it any further.The clasp is one of the fold-over styles. It locks in very well, and the fold-over portion is just an added bit of security. It is easy to clasp and remove, but it has enough grip to not just "fall" open. In other words, you won't pop it open if you, say, put your hand in your pocket.You get the bracelet in a very nice black padded box. The bracelet is wrapped in plastic, keeping it smudge free.

After a rotator cuff injury, I need the extra support provided by kinesiology tape. Happy To Go offered to let me try their tape in exchange for an honest review, so I happily agreed!I have been using k-tape for a few months now, needing it for everything from mowing the lawn to washing the car. Any time I have any rigorous chores, I tape up my shoulder. The Happy to Go tape works just fine for me.I always apply any type of k-tape to clean, dry skin. No lotions, powders, sweat, you name it. I make sure the skin is prepped well in order for the tape to stick best. If you skip this step you may have different results with your tape.The tape comes in 2 rolls just as in the description, one black, one tan or "skin" colored. The rolls are cotton tape with an adhesive on one side covered by paper backing. The backing is the standard backing you see on most of the k-tape out there. The tape comes off of the rolls easily, and you can utilize the box as a dispenser. It also cuts easily with sharp scissors. The ends do not fray when you cut them. They stay solidly together, making it easier to apply. You get the correct amount of "stretch" in this tape. Pulling on this tape feels no different than other name brand (more expensive) tape.The adhesion is just right. I can easily wear this tape all day long without any troubles. One caveat, if your clothes drag across the tape for a long period of time (say, 2 hours worth of lawn mowing), you will get some fraying on the ends (reason for only 4 stars instead of 5), but I have never had it compromise it's effectiveness.I only wear the tape for one day at a time. I understand that you can wear it for longer periods, but I simply prefer to remove it at the end of the day. I can only speculate as to how long it will last since I didn't wear it for multiple days, but even after a day of roofing, the tape was still very "stuck" to me! After sweating all day long, it still took some pulling to get the tape off. I really think I could have left it on for at least another full day. I did try wearing it in the shower on a number of occasions and even then it did not lose any of it's adhesiveness.I would gladly purchase this kinesiology tape in the future. The price and the quality make it perfect for me to use without reservations. Like I stated above, I received a sample of their k-tape in exchange for an honest review. I honestly like this stuff.

Any extra storage ideas make me sit up and take notice. When Attmu offered to send me one of their over the door shoe organizers in exchange for an honest review, I jumped at it. I just wish it was a bit bigger.What you get is the shoe organizer and 3 separate hooks to use over a door or closet rod. The hooks are heavy enough to take the weight of the organizer fully loaded. I had no trouble sliding the hooks over the door and hanging the organizerThe quality of this organizer is ok. The stitching is adequate, but I'm afraid that after using this for a few weeks that I will end up ripping them out. The plastic used for the shoes slots is crystal clear, but made of thinner material. Again, with a lot of use I think you could rip those out as well. The grommets on the top are well mounted and easily fit over the tin hooks.This would be great for a kids' room because my shoes don't fit in the slots. I tried using this as a way to store extra slippers. I only have a size 8 1/2 shoe. I can only get one slipper in each slot, and only the back of the slipper. I cannot get them to go into the slots toe first, as they show in the description. Flip flops, even when smashed together, will not fit in one of the slots.If you were going to use this as simply extra storage, then this would be ok for a temporary fix. But if you need this for daily use, I think you would be better off looking elsewhere.

Just in time for some early Christmas shopping! This snowflake pendant will impress!I received one of these in exchange for an honest and unbiased review, but this is one I would purchase as a gift anyway!The pendant is just right, a bit over 1/2" in size. The pendant is held by a beautiful 16" chain with the "claw" style clasp. There is even the high style little (about 2 1/2" long) "tag" that rides on the back of your neck. As far as I'm concerned, unless you were some experienced jeweler, you can't tell the difference between these and the real deal. The Cubics are not so large as to be unbelievable, but not tiny, either. Just right to keep em all guessing! There is enough lift from the mount that light gets under the Cubics and really makes them shine. The spaces between the stones make it a versatile piece. For example, I wore this with a black turtleneck and the pendant really showed off the rainbow! The next time, I wore it over a red t-shirt (even casual dress it looks nice!) and it almost looked like there were rubies as well as the cubics!.It looked like I was wearing a different necklace altogether.The necklace is packaged in a sealed plastic pouch, and you also get a nice gift bag. Perfect for the upcoming holidays!

I've hit that age where dark circles are a fact of everyday life, not just after a night of revelry. OZ Naturals asked me to review their Eye Cream for Dark Circles and I am impressed!I have been using this for about 3 weeks now. I wish I could have taken some before and after photos, because there is a definite difference. The combination of ingredients must have hit the nail on the head! Not only that, but it leaves my skin so silky smooth! You aren't going to see results right away, however. I had to use this for more than a week before I noticed any real difference, so don't stop using it! My dark circles were pretty bad, if you know what I mean.When you get the tube, you will notice that it isn't very big. Don't worry. After 3 weeks of use, it still feels like I have a lot left in the tube. It really only takes a very small amount. Using too much, like I did at first, actually makes your face feel "tacky" for at least a half hour. I use one drop, about the size of a pea to do all of the area around my eyes. If I want to do my entire face, about 2 drops. When I say "drop" I don't mean to say this is runny. It is the perfect texture to easily smooth into your skin.I have had no breakouts, no rashes, no reddening, no side effects of any kind. I apply a sunscreen afterwards and don't have any weird "reactions" between them.Like I said above, I received this product in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I really do like this eye cream!

I love picnics. Any excuse to go outside to share a meal! This makes a perfect, leak proof, addition to the picnic basket!I was given one of these Bento boxes in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. I never knew they could be so handy!First off, you will notice that the big section is not "sandwich friendly". Unless you have odd sized bread or custom cut your sandwich, this really won't work for a sandwich container. I'm not looking for just another sandwich holder, I wanted something a little more substantial. This is perfect.This is not just a reusable container like you buy in multipacks at your grocery store. This is heavy duty 100% food grade BPA free plastic. There is nothing "thin" or flimsy about this product. It is very well made and built to last.Since I didn't have a picnic planned, I just put in some leftover chicken breasts in the large compartment, and then zucchini and cranberry sauce in the other 2 compartments. As if I was taking this to work.  The zucchini and cranberry sauce still had a bit of liquid in them, but there was no, repeat NO, leakage between the compartments! The silicone seal keeps all the foods inside their own little world, and the 4 large "clips" keep the lid on tight!Heating in the microwave is ok as long as you remove the lid as per instructions. 1300 watts and a couple minutes later I had a quick lunch. Right into the dishwasher with the whole thing. Ready to go the next morning.Along with your Bento box, you get access to download 2 free PDF books. The first one, "healthy cooking Tips" is a very informative book. Whether you have been eating healthy for years of if this is your first entry, you will find valuable information in it's 73 pages! The other book "Fun and Delicious Bento Box Ideas for Kid's Lunches", is 14 pages of tips for fun and unique ways to pack your box. You could easily get ideas for your spouse's lunch as well. One nice tip I picked up is to use lettuce leaves to divide up portions. I'm thinking deviled eggs here. Or you could use lettuce as a "liner" on the bottom and sides of the compartments. That way you can get every last portion of last night's taco salad out of the box, even without utensils!I can't wait until Lifemark Labs comes out with more sizes of these wonderful boxes!

I have been trying to find a larger sized wallet so I could put ALL of my cards in there. Not just credit cards, but those other pesky cards that get lost. Like my library card, or my AAA card. Now I have room for them all. I received this wallet in exchange for an honest review and I am so glad they picked me to review it!If you're like me, you love the feel of real leather. You will get your leather fix with this wallet! All of the stitching is solid. No skips or "skims" on the edges. The snaps on the front and inside and the zipper on the inside are all well attached. One thing I really liked about this wallet is that it has 2 areas for paper money. I like to keep larger bills hidden away from prying eyes in the checkout line, so now it looks like I only have a few dollars.Another bonus is that the interior snap keeps the rest of the wallet from falling open just because you need to get a couple bucks out of the bill slot. The snap keeps all your cards tucked away, again, from prying eyes. Saves you from having to refold the entire wallet every time you need some cash. And since we're talking prying eyes, they thoughtfully made the id window out of a dark mesh. You need to be up close to read what's behind there.Since I don't carry a lot of cards, I was able to put all those cards into this wallet. The card slots are all nicely "tight". You don't have to worry about your cards just falling out. You actually have to do a bit of tugging to get them out, which I like.  Behind the card/id area there are two handy slots.  I used one as a holder for an individually wrapped handy-wipe and an eyeglass cleaning wipe. Also, since I don't have an iPhone, I use the slot on the back of the wallet to hold my grocery list and coupons that I will need for that trip to the store. All of my cards and id, all of my cash (not like there's a lot), some coins, a handy-wipe and glasses wipe, and my grocery list and coupons all in one wallet. And I'm not straining to get it snapped! The two outer snaps give you the option of making the wallet tighter or looser, depending on how much stuff you want to stuff.This is a very versatile and high quality wallet. Well worth the price of $37.99 as of writing this review. This is now my everyday wallet. Thank you Winkine for such a wonderful product!

After moving into a different home, we noticed the toilets were "taller" than we had used in the past. They were brand new, but measured 16 1/2". That makes it pretty uncomfortable to sit on, given that I am only 5' 6". I thought my days of dangling my legs from the "potty" were over. They were until I bought one of these!I didn't want one of the "potty stools" that supposedly put you in the correct angle to "go". Those were too tall. I just wanted about 4 inches of height, and that's just what I got.This is a real solid unit. I was able to stand on the edge, hang-10 style, and it did not feel like it was going to tip over at all. I did not attach the non-skid surface, which comes separately in the box, since I knew I was going to put this in front of a toilet. No absorbent pads for me, thank you. I simply place the toilet rug on top of the step. Since it is all plastic, it is super easy to clean. I mainly use an all-purpose cleaner or Lysol to clean it and it still looks brand new.This makes for a perfect toilet step. The wide 20" platform allows you to sit naturally, rather than having your feet crammed together on a tiny stool.I just wish they made this in a toilet shaped version so it is more form fitting.This has some good non-skid feet, no worries about it skittering away when I step on it.

Stop spending money trying to find one of these that works right and lasts more than a year. Just get this one. I received a sample of their 4-way garden hose connector and promised them I would write a review giving you my honest opinions. I honestly love this.Right out of the box you can tell this is built to last. Nice and heavy. 8" wide, 5" tall, each outlet just a bit under 1" apart. Two of the hoses I have attached to this have the larger "easy grip" ends just like the inlet on the connector, and there is enough room between them for both to fit. This doesn't feel like it's made of junk metal. The threads are cut clean and are beefy. Not going to be easily stripping these. The on/off valves are big, just a bit over 1 1/2 inches long. Not huge, but way bigger than the little metal ones you typically see. They easily and smoothly turn 1/4 for off/on. The oversize fitting easily attaches either your hose or directly to your outside faucets/hose bibs. Makes a very handy and economical way to increase the usefulness of that one simple faucet!  I attached mine directly to the faucet and then attached a hose to each one. Now I have 2 hoses for lawn watering, 1 hose for a garden sprayer which I also have from Coolife, and 1 short hose for bucket filling rinsing off, etc. right at the faucet. Even with all hoses running, or any combination in between, there were no leaks. None. This is obviously the first season of use, so if there are any changes I'll update as needed.

For a great, inexpensive way to keep an extra set of these specialty batteries in the home, RV, hunting/fishing cabin, wherever, you can't go wrong here. I was provided a sample of these 18650 batteries in exchange for an honest review. This is my first experience with these types of batteries, and I am impressed.I must make it clear, these are NOT standard AA or AAA or C batteries. These are a 3.7 volt li-ion battery about 2 1/2" long. They are the same diameter as a Mini Mag flashlight, so you can see that these will only fit into certain products. I use these as spares for a CREE flashlight.You get everything they say in the above description: the charger with two batteries. The charger displays a red light underneath each charging port while it is charging. The light changes to green when it is done. The unit has over voltage, over current, and short circuit protections built in.After I initially charged these batteries, I swapped them out for the ones in my flashlight. they were just as powerful and the light was just as bright. I've had them in the flashlight for 3 weeks now and they still show no signs of dimming. I use the flashlight for at least 5-10 minutes almost every night, so it's not like they aren't getting used.This being my first experience with these styles of batteries, I must say that this one seems to be of excellent quality at an excellent price.

There have been so many advances in Bluetooth tech that I'm amazed at the speed and quality of what's available. These are no exception.  Vtin offered to send me a set of these ear buds in exchange for a review and I am very pleased with them!PROs:They don't fall out. You are going to spend quite a bit of time getting these to fit right. they are not your typical straight shot into the ear headphones. These have a "tilt' to them that, to me, is a step up. The headphones come with plenty of sized "adapters" to fit your ear. There will be one that fits. but you MUST take the time to adjust them. after using these for about a few weeks, I found that the easiest way to get them to fit correctly is to "turn" the ear bud either clockwise or counter-clockwise depending on the bud while inserting it into the ear. Picture yourself trying to "screw" the earbud into place with a half-turn.Sweat doesn't get into your ears. With the newer angle, sweat doesn't even seem to form around them.  After trail running for about an hour, my ears were still dry.They sound great. I am no audiophile, but I listen to everything from Diana Krall to Thousand Foot Krutch and all of it sounds just right. The bass is just a little bit light, but for the price of these, I'll take the lighter bass.Only a couple of buttons to navigate. I like having options, but not when it takes me weeks to figure out the right combos. You only have to worry about a couple of buttons, and they are pretty much intuitive.Long battery life. I'm not sure, but I think I've only charged these twice since getting them. Once when I initially got them, and once more about a week ago. I run about an hour a day, at least 5 days a week and they are still going strong. I never did kill the battery, I just figured it was time to charge. It took about an hour to get it back to full charge.CONs: Only this. The wraparound cord is a bit too long for us shorter folks. Just add a little stop slider to the package so I can shorten the cords to my liking.

I have been taking fish oil supplements for years. I think I finally found "the one".  Here's why:1. No fishy burps, aftertaste, reminders, etc. that you took a fish oil capsule. None. Ever. I have even taken these on an empty stomach with nothing but my morning coffee. Not the best idea, but it was time. I still had no fish breath.2. When you open the bottle, it smells like fresh fish. Not in a bad way. It smells like a fresh fish oil should smell.3. When you open the bottle, you also get a citrusy smell. They thoughtfully added a natural lemon/lime flavor to alleviate what bit of smell and/or flavor there may be.4. At 1370 mg of fish oil concentrate, I only need one a day.5. With all that fish oil concentrate tucked inside each capsule, they are big. Thankfully, they give you a capsule shell that doesn't immediately get stuck on your tongue or in your throat when you try swallowing them.6. All this high quality fish oil concentrate comes at a great price. You could go cheaper, but what are you getting?I received a bottle of this fish oil in exchange for an honest and unbiased review. All the opinions are completely mine.

You have no idea how much you need something until you have it. Then you wonder how you ever lived without it. Here's an example of one of those. They sent me one of these in exchange for a review and now I take it everywhere.I have a ton of water bottles. Where are they? Sitting in a cabinet in the pantry. They do me no good when I decide to take an impromptu hike through either the woods or the mall. Now I have a water bottle on hand and ready for adventure.Folded up, it measures about 4" x 4", so if you're like me, you have enough room in your purse/backpack/briefcase/book bag to easily carry one of these with you. Put one in the car, the rv, you get the idea.There is a handy silicone rubber band attached to the bottle to hold it neatly rolled up. A clip lets you attach it to your gear. The cap is heavy duty and seals completely. The outer cover snaps down and makes such a good seal that if you squeeze out the air as you roll this up, you can close the top cap and it will stay sealed. The drinking spout is generously large. You can get more than a trickle out of this thing! They also added a "screen" to the drink tip. It doesn't appear to be removable, if you don't like it, but I love it. I can put crushed ice in my bottle and it won't clog the tip anymore! It also filters out lemon seeds, lime bits, orange bits, whatever you flavor your water with these days. The fill hole is just about right. I can put ice cubes from my ice maker into it, but anything bigger might be an issue.The way this is shaped, you get all of the liquid out of the bottle. Plus, being able to squeeze it gives you enough pressure to spray someone nearby, or rinse off your hands, etc.I have never put this in the dishwasher, although they claim it is dishwasher safe. It is so easy to clean in the sink, I just haven't tried it. Knowing that it is silicone makes me confident that it is safe.

This has so many uses, I hate to just call it a blanket. Gecko active offered to let me try one of their parasheet picnic/beach blankets in exchange for a review, so I tried it, and I love it!Not having a chance to go camping, I just threw this in the backyard and we had a barbecue picnic. This is not heavy, but don't think that lightweight means poor quality. This is just like the material used for parachutes, so you can imagine its' strength. The stitching is all very well done. Pulling on seams didn't create the gaping hole that you get with inferior products. This thing is big: 6.5' x 7'. Spreading it out on the ground, it easily accommodated all of our picnic supplies.The corners have large pockets for filling with sand, but I just filled it with a few heavy stones so the wind didn't move it. There are also large elastic "rings" sewn into the corners. You could also use tent stakes or even sticks to hold the corners in place. Those rings also allow you to hook the corners onto trees, brush, tent poles, hiking sticks, you name it, so you have an instant sun shade. It is big enough to be able to use half for sitting on and the other half to make into the sun screen. With the snaps on the sides, you can even convert this into a tube tent. With two of these you could open up a world of possibilities! I don't own a pickup, but if you have one, these would make a great way to have a handy bed cover on hand.Spilling a lemonade on it didn't ruin the fun. The liquid was easily absorbed with a paper towel and the blanket dried in less than a minute in the sun. After the picnic, all the little crumbs and other food particles just fell off when we gave it a good shake. Also, all the grass and other debris from the bottom fell off as well. This is a major step up from using actual "beach blankets" which stay wet and hold dirt just as well. It was easy to fold up and stuff back in the bag, and you don't have to refold it the same way (like a map) in order for it to fit.Stuffing it all back in the bag left me with a little pillow measuring about 5" x 8", definitely small enough to throw in your car, RV, camping gear, etc.

These have everything I want in an ear bud: great fit, great sound, tangle-free wires, great price.Fit: they are finally making ear buds "ear friendly". Somebody must have figured out that our ear canals don't go straight in, they are angled towards the face. Now they make ear buds that fit the way we are made. This makes for a comfortable wearing ear bud, even on long runs. No more sweat running into my ears. The fit "adjusters" that hold the bud in the ear are semi-soft but pliable. The way they hook into the ear is almost imperceptible. Getting these to fit right takes a little bit of time, but it is well worth it. The best way I have found to insert these is to rotate the ear buds towards the back of the head, insert into the ear canal, then rotate forward till they "seat" themselves in your ear. I know that doesn't make much sense, but it's the way I do it. Trail running, mowing the lawn, doesn't matter. These babies stay right where they are supposed to be. And, like I said above, they have tangle-free flat style wires. I hate tangled ear buds.Sound: I'm not going to go into the difference between these and expensive brands such as Bose. These are not. But I don't care. They sound just fine to me. Plenty of bass, and no tinny "highs". They are very noise cancelling, even when used while mowing. The only small complaint I have is during phone calls. Callers tell me I sound like I am far away from the mic, and I have to raise my voice a little to be heard. I don't use these much for phone calls, so dealing with that is not an issue. Just keep it in mind if you are going to take a lot of phone calls using these. calls sound crystal clear on my end.Pairing was a breeze. My LG Lucky picked it up and connected in seconds. No drops, even when I walked 20 feet away. Also paired it to a Kyocera Hydro XTRM with no problems.The price is right on. You can spend a ton more on a set of Bluetooth ear buds, but I just have to ask why? I use these for running, about an hour a day. My concentration is more on my running than the music anyway. They sound good and they don't break the bank.  Win-win.My complaints. Yes, I still love them, but I have just a few measly issues. I wish they came with a case. Something to keep them in when I'm not running. I wish they had a "slip ring" on the wires. Some way to take up the extra slack. Like the old chums I have on my sunglasses. I wish they lasted more than a week between charges. It doesn't take long to charge them, only about 2 hours. But they only last about 4-5 days on a charge. In their defense, though, I can keep track of the battery level of the ear buds with my phone so I never leave the house with a dead set.I received a pair of these ear buds in exchange for an honest review.

Here is a great way to introduce yourself to the portability of the sun! I was offered one of these in exchange for an honest, unbiased review. I couldn't be happier!My first intro to solar powered anything was a unit that was designed to keep RV batteries charged while camping. Heavy, awkward, prone to breaking, and flat out did not work unless it was lined up just right to the sun. Forget that. Right out of the box you will notice that they are serious about their stuff. Well built, heavy stitching, heavy covering... You can see that this is built to be used and to last. I had a Kyocera Hydro XTRM that was at 30% battery so outside we went. I set it up directly in the sun, obviously, to get the best results. It unfolds easy and it is so user friendly you don't need instructions. The 2 USB connectors are on heavy duty cables that just clear the top of the handy storage bag, making them easy to get at and manipulate. Plugging in my charger cable to the phone, I was able to put the phone and all back into the storage pocket. That really helps to keep your phone cool!  The phone was off when I started and after losing track of time, I finally went back after 2 hours and the phone was fully charged. I can imagine hanging out in camp, charging up my phone while I take care of camp business. I also tried it with my LG Lucky at 50% charge on a mostly cloudy day. It took about 4 hours to charge, but it still charged up.Folded up, this measures about 7.5" x 10". Unfolded it is 31.5". It weighs in around 2.5 pounds. They even thoughtfully placed some heavy duty grommets in the corners and 4 small D-ring style clips in order to hang it to get the best sunlight.

I need a supplement that will help me recover from my trail running workouts. I found it. I am 49 years old and have beat my body practically to death. But I just can't seem to stop the running bug so my achy, sore muscles need some relief. When PCNL offered me a bottle of their L-Glutamine in exchange for an honest review, I couldn't say no.I started by taking 2 capsules when I first got up in the morning on an empty stomach, then 2 more after my workout later in the day. I had no stomach upset or any other side effects.If you work out and push yourself like I do, then you understand what it means when I say that sometimes I get so sore that I can hardly get up out of my recliner. Just going from my chair to the kitchen is a workout in itself. After taking these for about a month, I can honestly say that my soreness is significantly less. I have been taking this along with PCNL's L Arginine. Muscle recovery is one of the benefits of L-Glutamine, and they are not wrong. Even running the next day wasn't as bad. Normally it takes me at least a mile to warm up when I'm sore, but within a couple hundred yards I was relaxing into my run.Of course, when your muscles don't hurt so much you are able to do more. When you do more, you see physical increases and improvements sooner. While taking the L-glutamine, I turned in some of my best times ever since I was able to concentrate on running and not on hurting. Not only that, I lost some weight without even trying. I can only imagine that if I had noticed that little benefit sooner I would have lost even more!Along with your L-glutamine, you get a free e-book that explains the basics of the supplement and why you need it. It is easy to read, no PhD. required.

I am a darn-near 50 year old woman who loves to trail run long distances. So I guess it's needless to say that I get sore, achy muscles from discovering challenging new trails. When PCNL offered me a chance to try their L-Arginine in exchange for an honest, unbiased review, I had to give it a shot.There are a lot of supplements that say they will give you relief from your workouts, but this one comes through. If you are into any kind of exercise, then you know how your body feels after a hard session. In my case, all of a sudden standing up, sitting down, and squatting become enemies. I started taking the L-Arginine along with PCNL's L-Glutamine. Now I won't tell you that the "morning after" aches were completely gone. There were still some reminders of a rigorous workout. But I didn't have the "can't get up out of the chair" experiences like I've had in the past.Not only that, but when it was time to go for my daily run, it didn't take me a mile to get warmed up. Within the first couple hundred yards I was already relaxing into my run. When I hit that first hill, it wasn't as daunting. My lungs didn't feel like they were going to explode by the time I got to the top (1 mile, all uphill). In fact, I turned in some of my best times this year!Another bonus was a bit of weight loss. I started out about 10 pounds over my ideal weight. I haven't been really trying to lose the weight, and I wasn't. I had been hovering at the same weight for about 2 months. The month I took the L-Arginine, I averaged a half pound a week loss, without trying at all. My diet and exercise routine stayed the same. Maybe if I had noticed sooner, I could have shed a bit more by actually working at it.PCNL also offers a free e-book covering the basics of L-Arginine. Excellent read. You don't need a doctorate to be able to understand what this supplement is all about and how to best utilize it.*edit* Forgot to mention my daily intake of the L-Arginine. I'm 5' 6", weigh 127 pounds (now!) and I was taking 2 capsules about 30 minutes before breakfast and lunch. I work out about an hour after a light lunch high in protein.

You had me at shiny! This is a very unique design in a chain style necklace. Each link is 1/2" long, with a beveled cut that makes it look almost "twisted". Just because it says it is a men's necklace, don't think that us women can't wear it too!The lobster claw clasp is strong, as well as the rings holding it to the necklace. If your man has a rugged streak in him,  this should stand up to his adventures!The shape appears to have sharp points, but there are none. You can run this necklace through your hands or slide it back and forth on your neck and you won't get "sawed". And the nice thing about titanium: it weighs less. You get a beefy looking necklace, without the weight.The price: wow. For a necklace this nice, you would spend a bit more! Quite a bit actually. No tarnish, no polishing, heavy-weight...  You can find cheap knock-offs for about 20 bucks in the big box stores, but they're not going to last nor maintain a shine like this does.You get a really nice necklace, packaged in an upscale black box with a felt padded liner. Excellent for a gift.*I received one of these necklaces in exchange for a review*

Now this is a really nice way to step-up your shopping trips! I received one of these backpacks in exchange for a review. They were kind enough to send it so when it arrived we went shopping!When it arrived, your first impression is that this is a very expensive bag. Well wrapped, it comes in a protective fabric sleeve like you see the high-end bags in.The faux leather material is butter-smooth! Unless you are really into leather, at a distance, this looks like the real thing. The feel of it would only confirm someone's suspicion that this must really be leather. the stitching is well done and heavy duty. the only thing keeping me from really loading this up is the straps. They are adequate and look really nice with the bag, but they are a little thin. I'm 5' 6" and the straps adjusted to a perfect size for me, with plenty to spare if you are either shorter or taller.The front pocket has a magnetic button closure. The straps on the front could be used to hold a jacket or other item, but they are there mainly for decoration.  The main pocket zipper is plastic, but so far it has held up to a week of use. The two big pull-tabs on the zippers make it real easy to open and close. There is a 6"x6" zippered pocket inside the main compartment, as well as 2 open topped pockets for keys, etc. The bottom of the bag is about 4" thick, so you can imagine the amount of stuff you can put in here. Yes, you could put a tablet or a smaller laptop/notebook (my Dell Venue 8 Pro was swallowed up by this thing), so it could also be for back-to-school as well. The entire interior is well lined, and pulling at the edges, I could not get the fabric to tear as you see in so many cheap bags where the liner starts to tear away as soon as you load the purse.I like my bags to stand up on their own when they're loaded, and with the wider bottom, this one will stand up just fine, as long as you load it correctly. I didn't use it as a book bag, so I'm not sure if it would stand up with books/notebooks/etc. inside. The addition of the handle on the top is also a big plus since I can just grab and go, and not fish around for the straps.The price of this bag is great! While shopping in-store, I found one similar that was $65, and it was faux leather as well. For an easy way to change up your everyday casual look, here ya go.

I received one of these scratching posts in exchange for an honest review.Do you have furniture? Do you have cats? It's a natural instinct and healthy for cats to scratch, so give them something you WANT them to scratch on and you will save your furniture! My cats were taught at a young age to scratch only on horizontal surfaces. We bought those cheap scratch pads and praised them every time they used it. So when I introduced this to them, they didn't really take to it at first. They are both adults (5 and 6 years old) and set in their ways! Then they slowly started to try out the scratcher. They don't use it much, but they do use it. They have not tried any other vertical surfaces so I guess the furniture is still safe!They loved the ball on top! The feel of the jute covering along with the rattle sound drove them crazy! And one of them loves to curl up around the base and nap on the soft fabric.This was super simple to put together. You simply need a screwdriver to attach the post to the base and it's done. and it doesn't look bad sitting in the living room, either.

I was provided one of these shower curtains in exchange for an honest review.Right on! What a beautiful shower curtain! I love the minimalist look to this. Just a nature silhouette. A very subtle way to "dominate" a room, I simply use this as the focal point. Everything else in the bath is either black or white to match. How simple and affordable!I would recommend hanging this with a shower liner. The curtain can then hang freely outside the tub. It is waterproof, but after a long shower it's effectiveness dissipates. This is NOT a plastic liner. It is a very smooth feeling polyester, almost like silk, so you know it won't shed water forever.The curtain fits a standard tub/shower. I have mine hung on one of the curved rods and there is plenty of coverage.The material, as I said, is a lightweight polyester with good stitching all the way around. The top is doubled over to make it double thickness for extra sturdiness. The metal grommets are large enough to accommodate any shower rings. You get a set of plastic ones included, which would make this a great housewarming gift as it would be the full set. Nothing else for the recipient to buy. However, they are not that high quality, so I would recommend using others. My personal favorites are the ones with the metal rollers.The price is perfect. What a great way to redecorate on a budget!

My shoulder hurts. After an MRI, I have Grade 3 rotator cuff tear, grade 2 acromion. According to the doc, it's pretty serious. Yeah. I coulda told you that. So on to rehab. I was warned that it was going to be fairly painful, and it was. I was doing rehab for about a week, then I got an offer to try Nervia. It claims to help with "inflammation" so I gave it a try. I received a free bottle in exchange for an honest review.After 3 weeks of rehab, all my doc can say is "Wow". He is amazed at the speed of my recovery. In fact, he even said that if he hadn't seen the MRI he would not have believed that there could have been that much damage. I have full range of motion, albeit still with some discomfort. Was it the Nervia? I don't know. That was the only thing I added to my supplement regimen, and the only change to my diet. Now I KNOW that I am not HEALED.  What I think happened was that the Nervia was able to relieve a lot of the inflammation and allowed me to concentrate on rehab. Less inflammation, less pain. I am in no way a doctor of any kind, so this is just my own personal SWAG.I started with an initial dose of 6 softgels about 2 hours after lunch. Then I switched to 3 softgels  after lunch every day until they were gone. I just ran out so I don't have any comparison yet.I had no side effects. Could not actually tell I was taking them. The pills are large, but at least it is a softgel which don't seem to get stuck as often for me.

I received one of these Mini Food Choppers in exchange for an honest review.Chopped garlic? Not so much. I typically buy those pre-chopped garlic in jars. So why do I love this one? Jalapeno chopper! I make a lot of fresh salsa. 2-3 days a week. That means we have a lot of jalapenos to chop. It's way too time consuming to do by hand, and using a "blender" type chopper leaves me with everything from chunks to minced. Enter the mini food chopper.PROs:Solid build. I've been using this for a few weeks now and it looks brand new.Evenly chopped pieces. All of my jalapenos turned out the perfect size. None of them were smashed.Nice size food catcher. The little catch cup will hold one very large jalapeno. The cup slides out easily.Sharp blades. These are very, very sharp! It may look like a simple "toy" but it is not!Easy to clean. You see those little green pegs on the lid? You would think that this area would fill with food particles. And you would be right. But they already thought of that. The dark colored plate that lays just underneath those pegs is actually a cleaner. When you remove the black base, you remove all those little "bits" that were left stuck between the pegs.Removable blades. Again, this makes it so much easier to clean. I use an old toothbrush to clean in between the blades.Two styles of blades. A second set of blades makes mini "julienne" slices. I tried it with hard boiled eggs and herbs. The herbs get a little jammed up, but this is mainly for more solid foods.CONs:The extra blade holder is in a bad space. Not that they have any option for having it elsewhere on the chopper, but if you grab on to this with your fingers/thumb on the bottom, you can get cut. The extra blades go on the bottom of the unit and do not have any sort of cover. Those sharp blades don't need much pressure and you will be bleeding.Small and compact, easy to use and easy to clean. I see salsa in our future...

I received one of these rolls in exchange for an honest review.KISS. Keep It Simple, Silly. (OK, you know how it goes...) That's the idea here. How much simpler can it be?You get a roll filled with tiny beads not unlike a bean bag chair. You know right there that this will form fit to just about any position you need. Add on a little "rack" and you now have a place to prop your tablet. The material is heavy enough, but I think it would be better if it were a bit heavier. Yes, you would lose some of the flexibility, but for me that's ok.I have a Dell Venue 8 Pro. I have it in a protective case with a flip cover and it still fits fine.
