I can easily use the touch screen and the tablet stays right there. Nice and light, it doesn't feel heavy on your legs. And speaking of lightweight, you can throw this anywhere out of the way. Great for my RV.You are not limited to just using this on your lap. You can also set it on the counter or tabletop and use your tablet for movie night. You could throw this in the tent in the backyard with the kids and let them have scary movie night out side.Added bonus: Just like the pic in the description shows, you can feed your power cord through the roll. Not only does it get the cord out of your way, it also adds another layer of protection by "attaching" you tablet to the holder. The cord goes through a hole in the bottom of the holder then through the roll.Another bonus: Makes a great pillow or lumbar support for those times when you don't need to use a tablet.If you are tired of trying to make a pillow work right, and don't want one of those lap "desks" covering your lap, here's a great option. The only downside I see is that it is round. It has a tendency to roll  because of that. Just add some props and you're good to go.

I received one of these derma rollers in exchange for an honest review.I have seen these used on those makeover shows where they basically give someone a "spa day". What I learned was that the rolling of the tiny needles helps get moisturizers and other facial "nutrients" into the skin. Makes sense. The same way I make poke cake. I've read that it can increase absorption by up to 1000 times. Maybe that will get my expensive anti-wrinkle creams into the skin where it needs to be and not just sitting on top.They are also reported to be useful on wrinkles, fine lines, stretch marks,  and acne or other scars. The tiny needles supposedly stimulate the body to produce elastin and collagen. Those two give the plumping appearance, thus relieving you of your pesky lines and wrinkles.Here's what I've noticed so far:1. Super easy to use. Even with virtually no instructions, you get the idea that you roll this thing 4-5 times in every possible direction. How much more complicated do you want it?2. Easily add to your facial routine. This only takes me a minute or so to cover the spots I want on my face and neck. A couple more minutes and I'm done with the stretch marks.3. You don't need any pressure to use this. If you do, you will be sorry. Ouch.4. Expect to get a little bit of redness. You are, after all, poking your skin.5. It really does feel like your moisturizers are going in deeper. Like poke cake...6. You may also get some more burning from your creams. I did, but not so much as to make me stop using either product.As far as results, I haven't used this long enough to tell. I do know that it is so simple to do that I have already made it a regular part of my cleansing.It comes in a really neat case, great for packing. And it also has a cover over the head to keep the needles sharp. You could throw this in your overnight bag for sure. My only complaint is the instructions. As easy as it is to use, the first thing it says is "Do not re-use head." Are these for single use? It says to keep the microneedles clean and not to share, which also makes sense. But "do not re-use head" to me means that you can only use it once and then you have to either replace the head it or throw it away. I simply clean the roller with alcohol every time I use it, before and after.

This is so much nicer than using the old cassette player corded adapter! I have OLD cars. 1994 Ford Explorer for one. Old school cassette player so I just used one of those adapters that plugs into the headphone jack on your phone/whatever. Problem was, if you didn't fiddle around with the volumes on them, they would sound oh so terrible! AND you were limited by that cord running between your phone and the cassette player.PROs:I live in the sticks. I mean remote. If you get 5 miles away from the biggest town, you've got no reception. Even satellite is hindered here because of steep mountainous terrain. So no radio. Pick one of the frequencies on this thing. Any of them. They all work.No more cords dangling around just waiting to get snagged by the driver...  You get the picture.Plenty of ways to listen to music. If you can't get your phone to Bluetooth, or if you have a device that can't Bluetooth, then load a micro SD with WMA or mP3 songs.You can charge your phone using the USB port, so you don't lose the use of the lighter "port" for charging.You can use either your phone or the Jebsen to control music functions. You can skip ahead using the buttons on the adapter, as well as control the volume by turning the knob. Plus, using the Jebsen to skip tracks makes more safety sense since you shouldn't be messing with your phone while driving anyway. If they see you using a phone while driving around here, expect to get a ticket.Small enough to throw in the glove box, jockey box, or whatever you call them these days.Once paired, the unit quickly connects to your phone. Like it's sitting there waiting to connect...CONs:Maybe it was just me, but I had a hard time getting my phone (LG Lucky) to pair. the instructions didn't give me much help either. I'm not even sure what I did to get it to pair, but finally it paired.A little too big for my Ford. This fits great in my 1997 Saturn SW2. But if you are familiar with or own an old Explorer, you know how much room you get to jockey stuff around.  If you get it at just the right angle you can slide it all the way in so it makes a connection. Otherwise, you can't get the power. Not that this is a problem with the device, just my vehicle. It worked just fine once I could get juice to it.*I was provided one of these in exchange for an honest review.*

I received a set of these tent pegs in exchange for an honest review.You always need extra tent pegs. Period. I don't care if it's for a hike on the PCT or you're just setting up a portable awning/shelter in the back yard, you need these. Right now I have a couple of them doing long term duty in the garden holding up some gardening string for the green beans to grow onto. Why these?PROs:These are heavy duty aluminum. They are not plastic or those awful bendy-ones that come with most big-box store tent kits. These are up a notch. Yes, if you hit a rock while driving one of these into the ground, it will bend. It's not titanium folks. It's aluminum. You could probably pay a lot more to get one you could drive through granite, but hey, I just needed a few extra tent pegs for just in case. AND to replace those crappy plastic ones from the tent kit.Bright color makes them easier to see. I saw one stuck in the ground just before mowing over the top of it. If it had been dark colored, it would have been eaten by the mower.Long enough. If you have ever used tent pegs in a variety of soils, you know that there is not one peg out there that fits the bill for every type soil. These are a great length and perfect fit for medium/heavy soil. but not so long as to be cumbersome to throw in your pack.Lightweight. Again. It's aluminum. You can easily throw this in the RV for awnings as well as throw some in a backpack.The pull cords are a nice touch. Easier removal from that medium/hard soil. You need them since the little cord notches aren't the biggest. More on that later.Nice carry bag. They all fit inside. Easily. I'm used to getting the Rubik's Cube set of pegs that all fit neatly in a bag. If you can get them all lined up perfectly. Or else you get the bag that rips apart the second you try to fill it with the pegs. Not this one. This is a nice sturdy bag. The pegs won't be poking though very easy.CONs:The cord notches are too "rounded". They hold p-cord nicely, but if you were in a high wind or someone tripped over a cord, then I think the notch won't have the "bite" it needs to hold the string.No flat spot on top for your hand. Like everyone else, I always try to push the thing in the ground with my hand. 99% of the time it never works but I do it anyway. If you're like me, then you will notice that there is nothing to grab onto to push it into the ground. You almost HAVE to have a hammer, rock, etc. to get one of these in the ground. You will need one anyway so just go get the hammer.Nice pegs at a nice price. Cause you just really should have some of these around.

This is my 4th 1440 and I just can't stop getting them! I've been buying these for years. I don't destroy them, only the straps have ever worn out. I simply like the way they have flawlessly functioned year after year. I replace batteries and the occasional strap, but the watch itself is, dare I say, bulletproof. I only need a stopwatch that will give me lap times and boom, there you have it. I have small wrists (only about 6") and there are still holes left over.If you're into that sporty look, this is just as nice at the grocery store as it is on the trail. It's a Timex and it's a great price.

These were  perfect replacement batteries for my Dell Active stylus . Best price for these types of batteries. Expiration date of 12/2019. Use my stylus at least an hour a day and the new battery is showing no signs of lagging.

I received a set of these paracord bracelets in exchange for an honest review.This is a step up from all of those other bracelets. With those you get paracord. That's it. With this, you get at least some semblance of fire-starting ability and a nice, loud whistle.I couldn't confirm if the bracelet had the described 4 meters of paracord. I didn't feel like tearing it apart to measure it. All I know is it is large enough to go around my wrists, which are 7 inches. They are a little too large for just casual wearing, so I use one of them to hold my cell phone case onto my backpack.The plastic clips are heavy duty. The total size is about the size of a large digital watch, about 2" by 1". The whistle is loud! As any survival enthusiast can tell you, if you get lost and are yelling for help, your voice is going to give out on you long before your breath will. So why scream yourself hoarse when you can easily blow on a whistle and be heard?The firestarter is an awesome touch. Me, I carry a Bic lighter for survival. But say you lost it. Or you just didn't think to drop it in the pack this morning before your hike and it's now 30 degrees and you are wet and you need to get warmed up. This throws a good enough spark after you get the paint scraped off. You can either use the scraper while it's in the bracelet (nice way to make sure you don't accidentally fling it away in the dark), or slide it out. Either way makes a spark good enough to light a fire. If you know what you are doing. If the conditions are right and you have the right tinder. You get the idea.What a bargain. You find the less-bling versions in stores for the same price as what you pay for these. Sometimes even more expensive. If you want to give these style bracelets a try, here's a great way to do it.My only complaint (cause I just gotta have one) is that there should have been instructions on how to use the fire starter. I already know how to use these, but if you wanted to give this as a gift to a newbie survivalist or local scout, it would be cool if they could take it out and actually read how to start a fire.

I received a bottle of BRINutrition Fucoxanthin in exchange for an honest review.I am not a weight loss expert nor a supplement expert so if you want to find out about the health bennies of Fucoxanthin, just do like I did and read about it from other sources that know what they are talking about.PROS:Great appetite suppressant! I have tried just about every product that claims to reduce cravings or at least "suppress" your appetite. They have never worked. The only thing that suppresses my appetite is food. Lots of it. Until now. I take one capsule with my morning java and another about 6 hours later. I could easily skip eating.No side effects. I'm a caffeine junkie, so getting jitters has never been an issue for me. If you are affected by one cup of coffee, maybe your results will be different.  Also no stomach upset, no headaches...nothing.CONS:I really don't have any. I guess if I have to have something in the CON area it would be the price. These are by no means the most expensive ones out there. These are actually a fair price. But there are some cheaper ones. Since I cannot vouch for any of them, I think I'll just stick with what works for me.

I received one of these metal wallets in exchange for an honest review.This is sturdier than it looks. When I saw that it was " ultra thin aluminum" I wrongly assumed that you could bend this with your fingers. Unless you are the Hulk, I don't see that happening. It may be ultra thin, but it is also sturdy.Ultra thin also means ultra light. I have felt fabric wallets, and especially leather ones, that weigh more than this.The description says that it will hold 6 cards. I was able to squeeze in 10 without having any trouble taking them out. I wouldn't put any more than one card in the end slots, since it can be a little difficult when removing a single card. I am not sure if the vinyl used as separators will last as long with 2 cards in one slot, so use your own discretion.The hinge only allows the wallet to open just a shade past 90 degrees. It does not open to fully flat.Opening and closing are flawless. Even when thrown in my cavernous purse the latch did not pop open. A nice touch is that even if it did pop open, the cards don't just fall out. The vinyl divider grips the cards. If it happens to fall out of your hands while opening, you don't have to worry about chasing down flying cards.The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because of it's "plain-ness". This is a very nice looking wallet. The aluminum shines up quite nicely. But it is just plain. If that's what you want, then here's your wallet. If you are looking for a little more detailing or customizing or "bling", you may be able to put some engraving on it or ??? This is really a blank canvas for your own statement.

I received a bottle of Viva Labs Vitamin D3 in exchange for an honest review.If you are buying D3, then you already know that it has a lot of health benefits, so I won't waste your time here. You just want to know if these work. Yes, they do. I have taken 5000 IU of D3 for over a year, and have experienced the improved mood and improved blood tests. After taking these for over a month, I can tell you I am still getting the benefits.One item to note, be sure that you are taking a D3 supplement that only uses organic non-GMO olive oil. Viva Labs has got it covered.Here's another benefit: check out the price. For 5000 IU, at 4 cents per pill you are getting a good buy. And once you do buy them, you won't have to buy them for about a year. Only 5 days short.Whether you are just looking into buying D3 or have been enjoying its' benefits for years, this is a top quality D3 that will give you what you need at a good price.

I received a bottle of Upbiotics Probiotics in exchange for an honest review.I have been taking probiotics for years. I understood the importance of those friendly little buggers in my guts. Now it's all about finding THE one for me. With all of the probiotics I had tried, I knew the biggest improvement I had seen was less upset stomach. Less of the heartburn and bloating that had become so common. But I still hadn't found one that worked any better than the others. Then I tried the Upbiotics.  These will do just fine, thank you.What makes these any better than the others? I have had even less stomach issues with gas and bloating, and outside of a "blow-the-diet" day, no heartburn whatsoever. I was still having an occasional bout with other probiotics.  I have also been more "regular", something I didn't realize had been "off". I really couldn't tell you which of the bacteria it is that is causing the most improvement, but my innards say "Thank you"!Another bonus, I started out taking the 2 capsules, but was able to drop to just one. I was still seeing the improvements so I just kept it there. That makes these an even better price per pill. If you compare prices, you will see that these are priced lower than most of the others, but don't think that means less quality.And just in case you are still on the fence about trying these, read this, directly from them: "All 100Naturals Products Backed by Unprecedented Five 100% Guarantee : All products are 100% Naturals | 100% Drug Free | 100% Satisfaction Guarantee | 100% Full Refund If you Are Not 100% Satisfied with ANY Reason in 100 Days | 100% Potency Tested by 3rd Party". The biggest one for me is the 100 days. If you need a probiotic and don't see any improvement in 100 days, then you are taking the wrong one.

I received a set of these headphones in exchange for an honest review.I was hoping someone would come out with a decent set of Bluetooth ear buds for running. Here they are! I love these! I've had others, but the biggest issue I had was the fit. With the stiff wires, it was almost impossible to quickly get a good fit. These feel almost custom made for my head.PROS:Nice packaging. You get packed in a very gift-worthy box the headphones, the charging cord, 2 extra sets of ear bud covers in large and small size, instructions, and a very nice semi-solid zippered case to throw it all in. The case gets 5 stars just for the way you could throw this in your pack and not worry about them getting smashed.Sound quality is right up there with other ear buds in this price range. Bass is a little heavy at lower volumes, but the higher notes still come through.  These get nice and loud if that's what you're into. I like to kinda hear what's going on around me when I run and these actually allow me to do that. You can adjust them to fit tight into the ear, making them more "noise-cancelling", or you can wear them like I do, loosely in the ear so I can hear background noises.Fit is just right. I have a smaller sized head. Size 7 1/8 in a hat. Most stuff is made for bigger, average size heads. You know, somewhere between men and women. The stiffness of the wire actually made them "grip" my head, and the back of the wires cradled some of the weight onto my neck. I can put these on and off in a flash. And they seem to be shaped just right to keep sweat out of your ears. I use them for running cross country and they are wonderful!The buttons have been minimized! I tend to forget which side has which function. Volume on the left, or right? Now there are only 3 buttons. The typical MFB, multi-function button, and 2 other buttons that control both volume and track. For example, a quick press will skip to the next track, but a long press increases volume. The other button does the opposite. Easy-peasy.Battery life is great so far! It took about 2-3 hours for the initial charge (a red light goes out when it is finished charging), but I've been using them now for about 7 hours and they still show half charge. Yeah, the battery life of the headphones displays on my phone. Nice touch.CONS:Remember those 3 buttons? The MFB is really hard to get to without having to stick your finger in your ear to keep the ear bud in place. Other than that you have to literally take it out of your ear to get to it. This is not a big issue for me since I rarely get a call during a run.If you are really "into" music, these may not be for you. I am no audiophile, but my son is and he says that the bass would be a put-off for anyone looking for "high price-tag" sound. I've said this before, if you want Bose, go buy Bose (or whatever brand is the bomb these days).

I am impressed with these mugs! first off I have to tell you thatI have tried other metal cups in the past and they acted just like I thought they would. Hot drinks scalded your hands/lips/tongue and cold drinks froze them. That's what I was expecting. WRONG!I filled all 16 ounces with hot coffee. Don't worry. These mugs are sturdy, even for as "thin" as they are. The handle and cup are well able to take the weight. And the heat. I first noticed that the outside of the mug did not burn my hand when I picked it up. I tentatively took a sip, waiting for my lip to be seared to the rim. It didn't. I was able to actually drink the coffee. A bonus: it kept it hot for quite a while. This is not anywhere comparable to an insulated mug that claims to keep stuff hot for hours, but if you guzzle your coffee like I do then this will keep it just the right temperature.I got the same satisfaction when I tried putting a cold drink in it. It kept it just as cold as if I had put it in a nice big glass.Only 2 cons to these mugs.1: No instructions. No cleaning instructions at all. Since I got these for free as a reviewer I just threw them in the dishwasher to see what would happen. Nothing. They came out clean. They look like they could use a little polish, but I have a 20 year old dishwasher that doesn't have the rinse-aid ability so water spots are normal to me. The description above says not to put them in the dishwasher so I guess you better not.2: Can't microwave in em. Duh, but sometimes I need to heat up my midday mocha while I sit at the computer.100% money back guarantee and a 2 year warranty. What's not to love?

I received one of these money trees in exchange for an honest review.Got Feng Shui?  This is a cute little gift for those moving into a new place or getting a promotion with a new office space. Anywhere you need your money to grow or at least stay where it is rather than escape through the windows and doors! One way to "use" them is to place them in an area devoted to money. Got your ledgers in a desk or a cash register in your business? Place the tree nearby. You can put it in the hallway or near your main door so money doesn't fly out the doors. Place it in the Southeast corner of your home to energize the money corner. The Northwest corner welcomes helpful, "money bringing" people into your home. Put it on the East side of the house to energize the wood element which stimulates growth. I'm no expert in Feng Shui and can't say one way or the other if it really works. I just think this is a cute little tree and it would show anyone that you care about their financial future. Nice, thoughtful gift.It would be nice to get this in a giftable box rather than just bubble wrapped, but it is small enough you can find a box easily. The "leaves" are all attached with wires so they can be adjusted to your perfect look. If you look at the pic in the description, it looks like the entire tree is golden colored. The trunk of the tree is actually darker, more red toned. Not in a bad way, just don't expect all gold coloring.

I've had other pocket chainsaws in the past. They were basically just a cable with 'teeth" cut in. What a waste. I would have hated to have to rely on one of those. I received this pocket survival hand chainsaw in exchange for an honest review.This is a real saw. Really. Really sharp and cuts really fast! I had some light thinning and pruning to do around the yard. Limbs were everywhere from 1" up to 10". Usually I grab the little gas chainsaw and I'm done in seconds. I just grabbed the pocket saw and went to work. Hey, no more noise and fumes!! It takes a bit more time, obviously, but I was able to get the saw onto limbs that I would not have been able to reach with the gas-powered saw. Just throw the end over a limb and away you go.If you've got a partner, you can even do tandem cutting. You have to have some coordination between yourselves, but it can be done! Just shorter strokes.One concern I had was how to sharpen it later if ever needed. The shape of the teeth make me think you could use a knife file or some other small key files to sharpen it up. There are 92 individual double-sided teeth, so you are going to be sharpening 184 edges. This is going to take a while. I think I'll just buy another one rather than do all that sharpening.Another concern is the "rope" they use to attach the handles to the saw. How about using some chain or something a little sturdier? I'm afraid that if you accidentally drag that rope across those teeth a couple of times you are going to have a cut handle. But on the bright side, they did design it so the rope could be removed and replaced easily. The end of the cords is "friction fit" into the handles and the S-hook on the saw end could take a lot of sizes of other cords. You could even replace the S-hook if you wanted.Great for camping and survival packs! The carrying case measures only 5" x 5 1/2" and has a belt loop. The large buckle clip is sturdy and all of the stitching is well done. The nylon pouch is lined inside, making it shed water like a duck's back.  The saw easily rolls up, very carefully, and fits back in the pouch.I'll never even look at those "other" survival saws again. I'm sold on this one! Fast cutting and quiet. It's even a little bit of exercise, if you want to look at it that way. Just use proper form and watch those repetitive motion injuries!

I received a bag of this Organic cacao powder in exchange for an honest review.Right off the bat let me tell you this makes the best smoothies ever! The chocolate flavor is outstanding and less bitter than other cacao powders. Now I'm not talking about grocery store Dutch process cocoa sold in the baking section. This has more chocolate flavor. Like the difference between milk and dark chocolate.  If you've tried their nibs, then you will really enjoy this!I know there is a slew of health info on chocolate/cacao out there, so if you want a health lesson, I suggest doing a search. Other folks are much more suited to explaining the goodness of cacao. And with this, I don't see a downside. Nothing added, simply organic cacao.I've tried using this in place of the regular baking cocoa and have come away very pleased! Cookies and cakes, for instance, have a deeper choco flavor without altering the recipe. I simply substituted 1:1. I'm no chef, but I haven't heard any complaints from the eaters around here!I had to try the recipe shown in the above product description for the fruit dip! Perfect way to showcase the flavor of the cacao! Seriously I could not stop dipping into it. I even amped it up a little by replacing half of the cacao powder with peanut butter powder to make a choco-peanut dip. A little pinch of cinnamon and I had a nice spicy sweetener for my coffee! Almost like a Mexi-Mocha.And if you are really adventurous, make your own candy for those chocolate attacks. Way healthier than you will buy at the store.If you just want to give this a try, here's the best deal I've seen. If you check out the price of other organic, fair-trade cacao, you will see that you are getting a great deal. This is a LOT of cacao! I have been using this for about 3 weeks, adding it to everything I could imagine and I still have a lot left in the bag! When I run out, I'll be back for more.

I'm typically not one to wear gloves when I'm on a bicycle.  Mostly because I ride BMX IN the country instead of CROSS country.  That being said, I just might start, because these gloves are REALLY nice to wear and they keep me from getting those massive blisters on my hands when I'm doing those sweet jumps I'm known for!  The gloves fit perfectly to my hands and the included gel padding just under the thumb keeps the strain off my hands while I do my tricks.  All in all, a glove that feels great and keeps my hands from being wrecked!  Can't ask for more than that?!I received this product in exchange for an unbiased/honest review.

I'm glad the companies finally learned how to make selfie sticks the right way!  I love how these newer models fold into each other.  Makes is super simple to store away for future use.  This stick has a really nice handle on it and fills very strong.  I've dealt with sticks in the past that didn't seem as such.  Either way, this gets the job done and does it right!  I do have TWO complaints,....actually I have one and my wife has one.  She hates that it doesn't fit her iPhone 6 PLUS (with an otterbox case).  However, that's not the companies problem, but might should be addressed in future models.  My complaint is that when you go to pair it with your phone, I already knew how to do it (from using others) but it doesn't exactly give the best signal to let you know it's in "pairing mode".  Normally, the light will blink red/green on blue tooth devices when being paired.  This one didn't do that, it just blinked.  Maybe that's good enough, but I was still slightly confused.  Regardless,..great stick that does exactly what you hope it will.****Includes USB charging cable!****

As far as WIRED earbuds go, these are some of the best I've had in my ears!  Obviously, they are simple plug and play, but they fit very nicely in the ear.  Also, they come with 12 additional ear fittings to soot your needs (or if you want to loan them out,..gross).  They also come in a nice case that you can carry them around in later.  The sound on these is fantastic!  I was listening to Burning Red by Machine Head (1999) Audio CD and it was JAMMIN!  In case it matters, I'm listening through my iPhone 5.  I had absolutely no problems with the EQ and the sound.  I must say,..I didn't attempt to make a call with them.  That's something that I don't do anyway.  If I'm listening to music, I don't want to be bothered, so I can't comment on the quality of the mic, but the buds are AWESOME!I received this product in exchange for an unbiased/honest review.

Man, I can't begin to tell you how much I love these bowls!  I used to have those little 2 in 1 bowls for the cats, that held water and food.  Of course, those end up being one side empty and the other side full of soggy food, so I started filling both sides with food.  As you can imagine, that only led to me have really fat kitties!  Of course, they're super soft, so that's not a problem.  The problem was, it was costing too much to constantly fill them!  These bowls rectify that problem!  They now get this bowl filled with food and that's it.  If they eat it all at once, that's too bad.  I think they're already starting to understand they got to portion their grub out! These are very nice faceted beads.  I have had to pay much more for faceted beads in the past to get beads as nice as these are.Generally, I think a faceted bead should have a wide band of facets on it. I have had inexpensive faceted beads which were narrower than the average bead, and the facets would be very wide so that the resulting bead was obviously was of an inferior nature because the bead had very few facets when ciompared to a more expensive bead. aaad.  These beads instead have a large number of facets and the bead is as wide as as any medium priced bead, so no one can just glance at these and see that they were inexpensive.These beads do have silver plated inner cores as opposed to the more expensive sterling silver cores found on more expensive beads. I was somewhat hesitant to try these faceted beads because at their given price the deal seemed too good to be true. When I purchase a bead from any given company, I find that a faceted bead of a matching color generally costs just as much as a regular bead. When I first started buying beads for Murano style bracelets, there were no "deals" on faceted beads by any vendor, but that was several years ago.I was very pleased to receive this faceted set. My previous purchases had shown me that a relatively inexpensive faceted bead had a limited number of facets. Thus, the more I paid for a faceted bead, the more facets it had.  That has changed over time. Now, the number of facets seemes to be up to the particular bead maker. That is to say, some beads have more facets than others and price does not seem to be a variable.These are very nice beads.1.  They have a large number of facets.2.  They are as big, if not bigger, than the average Murano glass bead (Some of the more expensive bead makers tend to have larger beads than others)3.  THE CENTERS OF THESE BEADS ARE SILVER PLATED). Generally, good quality beads and charms are sterling silver.  Less expensive items are silver plated.4.  These are not THREADED BEADS:  Some of the more expensive beads are threaded so that if your bracelet comes unclasped, your beads do not fall off. These are NOT threaded.I have certainly not taken any stars off because these are silver plate, nor because they are not threaded. These beads are a good buy because you get a large quantity for a small price. These are a good deal because they are a nice size, have many facets, and you get 6 of them for a nominal fee. The color is good and they look very nice on a bracelet; hence, I recommend them.

i  am in a Bible Study group that is using this Life Change book on Ezekielas their guide through this book of the Bible,. Prior to this we have done many studies using a different series of books to lead us through various Bible Chapters.I have to admit I was quite tired of the other studies and was looking forward to a change in format.And I have been pretty happy with the Life Change style of presentation. I find that the more salient items are more carefully delineated and, in general, I find the Life Change format to be interesting and easy to understand. Interesting asides are introduced and high points are brought to the fore.My biggest complaint about the other series, and about Bible Study books in general, is that the questions, and points to consider or discuss, tend to be redundant. I gather, that this is to make certain that the main points are well understood. So, I still have the same old ax to grind...there is a lot of redundancy incorporated in this book, but it does not seem to be as extreme as other studies that I have seen and used.These authors do seem to try to incorporate fresh ideas into their work So, I am well pleased with this and do recommend it to others who are in a study that is an overview of the Book with interesting details included along with major points and ideas that any general student should know.I accept that some harping on various points must be done as we are not necessarily scholars, but your garden variety of "weekend learners."

I have purchased five of these crosses with red crystals during the four years that I have been buying Murano glass beads and sterling silver charms. Throughout that period of time this Zable cross with the red crystals in it has been my favorite cross. When putting together a bracelet, I generally put a cross at the mid-point of each of the bracelets I have. And, generally, as much as is possible, my bracelets tend to be mirror images of each other with the cross being the midpoint. Sometimes, this becomes too expensive, so each side of the bracelet may differ, but generally, I have found this conformation keeps me happy and I generally get many a compliment.Although this red cross is not always compatible with a given bracelet, I find that it is frequently OK. If not Zable always offers other crosses, though I always return to this one as a favorite. It makes a statement about my beliefs as well as being a beautiful, durable bead. Usually I find that these stones in a bead tend to fall out, but although I these bracelets go whever I go, These stones have stayed in the cross and have given me no trouble. I recommend it to any who are looking for a beautiful cross for their bracelet or as a gift to someone who llike Murano beads and bracelets.

I have two of these pink beads and wear them on my "Pink Murano Glass Bracelet." They are beautiful and the craftmanship on the flowers which are hand blown onto this bead are amazing in the beauty they add to an already georgeous pink bead. Each of these is painstakingly crafted of molten glass with the flowers desings and the added petals bringing each bead "to life." I am always amazed at the amount of work that goes into each bead. I have sterling silver Zable bracelets that are warrantied for 5 years.This is a lovely bead and will be a wonderful addition to your bracelet.

I bought this bead when I first began making/putting together Murano bracelets. I have had this beautiful green bead for over 4 years now and it is still as lovely as ever. The green is a deep green that absolutely glows when the light hits it.It has a companion bead that is the same design but is blue This green bead and its partner, the blue bead, have withstood many a wearing but show no signs of wear. This is a great bead. You will get years of wear from this exceptionally well made Zable product. I have worn the bracelet with this bead on it while cooking, gardening, entertaining, and partying. It absolutely goes the extra mile.When you have a choice, I would recommend going "zable." These beads are slightly wider than the run of the mill bead and generally carry a warranty. This is a great pain relieving cream as well as a good hydrating product. I use it at night on my feet and wear socks that increase the absorbent properties of the cream. This is a fairly nice grey bead from Sexy Sparkles. The gray on the body of the bead is a medium gray with the 5 sided flowers a lighter gray. The light gray against the medium gray does not make for much of a contrast in colors;  therefore, the flower petals do not stand out definatively on the bead.The bead has three sets of the lighter gray petals on the bead and in the center of the flower is a sparkling rhinestone. It has been my experience that these rhinestones fall out fairly quickly, though this bead did arrive at my home with all three sparkles intact.The core of the bead is not sterling. It is listed as being "not rated" which means it could be plated, rhodium covered, or brass under a gray looking metal. I do hot know for certain because this information is not listed.it is not a screw on center, but is a slide on one.This was an inexpensive bead and looks pretty good for such an item. My biggest disappointment with this is that the body of the bead is a medium gray which gives little contrast to the light flower petals on the bead.Also beware, though there are two pictures of this bead, this is not an indication that there are two beads. One picture simply shows the bead lying down, while the other show it standing up.

First I bought these in my usual size, but after wearing them for half a day, they had stretched to the point that they were too big. So, I sent them back for the next smaller size. Another half of a day of wearing and they were still to big, so back they went.Finally, two sizes down and they fit.I was very surprised at having to go down two sizes to find the correct fit. As usual, when I first put these on in my regular size, they were quite snug and it seemed like a good fit was on the way. Same thing with one size down. Having to go two sizes down was unheard of in my wearing language with NYDJ.It is good for the ego...to some extent, but hard on the pocket book while trying to ensure that one gets the needed color/colors. Sending back and forth can get tiresome while one is waiting for the correct fit of jeans for the summer that then slides into the fall.Once I find a fit in a certain set of Jeans, it seems to go OK, but I do wish that sizing would be stabilized in the NYDJ department!Once again, in a pair and color that fit, I order another color to fleece out the wardrobe. I used to get Sherrie Petites and will continue to do so, but the cool colors were not in Sherri this year.So, I suggest you buy at least one size down if you are used to Sherri's, but that is almost all the help I can be. I might throw in that I am 5'5" and weigh 150.  That frequently helps me to decide...if the reviewer is cool enough to add her own Vital Statistics.  Helps me decide how many sizes I need to alter in any given type of jean from NYDJ

This is another of Doig's wonderful books where one reads from the beginning..first getting a picture od the characters as Doig paints them. Once one has the characters clearly in mind, Doig pull the fishing taut and has the reader hooked. Then one goes through Cliffhanger after Cliffhanger.  What will Mitch do to line up a job after college? He is now married and has "akid on the way?!"But will he go in with his pot smoking buddy where he can have an easy money job at the same rate of pay as the one he currently has?  Why did his wife take off from him in the first place?  Why do his only two children diespise him when, over all, he seems like such a wonderful guy?Will he die from various fun jobs too close to volcanos?  what about in a tour of Alaska on a seaplane? How about close encounters with grizzly bears?Why isn't he married to his latest live and live-in named Lexa?It seems as if every time Doig slings in another $3.00 word which requires a dictionary to enlighten Gentle Reader that a new twist or turn into the plot arrives...new word/new twist to the book.But ll these twistings and turnings are part and parcel of the fun of reading Ivan Doig. He stays in his own back yard of Montana or, perhaps Arizona when he paints the backdrops of his novels. Then he throws in some uneducated characters to mix in with his hard working ones who have pulled themselves up by their boot straps along with the highly educated crew.  All in all, it maks for fine reading. Those of us at home with his sudden twists and turns find that thise are the reasons we come back to see how his literary fantasy is coming along.I find that the moment he becomes too complacent about stringing the reader along, that I simply ditch that book and go on to the next one. But Mountain Time hooked me from its onset and held me there until the very end. It is never possible to discover how the ending will arrive..on horseback, a destroyer from the WW11 era or on the whispered words of the kindly author. Always something to attract us all for a spin into fantasy of a bygone era.This is a good one. Buy up and enjoy for the present and all the time that memory seves.

I can go through the day thinking that I am the Coolest person around because I have on some snazzy underwear...not the old run of the mill white cotton panties that I grew up with...just something a bit out of the ordinary.Bali's Comfort Revolution Brief's have provided me with Secret happiness on numerous occasions. Since these briefs are offered in a multitude of colors and styles, I have had the fun of looking at many of those offered and have found several that are now residing in my own personal underwear drawer.I got the world's best deal on this  pair of panties": These start at the iop as an almost white color and then as you progress further down the item, stripes of a light pink/orange color until the stripes coalesce into a light salmon color. You can bet that I wear a pair of these under my orange jeans!!Generally I wait until Amazon has a smashing good sale on bras and then I buy one to match the panties. I may not be the most "together" person there is, but I surely behave as if I am when I am all coordinated underneath!!How is the fit of these Panties? I find that it is just great...they fit just like they should. The elastic band sits just below my navel and does not pinch at all. Although I wear a size 10-12 in jeans, I find that I am the most comfortable in Panties that are either L-7 oe 8/9 oe 8. You just have to adjust to the maker of the underwear.Personally, I have had to accept the fact that I have a fairly large caboose.The elastic in the legs is in tune with the waiste band of these knickers. It6 is just rught...does not pinch but certainly leaves no gaps either. They fit just right.I am not one to hand wash my undies. Now, I do wash my bras by hand, but the panties go through the asher. THEY DO NOT DRY OUT IN THE DRYER!. I have fouled up too many undies by throwing them in the dryer and I have made that mistake, than k you, and will not do it again. All of my knickers are hung up to dry--either right in the llaundry room, or outside on beautiful days.This particular pair of undies is currently being offered as an add-on item. The price is unbelievably low at $4.ii with free shipping.But, though they may increase in price at some point, they are still worth a few extra pennies. They are cute and fit well...I take an 8/9 and they fit perfectly on me and though they are machine washed, they still fit perfectly after being air dried.I definite recommend these and hope you feel as special in them as I do!

I was disappointed when I received this CD from Amazon. I have two other CD's by this group which I love to listen to. They are AMERICAN ANGELS: SONGS OF HOPE' REDEMPTION AND GLORY,  and  GLORYLAND. Both of these CD's are sung with a minimum of musical accompaniment are sound like Grassroots Pentecostal music as opposed to the Chant format that the group has grown into.I tried to listen to the music prior to purchasing the CD, but the tracks are listed, but you cannot listen to them as you can in most cases these days. Since The Cherry Tree is a well known song and since the title of the CD  says that these are songs and carols, I had my hopes up thinking I had found another CD of rolicking uplifting music.  (I like Chants also, but was hoping to match the tenor of the other CD's I had).I eagerly opened the package and put in the line up with my other CD;s. It was Chants...just not the sound I was hoping for.With technology as advanced as we have today (Soon technology will bypass the human element and take off on its own course...at least that is what "they" are telling us) I find it difficult to believe that it is not possible to listen to snatches of this CD prior to purchasing it. Better interface with the consumer is certainly needed here. Though the CD itself is surely wonderful, the circumstances presented to purchasers certainly falls below the mark of what is acceptable these days. And Amazon makes returns fairly easy, it is still a hassle to send something back, especially since a bit more "tecnological Thrust" and this error would never have occurred.Thus, my three stars. This is a CD of Chants...so that others do not have the same experience I have had.

I love thse and have now ordered 3 packages of them. I realize that this gives me six pairs of these, but I love them so much that this number seems totally reasonable to me; in fact, I may even talk myself into ordering two more sets. Why?And in the "Why" of this, I am able to see why theynwork so well for me. I am one of those souls that is persecuted with overly dry feet. I have looked for years for something that would give me LONG TERM RELIEF FROM MY DRY FOOT PROBLEM.Initially, I wore these little footies with the balm that the vendor said worked best with them. I had no luck and put these little socks away for several months thinking I had just tried another avenue that did not work for me.Then I tried them with some EMU OUL. In addition to dryness, I was now suffering the pains of Neuropathy. Many said the Emu Oil gave them Relif from their Neuropathy pains. I thought, well, I might as well throw good money after bad and ordered the oil. Within a day, I received a personal email from the Emu Oil Vendor saying what I could expect from the oil (pain relief was NOT noted on the list) however, he said to notify him personally if it did not live up to its reputation as a healing oil.So, there I was with oil dripping from my feet. (Any type of prior planning for this eventuality had not occured to me) when I remembered my little "dry feet socks."  Fortunately I had put them in my nightstand. So I recovered them and put them on my oily feet. To my amazement, my neuropathy pain began to subside within ten minutes and within 30, it was gone. My little socks had kept the oil in so that it did not get on my bedding. That was a huge plus. But the morning brought my ultimate gain. My dryn skin began to peel away. First the dry sjin came iff in little dabs. By the third day, it was coming off in strips. I was getting worried that I would have no skin left on my feet, but night after night, I would apply Emu Oil to one foot and then put on my little blue sock with black feet running across it. Then I would do the other foot.It has taken almost a month for all the dead skin to peel away. In its place I have new pink skin with no dry spots in it.I tried putting the Emu Oil on and then covering my feet with little golf socks that I had. That did not work at all. Those golf socks absorbed as much oil as possible and left a mess on my bedding.I learned that my little blue socks were sending the Emu Oil where it needed to go...into my skin and not into my carpet or bedding.I run these socks with Emu Oil on them through the washer. Hand washing treatment is not good enough to take the oil out. So, now I have a pair for 6 nights and will llikely order another set. It is yucky to wear a set that has seen a night's hard work, so I use a freshly laundered set each night. And noe I cannot imagine going to sleep without them. The Emu Oil takes care of my pain and the socks see to it that the oil is absorbed by my skin rather than oiling up the bedding.Now the skin on my feet has changed from ugly dry stuff to a healthy pink thanks to the quality in these socks that sees that my oil is absorbed rather than just making a mess of the bedding.I love thse and wear them nightly. They have made a huge difference in my life. I turns out that these were a very wise purchase and were not good money thrown after bad.  I no longer have to worry about uglyn scaling feet. I can wear sandals any time I wish.  And because of the way these handle the Emu Oil, I now get a good night's sleep because my foot pain is gone.I recommend these to those with a dry foot problem, and, as a bonus, those who have foot pain can wear these knowing their pain cream will be absorbed into their skin instead of onto the bedding where it will do no good.

This is a beautiful LITTLE BEAD offered by Bling Jewelry.It goes beautifully with its companion bead which is a Sea Themed Sea Turtle Bead also offered by Bling Jewelers.I capitalized Small Bead when I initially mentioned thee Seaa Themed bead which has a thin coating of Gold plate on it because one must be aware that both of these barrel shaped beads offered by Bling are much smaller than the average round bead one normally buys for Murano Bracelets..The length is about 3/4 of an inch and the with (where the holes are located) must be a bit over 3/8 of an inch because that is the diameter of most of the bracelets we wear. So, the hole for the bracelet is adequate but only a bit bihher, perhaps 5/8 of an inch.I noted that the Sea Turtle Bead which is offered as a companion to this one has outlines done in Sterling Silver; however, this one is bordered in gold. The gold attributes are one of the main selling points for this bead. It would probably be pretty drap if it were highlighted in Sterling.My experience with Gold Overlay in these beads is that the Gold wears off pretty quickly. What do I mean by pretty quickly? If you wear this bead every day for a week, I would expect to see the gold worn off at its most prominent features..the ones that get the most wear. If you wear it daily for a month, i would expect all the gold overlay to be gone.I have had experience with several beads with a gold overlay. Some were inexpensive, but the most expensive were $29.95 four years ago. I bought 6 or more small spacer beads from Zable. They bwere all identical. They had small As is this bead, they were all barrel beads and had crosses around their middles. I was brand new to Murano Beads at the time and thought that if I bought an expensive bead/s with gold overlay that they would last and the gold would not wear off.I was very wrong. At the time, I wore my bracelet, which had two of these barrel cross beads on it, all day, every day. It came off only at night. I was horrified to find that the gold began to disappear within a week, and though I was as careful as I could be, the gold was ALL GONE within 3 weeks and certainly within four. I spoke to the people at Fine Jewelers and they were kind enough to replace the two barrel beads I had been wearing continuously. But, they told me, was the way gold was. It was applied very thinly, and I should only wear those beads with gold overlay for an hour or two. I could go to one function with them on, but should take them off after that. Wearing them continuously was sure to ruin them.  I still have those beads, but am very judicious about where I wear them, and for how long.I will treat this gold and blue bead the same way. I will wear it out for an evening, but onece home, I will wipe it gently with a silver cloth to get all human sweat and grit off of it, then will put it and the bracelet it is on in an anti-tarnish bag and put it away. I know that sounds like an awful lot of trouble, when what you want to do is show off that beautiful bead!!! But unless you plan to replace this bead with a new one when the gold wears off, you will have to treat it very kindly.With all that said: !. It is a small bead...more the size of a spacer bead than the usual Murano bead and 2. It's beauty lies mostly in the thin veneer of gold applied to it, but that gold will easily wear off...I still give this bead 5 Stars.I give it 5 stars because Bling makes a good quality product and stands behind their purchases. Most of their beads are purchased as gifts, so even though their product may fail, they will not know of it, but they will stand behind it. Given that you know the potential flaws of this product and still buy it, then you should know to treat it carefully.I bought it knowing the inherent problems, which for me will boil down to this bead requiring more care than the normal bead. Since it is so small, will anyone else even notice its beauty? Sometimes, I have to admit that a bead is beautiful, even if I am the only one who is likely to notice its beauty. And sometimes that is fine. If the only one who enjoys the beauty is me...well.....I am not here to knock the socks off the world...I am here to appreciate the beauty in the things i am given.So, I will wear this bead sparingly and enjoy it every time I wear it. If you are nof the same mind, then I heartily recommend this bead to you.

This was one wonderful book. It is written from the perspective of a young boy.The first part of the book is narrated by the boy when he is six years old. He has a father, the Bartender, whom he sees about once a year. He is currently living with his father's sister, his Aunt, who lives in Phoenix. His aunt has two sons who are older and much meaner than he is. All he wants to do is get away from this awful situation.In a dream come true, his father, named Tom Harry, arrives at his aunt,s door one day and announces that he is taking his son back to Montana to live with him. This 6 year old spends  quite a bit of time and energy, woorrying that he will do some Godawful thing that will cause his father to return him to his aunt's home. His other main concern at this point in time is "Who is his mothwe and will she show up at his father's anytime soon?  This desire to know who his mother is becomes a major thread during the whole book. You, the reader, will not be given this information until the very end of the book.The author cunningly weaves this thread throughout this novel.This page turner progresses from the child at age six until he is twelve. A new and dangerous, or merely curious sometimes, set of events will keep you on the edge of your seat for the entire reading of this delicious novel. I read long into the night on this one and yearned for more when I HAD TO PUT THE BOOK DOWN.MAIN THREADS OF THE BOOK:1.  Will I ever get out of this hell hole in Phoenix, i. e. who are my parents and why have I been abandoned?  If I do something wrong will my POP send me back to phoenix2.  Who is my mother, and where is she plus what will happen if she shows up?3. My father is to be called Pop and he runs a Saloon.4. School is intolerable,  I am a smart kid, but there are bullies around5. At age twelve he meets his  best friend and she is a girl. Their ruses and shenanigans bring the reader into a much expanded view of how things can go wrong, or frequently they go right, and what fun can be had in the process6. Fishing: Tom Harry loves to fish and the Kid, not so much7. High jinks at the bar with best friend8. Dad plans to sell the bar...Oh My God!9. An unknown Sister show up and throws the whole group into a tizzy10. The earthen dam at Fort Peck fails and the entire town is flooded..who will go back to their businesses and who will not? Many are killed by the flood11. The Bar stays, Proxie is not his mom, nor is Frances his sister12. Identity of Mom finally comes out13. The end and all is wellI really enjoyed this Read. The action never stopped, characters came and went, but through it all POP and the Saloon were stabilizing forces. I just never knew what would happen next And the ending really did take me by surprise.I definitely recommend this book; in fact, I liked it so well that I am going to give it to my friend who is quite haughty about what she reads: Novels Only and They Had Best Be Good!

I have been buying these 3 beads as a group for 4 years. It is a terrific deal to get all three at a low price. I could buy each one separately for about $10-$15 or a whole lot more if I was forking out cash for a Zable or SilvaRado bead.I have put together a Christmas bracelet with red and green sparkling beads intermingled with some expensive sterling beads. I have a Zable Snowflake, a Zable Christmas Sleigh filled with gifts, a Zable toy train, Z able Christmas bells, and a SilvaRado GingerBread Man. (I spent an excess amount of money on this particular bracelet because a. I wear it for the entire month of December and b. I plan to wear it as is for the rest of my llife during the Christmas holidays!)I put shiny beads in between the silver charms and love to use the inexpensive sets that Pro Jewelry sells.I know from long experience that these beautiful beads will rattle against one another for the whole month. Whether it is these three beads that I get a bargain on, or rhe really expensive ones such as Pandora and Zable sell, these lovely beads start to loose their little sparkly parts within a day or two. By the end of the month, the sparkling beads need to be replace because they will have lost more than half of their little sparkles.I would say it is planned obselescence, except, I do not think anyone has come up with a glue strong enough to keep the little sparkling gems in place. THEY ARE BEAUTIFUL, THEY ATTRACT LOTS OF ATTENTION AND i ALWAYS GET A TON OF COMPLIMENTS when I wear rhis beautifl, sparkling bracelet. It is just part of the deal of having such a beautiful item. It requires upkeep and new sparkling beads every year.When I was a Newbie to Murano bracelets, I thought these sparkling beauties were to die for. But reality came knocking in by the end of the first week of continuous wearing of these beauties. So, I learned to limit the number of sparkles that I wore.But for 4 years now, I have checked in to buy a couple of these sets.I want to sparkle through Christmas and into the New Year.With prices this reasonable, I am able to do so.I highly recommend this grouping.

Lately I have been on a gray kick; that is, I have purchased a couple of pairs of gray jeans, some tops to go with them, and some gray shoes to complete the clothing look.I like to wear Murano Bracelets as accesories to my clothing. But finding pretty gray beads has been quite the challenge. I was looking at other dangling beads when this gray dangle appeared as "You Might Also Like...so of course I took the bait and got this wonderful dangle.It is rather a a rather small dangle, but I have no quarrel with that as it is just like its' picture.. Its total length from the top of the dangle to the bottom of the pearl is just shy of an inch. The pearl itself measure about 3/8ths of an inch across and 3/8ths of an inch up and down.The silver bail that holds the pearl in place appears to be coated with a substance that prevents tarnish. Be very careful if you should need to clean this. the silver bail that holds the pearl in place appears to be treated so it will not tarnish. Be very careful if you need to clean this. The pearl is real and the Bail is sterling. I would suggest a disposable tarnish remover should this ever need a touch-up.I am thrilled to find a beautiful gray bead and recommend to anyone else who needs a quality item.

This is the second pairTaos Sandals in this style that I have purchased. The first ones were gold and I still have them and still wear themFor me, Taos Sandals are a little bit of heaven on this Earth My feet tend to swell if I am on them for long periods of time: 12-14 hours at a go./ But Taos Sandals like this pair are there to my rescue.For those of us whose feet swell !.  If we stand or sit with them hanging down for 4 plus hours at a time.  2. If we are on our feet and doing hard chores such as lifting heavy objects, cleaning house all day 5. Forgetting to elevate our feet when we are sitting down or not keeping them above heart level while we sleep...the usual things that lead to swollen feet...we know better than to sit down and have them dangling. and we mean to elevate them at night, but then do not...whatever the reason, our feet swell...3. and if you are wearing ordinary shoes, as tour feet swell, so do your shoes, but then when you put your shoes on in the morning, your feet look almost normal, but your shoes are too big.This is where I HAVE COME TO CHERISH MY tAOS SANDALS. These T-Strap style are just perfect for me. These shoes fit in the morning when my feet have no swelling. By 2 in the afternoon, serious swelling has begun, but my feet are still cradled by my Taos Sandals. Even though the swelling is becoming serious by 2:00 PM, the arch support in these sandals still keeps the foot where it should be and, though these are my normal size 7's, they accommadate the swelling and do not stretch out of shape,These shoes allow me to keep up with my duties even though swelling has ocurred and is painfulSoon I will be having surgery to correct this problem, but until then, Taos sandals will be my best friends. (I have had these for use after a couple of other surgeries I had....They contour to the shape of my foot and that gives me a genuine feeling of confidence as I go to take my first steps after surgery. The soles give me traction and, again, these allow my feet to swell, or not, without hurting the shoes in any way.If these get really dirty, I have been known to throw them in the washer on a very delicate cycle, in order to make them look spotless and new. I readily admit that this is strange behavior, but, every couple of years, even shoes need a shower! I do not recommend this as routine behavior, but, as I say, it has been knoe to happer...No dryer...air dry only!These are wonderful, wonderful shoes. They have tread for stability, a finish on the footbed to keep odors away, a nice thick sole with a small elevation that lets you move unfettered without locking your knees, great arch support, and room for a swelling foot if need be. They can be cleaned with a wet cloth, and seem to last forever, no matter the harsh treatment they are givenA sturdy shoe for all seasons

I do like this bra. I have lost some weight and I have a new bra size:38C. When I was a bit younger, it was "just the thing" to have a large cup size. Showing it off in sweaters was a lot of fun. Sut a stint in the hospital took some flab off of me .  Back when, I would have been devastated to  to find I had lost some in the bra area. Being slimmer all over with this new bra size, I justn look like a sleeker human being...I am not the only one who thinks so...Multitudes have commented positively on the "New Me"  that is to say others have noticed and made positive comments...I am not just out on my own head trip.So..I initially bought this bra on sale in blue. Apparently they are ridding themselves of this stock, as I now see that the Strawberry color is now for sale at bargain basement prices. Since I am so happy with the Blue/Turquoise colored that I already own, I will now pop foe the Strawberry one.THE BRA ITSELF: is just a plain, no frills garment. The straps adjust from the back and this is a regular "Back Fastening bra."The colors are bright and warm, and they launder nicely. I do wash mine by hand and then hang them out to dry..usually in the master bath, but outside when the days are nice.  I hang mine in the shade to dry...avoid putting them in the direct sun as they may fade.One of my arms tends to sit higher than the other..perhaps permanently scrunched up;  thus, I have a difficult time of getting my bra straps situated. I did have a day of drooping shoulder straps, but one I got the straps where I WANTED THEM, i NO LONGER HAD TO DEAL WITH THIS ISSUE.The cups are lightly padded...in this case, that means that the bra will hold it shape while you are not wearing it, and there is enough padding to add 2-3mm to the size of you natural breasts..You will still have a small cleavage if you lay flat on your back, but this is not SSSoooo padded that it looks unnatural. Personally , this small amount of padding is OK by me. I have worn my blue bra under several T-Shirts (no camisole in sight) and the bra shaped me, but did not look unnatural at all.There is no lace and no frills with this bra. It is definitely a "you see what you are going to get" j as the picture show Now that I have the bra straps in the "RIGHT" places to fit my uneven anatomy,  Now that the bra is all rigged the way I want, it fits just perfectly and the straps stay in place on my shoulders...which is a real hangup for me..For a bra to be wearable (in my own little world of rules) the bra straps must stay put!

This is one classy belt. The Leather covering on the majority of the buckle really makes this belt look like the Top Of The Line. The leather is sewn on in a sturdy way that makes this belt a real deal. It looks great with just jeans or even a much dressier pair of trousers...You do have to remember that it is one and a half inches wide, so it works just fine on "Jean Trousers," but you may have to get a skinnier belt if you have on Real Dress Pants.I have lost a lot of weight lately and am using this to hold up my pants so I do not look like a gang banger. Of couse it works wonderfully doing this duty, but looks really nice in so doing. It does not seem to matter how much weight I loose, my waiste is stubbornly sticking in at 40 inches. I originally ordered a Medium in this belt, but it just barely made it to the first hole when I put the belt on. That looked awful, so I sent the medium back and got the Large.  A blow to my ego, but the Large looks really nice in the 3rd hole.I do recommend this Fossil belt;  indeed, I have two others of their line and find that they are consistently lovely across the whole line of belts.  Fossil puts out a good product.

I got this Lenox Ceramic Cup for my next door neighbor as a gift. She and her husband work together downtown. I see them taking off in the mornings and both will have a coffee cup at their lips. Z. was thrilled to leave her plastic one at home and exchange it for the ceramic which keeps her coffee hot until she is down to her last sip.I got one for myself that is in Lenox Pink. I can Testify that the Lenox Cup also keeps Cold Fluids Cold.So there is happiness all around.I do recommend this cup. I only wish that it came in a larger size!!!

I have had many a visitor to my home lately and "MY GOOD GUEST TOWELS" were no longer in good shape.I had tried various towel colors, had even gotten a different Shower Curtain to liven up the room, but the Towels were a disaster and had to be replaced. I was looking over the offering in Yellow Towels when I came across these Turkish Towels."Why Not?" I asked myself. If you hate these, you can send them back. I ordered six towels that were not as expensive as these. When they arrived, I was amazed. They are so, so soft, and they are SO BIG..much larger than the standard American Bath Towel, and the cost was moderate.So I took a shower using one and then ran it through the washer. It was a wonderful find.It was softer just out of the dryer than it was when it was first delivered. I had ordered a fairly "Cheap" group of towels for the guest bathroom. I reasoned that they did not have to be the most expensive available since they would only be used intermittently. In addition, if the kitties decided to try to pull threads out of these (their favorite trick with regular towels), then I would not want to "PAY A FORTUNE" for towels that were being "TESTED."Since the less expensive towels has passed their test with flying colors, I decided to get a slightly more expensive lot for the Master Bath, where I knew they would take a beating on a daily basis.So, I ordered these towels. I got two orders of three each.That number has worked beautifully for us. I got enough towels that we could mix and match colors. I must say that they definitely look upscale hanging in both bathrooms. If I was washing my hair, it used to take 2 regular sized "Bath Towels" to get that job done...one for the hair and one for the body. When I used my first Turkish Towel, I was amazed, ..one towel dried my hair, the body., and even got my backabsolutely dry.What a wonderful deal. The towels Dry me and then go through the washer and dryer and come out looking like new.(The kitties find this tight weaved towel to be of no fun!)  Even the tassels dry out straight. You do have to remember NOT to wash them with any sort of shedding fabric...like the old style towels have.) I imagine you would end up with tassels with fuzz all over them. I DID NOT try this combination to see what happened.So, I really love my new towels. I love the softness. I love the texture...the texture  that the cats have no interest in.  I love the nice, bright colors which one mix and match without the towels screaming out(We Do Not Go Together!)So now I have both bathrooms decked out in this type of towel and I am very happy with the results. So, I highlt recommend these to one and all.

lIt is really difficult for me to find petite sizes that fit. I do not knoe that this is a direct result of my body being shaped so strangely that no vendor can find a way to acommodate. That is generallyn the spiel that they give me. However, if I just accept that the legs will be too long or that the sleeves will have to be rolled up, then a size 12 or a size 14 will fit "as expected" right across the board.It seems like vendors just really do not know what to do with a Petite. Theoretically, the size should stay the same, but the length of the sleeves in a blouse or top should be shorter and with pants or shorts the same thing should hold true. The body of the garment should stay the same, with the length of the legs being shorter in both pants or shorts.Coral Bay did an OK job. Their size 14P equals a 12 throughout the body of the garment with the length being what you would expect in a 14.So, eventually, I ordered a 14P in these shorts. The lenghth was good because I am 5' 5". The overal size was good because I prefer a size 12. I COULD give the advice to go up one size;  however, this might really throw things off depending upon how tall you are and what size you normally wear.Frequently, I get so tired of this Petite size game that I just go to whole sizes: generally a 12 is good, but it seems like that in leggings, I take a 10. Like many people who order online, I have to TRY a couple of sizes before I find what I really need.Still, for me this is a better option than driving to the nearest mall, and trying on "This size" for one vendor and then "That size" with another. Of course, I put the face of the poor harassed sales lady in this equation. I would prefer to do the whole scenario in the privacy of my own home.Other than the fact that these run a bit small in a petite, I still do like them. The quality of the fabric is good and I have worn these at least once a week during the summer and on into the fall as this IS SUNNy ARIZONA.Overall, these are really niice, especially since there is a draw string in the waiste, therefore, it is adjustable.So, I do recommend thse with a bit of hesitation...you may have to order more than one size in order to get what fits you.

I purchased a Waste King L 8000 Garbage Disposal from Amazon. It was purported to come with all necessary parts for installation. It came with none. Either Amazon flubbed on the  disposal coming with necessary parts, or somebody had robbed the parts.In order to make the Disposall fit under my sink, I ordered every  part listed as going with the L 8000 so that my Handyman could get it installed. Most of the parts for Waste King, did not fit, or I needed the Old Style, or some other badly worded atrocity made the fit unlikely or impossible.But this Elbow and Gasket were one of the items with which I hit the Jackpot. The man,s face was wreathed in smiles when he saw this. He did not have to saw an old pipe apart. He did not have to rush home to see if he had a gasket this size. He just popped this on, applied a bit of Plumber's Putty "just in case" and he went whistling to the next item that attracted his attention.The pipe was just the right size. The gasket slid easily into pace on the pipe. No cutting or fiddling was required.  The gasket and pipe were made of high quality materials.My Handyman was happy with these, and if he is happy, I am happy.  We both recommend.

I cannot believe how expensive stopper beads for Murano Glass Bracelets have become. Just a year ago, I thought it was Highway robbery to pay $18.00 for only one stopper bead. Now it seems like thirty or fourty dollars is certainly acceptable.I disagree. I searched until I found these two beads at a reasonable price...definitely less than twenty dollars for two. These have yet to stand the test of time, but arrive, both of them, in a nice little packet and though they are plate, they both look shiny and new.

I am from Tennessee and grew up listening to this twamgy Bluegrass Gospel. I have always especially loved the Quartette singers with the Deep Deep bass voice that really sets this Country singing apart from every other kind.I put this on with my other Gospel Favorites and it plays continuously day and night and fills my home with lovely sounds and my heart with hope'This is just as good as having "Comfort Food" except it comes in the form of "Comfort Music." A true Blessing. Even the Air Conditioning Repairman Commented on how soothing it was!

This is a beautiful oiled copper Kitchen Sink Strainer and Drain. I am going through my home and replacing the cheap/and cheap looking hardware that came with my home when we purchased it.Oiled copper is my favorite and that is what the new hardware is.. My old garbage disposal finally bit the dust. I figured this was a grea opportunity to update the hardware in my kitchen sink. I ordered this Drain and Strainer from Amazon. They had many to choose from. Some were outlandishly expensive, and some were just cheap and cheap looking.I thought this one liiked really pretty in the picture, and the price seemed reasonable. I also bouth the draim for the disposal side with the splashguard and stopper lid. Both of these are Beautiful with a true oiled copper finish that looks lovely. I also ordered one drain and splashguard from a different company. A comparision would be nice, I thought. The other drain arrived labeled Polished copper. but it was so dark it looks black. It will go back.I am really pleased with the color and quality of this  drain and strainer. aaaaaaIt is a warm bronze color and coordinates well with my Almond sink.I definitely recommend this.

I am not entirely happy with this  purchase at all. I have other Zable beads with this pattern:  that is, they have a pink flower with greenery extending around the bead.  In stead, I received a blue bead with a white blob on it and red dots within the white blob. The white and the red in no way look like my other beads which have pink flowers on them. These were all to go on one bracelet I am putting together. The Red dots on the white circle in no way look like a flower!I have purchased many a Zable Bead. Generally on Amazon Zable Beads are vendored through Fine Jewelers. Only one other time have I had them send me the wrong bead. So I will send them an Email and inquire about the blue bead with the Pink Flower. Sometimes a Vendor will discontinue one bead and then sell a different bead under the same number.. If that is what happened, I will not be able to get the correct one, or the one I want. If someone just flubbed up and sent the wrong bead, then a replacement can be done. I will just have to see.I will plan to come back to this review with the correct information.For now, something has gone awry with this orde. The Zable bead I received is indeed a good quality bead, but not the one shown in this photo.

This is a darling little sweater that I purchased for my gorlfriend's Great Grandson. I happen to really like green as I am a redhead, but I was really interested to check the colors available for different colors of the same size. The green one was less expensive than some of the more popular colors..At any rate, this is a very styleish sweater for a 12 mont h old little boy and in the green it is quite reasonably priced.It is very soft and will be fine against a small one's skin. It is also fairly lightweight which is fine for Arizona where I live, but may not be heavy enough for colder areas. It would be fine if he was warmly dressed underneath the sweater/Mostly I was impressed by how sharp it was.

I am one of those "Birds" myself that are of the old school who whould prefer to communicate using the written word rather than receiving a message by EMail!.  I am obviously over one hundred years old...(That is a joke". OK, now that the personal confession is out of the way, I can write a review of the postcards which I purchased.I really do like Postcards. Sometimes I just need to tell a friend or or relative....or whomever, a short message, generally the message is of love and encouragement...just a few lines, a brief message and it arrives1. On a beautiful postcard2. Written on paper of very heavy bond3. The postcard is suitable for framing. or5. The person can actually hold it like a treasure in his hands6. Because the message is that someone loves him and cares abput what is going on with him...something that electronic messagews can never do.7. The birds on the postcards are beautiful, The Glitter highlightx the card  and accentuates its beauty, the heavy bond paper makes the recipient realize that this is not just a little postcard thrown in the mail to share a message. Sending a card  of this high quality require some forethought. Finding and then purchasing a postcard of this caliber requires some real effort. It just does not make its appearance at the local Walmart.8.  The act of purchasing this card announces to the recipipient that you have takenn considerable time and effort to find something this nice for  him. It is a real thing that he can hold in his hand and treasure.9. I see that many of the reviewers and recipients have found these so beautiful that they have had them framed. This is a warm, human, comforting gesture. People can treasure these for years knowing that someone truly cares for them...a wonderful gesture!What A WONDERFUL Treasure we have found in these cards. Just a few lines of prose and off it goes to be a treasure for the one who receives it.
