Yes, I am Computer Literate, But the Art of writing will be a thing that will truly cost our society if our prose no longer covers the pages of paper, but is rather sent as electronic blips that have no warmth for the human heart.These are beautiful Post Cards. Please purchase them and send them out to keep the Love that is Spread from one to another when we take up our pen to send love, which then becomes our weapon against the Mediocracy, Terror, and general Dishelvelment that is currently trying to rule our world. It is written that the Pen is Mightier than the Sword.Let Us Make It So!!

This is beautiful, beautiful music. It is absolutely Christian in its theme, with Salvation and Exhortation, and Renewal being the major themes. It is sing acapella (no musical accompanyment, and it is so uplifting, that I bought two CD's...one for my home and one for my car. I have sent a couple as gifts....to peop;e who weChristian Music.  As you probably knoe, it is really difficult to pick out music for others.  It was with hpe and a prayer that I sent the CD's to my friends, but both really liked the music.  I also have Gloryland and The Cherry Tree by this group and those two are also lovely.Obviously, I would heartily recommend this CD as well as Gloryland and The Cherry Tree. This is a 5 Star CD, so if you like goof Christian music, then order a copy for yourself, and maybe a friend also.

I got this as a Birthday Present for a friend of mine with a wonderful Wry sense of humor. He is out of town for the summer, so I sent this to him at his Summer Cottage. He goes into work three days a week, but for the other two days, he enjoys the cottage. His friends visit him and he likes to have Coffee Table Books around for his guests. Of course he has to read the book several times himself just to make certain it is OK for the guests.....that is a bit of a joke.He revels in The New Yorker Cartoons. I am not fooled.I waited a few days after his birthday and then gave him a call. Yes, "He allowed"  He had received the book and it was "Quite Goos".  That, in his language, is akin to a "Platinum Edition of a CD, or a Newberry Award for a Book. It is his Highest Praise.I know him well. Even though it is on the coffee table, he will take his coffee and sit their and read it again.I am so pleased my friend truly enyoyed this gift.So, for you out there with a wry sebse of humor, I anticipate that you may find this to be a Quite Pleasing compliment to your Library.

I have a new Waste King Gaebage Disposer. I purchased it on a Lightning Deal from Amazon. The Description of the product said it came with all the hardware needed for installation. Not So. It requires an Adaptor Kit.I am putting Oil Rubbed Bronze fittings on things in my house as I like that better than the Bright Brass that traditionally comes in tract home.When I queried Hardware for Waste King 8000 Disposers, tjis came up as a "Frequently Purchased Together" item, so I measured my sinks and it seemed that this would fit, so I ordered it.It is too big. Well, one more trip into the School of Hard Knocks. I have a Handyman who can help me and hopefully he will know what to order.

This is a beautiful accent bead from ARG' I actually bought this a year ago and have worn it on my bracelets in several different configurations.It has certainly stood the test of tiem. It is just as pretty now as it was when I got it. The silver has not worn or tarnished;  nor, have the flowers been damaged and I can guarantee you they have taken a beating on my wrist because I wear two or three bracelets at a time!THE oNLY pROBLEM  i HAD WITH THIS IS THAT WHEN i FIRST STARTED WEARING IT, THE LITTLE FLOWERS WOULD TURN AND PINCH MY SKIN. i GATHER THAT OVER TIME, THOSE EDGES WERE ROUNDED OUT BY TAPPING AGAINST MY SKIN. the feeling went away after a couple of wearings'I an very pleased with this vendor. They seem to keep the things that sell and rotate new things through their inventory. I own three of their dangles that are no longer available, but others have taken their place.I am happy with bead and this company.

I have been an aficianado of Dangling Beads since I became hooked on Murano Bracelets, beads and charms about 4 years ago.However, finding quality Dangles is a constant battle. I came upon this Asset Resourse Group (ARG). I had purchased three other dangles from them, but they are no longer available, and I had two of their beads, which were nice, but nothing terribly special.But this Dangle is A Beautiful and Wondrous find for those of us who like little dangly things on our bracelets.SIZE:  It is One inch plus 2 mm when measured from the top of the Bangle to the bottom of the Turtle. The Turtle itself, not incliding the tiny tail that sticks out is 5/8 inch. THE SIZE OF THE PERIDOT ITSELF is 3/8 inch in lenghth and 1/4 inch in width.The Peridot is lovely. It is held securely in place by six jewelers' prongs. Your Peridot will not suddenly fall out of your Dangle. It is not glued into place but is secured  just as any stone should be!IS IT DOUBLE SIDED: No it is not The top of the Turtle has the Peridot. That Peridot represents the top portion of the Turtle's shell. The rest of the shell is painted green using enamel. There are 4 little legs and a tail that stick out. They are silver.The head of the turtle is where the dangle hooks onto the "Dangling oirtionof this.THE UNDERBELLY IS ENAMELED A WHITISH YELLOW WITH THE PORTIONS REPRESENTING A SHELL BEING BORDERED IN SILVER.Well, that is that. It is a great find for a Dangle Lover.

This is a lovely bead . I had a LoveLinks (28 dollar bead) on my bracelet and ut cracked, then chipped. That vendor is no longer available through Amazon, and though I have always had excellent customer service with that vendor and their beads are still on the web, I decided to just replace the bead with a vendor available on Amazon. The cracked/chipped bead IS two years old.So, looked at a Bling bead which was yellow, but decided against it, I already have two of those on my yellow bracelet and they are beautiful, but the bead I needed to replace was more of a gold color.Then I found this Butterscotch bead by Asset Resource Group. It was more the color and price that I wanted to pay. Zable and Reflections Limited had beads that were pretty much identical to the one that broke, but Zable's beads are $29.95 and Reflections Ltd. go upward from about $32 and freqently have $5 to $8 dollars shipping added...UGHThis bead is approximately 5/8 inch wide. That includes the silver beveling.The coloreed portion of the bead is almost 1/2 inch wide. Witt the bead lying flat on my desk, the bead is eactly 1/2 inch wide.It is not quite as big as the bead that it is replacing, but that is OK. I could go to LoveLinks on the web and buy a duplicate, but the price is now $34.00. Crazy. All I would actually gain is 2 mm of with and one mm of height; therefore, I choose to take the more prudent path with this Lovely Butterscotch Bead.It is uniform in color and quality. At this price, it is the most beautiful yellow-gold bead I could have wished to find.I definitely recommend it!

These are the neatest jeans I have seen in a long time. There are rhinestone decorations on the front which start right below the waistband and continuing to the bottom of the pocket. Then there is a semi-circle of rhines delineating the curve of the pe...obviously the same on both sides.To make these jeans even more interesting, there are a sprinkling of rhinestones on the backside.At first I hesitated to buy these because I immediately thought about the rhinestones coming off in the,  wash. So, I finally made a pact with myself...these will go to the drycleaner.The pants themselves are described as being the color of CLAY;  THIS MEANS THAT THEY ARE AVERY VERY LIGHT TAN COLOR. So, They will show dirt and you will have to wear rhem carefully.There was only one thing I disliked about these, but it seems to be characteristic of NYDJ this year....the waistband comes just below my navel in the front. But in the back they are half way down my backside, which means I have to wear very much Bikini style panties, or they will show!So, I do recommend these jeans, but for me they will be for special occasions.

This is a beautiful toilet Paper Holder. I bought it to replace the old fashioned one (with the two ends which go in the wall and the center part with a spring that you have to squish to get a roll of toilet paper on it. Whoever came up with the idea of an opened ended holder which is designed so that you take the old roll off and then just slide the new one on, should get a Noble Peace Prize. No longer fo the children whine when a new roll is needed; no longer does my husband say that it makes his brain hurt when a new roll must be put in lace; and no longer do my friends whisper that I just cannot keep up with the new advances in Tecnology. Indeed, I must be the first Self Actualized Granny on my block. WoW! I am so special. Actually I just gave the Handy Man's wife some of my jeans (still new and in the wrapper) because I have lost a bit of weight and needed new ones. To repay me, she sent her husband, the Handyman, over to do some odds and ends that my husband just never got around to (YOU KNOW, The old Brain Hurting Thing again!)It is new, ir is pretty, it is functional..IT MUST BE A WORK OF ART...So Buy It!  Then you will be as cool as I am...Boy, there is something to aspire to...actually..I do recommend

I happened upon the bracelet offered by this group in Stainless Steele. At the time I was actually looking for a cheap deal on a grouping of Blue Beads. It turns out that this Bracelet was a Terrific Find.IT IS THE MOST SENSIBLY DESIGNED BRACELET THAT I HAVE EVER SEEN!I love to work with Murano Beads and have bracelets in many colors. Most of those are still on Sterling Silver Bracelets...which are a pain because they have to be polished. Even though I store the bracelets in anti-tarnish bags and the bags are in a jewelry box, they are exposed to regular air for the duration of the time that I wear them. And I may wear the same bracelets for a couple of weeks or even a month. I will put together a bracelet that I really like and then wear it to death. So, the Sterling Bracelet tarnishes, as do the silver centers of the beads I am wearing. I am not so careful of my beacelets that I take them off at night and put them away. Sorry. If I am working on the garden, then the bracelets work with me. If I am baking, then the bracelets help with the stirring. I have never had a bead fall apart because I was working. And, praise God, only once did I drop a glass bead and have it break. A Miracle.So I was thrilled when Stainless Steele bracelets first appeared. But they were like the Sterling ones when it came to putting on the beads...you had to unscrew one end of the bracelet, find a place to put the end you sceewed off, then put the end piece back on once all the beads and charms were on it. I actually have an entire section of an old fashioned "Tupperware Organizer Box"...circa the 70's..filled with various ends of bracelets. Finding the correct end to a given bracelet is always an exciting process...do I have it, or did it jump in the floor and is now playing hide and seek with me? AND i LOST THE USE OF A $50.00 BRACELET BEcause the threads on the end of it were stripped.But this bracelet was designed by a person who knew Murano Bracelets! THERE IS no screw off end. Instead the end that generally screws off is attached to the bracelet. The connection area is actually small enough that you can thread the beads over the connector. Wonderful..no more loose ends to keep track of.In addition, this company sent me a free bead with my order of a bracelet. And it was no ugly bead that no one would ever want to wear;  instead, it was a nice one.  OK'''this is a really great vendor...They have made a Bracelet that stays intact and they include a free bead..what is not to like????I only have one small complaint, and this will cost them no stars as it is their preferred design and they can set the parameters any way they want to:  their longest bracelet is only 8 inches long and I prefer an 8.5 because it can hold more beads and still fit around my wrist.So, if you hate to polish silver and are tired of trying to keep up with the screw off ends to your bracelets, I suggest you try this one. I consider it to be quite a find!!!!!

This is one beautiful belt!PROS:1. True to size: I wasn't sure what size belt to buy...so  I looked at the measurements given by Fossil and  tried to gauge the size of my waist. Other reviewers of other Fossil belts said "measure, measure,  measure. Unfortunately my measuring tape has hidden from me and all I have to measure with is an  old fashioned measuring stick which measures up to 72". So I took a piece of string and put it around my  waist, then cut it and held it up against the measuring stick to determine my waist size. It came to  38-40 inches so I went with a Large. In reality, I could have purchased a Medium. DO MEASURE.2.  If you measure with an accurate measuring device, Fossil's sizing information will give you an  accurate description of the size you need. If you are in between sizes, itis up to you...either get a  belt which is a bit too big (I am wearing my large on the third hole, or get the smaller size while  knowing that you may have to wear it on the last hole, or the second to last hole.3. The BELT is exactly one and a half inches wide. It easily goes through the loops on my jeans:  which are either NYDJ or Cold Water Creek (They are back, but doing Catalouge business only.  (I received my first Catalogue in about May or June 2015)'4.  The belt, in person, looks just as it does in its" photo.  a.  The buckle is gold toned  b.  The belt itself is Black  c.  The entire length of the belt is embroidered, which you cannot see from the photo5.  The colors that are embroidered on the belt are Tan,, Turquoise, Olive Green, Orange-Red, and  White. The Predominant colors are Tan and White with the other colors available to make the  Belt a piece of Art instead of just a functional piece to hold your pants up!6. It is a truly beautiful belt7. I was able to purchase it on sale, but I would certainly be willing to pay afossil's rregular price which  currently seems to be about 38 dollars  (September, 2015).8. It does it's job and keeps my jeans at my waist rather than having them slide way way down so  that I look like a Granny who is a Punk Rocker Wanna Be!I can think of no cons.So I do recommend this belt. If you would like to wear a piece of art with you pants, this is the Belt tochoose.

I got this beautiful ceramic mug as a Birthday Gift for my dearest friend.She always takes a coffee mug of some sort in the car with her as she speeds off to work.Once in a while, she will tell me of the failures her other mugs have been. She is certainly never one to complain, so I only find out about these failing mugs only in a roundabout way. While shooping together, I will see her eyeing some new appliance which will come with great ballyhooing about why This New Generation of mugs will keep your coffee hot or your Tea Cold much better than died after it went through the dishwasher, or was unusable because the lid cracked, or failed because it was too cold/hot outside and the thing only worked within certain proscribed temperature etc. etc.One time she gave me a cold drink with ice and announced that she hoped it worked for me OK. When I asked Why, she told me the following tale. This cup had to be kept in the freezer if it was to be used for cold drinks so the the substance in the middle of this cup could freeze and thus your drink would remain cold for an extended period.  BUT, since she uses it for hot coffee herself, she had had it in the freeaer for only 30 minutes prior to my arrival.  AND..she had noticed that the substance to keep things cold or hot, had dwindled awy with every handwashing, plus it had turned an ugly green color and quite frankly, she had found that her coffee did not stay all that warm, let alone hot, on her drive in to see her employer.So, basically, she had told me "Good Luck with this Honey. Better drink it up before something else goes wrong with this contraption."It was time she had something reliable to work with. While looking on Amazon for a travel cup that would keep things Hot, I found this travel mug by Lenox. But it was not the beauty of the mug that swayed me, nor was it that I could get a mug with my friend's initial on it, nor was it the 50% breakage warranty offered with this mug. In the end it was the reviews written on Lenox Ceramic Mugs written by HARD CORE Coffee Aficianados who described their pleasure regarding Lenox Travel Mugs of all types.I was amazed at some of the requirements that hard core coffee drinkers had for the mugs they chose. It had to bear up under Very Hot Coffee being plunged into on icy mornings where glove and coats and boots were the outfits of the morning. The cup could not crack and the lid, once applied, had to stay on through the thick and thin of the office commute. I found that the lid on the cup is like the gold dome on top of a snazzy building. If the lid failed in any way, the cup was tossed. There could be no separation of the lid and the cup; Cracking of a lid automatically disqualified the entire set up; and the most stringent of requirements were that the lid did no to drink coffee while negotiating a messy freeway; NOR,, in the strictest of requirements, could the lid be felt by the lower lip by the drinker who must only feels the ceramic on the lower mouth, never the silicone of the item capping their favorite morning wakeup call in the form of a liquid. THESE WERE SERIOUS PEOPLE WHO absolutely dotted theit i's and crossed their t's.I read many a revew od different types of cups, but those who chose Lenox Ceramic cups with Silicone lids had the very MOST STRINGENT REQUIREMENTS. They asked for perfection in items that I had not known existed..The Lenox Ceramic cup had to be the one For my friend. And, I was blessed to find that they even offered one with her initial on it!!!  Now, after all this reading about the perfection of this item, I had to get one for myself. I drink tea, not coffee and am quite used to my mouth hitting some sort of plastic lid handed out at the nearest take out window. I certainly did not have the list of requirements that THOSE COFFEE PEOPLE had.So, i found only one slight failing in  this ceramic beauty:  I wished that it had a larger capacity so I could have more tea with me!

This a beautiful, very classy ceramic cup for hot or cold liquids. I happened upon this while I was looking for a Lenox Spoon Rest for my stove. To be perfectly honest, I had never seen a ceramic mug like tnis and was enchanted when I did.I read some of the length reviews with great interest. Obviously there are those folks, I am guessing that they are Very Serious Coffee Drinkers who have listed all the reasons that these mugs are great and then there are some who had serious problems with these mugs...mostly that they cracked if a steeming, hot liquid was poured into them. Happily I have retired from the workaday word' therefore, I no longer need a cup of coffee attached IV style to my arm so that I am ready to Hit It at the approiate time.Since I l live in a desert climate, I am much more interested in staying hydrated than  being all revved up to work. This brings to my mind cold liquids rather than Hot Coffee. I read of no complaints about cold beverages, so I purchased this item with no trepidation. And so far I have had no problems at all. The container has kept my drinks cold through 3 hour get togethers with my friends; in my car when it is 113 degrees outside, my drink remains refreshing. It is accepted as a routine practice here that drinks are acceptable anywhere: shopping, at restaurants, meetings with friends, church qand even at weddings and funerals. So I take this whereever I go. I receive multitudes of compliments and several friends have gone to Amazon for one of their own.I do wish Lenox would sell the silicone lids separely as I fear the one I have will stretch out over time. amost people do not seem to see this as a problem so I will wait to see if the feared occurence occurs.I do recommend this and will probably order another after I finishChristmas gifts.

I love using these color coordinated bags in my home. SOMETIMES i use the bags to coordinate with decorating colors that I have used and sometimes i use a specific color for other reasons.For instance, ai use the red ones in the front bathroom because the Shower curtain and many of the accesories have red in them.The kitchen gets blue because it is a lovely color and I spend a lot of time in the kitchen.The master bath gets purple.By using various colors in different rooms, ai can keep track of whether or not I have gotten all the garbage and gotten it to the barrel on trash night. Many a time ai will think that ai have everything, but then will realize that a color is missing...most frequent the stuff from the guest bathroom. So I think<<WHOOPS, you have forgotten the red trash. Since I have two trash cans in the master bath, I have to double check to see that ai have TWO of the purples.For me, these are not just a pretty product, but one that works on my organizational skills.It helps that these are well made. I have never had one leak, and they are just the right size for the small trash cans one has around the house.. Now, if they would just come out with three more colors, I could do the bedrooms and the living room!I do recommend these.

This is a nice dustpan and brush set. I bought this because the review applauded the brush and said it was wonderful. Because the brush was fairly expensive, I thought the dustpan would be metal;  however, it is plastic. I should have read the reviews and the item description more carefully. In addition, the manufacturer ran out of stock once the order had gone in and I had to wait almost a month for the things to get here. Meamwhilea, ai had ordered an Oxo Goodgrips set which arrived in two days and was busy cleaning up kitty litter spills with it when this arrived.I am giving it only four stars because the dustpan is plastic and because I had to wait so long for it to arrive.The brush does get up more dirt than cheaper brushes, but the plastic pan is average run of the mill pan. The plastic is fairly flimsey and I imagine the brush will be around long after the pan is gone. aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaIi would recommend that you look for a better set...one with a metal dustpan.

These jeans run a bit small. I recently lost 15 pounds. ai was wearing my old Sherri Jeans which are a14 P, but after wearing them for a whole day, they were embarrasingly baggy in the crotch and the posterior hung in wrinkles. Plus they were way way too long. I had to wear them double cuffed or they dragged on the ground.So when I ordered these I ordered a 12P. I had some 12 P's of NYDJ that were hanging in the closet that had been too small. Now they fit perfectly. So my order for these Clarrisa Jeans went in as a 12PWhat a disaster that was. They did button and if I were a cute little teenager, I may have kept them, but I have progressed to the point that "I can no longer die young." So I sent them back and got 14P What a difference a size makes. The 14P's fit perfectly and did not stretch out as much as my older ones. They hit me about an inch below the belly button, fit nicely through the hips and the legs hit me right above the ankles.I am 5' 3-4" and weigh 160...a hefty gal I know. I claim it is all in my heavy bones!The fabric is beautiful. I have never seen fabric that is softly striated as these are. If you look carefully at the fabric you will see that the striations are caused by different weaving patters in the cloth. It is really pretty and I believe that it most prominent in these and the blue colored pants.I did order one size 12...it was only available in the grey. I think that I am just between sizes and that is a nuisance. But get these while you can.They are beautiful!!

I have not purchased this from Amazon, but generally get it at the local grocers. Here it is awfully expensive, but if push comes to shove I will order it.I use this for cat food and it generally costs 85 cents a jar. My kitty only likes the Ham variety, but this is actually cheaper than the Fancy Feast Broths she also prefers.I thought I was very clever and had discovered this Baby Food deal all on my own. But I was telling my secret to a couple of friends and they both laughed at me and said they had been doing it for ages. One informed me that she gets it by the case at Costco, where it is even cheaper than at the grocers.If Amazon knocks its price down, then I too will get it here.

I have found a new use for alcohol. MAny of us suffer from dry cracked heels and feet. One night I was at my wits end with this and my feet were aching so I just grabbed this bottle of alcohol that was nearby. I frequently use it for cleaning my tile floors.I sprayed this alcohol on my feet and immediately they were soothed. Then I noticed, that as I rubbed my feet, old skin was coming off. Overgrowths that I thought were permanent that were on the ends of my toes began to disappear. I spent 30 minutes working on my feet: alternately spraying on alcohol, then rubbing with a washcloth. When I finally finished, my feet looked like a newborns. There was no extra skin, no cracked areas, and no more flakes.I knew that alcohol was very drying, so I immediately slathered my feet with Burt's Bees Coconut lotion for feet. My "new feet" sucked this right up and since then I routinely clean my feet with this alcohol then moisturise them. ai also slleep with little booties on that keep my feet moist overnight.It has been a dream come true. I certainly recommend this.

I bought this sterling Silver clasp in two colors, red and blue, because I got really tired of my1. LEATHER BRACELETS: pulling apart because the ends which hold the clasp in place  are just crimped together and once the weight  of beads and charms becomes TOO MUCH the little crimped portions pull apart...and there I was at the Museum downtown with charms and  beads flying in all directions2.  STERLING SILVER BRACELETS: Sterling bracelets usually have some sort of a screw on device on them so that you unscrew an end, then  put your beads and charms on then screw the end back in place. If you change your bracelet frequently....put on new/different beads or  charms.....then, usually sooner than later, the little screw on ends, or the receptacle into which the screw goes will be "stripped." Once any  portion of the threads are stripped, the bracelet is shot. We are talking about a tiny interface in this instance...with the end which are to be  screwed together being about 1/16 inch in size.  Before, I realized how much pressure was being put on a tiny threaded area on my bracelets, my beads went flying 1. in a friend's car2.  right outside the door before Bible Study 3. An untold number of times at my dining room table while I was changing beads and charmsaround 4. while I was working on the computer ( then the flying beads become a special "hunt item" for the cat) and most miserably 5. Inevitably a friend would drop by and want a bracelet, so I would give her an old bracelet to practice with ie.  a. Put beads and charms on thisuntil you get a combination you like 2. Put it on your wrist to be sure it still fits once the beads and charms are in place.  Of course, the first time a friend waggles an arm, having stated that end clasps take up too much room, beads go flying. Enter the cat to hunt lost beads...she really is quite good at this.3.  STAINLESS STEELE BRACELETS: also suffer with the same problem as the Sterling bracelets..a tiny bit of stainless with screw threads is holding your bracelet together; however, stainless does not strip its threads nearly as easily as Sterling. I have only had a Stainless bracelet fail one time...and it was my fault for not assembling the bracelet more carefully.So back to the subject at hand:  Once you have a clasp on either end of your bracelet, things should not go flying. But, you have to be sure to place these on the bracelet in an area BEFORE THE SCREW AREAS. iF YOU PLACE this over the area that screws and unscrews, then if the threads pull apart, your beads will go flying again.I put two of these on one of my favorite bracelets...one at the end where the first beads went on and at the end before the screw area was reached. I have had that bracelet, a blue one,These are very high quality and keep things where they should be.There are a couple of things I am not crazy about with these:1. I think this is quite a bit overpriced....others are available at much lower prices which do just as dandy a job2. These tarnish badly..I keep mine in an anti=tarnish bag and include a strip of anti tarnish paper, but they still tarnishOtherwise they are quite lovely and I do recommend them

I had a bout of illness that left me feeling washed out and generally out of place in my own home. I was cruising through Lenox to find a gift or  two for those who had helped me so much. I happened across this as I was looking and it was like being hit by a ray of sunshine. I ordered one with the intention of giving it to one of my neighbors. When It arrived, I opened it to make certain it was all in one piece and was as lovely as it looked in Amazon's picture.It was more beautiful than the picture. For starters it is bigger> I thought it might be 4 inches by 4 inches, but it is closer to 6 x 6. I had been looking for a spoon rest to use when I was cooking, but had not found one that suited me. When I saw this I realized it would double as a lovely saying and a spoon rest that would hold 2 or 3 cooking implements all at the same time.Too bad for the neighbor, I got this and its beauty really perked me up.  The neighbor got  a ceramic coffee mug from Lenox. So we are all happy with what we have and this rests on my stove to remind me of what a great place home is.

I bought three sets of socks from Javel, one in the color shown above and two more in other colors. I did not wash them before I wore them. They were so pretty and I was in such desperate need of socks, that I went ahead and wore them, then laundered them.I was in for a very unpleasant surprise. Fifty % (50%) and I did count very carefully, of these socks came out of the washer/dryer process (one time only) and were then unwearable. The greatest offender is a seam which connects the top part of the sock to the bottom and this seam simply unravels in the wash/dry process.I was going to a movie with a friend and had on a yellow outfit, so I grabbed the yellow socks to wear. I noticed a small hole right above the ankle, but it looked very small and I thought I might get by with it. I tried to put the sock on but ended up with a top and a bottom in my hand. Perhaps pink would not be too bad with yellow. The pink sock unravelled also. I ended up wearing orange socks and looked just like your average Bag Lady.  At least it was dark in the movie theater, so hopefully not too many people were giggling as I courageously walked by.I have now had these too long to return them., But believe me, I will not buy anymore from this vendor.  I DO NOT recommend.

I am going to give this paper for writing a 5 Star review. As other reviewers stated, the paper is high quality bond. I generally use a medium felt tipped pen in my correspondence since, as I grow unerringly older, my handwriting deteriorates. When I use w medium felt tip pen on high quality bond, my somewhat jittery writing levels out and my writing becomes legible once more.  That is especially nice for the person receiving my correspondence...then they stand a chance of reading what has been pennedMy only unhappiness with this product (and it is my fault for not having read preceding reviews more carefully) is that the background color is a light tan. One reviewer stated that it was rather a cream color. To me, it is a light tan.However, though I was remiss in not reading enough reviews in order to determine the exact color of this paper, I DID read every thing the vendor had to say about this and several other colors of paper that were available. It seems that Peter Pauper Press is excellent at telling us the color and nature of the decorations found on the paper, they are quite remiss at giving us the background color. I ordered my box with the intention of using the pieces to go along with a set from another company, I had used too many stationery sheets from that set, and had many envelopes remaining. Since I thought these were pink, J thought I had solved problem.  Oh well, if I use a pink envelope with a cream/tan paper, who shall be the wiser? I generally open the envelope of correspondence that I receive without giving it a second glance. What I want to get to is the letter and what it has to say.Since I have to believe there is no "You must use matching envelopes and stationery FAIRY" hanging around to bring me woe, I shall just work with what I have and go on about my business. Just remember, This Is Not Pink.

Several of the reviewers said that this was a a very nice cross. I had been looking for a really nice one to put in my guest bedroom, so I gave this one a try. It arrived within two days, but when I opened it I was really disappointed. Like many other items that are made f some type of colored, molded plastic, this one looks to be exactly what it is: An item made of molded plastic with the plastic being colored by a process not discussed. Like several other items that I have looked at made by this process or one similar to it, this one has a tawry, cheap look to pt. I set the cross far away fro me (I had planned to hang it over the closet doors, near the ceiling in the spare room...so I was trying to figure out if it did not look so cheap if it was viewed from a distance) and tried to decide if it looked OK if I were not so close to it.Distance did help. But there remained the problem of reading the words on the cross.  One has to get pretty close to the cross, within just a few feet, in order to read the words. One loses the judgement of this being a nice looking piece if one is close enough to read the words.  This also made the "over the closet doors" a problematic position for this piece.  If it is far enough away that it does not look so cheap, then it may be too far away for a guest to be able to read the words.  Now There Is A Predicament!Unfortunately, as I thought  I had found just the perfect sentiment with which to soothe a weary visitor, I am going to have to send this back. Right now I have a cross above said doors which is just a plain little cross.. Perhaps it says exactly what needs to be said...nothing more than its mere presence....then each guest can fill in any empty blanks in prayer without the nuisance of added verbiage.I am not crazy about this cross, though I find it's sentiment to be beautiful and strangely haunting. Perhaps it fill your needs, but I will send mine back.

Though I am not Jewish, I know what a Mezuzah is. Since God grafted the Gentiles into His Original Vine, which would be The Jewish Nation, I do not think He would mind if I borrowed a tradition which belonged to them. I, too, want my home to be given His protection and blessing. I was browsing around one day looking for a cross that I could put on a barren area of my wall. While doing so, I happened upon this lovely Brass MEZUZAH written in nice clear English, rather than the traditional Hebrew.  What a find.PROS;1.  The Mezuzah is Solid Brass; therefore it will not rust.2. It is a nice size for putting on your doorpost: ACTUAL MEASUReMENTS:  a.  The LENGTH: Including the projections through which the screws will go is 5 1/2 inches  b.  The BODY of the item without the scerw hole areas is 4 1/2 inches  c.  The width is 1 1/2 in ches  d.  The depth, including the rounded area on the body of the Mezuzah is 3/8 of an inch  3. INSTRUCTIONS FOR PROPER PLACEMENT are included  a.  SLANT the Mezuzah with the top inclined toward the door  b.  SLANT the bottom toward the outside of the door  c.  PLACE this on the upper third of the doorpost at eye level...if you are VERY SHORT or VERY TALL, you may want to place this at the  eyeball level of a more average sized person....I see the Jews touch this item before they enter a home so they are covered with God  blessing while they are in a home which is not their own. Since I rarely enter my own home through the front door, I tend to consider this  more of a blessing for my guests, though I consider it a continual Blessing/Safety Net for myself and those who live with me.  d.  Once you have decided upon the placement of the Mezuzah on your doorpost, attach it with two screws...they are not included  e. FINALLY, you are to recite the following blessing over your new Mezuzah:  Blessed Are You Oh Lord Our God, Ruler of the Universe,  Who has Sanctified Us by Your Commandments and has Commanded Us to Affix The Mezuzah.  f. In  Hebrew, the word Mezuzah, means DOORPOST.  CONS:  1. No SCREWS are provided for the attachment of The Mezuzah.  2. Since this is Brass...NOT BRIGHT BRASS, but with some antiquing on it, I would like to put it up with similar screws, but I do not have any  this color, I will have to go to the hardware store to get a couple, but I do not know if I can buy just two. In today's world, I may have to  get a whole pak. I guess that is OK because screws are not something that show once they are in place.This item is sold by Holy Land Gifts. Their Phone Number is 1-800-564-4659.I do recommend this item, even with no screws. It is really pretty and the instructions for placement are quite clear.

I love to read, read, read!!!  I always have 3 or 4 books going at any one time. Many a time, they are very heavy duty Christian Books, or books about current Theology or some such. So, I always try to keep one novel going and sometimes I think a Comic Book would keep me happy.I ordered one of these New Yorker books on Politics for a friend of mine and while I looking around, I espied this book on Literary Cartoons. I bought it for myself and have read it twice already. I will give it to my friend later. He is a dyed in the wool reader also. So at least two of will enjoy it and of course guests will read it also.My only complaint on this one is that it is too short!!  I wanted more>>>

I was lucky enough to try to lose some weight and stuck with it and did so. Hoorah. In the process I went from a bra size 42 D to a 38 C. I know that many of us do not go around whooping for joy when our boobs become smaller, but in this case I did. I was sick and tired of searching and searching for a pretty or even decent looking bra when I was a 42 D. I found that I could fit into nursing bras (God Forbid...I am not 25 any more), or I could have my choice of very practical WIDE STRAPPED bras...UGH NO! So, when I became a bit smaller, pretty bras actually fit into my realm again.I was very blessed to have Amazon initiate its annual Labor DaY Sale at that point, and this time I was happy to scan the offerings that Amazon put forth. I purchased this Simone Perele Andora bra in Poppy Red.  The white and beige and lighter colored bras tend to still run at higher prices, but Poppy Red was available at a totally reasonable cost. (For some reason the computer seems to think I purchased this in Ivory, but, not so..a bright Poppy Red is what I am currently wearing.Without a doubt, it is the most beautiful bra I have ever owned. I went back to peruse other colors this afternoon, but they are all hanging in at about $89.00 and I am just too Scotch to part with that kind of money for a bra.  Although, who knows, in the future, I may decide it is worth it.I was lounging around in my grungies, reading a book today and a friend called and invited me to go to a meeting at church with her. Well, the book was a 500 page tome and I would much rather be with my friend, so I showered and then went looking for my Poppy Red bra. The meeting was at one oclock. It is now 7:00 PM. If I were not writing a review on this bra, I would not even be aware that I had it on. It is that comfortable.The straps adjust from the back, which I like better than the front adjustiing ones. They stay in place and do not go wandering off my shoulders in search of my waist. I have been known to get the straps adjusted just where I want them and then stitch then in place to washing does not disrupt their placement, nor does extended  wearing or anything else that gives them an excuse to jump off my shoulders.When and if, this bra goes on sale, I will get another color. I feel like a princess with it on!!!

I read the reviews on this particular cross and found that some were good and some were bad. In those instances, I have discovered that it is generally a gamble to order such an item as it is a stroke of fate to see what you will receive:  some are good and some are bad, so I take my chances and go for it!This time I was on the unlucky side of the coin toss. The leather on my cross is a dark dark brown and I was anticipating a medium brown that then darkened toward the edges. Not so for me. The leather is just dark all over. Additionally, it is starting to curl like the reviewer who posted pictures shows.I looked at many crosses before I picked one. I needed a fairly large cross and this one fits the bill in that area. I also did not want turqioise or any other stone in the middle of the metal one.  So I hoped this plain metal one would be attractive, but since the leather is so dark, the silver color metal goes poorly with it and the black cross under the silver metal one is just lost in a sea of dark leather. I had to look really hard to even find it. It provides no contrast at all.So, I find this cross to be poorly made and it certainly did not fit the bill for me. You may get a decently made one or you may get one that is not so good as I did. Mine is going back. I would not waste my own time again and do not recommend this item.

The reason I think I really enjoyed this book is the characters themselves. The way the author has set them up then went from there gave it full body. Chloe makes a statement that many a woman has made but when they meet the right man it can turn that around. Ryan wants a night of just being himself away from the ice but then he runs into Chloe. They hook up and once it is in slowly sinks further and further. I could just picture her face too when she finds out that he is a well known hockey player when the kids from a charity she is with, are on the ice with the players. The way the author takes them off from there is like a speeding bullet kinda with a little harmless blackmail too. The two of them meld so well together and when they do come together they could melt the ice he skates on. He is with someone who is for real and she is with someone that keeps the game on the ice. She will find herself doing things she probably swore off more and more. The chemistry is such that the personalities is what I latched onto, added humor between the two was a plus too. But with all well known people sooner or later the press will paint them black and that is where drama will start and emotional side will be tested to the limit. I love how she ends it that with a sweet touch added that wraps it up nicely.

One thing is for sure I found I liked this one better. Having read the one before it I liked the characters and the storyline because Jag had quite the challenge set before him. Alix might be the girl he remembers but the girl that comes is there thanks to seeing something that has her running away from her ordered life for a minute. I for one am glad she goes to the ranch, and this author takes you along with them as he melts away the hurt by showing her what a real man is all about that can love. Nothing better than seeing a woman also grab life with two hands going for the real romance. As he brings her to life for the first time you enjoy every step of their journey. You will also find a smirk on your face when her jerk fiance that was comes calling too. Just as the title says she gives you one with this novel.

First off I must say after having read many of her novels I think this one will be one of my favorites. I say this because it will show how in order to overcome fear patience fueled by love is the key to it when it comes to a relationship. It starts a healing process and opens up the gates to allow feelings such as happiness to have a chance to once again be experienced where once it was all closed off. By now many have found their mates around him with his mind wondering if he too could have that chance. Little did he know that when he went to give his estimate to one lady who had quite the reputation with even the word Ice being used, that his was right before him until he touched her. Jared did not know that Taryn did not touch anyone for she had a fear since she had the gift of pyrokinesis. I do not think even if he knew it would of stopped him anyways. This author gives you their story with humor mixed in with raw emotion. Another discovery will be her son and how special he too is. There will be many discoveries in this one with old enemies coming to the surface as well. It would also seem that how and why she did end up here in the first place will be uncovered with not just one needing the information. Jared will show her how love can be patient and strong to overcome many things. He will unlock her in ways she never thought to live again. She will also be his missing piece because he too has a secret that even the pack is not aware of. Danger too will have to be met and faced with her no longer being alone in the battle. Once you open the pages of this one you will be swept away until the final word.

This author starts out by giving you a glimpse of Jack and what made him the man he has come to be today. The way it is done you are drawn to him thanks to the talent she has in her writing. You are now also firmly seated into the story with him and his guys going over what has brought them all together at Jack's place the hub of it all. They have been requested to step in and find a killer whom has alluded most agencies. As they are looking at the files alarms go off alerting someone is on the property and gotten through the line of security. They find they have one elderly woman who has managed this followed by another striking young woman. The scene itself catches you unaware but captivates you with how it must of looked. Bethany with her grandmother are from the property next to his that the rental cabins stand on. This author lays the foundation on their story with you following and latching on to these two and their feisty personalities. A perfect match for Jack I think. Be ready to be transported along with this high drama filled suspenseful romance that as Jack and his team go after a killer he also begins to get wrapped around Bethany. She is taking care of her grandmother while running the business does at times have her hands full because of her grandmother's Alzheimer's. They begin to fit in with each other and what is going on their relationship building. The intensity and at times raw passion that quickly forms into a love that is deep I would say for both. Danger though also has it's sights on her and when it reaches out and grabs hold you might find yourself gritting your teeth so hard to chew nails especially at the climax. Suffice to say the level of suspense is superb with the right amount of romance to feed any reader's addiction. Her ability to take you and embroil you in, but also keep you locked in it through it all capping it off with gently rolling you out, happily exhausted but satisfied at the end is what a reader craves from any novel they enter in and she delivers it with this. Her novels have become done with a style of high caliber that you look forward to each one.

So wonderful this author has taken me on another journey with none other than a dragon that can come heat my bed for the winter. Seriously though she has taken this dragon and personalized his quest that will include not one but two beautiful ladies. By the time you are finished with their story you are yet again reminded why dragons are a favorite and a love of many. Kara is one resourceful cat and she had to be, but having been gone longer than she wanted at all because it was not by choice, Cayden is not going to let her close to Nyna. Nyna is his even though she is human she has through alot. Someone has killed her parents but the case is still open and now cold. He is also cursed and only true love can break it. He wants to start the dragon's web if she will have him but he will soon find out Kara is also part of her life too. So much to keep a reader embroiled in a suspenseful hot story that you too will find yourself being part of the dragon's web. You get their story and the answers to her parents murder thanks to curiosity that opened that up.

Every once in awhile you look for something different because too much of same thing gets blah but not with this author. She has story lines and characters that are different especially since subject matter is not over done. Faith is doing what she dreamed and loves her dogs and takes to building trust with abused and unwanted dogs by fostering them. Plus she knows how it is to be abandoned. Then there is Tanner who came close to death's door but given a second chance he ends up helping a town's shelter. When they meet at the shelter that is a new door that opens for the both of them. Funny too is the trust factor on both of them is same and check up on each other. Faith though begins to notice something strange at the shelter and curiosity will lead her into danger a time or two. Of course Tanner no dummy he too notices some things and the two of them together uncover some stuff that would get anyone's blood boiling. Of course do not forget the romance it is in here, sweet and sneaky that catches these two that are perfect for each other. With the hair curling ending event this author will wrap up their romance in perfect way-fur and all.

I know that when I open one of her novels I am going to get transported into different that is a style all her own. She captivates right from the start giving you characters that you learn about and then fall in love with going with them through their story. While I was reading this one I really sympathized with Ned and wanted something, anything for him thanks to those Wizards. In this one you go on a grand adventure with him. She will also have many other characters in here that will support the story perfectly to a tee. There will come a point when he will have to choose though especially because of Amanda. The funny thing though thanks to this author I would be so caught up in this story that I would zone out everything around. Of course as with anything there is dark and light but the ways of it seem real enough in here. Fighting and armies are also part of it but not like you think the magical kind. She does not forget the romance either it does come alive in here with in my opinion love being the victor.

This is the first time in reading this author for me and even though I see alot that it says she is erotic author, I like she has a story to go with it. This is also alittle different than most because it has a flavor of paranormal, biker, mixed with that. One thing I do know is that this one was a raw, passionate mixed with drama paranormal. Her characters I came to adore, first with the boldness of Tabitha whom finally sees him too-Finn. When she announces to the club's alpha and president that she knows they know what she is and she wants to be their type of wolf, oh boy she will get a whole different reality than what she thought. When Finn realizes just exactly what more there is to Tabitha he does what he must. The only thing I disagreed with where he was concerned he should of been more up front with her at times. Rich story with a couple of unexpected events with when you reach the end you might find yourself whining like I did that it was not longer.
Easy to put on and fits fantastic. Great value for the price. Long lasting to keep screen the way a reader wants it. Shipped in a timely manner which was a plus.

I do have to say first off that I think I liked this one better than the first one because you know more about what is going on. That Daire also thinks he is all that and he certainly is but he will meet more than his match. Cee Cee might be something he is looking for but she will give him something unexpected that will set the wheels turning in a chase that will be the beginning of their forever. Gleefully you will see her take him down and start her plans that will have him chasing her, good thing for her but will be the first of many turbulent adventures in fulfilling her plans. Humor also when her kids find out their mom is doing some crazy things and with Daire of all people whom they blame haha. It also will be the start in shutting down some serious places that is harmful to alot of people but also a set up is in the works that comes to light. Another thing that comes to light is exactly who Cee Cee is and just how special she is. I like that when they come together they both get something special that neither was looking for or expecting. Needless to say this author has done it again a provided another fabulous read that even though it is wicked it is also delicious.

It did not matter to me that I did not read the first one because of the star line up of authors that it contained. If I can not read paranormal, I crave novels such as these and to have this many back to back I was in lala land. What captured me right away is the precept that they were ghosts and I do not mean the Gothic kind either. They were that way for a reason but each author gives their comeback a stunning return in a way that fits them and the reasons for it. Not to say the danger is over either for them but love will drive many. Not all are male either we are also given a mighty strong female that will blow most away. The relationships are intense with each author giving it their special brand to their story. Through the dark pieces there is the light that will heat up each one. I actually thought by the time I would be done I might have a slight case of OD but I was quite sadden when I reached the last one and finished it especially since it had me on a roll most times. These are the finest given you their finest with love that now will grab them to the point of meltdown.

I do so enjoy reading military romance. This author knows how to write them right. this one will also pull at your heart strings and keep you transfixed as this story develops as you read it. Ryan had known he was going to marry Elana but before he asked her he had enlisted. I know personally that has caused a rift or two in a relationship but that being said it does go with who you are with if that is their heart's desire. Elana does say yes but then you see the struggle she has and the wear and tear it puts on their relationship once he is in training. Oh my then it gets really emotional but love will have to work overtime. The thing about love it will overcome many mountains as this author will show. She will tell you what Elana does with her decisions, time will tell how it all works out.

Funny how some think they can match people up and are very good at it. She is also very talented but Chole also gets excellent results. When one alpha who must do what he must do even when he does not want to goes to her for a mate but how can she find him one if he doesn't believe in love? Oh just love those stories when one or the other does not believe in love because it will prove them wrong every time. When she becomes his temporary one they both I do believe signed up for one wild and crazy time courtesy of love. As this little war plays out this author will give you sizzle and burn with it so be careful of the sparks that will fly out. I also love when a alpha will meet his match per say. Kieran will also have a bit of a war between his wolf and self as he fights love. Of course Chole packs quite a punch because of who she is and even when a bit of a challenge for his affections comes along I say the other one lost before she started. Funny how saying I Love You can put fear into even the strongest. This author gives you one that shows you no matter how you try and think you can, you can not fight love. There will be a winner in this and glad I witnessed it.

I do not get to read as many as I would like novels set back in time, but when I do they must be full of adventure. This one was more than I asked for. To my special delight one of the pirates is a woman whom is full of adventure and daring, very much the Captain of her ship. This author pulls no punches in how she starts this out full of a fight going after a treasure. Catherine does know how to fight and she does not sit back either. Thomas does not give up without a fight even when he realizes that his opponent is whom it is. This author though will give you their adventure that will keep you fixed to their story. She has her reasons and even as their relationship grows the fire from them both, their sparring will thrill you,plus it will be the best romance in quite awhile. There will be some surprises at some turns but never a dull moment. She will get far more than what she set out to get even though she does not think so until this author gives you a ending that will put them on another adventure of a different kind.

Read the first one in this series and loved it so just had to open this one. This author knows how to weave you in with the magic of her writing. Serenity is the one here who has alot to face even with her abilities. Then there is Alexi whom you will eat right up. Plus they have met before. He works for a different area and he has been watching her quite awhile now. They both have things that are special about them and together they will explode. Your heart will race for them especially when he thinks he can not have forever. Threats must be stopped and that too will keep you on the edge of your seat or where ever you read from. I do so love when a author though can take and put love in charge because it can go against all odds and overcome mountains, foes or rules. High level of action for those that crave it with your romance. But through it all she will give you what you crave and want with this one especially since love sees the inside and she will give you a ending for them that will etch a satisfied smile.

I really enjoy reading this series from this author. Each one gets into your heart and grabs ahold. This one was exceptional a heart wrencher because of the basis. You adopt but then someone shows up needing to know if that child is theirs because they did not know and things could drastically change in the blink of a eye. Alex has several challenges, she is about to loose the dream of owning the bakery and Hayden pops in with the news he needs a DNA test to see if maybe her daughter is his. Well written and a flow that once you are on it you do not want to get off because of the emotions that swirl with having to know the answer yourself. You also see that a relationship is building and with the romantic at heart I have I so want it all to work out for them because of what is written of her past, she deserves the best. She will play on many of your emotions but best of all is the characters in this series and as she focus is on one of the girls in each one you really fall in love with them. I will say I was surprised with the results and loved how it was written unexpected endings are the best.

You first are given her heart stopping nervousness everytime she sees him which leads to daydreams on her part. Mary Alice is relate able because women that hide behind walls after too many hurts seem to look but can not seem to touch. Bridge though kinda set her up I would say purposely using that eye candy build to make her sweat. He has to get her on his side for a undercover that has to do with her neighbor. Undercover and stuff like that makes for suspenseful reading but she has added in a hard to crack wall thanks to her past that cops no way is that her cup of tea. This will catch your interest, have you so caught up in their relationship that when the drama hits the fan you almost forgot why they met in the first place. It starts slow the drama that is and speeds up and ends well with a nice touch at the end.

This is a nice romance that is set in the south and so enjoy reading about B&B's. Savannah is home after her mother's death to meet her brother and sister and see about the B&B left by her. Thing is she did not plan on coming back and the memories are alot. Logan also has many of his own but he is also here for his company he works for to buy the place that has become the one of the town's landmark, but also thinks he can not have the girl. Their story is like a second chance but they have both hid their feelings from each other but others did see it in the past. The past will in way meet the present with things coming out in the open. Some parts though are kinda long that could of been quicker but when they interact with each other they have a special blend together with bits of humor mixed in even when she is steaming mad at him. Time will also be short if they are to save the place because of past money owed which gives it some suspenseful moments. Regardless of all the outside forces they will build something better this time with this author giving it a heartfelt wrap up.

I was glad to find the time to read this next one in this series that is breeze to read thru. This one is also more focused filled with a touch more suspense type thriller. Maile like the other women was on of the ones that chatted in the group on line and met with them to then settle in Seattle to start their own business. It seems though that while the other three are on cases she is not quite there yet but when she does she gets a whooper. Also being alittle homesick she is in search of food from her home here that really is the taste of home and finds it. Kalama is as intrigued by her as she is of him. Her case though will touch of possible murder with him being one of the suspects later. She reels us readers in and takes us on a nice little adventure that could turn deadly if not careful which is the kind of reading I so enjoy. It having that touch of romance in there makes for a bonus all the way around. This is also one I am glad I got to read that makes this a fuller series for me.

I just love this series and when this author has another one to offer in it I can hardly contain myself. She knows how to make this come alive and the characters melt in your mouth. Jazz is a bodyguard and she is given a special summons so special how could she refuse. Her charge is one of the seven and also key to saving the day thanks to being the scientist he is. Now to find Rockwell Burns will be another thing which she is part of her specialty. She also needs to work out and finds the perfect place with Conner hiring her to boot. Little does she know but senses that her charge is right under her nose. There is also a attraction between these two and when they do connect it is enough to melt the mat. Anyways she will reel you in with this one because who doesn't love a sexy genius but the two of them together is some exhilarating reading within itself. There is also others that want to find Rockwell for their own reasons,so when the majority of the seven get together to plan it will come together with more electricity to keep you charged. Jazz and Rockwell make a good team they fit so well together with this being another piece to this series that keeps you panting for more.

Sometimes i am reading so many books I forget until thankfully a author sends a reminder of a release of something I said I wanted to read and smack my head oh yeah. So when I relooked at this blurb I thought now not too sure forgot time travel in it and do not read too many of those any more but hey grew up in the seventies so okay. I am introduced to Desi and she is at the end of her rope per say thanks to a accident but she happens into a what is a psychic's place and she is told some pretty wild stuff. She follows it to Bernie's museum home, he was a R&B superstar after all, and wow she is there in his time. Thing is though a month later in a car accident their lives end. So this author gets you back to that time also but you are on pins and needles even during their wonderful building relationship. You get so far hooked into them that you are desperate for something, anything to change. This author will deliver one emotional story that will capture you taking you back and forth. Even when you get what you want she still will be dancing on your heart strings because of poor Bernie. She does know how to bring it all around to the point that with love being the bridge you get full circle and ya it sure was "deeper than perfect". Gotta love when a title aptly fits the book. So now I am more than glad I read this one.

In this one the author delivers exactly as she says. The title says it all with this being something I have wanted from a author like forever. The most you get is references in a next book from a series with you craving for more. This one I so was in book heaven enjoying every step of the way she takes us. Even though they are the main-Jack and Leila, you also get filled in and more of the others also. It does not mean she does not pull your heart strings though because I do believe some parts blew it up. The little girl for one. Even Matt will put his wonderlust to bed hehe. Alot of authors could take a page from her because we do want a novel like this when we have really connected with characters. She still though has one left to go who I am now so much more curious about it is maddening. Trey thinks he as escaped but has he?

What a great treat just before the holidays. Since I have enjoyed getting to know Drew and Betty this was perfect getting another visit. It gives you more of a taste of how their relationship has grown but also they still have some growing to do. Betty is also up in the air on this whole Christmas thing but Drew wants to have a holiday that bring everyone together. They first will have quite the trip when a toy train is found with a raging encounter that will lead to meeting new acquaintances and one old one. Betty will also do step in when a tree is decorated to find out her answer. On top of that she will throw Drew a request that had me picturing his jaw dropping to the floor. She will also get some insight from a unlikely source that will open her eyes. That is only some of what this little gem contains with I am for sure most will just eat it right up.

I have read this author before but this one for the most part kept me on the edge of my seat because of anticipation. Andi goes to take a trip to scatter her mother's ashes but ends up in trouble;e when mud and rocks come down and also avoids a bear. When she is later rescued by said bear he also bits her which opens the door to a different road for them both. She later wakes to find she is with the ranger Mac and they must wait at his cabin until help can come for her. During that time you find out all about Mac and also the consequences of that bite. You also realize they are perfect for each other but because of his heart he wants it to be her choice. You just know everything would be ok between them just love her already and do not let her leave. Even though things are changing inside for her she does not have a clue. She just knows that after she has gone he has filled her thoughts and heart and she must see him again soon. From there you are really hollering come on already but this author tortures you with the slow dance and another encounter with a bear that makes the other bear defend her. Seriously though this is read that will have you wrapped around her little finger until you find out what will become of the two of them.

How does a street cop feel when he is assigned a job of watching his brother's intern thanks to the magnitude of the case Declan will be doing? Hot but the interaction that goes down when they meet each other is just a part of why this book will have you being a Velcro baby with that book stuck to your fingers but still able to turn the pages. this is not their first meeting and Tess is mortified when she sees it is him. This though will be the beginning of the end of her isolated life thanks to her father and with his touch will be the start of how she blossoms and opens up. this is also my first time in reading this author so I am delighted to say she has the gift to bring her characters to life in such a manner that you are right there with them every step of the way in your own little bubble. Your heart will go out to Tess but as she warms you will also see there is more to her than she hid. She also has the ability to accomplish much thanks to her determination and intelligence. Another taste of her and Curran soon finds himself addicted to her in such a way that she becomes more than just someone he watches over. He does have his own demons in which as they grow she will get him to begin to take steps in healing. Oh and that father and say that loosely because he is one sick daddy-o. Surprise is what he will do when he brings her before his siblings because of his standard dating material that to me shows he just wasn't looking in the right places. They will be what each other needs with what builds between them the excellent part of this reading. Danger will come forth though in more ways than one with when you are done know that you do not want to mess with Curran.

This is the first for me in reading any of this author's work. the title and the description drew me in. Once I opened the pages it was the writing that was a web that kept me there. Angus is one character that is predominate in here that you encounter first. He is sent to investigate missing dragons but also the truth in a death also. He can go between worlds and times which was fascinating reading within itself. He encounters Arianrhod whom is also sent to investigate. The two of them pair up and in doing so they also ignite something between them. He also is given some of his missing pieces but that road goes a different way than I expected. She is also what he dislikes but that does not seem to stand in their way once they come together. There is so much involved in here with many characters that bring this all about. Everytime they seem to be on to something, another question arises. There will be a gift from their time together that will be very important indeed. With very careful laid plans it will be quite interesting to see if it comes to pass. She does know how to put the heat with this lore that is the perfect combination to not want to miss a word.

This is just the right follow up to the first one with even if you did not read it you still would not be lost. The writing style of this author is such that she engages you right away sweeping you away as Luke and Andi begin their own careers but still are together. The fire that consumes them both they have for each other is still burning bright. The thing is that at first they have not told each other there will be a separation period because of his training and her traveling with the band, along with her singing her own stuff. Trust will be the no.1 challenge for them. Saying and doing are two different things. Plus it does not help with media coverage and help from another corner of setting the stage to ignite that mistrust. As it consumes them this author will consume you right along with them playing you like a fine fiddle. You will also want to bang your head on the wall because of the media coverage that amps up the jealousy but you know the truth. Your heart will get twisted when Andi gets twisted. Your anger will engage when Luke gets angry but for different reasons. This is one fine emotional journey until it climaxes with truth comes to light and the wake up call will sound. You hope it will be heard and love will reign again. She will take care of you though do not fret and give you a ending that you will not want to smack her for.

This is the first time in reading this author for me and I sure did enjoy her writing style. She easily enticed me into the story with the intrigue of Sophia going to help it's owner sent by someone claiming to want to help save the inn. Oh and one of my favorites there are ghosts too. Garren needs a answer because he can not loose the inn. He has been its guardian for years but now it is time to save it. You are taken with these two as the hunt for something to help but come upon a mystery that even includes the one who sent Sophia. As they find some answers they are also given some clues that tie this together but time is of the essence. You also find out Garren secret when him and Sophia come together one night with her also being a very important key. though modern day it has a delightful touch of Gothic mystery romance, with them being so delightful to read. Excitement will fill the air bringing you to the edge when they work together to stop evil and save the inn but in doing so alot more will be gained that is the kind that lasts a lifetime.

This is the start to a engaging series that in each one has its own brand of mystery. This one lets you know why these girls branch out on their own and they could not of made a better decision. Thanks in part to her uncle her and her friends are able to buy and take over a detective agency. River gets recommended by her uncle to a brother and sister who need her help with a cold case involving their parents. The elements are solid and prick the interest with intrigue right away, and on the back of that is contact with the one who initially handled the case. Gage will not be your average small town cop who thinks women can not be good at what they do but he is defensive none the less. Actually you get a pretty good feeling that Gage is one fine cop. As the time goes on in this they will even find a way to work together. Even though this is a basic who done it, it is stamped with her style and branded with romance that gives a warm touch to a murder mystery that needs solved. Along with this is another element that will need solving almost like a missing person's one that is key to the brother and sister. The characters are a delight and with everything that goes down with this one you will be caught up as you should be in a well written suspense. So at the end of this one I would say that River is very happy indeed with her decision.

This is the first time in reading this author and the title is what drew me in. To be honest though it took me a minute to get into the novel, my own fault really because after the prologue I got distracted by something else. So when I picked it up again after Danny has been retired and is approached by Angelica to temporary be in the agency my interest went into hyperdrive. Angelica is different and description by author excellent. The reason for their teaming up is to catch a killer of the vamperic kind one who Danny has be closer to than anyone of late. Vincent is a serial killer also, so heavy training for him. There are other paranormal they will go after in this time. During all of this you get to know these two intimately with Danny also getting flashes of the past. He soon finds out they are real. They are also getting closer to each other. There will be a event though that will drive Danny away except for business only which will pull on your heart strings for Angelica. You also find out why she is so special and wish he would quit being such a you know what. Anyways the more you read the deeper you become part of this novel and wanting to see more from this agency too. When you do get to the final parts you are transfixed wondering what will become of these two even if he did walk away. She has sympathy on her readers because it is not quite finished yet.

Just when you think you are going to get some time away at a perfect beach house that is very much needed, surprise you see someone unexpected too. Jilly is renting a cottage at a beach but stops at service station with some eye candy to view while waiting. She soon finds out who goes with it but none other than her boss who Dominic and glad he did not know how she had drooled. He too is on a break to surf a place who used to come to often. Soon he will find out just how close she is to him right nearby. Funny thing about this cottage though it is also thought to have a lingering occupant. This author takes these two blends a excellent romance with splashes of humor. They get to know each other besides the work place and it grows from there. chuckle with the funny pranks that will go down ones that will at first have Dominic trying to change her mind on staying there. Also just who did rent the cottage to her? The answer to that was one that was part of the special touch to this story. He will find out that it was done in love with a match made in heaven so to speak.

This is the first one for me to read by this author even though I have been wanting to for awhile now. If this is how she always writes than wowzer she is a keeper to turn to for reading. Some favorites are in this-bikes and wolves, oh and yummy guys. Lyric and her friends go out for the evening but she runs into a bit of trouble with some undesirables. Rowan does not let on he sees trouble but steps in for a rescue coming away with something extra for it. Lyric grabs him, his truck and her bike after claiming him for their pack and goes to his house to bide some time. She should of known though they would of not had much. This author then goes to give you their story along with how this pack deals with traitors and trouble. She also gets herself a mate that I would say fits her to a tee. Hard to explain but this was a quick excellent read that has lots of action and fire that quenches anyone's thirst. I found this group to also be a little different because of their club which is needed in today's plenty to choose from line up in this genre. I think Rowan will fit in quite nicely with them all especially Lyric.

I just love entering into novels that hold a big promise, one that will immerse me into a emotional sea. First it was the title, than the blurb that had me anticipating. The prologue is the beginning of the two actually even though you are caught up in the drama of the quickly unfolding event. Little girl Gracie will always remember her hero-David. The one though surprisingly that really holds on to that little girl is David. Time moves on they move on until one night they meet again by chance. Celebrating Jade and Gracie are out but there is also a third wheel who is not so nice. He gets meaner as the night rolls on and she has had enough. Just so happens the bar they are in is a firefighters bar and her hero will rescue her once again. Ian his friend and fellow mate eggs him about her. Who should show up at his station but Gracie with by now this author has my attention front and center. Once they establish later on at another place she is his Gracie they will begin the dance o fa much heated courtship. She also is going after her career and he has his nights he is on.
