What is Macro? The ability to shoot objects, such as a ladybug, at extremely close range. For example, for a recent wedding assignment, I tested this Zeiss to photograph the rings at extreme closeup. The jewelry was very, very sharp! You could not get the same sharpness with the Canon 24-70mm or Canon 70-200mm f/2.8L lenses.Focusing in low-light was quite speedy, and so I am looking forward to using this lens with the NEX-7 on my upcoming honeymoon.The biggest gripe with this lens is its cost. That's the price, however, that you have to pay in a market where there aren't that many good alternatives available for the NEX cameras. Perhaps the cost will drop once more quality lenses enter the market.The only concern I have is that neither the camera nor the lens are weather-sealed, potentially allowing dust and moisture to enter the camera. This is true for most cameras with interchangeable lenses.

I purchased two Revues when it was first released (about 3 years ago?): one for my parents, one for myself. The premise of being able to watch Live TV, surf the web from a desktop-style browser, install apps (this was introduced over a year after the initial release of the Revue), watch Netflix, do TV-based video conferencing, and the ability to watch DLNA/network-shared movies was exciting.The Revue was, at its initial release, a mess. I will not address these as that's in the past. Logitech updated the Revue to the Android Honeycomb-based Google TV software, which introduced installable apps. Logitech eventually and abruptly abandoned the Revue due to dismal, and sold the remaining units in a flash sale.I will not review the Google TV software itself. What I will cover, however, are items specific to the Revue, and why I ultimately got rid of it and its associated TV Cam.GOOD:1. Netflix streaming quality was consistently better than the same app on the Sony BluRay player I had. Its interface was also better than Apple TV v3: as you fast-forwarded/rewound through the movie, you were presented with thumbnails. Apple TV does not do that.2. Keyboard was nearly full-sized, allowing for quicker typing. The included TouchPad also worked very well, and using TWO fingers, you could scroll up and down pages with it. It was very responsive. Compared to the Apple TV, Roku, or PlayStation 3, finding things was galaxies easier on the Revue keyboard.3. Logitech added unique value to the Revue, which was both a good and bad thing. Good: Video Conferencing ability (more on that later) and ability to play movies from network-based shares. Bad: manufacturer customization can delay the release of updates. The Revue was consistently behind the competition with getting the latest software updates.4. Movies (DivX, etc.) played well from network-based shares (Windows, NAS) via DLNA. The browser interface was a bit clunky, but it worked.5. Logitech TV Cam, when working, was excellent for video conferencing with the parents. See the BAD section for more.BAD:1. Logitech abandoned the Revue. Do not expect any more updates from Logitech, though Google promised to still support the product. During the time I owned both Revues, updates were far and few in-between.2. Chrome web browser was horribly slow. I often found myself browsing on my smartphone or tablet instead.3. Amazon Prime and NBA apps were abandoned. They no longer worked.4. Logitech TV Cam, which I had used to do video conferencing with my parents, was a pain to configure. Ports had to be opened in the firewall, and although I am an IT Systems Engineer with sufficient knowledge on firewalls, I had struggled getting this to work. I couldn't imagine how an average person could set this up. Once it was up and running, video conferencing worked GREAT... Until the Honeycomb Google TV update. My parents' TV Cam still worked well and doing a test call to Logitech VID's test account succeeded. I could never get it to work on my own TV Cam at home again. Video conferencing was now broken, and the Revue was primarily used for Netflix viewing only. I have been considering to get 2 Logitech TV Cam HD units, which is a stand-alone, HDMI-connected, Skype video conferencing device.5. Memory leaks would eventually slow down the Revue, requiring a reboot.I ultimately sold both Revues and the TV Cams after my parents replaced theirs with the Apple TV. They lost the video conferencing ability, but an iPad or iPod via Skype or Facetime over AirPlay would suffice. They are quite happy with the Apple TV.My brother gave me an Apple TV v3 as well, and after playing with it, it reaffirmed to me that I do not like Apple's closed ecosystem or its tight grip on the use of its devices. I am eagerly awaiting for someone to jailbreak/hack the Apple TV v3 to allow the installation of XBMC, freeing it to do things that I liked the Revue for: freedom from shackles. Ability to play movies from network shares, and more. Alas, this review is not about the Apple TV, but about the Revue.I do not suggest you purchase the Revue. For $99, there are better Google TV alternatives out there from Vizio, Sony, Asus, etc. However, I feel that the Google TV platform still has a long way to go. Roku, AppleTV, WD TV Live Streaming (my choice among the three) are not as extendable as Google TV, but are far less frustrating to use. I am happy to see, however, that we are seeing more and more TV-centric, connected devices being introduced.NOTE: those of you who still own the Logitech TV Cam for Revue, note that Logitech is discontinuing its Logitech VID service due to the availability of other video services, such as Skype. Since the TV Cam ONLY works for the Revue (well, I got it to work with Windows 7 before after tinkering with drivers), Logitech is offering an exchange program for qualified owners. The exchange program ends sometime in September 2013 and started April 18, 2013.I had been a long-time customer and supporter of Logitech products: keyboards, mice, speakers, and remotes. However, with the sudden abandonment of the Revue, its poor support of the Google TV platform (during the years when the manufacturer still provided official support), and its questionable call to lock the TV Cam to ONLY work with the Revue (and not PCs/Macs), left a VERY sour taste in my mouth. The quality that the company used to be known for severally dropped, making me question whether I would purchase another Logitech product again. The company has an uphill battle to win this customer back, though the recently-announced exchange program for the TV Cam was a good, first step in the right direction. Kudos to the new CEO!

This case mirrors my review for the Sony-made case. As such, I will paste that case's review here and edit it for the MegaGear one. The edits will be enclosed within brackets like so: [edit]."This case fits the NEX-7 perfectly with the kit lens attached. It also fits with the Carl Zeiss 24mm f1.8 Sonnar E-mount lens on. The lens hoods have to be taken off the lenses or mounted in reverse to be able to fit.The case is made of [a leather-like material] and has a [less premium] feel to it. The camera is attached to the Half Case via the tripod mount. This presents a problem. More on that later.How does it protect the camera? It certainly protects the camera well against day-to-day bumps during everyday use. However, I am concerned that if you drop the camera in it, depending on the angle of the impact, the NEX-7 and/or its attached lens may not fare very well.Another concern I have is against dust: the side openings are large enough for dust particles to enter. As an experienced DSLR professional photographer, I have had situations (early in my career) where grains of sand deposited onto the sensor during shoots at the beach. Similarly, I have had moisture enter the camera body during shoots in the humid Amazon rain forest. I do not believe this case to adequately protect against those environments. However, the case will sufficiently protect the camera against light rain.Some reviewers at other sites have commented that this case can block the rear LCD from being pulled out. This is partially true -- yes, the LCD cannot be pulled out easily. Perhaps that's a plus: it'll help prevent accidental dislodging of the LCD. The way to pull the LCD out while attached to the case, start by pulling on the bottom of the LCD, not the top.Since the camera body is attached to the case via the tripod mount, the Half Case (the part that is screwed onto the camera's tripod mount) unfortunately blocks the battery slot. This is quite frustrating: access to the battery and the memory card are blocked until the camera body is unscrewed from the tripod mount. This is the MOST frustrating part of the case.The case does allow for quick shooting without taking the camera out: simply unclip one of the buttons located at the bottom right of the body, flip the top portion of the case over and under the camera, and you are ready to photograph. With the case hanging the way it does in this position, it does make you look like an amateurish, ridiculously-looking tourist or photographer.So, fashion-wise, this case looks ridiculous when you open it to photograph, and the blocking of the battery/memory card door is ridiculous. The biggest plus for this case is the fact that it does not add bulk to the camera. As such, it serves as a good protector of your camera while being transported in your backpack or carry-on suitcase. For its price, ... this case [is a good alternative to the Sony one.][...]One of [this case's] buttons broke the moment I unclipped it to put the camera body on. [I promptly returned it and didn't bother to purchase a replacement.]I had considered purchasing this case: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00489L6BQ/ref=ox_sc_sfl_title_8?ie=UTF8&psc=1&smid=A3E5K6GEFSI075 (EveCase Digital Camera DSLR Video Camcorder Pouch Case for SONY NEX-7). I may actually buy it.

This case fits the NEX-7 perfectly with the kit lens attached. It also fits with the Carl Zeiss 24mm f1.8 Sonnar E-mount lens on. The lens hoods have to be taken off the lenses or mounted in reverse to be able to fit.The case is made of real leather and has a nice feel to it. The camera is attached to the Half Case via the tripod mount. This presents a problem. More on that later.How does it protect the camera? It certainly protects the camera well against day-to-day bumps. However, I am concerned that if you drop the case with the camera in it, depending on the angle of the impact, the NEX-7 and/or its attached lens may not fare very well.Another concern I have is against dust: the side openings are large enough for dust particles to enter. As an experienced DSLR professional photographer, I have had situations (early in my career) where grains of sand deposited onto the sensor during shoots at the beach. Similarly, I have had moisture enter the camera body during shoots in the humid Amazon rain forest. I do not believe this case to adequately protect against those environments. However, the case will sufficiently protect the camera against light rain.Some reviewers at other sites have commented that this case can block the rear LCD from being pulled out. This is partially true -- yes, the LCD cannot be pulled out easily. Perhaps that's a plus: it'll help prevent accidental dislodging of the LCD. The way to pull the LCD out while attached to the case, start by pulling on the bottom of the LCD, not the top.Since the camera body is attached to the case via the tripod mount, the Half Case (the part that is screwed onto the camera's tripod mount) unfortunately blocks the battery slot. This is quite frustrating: access to the battery and the memory card are blocked until the camera body is unscrewed from the tripod mount. This is the MOST frustrating part of the case.The case does allow for quick shooting without taking the camera out: simply unclip one of the buttons located at the bottom right of the body, flip the top portion of the case over and under the camera, and you are ready to photograph. With the case hanging the way it does in this position, it does make you look like an amateurish, ridiculously-looking tourist or photographer.So, fashion-wise, this case looks ridiculous when you open it to photograph, and the blocking of the battery/memory card door is ridiculous. The biggest plus for this case is the fact that it does not add bulk to the camera. As such, it serves as a good protector of your camera while being transported in your backpack or carry-on suitcase. For its price -- RIDICULOUSLY overpriced -- this case should be passed on. If it weren't for the good deal I got for this case, I would have immediately returned it.The similar (but aesthetically less premium) MegaGear Ever Ready case looks even worse. Stay away from that one. One of its buttons broke the moment I unclipped it to put the camera body on.I had considered purchasing this case: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B00489L6BQ/ref=ox_sc_sfl_title_8?ie=UTF8&psc=1&smid=A3E5K6GEFSI075 (EveCase Digital Camera DSLR Video Camcorder Pouch Case for SONY NEX-7). I may actually buy it.

I purchased this backpack from REI two years ago for traveling to Peru/Machu Picchu. A big concern was my expensive camera equipment ($5,000 at the time), and I wanted to have a bag that would be able to house the Canon 5D Mark II, Canon EF-S 24-70mm f/2.8L lens, and various other items.This pack fit the camera and lens (both kept inside a small LowePro bag) well. What I liked about this backpack is that it has a metal mesh at the bottom and bottom front, making it difficult for someone to slash through the bottom and unknowingly removing your equipment. Furthermore, the zippers can be clipped and hidden, making it slightly more difficult for a thief to quickly get into.The reinforced carry straps also make it difficult for a thief to perform a grab and run, and one of them is removable, allowing you to attach the backpack to a solid object or a chair while dining at a restaurant.The material is solid and as well-made as a wilderness backpacking-type backpack. It resists abrasion quite well. There are also many hooks for you to attach various items. You can use inexpensive carabiners to further extend the amount of items you can hang.By all means, this backpack is not intended to be as safe as ... well, a safe. My advice is that if a thief tries to grab the backpack and won't give up (or shows a weapon!), it's best to let him or her have it if your life is in danger. Things are replaceable. You are not.Travel safe. Be safe. Be aware of your surroundings. Do not look like a victim. No well-made backpack will make you safer than being aware and looking like you would be a tough target. Like trying to break into an alarmed and non-alarmed car, thieves would rather hit someone weaker than you (in this case, the non-alarmed vehicle.)In my case in Peru, when I was traveling through an area that did not seem safe, and there weren't other tourists in my group, I would stash the camera equipment inside the bag. Again, do not make yourself become a target. Be smart.

The items arrived quickly (within a week), and the cover fits the iPod Touch 5th generation perfectly.The best way to apply these types of screen protectors is to follow this procedure:1. Open the package.2. Clean your hands and fingers afterwards. You may have caught some paper particles onto your fingers while opening the package.3. Ensure the area is free of dust.4. Thoroughly clean your screen with the included microfiber, and blow out any dust with a can of compressed air.5. First, remove the film (as labeled) on one side, and slowly align it over the holes.6. As you lower the rest of the film, smooth out any air bubbles with your finger in a horizontal motion.7. If you see any dust particles or small bubbles, lift up that part of the film, take a piece of tape, and use it to remove the dust particle from the protector.8. Keep repeating Steps 6 and 7.9. After the protector is fully applied, remove the top film, as labeled.10. If you still see dust particles somewhere, take another piece of tape and place it on top of the protector. Use this tape to slowly lift up the protector at the spot where the dust is at. Again, use another piece of tape to lift the dust off the protector. Repeat until satisfied.I repeated the last step (10) about three times before my protector was finally perfectly on the iPod Touch. Absolutely no dust particles or little bubbles can be found!The protector does its job of keeping the screen scratch free, but it also is a bit on the frosted side (it's matted), diminishing some of the beautiful brightness of the iPod. On the other hand, the matted finish helps prevent glare.

I am an avid hiker, wilderness backpacker, and run at least 4 half or full marathons a year. One thing that tends to occur a lot with me when running marathons is the dreaded cramping of my calves and thighs. I purchased this product to help put compression on the calves in an effort to streamline blood flow, minimize cramps, and speed up recovery post-race.I purchased the Medium size, and am 5'7" in height. It has a nice, tight fit on the calves and was the right size for me.To help you select your size, consider the below measurements from another manufacturer. Note: calf size is a better measurement for which size to get.Sleeve Size, Calf Size, HeightX-Small/Small, 9.5 - 12.5", 5'3" and belowSmall/Medium, 12.5 - 15", 5'4" - 5'10"Large/X-Large, 15" and up. 5'11" and up[Update 3/18/2013]I've worn these sleeves during an intense workout, and was amazed at how my calves felt. They were well-ventilated, stayed cool, and most importantly, I felt in excellent shape with no signs of cramping! I have definitely been recommending this product to all my fellow athletes!

I am a professional landscape photographer since 2005, and not until the release of the 600EX-RT, did I find much interest in putting Flash to work. I owned three 580EX II's, but did not want to invest in PocketWizards or any other type of triggers.With the 600EX-RT's built-in radio, I finally made the plunge and sold the 580EXs to get 3 600EX-RT's. I must admit, my experience with multiple flashes has been limited, but with the included manual, setting up the various groups was a breeze. I was able to use all three flashes within minutes of reading just a few pages of the manual.Because these are radio-frequency controlled, you do not need a direct line-of-sight (the 580EX requires it). So, you can position the flashes in any way you want, and all of them will communicate with each other constantly and without hesitation. Cycle time is amazing, and the flashes do not overheat as quickly as the 580EX II's.It is also nice not having to carry around multiple batteries for both the SpeedLite and external triggers (ie. PocketWizard), making for great weight and bulk savings. One less equipment to worry about on a photo shoot.Canon sells a newer control unit (ST-E3) to be mounted on your Canon dSLR (I own two 5D Mark III) for use with the SpeedLite 600EX-RTs. However, Canon took a step back with it from its predecessor by removing the autofocus assist beam. For that reason, I purchased the 3rd 600EX to be used as the Master unit by simply setting it to NOT fire a flash.Get the Canon CP-E4 battery pack to help flash many more times and to shorten the SpeedLite's cycling time.The case is much improved over the 580EX II's -- it comes with a built-in velcro strap that allows you to attach the bag to your camera bag for ease of access. Further, it also comes with a small loop with which you can use a carabiner to attach with as well.The 600EX-RT also comes with a Color Filter Holder, and an Orange filter. They both can be easily transported in the included, smaller bag.

I am a survival enthusiast and wilderness backpacker.The light is very bright, excellent for cave exploration or wilderness backpacking. It is well-constructed and sturdy. The biggest problem is the carry holster: it broke easily. I contacted Customer Service, and although I had language-barrier problems with a Chinese representative via email, I eventually was connected to their USA branch, and its customer service manager sent me a replacement holster on the 2nd try (they sent me the incorrect item on the first try.)
I've owned this for a year and use it to shuffle full-size board game cards. It has done so reliably and accurately. It has not yet failed (knock on wood!)

I am a professional photographer and amateur SCUBA diver. I purchased this housing to protect the PowerShot S95 camera. It works and fits well. The only issue I have is that it does not provide the ability to control the wheel where the lens is found, making it difficult to shoot in Manual mode (ie. adjusting Aperture/Shutter Speed)

I have been using the LoseIt! app for Android/iOS (Apple) to keep track of my weight losses and gains, and one annoyance I always had was remembering to record my weight measurements. This scale makes that convenient.It records your weight (for up to 8 individuals), and sends the information via WIFI to Withings.com. From there, LoseIt and other applications can receive the readings.The app and website provides a nice, graphical view of your weight history, including a trending graph -- that graph was instrumental in helping me see that I was INDEED losing weight, despite seeing my weight bouncing up and down hopelessly. It was right.When you weigh yourself, and you are similar to other users (in my case, my 2 brothers), it gives you an option to select which of the users you are by simply shifting your weight. However, the only issue I have is that there is no way for you to let guests use the scale without messing up the reading of the programmed individuals. I wish that the scale would ask if you are a guest or one of the users. I often have to go to the website to delete/correct readings that were not made by me.All in all, a beautiful, convenient scale.Battery life: it worked great for a year. On the second battery, the battery lost its charge fairly quickly (within a month or so.) I discovered that my WIFI access point was performing spotty during that time. After I fixed that issue, a fresh set of batteries has worked well again. So, those concerned about battery usage being too high, check if the scale has sufficient strength going to your WIFI router.
Bought this for my mom-in-law who is an avid tea drinker. She loves it. Said that it's convenient, holds the hot temperature well. It looks nice.

I am an avid wilderness backpacker and carry expensive gears with me.I bought this item to cover my then-girlfriend's Gregory backpack, and it fits well. Holds securely, and keeps everything dry. I was also able to use it on regular, non-Gregory backpacks.Stuffs away conveniently.

I am a professional photographer and IT professional. My previous CompactFlash card reader would not read the newer CF, SDHC cards. I purchased this one, and every card I throw at it can be read.Looks great as well.

I purchased these to more easily transfer information from/to Micro SD cards from/to my phones and tablets. Works very well, and is small enough to not add too much eye sore to your laptop, or having to worry about accidentally placing something on a larger USB stick and breaking the laptop's USB port.It also comes with a convenient string you can loop through the product.

I absolutely love the taste the liquid provides when added to shabu shabu or any other soup dish. 2-4 drops works great for me, although 2 or 3 seem to be the most popular among friends and family. The liquid provides a slow, even burn at the back of the throat -- a "kick" that I thoroughly enjoy in my meals.This liquid is one of my secret ingredients for my home-made jerkies. Adding 50 drops or so to my 8 lbs of meat gives it just the right spiciness -- and that "KICK" -- that EVERY SINGLE friend, family, and colleague has consistently complimented me on.The biggest gripe I have, however, is that the eye dropper's plastic LITERALLY melted. I do not know if this was a result of the liquid somehow bonding with the plastic, but it is a big, big health concern. I kept the cap in my kitchen, and also carried it with me to restaurants at times. When I noticed the plastic melting a bit, I kept the whole bottle in the fridge, just in case the California summer heat caused it.With the eye dropper completely disintegrated, I transferred the liquid to a glass jar for the time being. I will buy another one in the future, and will see if the eye dropper melts again. I hope not.Regardless, wonderful spiciness!

I am an avid wilderness backpacker and hiker, and wanted a watch that would give me compass, temperature, and altitude readings. One that would not require batteries, preferably.This watch fits the bill. It looks manly, provides lots of information, and although I disagree with the decision to replace the sunset/sunrise times from the older model with the Tides (useless for me for the wilderness, but of course, great for surfers and those looking to go explore tide pools), the watch is still very useful.The pressure indicator on the left can be helpful in predicting possible storms coming your way. When the pressure drops significantly at each reading (like this: \ instead of a gradual decline), rain is very likely approaching.For temperature reading to accurately work, you have to keep the watch off your wrist for at least 30 minutes.

This product is very small and portable. I am an avid survival enthusiast, hiker, camper, and wilderness backpacker. I wanted something to keep as a backup in case my Jetboil failed.Works with any standard butane gas canister.

This is the sharpest knife I have ever owned. I purchased 4 of them, one for myself. It cuts through fruit and sushi (raw fish) like butter. Feels great with its evenly balanced design.This knife is made of multiple sheets of metal, and manually hammered together, creating those indentations you see on the blade side. From what I have been told by a knife expert, this design is what gives this knife its sharpness and performance

This product is well-made, and very comfortable to wear. I am an avid half-marathon/full-marathon runner (I do about 4 a year since 2008), and needed something to carry my phone, ID, and keys with. This fit the bill.I keep my phone and ID in little sandwich bags to prevent any possible sweat from ruining them, although I did not run into any severe wetness issues. It also did not have much bounce while running.My bib gets attached to the belt loop via the safety pins.The only issue I have run into, after two half-marathons, was the inside pouch ripped. Presumably this is because of my large Samsung Galaxy S3 phone being too big for it (meaning, I may have overpacked the bag.) I'll stitch the pouch back to the bag and reinforce it.All in all, a highly recommended product.UPDATE 2/22/13: I took a closer look at the ripped, inside pouch, and found that it could not have been caused by my phone or "overpacking". There were smaller tears visible at the still-good areas, and my conclusion is that the rips were caused by the velcro that closes the inside pouch inside the bag. The velcro must have caused enough strain to the material. If that is the case, then buyers beware: the nylon appears to be of poor/old quality then. I didn't bother to send the bag in for repair or warranty service. I opted to sew the pouch back and, in the process, reinforce that area to counter-act the velcro's force. Further, to prevent my ID/money/phone from getting wet, I will continue to place them inside plastic bags.

I am an avid survivalist, hiker, camper, and backpacker. I was looking for a cost-effective, environmentally-friendly solution to use for when my JetBoil or any other fuel-based product would fail on me in the wilderness.This product burns wood pieces very well and fast. The fire lasts surprisingly long, and not many ashes are left behind. It does get dirty, but the convenient carry pouch makes this a non-issue.I wish there was a way to control the temperature of the fire for cooking non-liquid items (such as frying or baking in the wilderness.) However, this is not a flaw of the device.The hole at the top allows you to conveniently add additional fuel without having to take off the pot/pan.It's light-weight, and a must-have for your survival bug-out pack.As a bonus, it also acts as a small firepit with which you can warm yourself up with.UPDATE 12/10/2013: Almost a year after buying, it still works great. There are no moving, mechanical parts to worry about. So, I expect it to pretty much last a whole lifetime and more.

I am an avid wilderness/backcountry backpacker, and was looking for something sturdy and convenient to cook with without adding too much bulk to my packed 75L backpack.I purchased the 1.1L, and it's able to hold a small butane gas canister, salt and pepper shakers, hot items carry handle, and many other smaller items. It packs very tight and well. Cleans fairly easily with sand/stones I find near lakes and streams.Its construction is so solid, I know that this item will last me a very, very long time. I'm keeping one for my bug-out survival pack.The handle is not as flimsy as other reviewers have noted, and the lid serves as a convenient lid to eat from.

This timer allows you to use its built-in pins to set specific on/off times. It's so highly configurable, you can have it turn on/off devices every 3 minutes or so.Has worked flawlessly and reliable for the past 2 years I have owned two of these products.

I am a professional photographer since 2005 (7 years), and was looking for a convenient bag to carry around with on photo shoots and on travels.This item has many convenient options. It allows you to attach a tripod to the bottom, has straps on the sides to allow you to attach Canon SpeedLite 600EX-RTs in their carry bags. The main compartment is deep enough for you to fit a Canon 5D Mark III with a Canon 24-70mm f/2.8L lens attached (stored vertically or horizontally.) It is not, however, deep enough to leave the lens hood on.When the aforementioned camera and lens is stored horizontally in the bag, there is enough room for you to also carry around a SpeedLite 600EX-RT at the bottom.With that said, I still prefer my ThinkTank Retrospective 5 bag because it (1) comes with a rain cover, and (2) it's much more discreet than this Lowepro. The logo tells people that you have camera gear in it, something I'd like to avoid when traveling through countries with higher poverty rates. This bag, however, is bigger than the Retrospective 5.

I purchased these to more easily transfer information from/to Micro SD cards from/to my phones and tablets. Works very well, and is small enough to not add too much eye sore to your laptop, or having to worry about accidentally placing something on a larger USB stick and breaking the laptop's USB port.It also comes with a convenient string you can loop through the product.

I have used two of these to make many, many dozen pounds of beef jerky, and my parents use one to dehydrate bananas, persimmons, and other fruit. They have been reliable. The only issue with this product is that it does not come with a timer to turn on/off the dehydration process.Get the Westinghouse T00448 2-Outlet Indoor Mechanical Timer.Get the Nesco SQM-2-6 Clean a Screen for easier cleaning and removal of dehydrated items.Get the Nesco SQT-2 Add-A-Tray for adding additional trays.I have made several dozen pounds of beef jerky over the years, and each batch (except for one that was semi-spoiled -- am no longer buying cheap meat!) was well received by friends, family, and coworkers. I don't want to get into legal trouble by someone reading this review and pointing out that my instructions were bad for making jerky due to food poisoning or what not. So, I won't get into how I'm making my jerky. Check out YouTube and search for "Alton Brown Good Eats Beef Jerky". He'll give you a good starting point.

I had never installed any internal after-market products in my car before (with exception of a trailer hitch). I went to ToyotaNation.com and YouTube to find how-to's, and found one thread with pictures at ToyotaNation.com for a similar Toyota Highlander. This helped guide me enough to give me the courage to open up my car panel and work on the audio system.I had purchased the USA SPEC BT35-TOY Bluetooth module for my Toyota Highlander 2008 Sport and was thoroughly dissatisfied with that product's poor sound quality. It had no bass oomph.So, I took a chance and purchased this PAC product with their Complete iPod Kit. It was easy enough to install. The iPod cable is thick and solid, and although it worked with my iPod Touch 4th generation, I have since bought the 5th generation with the Lightning connector. You have to purchase a 30-pin-to-Lightning adapter if you want to continue using it. However, keep in mind that the adapter is only useful for CHARGING your iPod. Audio would not play through it. Bluetooth, which is what I bought this kit for, would be the only connectivity option.Sound quality is superb through Bluetooth! Much, much better than the BT-35. No hissing, plenty of bass response. It does not sound as good as a CD or a direct cable connection, however.I connected the module to be used as my SAT (I don't subscribe to Satellite radio.) I wanted to keep AUX available for cable connections, and still be able to play CDs.Bluetooth pairs fairly quickly, but you have to be quick: have your device ready to be paired, THEN turn on the radio on SAT (or wherever your Bluetooth module is configured to connect to.) This will then pair the device. If you miss the pairing, simply switch to another channel (AM/FM/CD), and back, and it'll attempt to pair again.The Number 2 key on the stereo acts as Pause/Play, the Track Up/Down is for switching songs, and the Number 6 key is used to control the iPod by Voice. The Steering wheel controls work too.I decided not to use this kit for pairing with my phone. Let's say you are listening to the Radio, and your phone receives a call. Unlike what's mentioned in the product description, the radio did NOT switch to SAT/Bluetooth to take the call. I had the same problem with the BT35-TOY, and didn't bother to troubleshoot it beyond what I had already checked.However, if your phone IS paired, and you leave your radio on SAT/Bluetooth, it does take calls well. Sound quality was decent and the other party could not tell that I was on Bluetooth.The microphone can be moved around easily, and the manual even gives you some guidance on how to reroute it to your rear view mirror. I opted to leave the microphone hidden in the dash for now (again, I do not use the phone functionality.)It paired well with my iPod Touch 5th generation, 4th generation; Samsung Galaxy S3, Google Nexus 7; Laptop equipped with Bluetooth.Please keep in mind that if you are watching movies or play games, there is a slight delay of what you see on the screen and what is heard. So, if you plan on playing games (passengers, not drivers!), this product's delay is disappointing. For movies, it's somewhat... with some reservations... acceptable. I'd recommend using the AUX audio cable for watching movies in the car instead.In the end, I am fairly happy with this kit, and because it is modular, I know that I can add other functions in the future as needed.EDIT 4/25/14: I recently got a "NOT AVAIL" message on my car display while trying to pair Bluetooth with my new phone. I initially wasn't sure if my new phone was to blame, but the iSimple wouldn't pair with my iPod either. I immediately went to look for instructions on how to reset the iSimple. I suspected that there were too many devices paired with the product, and I'd either have to reset it, or remove devices from its pairing table. The manual was a bit difficult to understand, but I eventually figured it out, and am now sharing my findings here.1. One method to reset the iSimple is to disconnect it from the radio overnight. However, I did not want to open up the car and do so.2. This method allowed me to adjust many iSimple settings:a. Hit the "3" button. This changes the display to "Settings".b. Hit the Tune Up button. It'll now show "BT Search". Keep hitting the Seek/Track Up button to cycle through the choices, including "Devices", and "Remove".c. To select an item, hit the "3" button. Cycle through the choices via the Seek/Track Up button again.d. I removed all paired devices until none was left. I was now successfully able to pair my new phone to the radio, and everything was working fine again.e. If you don't want to make a selection, simply wait a few seconds, and the menu will exit itself.You may also adjust the speaker, microphone, and other volume settings by cycling through the Settings screen. On my car, everything was set at "12". This probably is the default setting.

This product was fairly easy to install. I found instructions on ToyotaNation.com on how to open up my Toyota Highlander 2008 Sport audio apen.Bluetooth paired very easily, but the biggest gripe I had (and the reason for why I returned it): audio quality was HORRIBLY thin/tinny. Although tech support responded quickly (I wanted to see if there was something I did wrong), I was too annoyed by the poor sound quality, and decided to return it and purchase the PAC ISTY571. I couldn't be happier with the PAC system. See my review of it here: http://www.amazon.com/review/R1N38VYVE7XMN2/ref=cm_cr_pr_perm?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B004HMC6DQ&linkCode=&nodeID=&tag=

I'm normally a fan of Griffin case protector products, but this time I decided to take a chance and purchase a less pricey one. It shipped fast and fits my iPod Touch 5th generation very well. The clear rubber looks just like the clear one pictured here (frosty, not glass-clear.) I decided to take advantage of this see-through cover by placing a small label at the back with my contact information in case I lose the iPod and a good Samaritan finds it (one can only hope!)The case is NOT non-slip, but when pitted against other rubber, it doesn't slip as much as a case made entirely of plastic.The case sufficiently covers the face of the iPod without adding much bulk. It's slim and should provide sufficient protection from minor drops.The only concern I have is the protection of the bottom portion of the iPod's face (where the button is located). The case does not extend much there -- iPod is nearly flush with the case at that area.Nonetheless, I am happy with the purchase.UPDATE 4/25/14: the case has turned a yellow tint.

My television has been at a spot in my apartment that receives very poor television reception. At most, I only received 3 of the mainstream channels, and so I decided to purchase this product.It has a well-written manual, along with tips on how to mount the antenna in various scenarios. I opted to hang it along my wall way above the television at a 45 degree angle (it didn't work well at that one spot vertically or horizontally.)It hides well (you can put it behind a picture frame), and most importantly: it picked up SO MANY channels, I consistently receive comments from visitors about how many my TV can catch. I have to keep telling them that I don't have Cable TV service. Yes, it's that good.

I have been a professional photographer since 2005 (7 years), and recently decided to pick up this book to see what new things I could learn from it.This is an absolutely great source for learning how to use single or multiple flashes in various scenarious, in-studio and outdoors. It is well-written, easy to read, and has many illustrations and before/after examples to look through.Even if you don't have a Canon SpeedLite, and although this book doesn't cover the newer SpeedLite 600EX-RT, this is a GREAT reference for anyone wanting to learn Flash photography. Amateurs, enthusiasts, and professionals... Point-and-shoot/Automatic-setting individuals... Nikon, Sony, Olympus, Canon, ... anyone.
My wife loves it. Well-made, soft to the touch, and very cute. I gave it to her for Valentine's as a surprise gift while on the way to the San Diego Zoo to see the newly-born baby Panda.

I am a professional photographer and need batteries charged all the time. I needed a product that would minimize having to carry around multiple chargers, and I wanted something that could charge a single battery (or charge batteries according to what each one of them needed.)This product was recommended by a fellow photographer, and sure enough, it charges each battery individually. There are several modes you can activate (manual was easy to read), including cycling/rejuvinating the batteries. Each indicator was easy to read.I was finally able to bring just one of these with me on shoot instead of having to carry two. I am looking to buy another one.

I purchased this during a Gold Box deal. I'm a fan of SanDisk and Kingston products due to my experience in the IT field, and I was a bit skeptical of Patriot ones.I have used it to transfer files back and forth multiple times, and each time they transferred very FAST on USB 3.0. It also works with USB 2.0 (most common type today).Product has a small hole for you to loop a holder through, and I wished that they had provided such string.Nonetheless, it's fast, looks decent, and doesn't require a separate cap to protect the USB connector. Simply move the smaller cap (where the Patriot logo is) away or toward the body to expose/hide the USB connector.UPDATE 12/10/2013: still works perfectly fine. Works great with my Surface 2 and Surface RT.

This product was easily applied and, unlike the types of screen protectors you place on phones, it did not seem utterly out-of-place. In fact, the black frame makes it look as if it's part of the camera.The larger protector that you place on the rear LCD covers the corners partially, but not enough to really find it as a big issue.The only issue I have with this product is for the smaller protector: it leaves a large bubble at the center despite multiple attempts to re-apply it. I also applied another one to my second camera, and it has the same issue. Nonetheless, it does not diminish the use of the equipment.

This is a breakthrough for drinking a glass of quality wine without opening the bottle.The Coravin system ingeniously punctures the (real) cork with a needle and injects inert Argon gas  to create pressure.  This pressure forces out as much wine as needed but leaves behind an inert Noble gas that doesn't affect the wine.  In essence, it's as if the bottle was never opened even after removing a serving.Obviously, this is not intended for inexpensive wine that you would drink in a few days; rather; it's intended for wines that are special that you might just want one glass of and the put back into storage.  We all have those special bottles pf wine that we don't wan't to fininsh in one sittting and the Coravin lets us do that.

As a photographer I could only wish to capture such stunning images.This type of book is often known as a coffee table book because its so nice that you could leave it out and your guests would probably pick it up and browse through it.  The book is large so the pictures are like small posters.  The dust jacket is a large poster when removed.The time and effort that went into these pictures is amazing;  Each one conveys an emotional response and thee are over 250 photos;The photo album is fantastic..

Not a big fan of the Treyarch versions over the past 4 years,  Can we please let WWII go?  I don't want t go from fighting a future ware to fighting in WWI and the Zombies in Campaign.  I don't mind Zombies and WWII as side missions but  not,in the the middle of the game .I don't like the limited load-out setup.  I want to be able to equip weapons I found on the field in my load-outs and not just pistols and launchers in my secondary slot.  My go-to war load-out is a LMG wit thermal sights, grips,fast mag and stock;  My secondary in a rocket launcher which I will drop for a good thermally-equipped auto if I pick up another rocket launcher on the field.The Super is kind of useless or I haven't mastered it yet.  Either way it isn't needed.I'll play this once on campaign and never on PVP so this game is not the best for me.
Sample received.I got this working on my iPhone 6 Plus with good results.  The lens is very good quality and made from metal with good glass.  The tripod and other accessories are included.
Sample received.Really nice hat made from a loose knit,
Sample received.I really like these cables over the cheap-feeling plastic version.  They have a nice braided exterior and aluminum ends.  The length of 10' helps when I'm far away from the charger.

This attachment fits on my Dyson's wand and I can use it to get under low thing like my sofa, beds and coffee table.  It works really good considering there is no rotating brush and just the suction from the wand.

This would be great for small cats or kittens but it is too small for adult cats.I put this together myself in about 20 minutes using the included hex wrench.  Once together, my cat inspected it but didn't like the dangling balls so I took them off.I'm not sure what the hole on the second level is for but it's the only place an adult cat had a chance of lying down.  The top perch may support a small cat or kitten but noting over 7-8 pounds.I like the sisal scratching wheel and I hope my cat figure out to use it.

These 100% down pillow are the best but you have to replace them every so often.I've washed them with special down soap but they're never the same.  Every 2-3 years be prepared to replace these pillows.  I look at it at a cost per day which is about 7 cents/day if they last 3 years.

Sample received.This product is not the same as the real survival pocket chainsaws.  It's better than nothing but being a camper for years I'll take a sharp hatchet and a file if my life depended upon it

I really like high cocoa content chocolate bars and CAILLER L'Ecorce Dark Chocolate Cocoa Bar, Strong/Intense, 3.5 Ounce delivers a chocolate punch.Somewhere in the 70%-85% is chocolate I like.  These bars are on the sweeter side that usual for me but they are very good.  They are not waxy and dissolve smoothly in your mouth..  The intense chocolate flavor is just what I want.These chocolate bars are perfect for what they are.
I've used this every day for a week and no warping or signs of use,The aluminum is think and the pan is commercial quality..  I line mine with tin foil before cooking so I don't have to clean it.

Sample received of a great product.When there's nothing else, a solar charger can save the day.The Aukey 20W Solar Charger Portable USB Solar Panel Charger has two USB port capable of delivering 2.4A st 5V under ideal lighting.  That's enough to charge 2 iPads of up to 4 phones simultaneously.The unit is well built from durable nylon and has a zippered mesh case to store the charging cables (not included).  In my case, I put in a USB Micro A cord, a Lighting cord and adapters for several other devices.  I also put in a 4-way USB splitter.My discharged iPad took about 3 hours to charge at sea level on a sunny day.
Sample received.Quick and easy to use.  I plugged it into my car and ran the App.  Lots of information but nothing was wrong or brokne.  It feels good to know

Sample received.This reminds me of a voltmeter or a piece of lab equipment and is a big step up from your average kitchen gear.This is a pretty awesome setup if you're cooking 1-2 things in an oven or BBQ but don't want to be standing there the whole time.  The thermometer consist of a transmitter and a receiver and two temperature probes.  The way it works is that the transmitter is placed near the cooking area and one or both sensor probes are inserted into whatever is cooking. Wire(s) run from the probe(s) to he transmitter that send the temperature(s) to the receiver (the bigger orange box in the picture).As long as you stay in range of the signal, the transmitter updates the receiver with one or both of the temperature readings from the probes on the transmitter.This is a well-built set of equipment that suits my cooking style perfectly.  I'm just wondering if an App could replace the receiver if everything was on the same WiFi network.

After years of trying new brands of dry foods for my 17 year old DLH, there has been a recent explosion of premium dry grain and gluten free cat foods coming onto the market recently and they're expensive compared to those 40 pound bags/buckets,Initially my cat didn't like the high-protein grain-free foods so I mixed in with food he liked to wean him off of it. Grains have been replaced by peas and potatoes so there are vegetables in the recipe.  My cat is older now so I want him to have a better diet and Solid Gold Nature's Harmony Chicken, Peas & Potato Grain Free Kitten & Adult Cat Food has been one of his morning meals.  He seems to prefer the salmon flavor more and even when I feed him wet food he eats the seafood and tolerates the rest.I really like this premium dry grain and gluten free cat food and my cat does too.  The bag is very appealing to boot.

My cat likes this premium dry food and he needs to loose a little weight.With so many choices in premium dry cat foods, it's hard to pick one based upon the package.  My experience has been hit or miss.  After reviewing my last premium cat dry food that my cat wouldn't even touch, I called the manufacturer and learned that cats that are used to eating lower quality cat foods often won't eat the high-protein grain-free dry cat foods.I mix a little more in with his food each time and now my cat likes these types of cat foods. My cat prefers seafood so this blend was to his liking.This comes in a very sparkly bag so it would stand out on a pet store shelf.  It is grain and gluten free.  I would order this again.

Every product I've gotten from Moen exceeds my expectations.  Yes, this faucet is simply elegant but the real beauty is behind the scenes in the quality of the components.  Every single piece of the faucet's hardware -- the stuff you don't see -- just feels like it's quality made when you're holding it and installing it.Installation is a breeze thanks to the flexible steel water supply lines.  The only thing required to install this faucet are basic hand tools.This is truly a beautiful faucet that compliments my brushed stainless steel sink.  The simplicity of the design is what gives it elegance.

Ringside is really making some great boxing products at very reasonable prices.  This heavy bag is very well constructed from leather and comes filled.  An unfilled version is available.The package includes: the chain and swivel for hanging, heavy-duty riveted straps, and a D-ring on the bottom so it can be attached to the floor.  (I attached min to the floor with a strong bungee cord.)  The bag comes in either red or black.There is a 1" foam liner that protects your hand from impacting the stuffing directly and also helps the bag hold its shape.If I could only have four pieces of boxing gear they would be: boxing gloves, a heavy bag, a speed bag and a jump rope.  That's all it takes to start getting into shape.

A breakthrough in circular polarizers from B&W transmits 100% more light.  Most circular polarizers (including my other B&W brand) take away two full stops.  That means that when I put one on my f2.8 lens it becomes a f5.6.  With this new Multi-Resistant Nano Coated Circular Polarizer from B&W, it only takes away one stop so my lens shoots at f4.0.This polarizer uses the XS-Pro mount which has the same threads as the standard F mount but it is thinner and uses thinner glass for superior light transmission.I tested this on my Nikon D810 with my Nikon 24-70mm f2.8 and the results were comparable to the standard B&W F mount circular polarizer.  I'll be using this one from now on and retiring the older one.I can't express enough how important gaining a full stop back from the polarizer is.  This is truly a breakthrough by B&W and a worthy compliment to my high-quality camera.
No frills but these fit inside my half sheet pan perfectly.
No frills but these fit my half sheet pan perfectly.

This mug is a nice addition to my extensive collection of insulated stainless steel flasks.  As such. It has some competition dating back over a decade.I like this mug because it holds 2 cups (16 ounces or about 1/2 liter) and it's leak-proof.  As with all mug of this type, they insulate cold better than hot.  It has to do with the difference between ambient room temperature and the temperature of the contents, The bigger the difference, the less effective the thermal barrier is and steel conducts heat fro, the interior to the exterior on all of these mugs.I don't need my hot beverages to stay hot for more than a few hours so if this can do that (and it does) that's perfect.  My iced drinks have ice the next day after I leave them out overnight so I'd say that claim is verified.  My coffee stayed warmish for about 3-4 hours but was far from piping hot.This is not Aladdin from 50 years ago but it's well made and dishwasher safe.I love the feel of metal in my hand an the ergonomic shape fits well in my palm.  The color is more of of teal than blue like in the picture.

When I was a Boy Scout they tagline was "Be Prepared!"We also learned that when things go wrong that basic things like shelter, water and food become the most important things.  The problem is that when stuff happens, it's too late to prepare.I've had all of the Mountain House dishes in this box except the Biscuits & Gravy and they're pretty good.  In an emergency, it's like I'm eating gourmet.  Keep in mind that this is survival or camping food intended to keep you alive and it is not a fine-dining experience.  Once you look at it that way, this food tastes really good (albeit a bit salty but that's intentional because you're probably sweating as well).
Sample received.Very handy.  I can't wait to try it on my next trip abroad.

Sample received.This pouch is huge and can almost be considered a piece of personal luggage.  I don't know if my neck would last with all of the weight of this loaded up.  There is room for everything that's for sure.

Sample received.I put this int he claw lamp I use on my desk.  In general I prefer white light but at my desk I prefer the warm white color that this bulb produces.This bulb is bright enough and is very energy efficient
The first one didn't work but Amazon's great return system came through and the second one worked just fine at 400x on a USB 3.0 port.

This supplement has two ingredients that help with joint movement: Omega-7 (fish oil) and Hyaluronic Acid (joint lubricant).  The main thing I'm concerned with in any supplement that contains fish oil is how well it stays down.  Barlean's Organic Oils stays down pretty well but I take mine with food.  There is a slight fishy smell when you open the bottle.As to efficacy, that's hard to say.  I take several supplements and adding this to my list may help and probably won't hurt.  My advice as always is to choose for yourself.

I've never been able to get a clean shave using one of these and this one leaves some stubble even if I go over the same area twice or more.  The second thing is that epilators aren't cutting the hair; rather, they're grabbing it and pulling it out or breaking it off so it can take some getting used to.  In other words this is not a gentle spa-like experience.I like the ergonomic design and the fact that it's waterproof rates a 4 Stars.  It's very easy to change attachments and my wife can use it too.

This Barbie is highly detailed and is a collectors piece.  Barbie comes in in real collectors box and has all of her accessories.The theme is that Barbie is a spirit of NOW and has things like a cell phone and modern clothes and accessories.  Barbie has modern clothes and in web-savvy.  The build-quality of bpboth thr doll amd the box is what I expect from a collectible doll..This doll is either a toy or probably best if left as-is to be a true collectible capturing a moment in our current time and the spirit of Barbie.

I tested these labels underwater for a couple of days and they held up fine.  My question is: What Laser Printer ink can stand up to 30 days submerged in seawater?My father has a printing-press and the only way I can think about getting chemical-resistant ink is by real printing.  My laser pre=inter ink washed off so I want a permanent ink solution.

This mat is a bit small for me at only 17"x24".  Usually I prefer mats with a non-skid backing in the bathroom and this 100% cotton mat slides a bit on tile.The cotton is absorbent and the weave is interesting.  I just wish it was larger by 50% or more.

This lamp is really well made with a heavy base and strong articulated joints.  It uses an ultra-modern design so the lamp doesn't look conventional.Here's what I liked:* The base is heavy so the lamp stays in place* The joints are articulated and can be tightened with the included Allen wrench (built into the base) if they become loose* The LED light is white and has 3 dimming levels.  At the highest level, it is very bright.* The USB port is strong enough to charge my iPad which needs at least 2.1A so it's powerful.  The USB port is more useful than I expected it to be.Here's is what I would have done differently:* The shiny plastic used picks up fingerprints.  I would have preferred a matte finish.* The power supply is a box-type external DC transformer.  I would have preferred a normal lamp cord with the transformer built into the base.* The lamp only has 3 dimming levels.  I find the lowest level to be to bright for night time use so I would have preferred 2 more lower light levels* The lamp head does not rotate.  This is my biggest issue because I can't aim the light -- it is always projecting straight down (or parallel to the arm).Despite my minor differences in design choices; I still think this is an awesome lamp and I'm looking at the other similar B&D models to see if I can find one where the lamp head offers a bit more adjustment and a couple of more light levels.

I was a bit disappointed when this took me over an hour to assemble and I needed a mallet.  The instructions are very obtuse.So after a lot of trial and error I got this together and it's a really great combo stroller and car seat for toddlers form 4 to 22 pounds and up to 40 pounds in the stroller.I'm a grandfather and I didn't even know their where devices like this where I could move the baby without disturbing it.  This is really a breakthrough that combines a strolled and car carrier into one product up to about 22 pounds.

Sample received.I received a sample of this belt for review purposes and I'm happy I requested it.  It's much bigger than the other belts I have in this style and holds large items securely.This can be tucked discreetly under a shirt so nobody knows you're wearing it

When I was an EMT, we only used Nitrile gloves because a lot of people have latex allergies.  These aren't medical quality gloves but they do the same thing -- keep your hand away from what you're touching.These gloves fit my hand (men's large) fine and the material is thick enough not to rip too easily.I use these all of the time for anything from kitchen cleanup to washing the car.  These are great to have around the house.

It took me a while to get the right position and the right setting for me but I seem pretty good around setting 30-35 without causing too much hand twitching.This unit is compact and rechargeable so it should provide lots of use.  It uses replaceable pads that are good for one person to use 20-30 times.I've used stim units from commercial sized down to pocket-sized and this one fits nicely in the middle

The House of Marley Chant Mini BT Wireless Speakers sound crisp and clear.  As with other small mono BT speakers, there is no channel separation and there isn't that much bass.The speaker paired easily with my iPad.  Just hold down the BT button until the LED blinks blue and pair with the device from the iPad.  The Chant Mini BT speakers can also be run from any non-BT device that you can connect a 3.5mm cable (not included) to the input jack next to the charging port.  I tried this using by connecting the headphone jack on my laptop to the speaker and it worked fine.I didn't test the speakerphone since that isn't something I'll be using.The real bamboo wood looks much better in-person than in the picture and the whole unit has a nice solid feel.(Mine arrived with the grill dented and the bamboo scratched and if I paid for these I would asked Amazon replace them.)

I use the professional version of Acrobat at work and this version is capability- limited. Most of the basic features are there but he ability to customize the menus is lacking. I have a lot of Adobe software and thsi is not one I would recommend.

When I go to the gas station to fill my car, I don't replace the gas tank.  So for years I've been wondering why I was doing that every time I had to refill my printer with ink.  Finally Epson has solved the problem of replaceable ink cartridges and replaced them with ink tanks.  To make it even better the ink tanks are huge and hold a lot of ink and the ink is really inexpensive to replace when I do run out.I connected this wirelessly to my home network but it also supports direct printing from memory cards and wireless devices like phones or tablets.  The print quality is very good (although not quite as picture perfect as my Canon Photo Printer) but for day-to-day use color prints are a fraction of the price of any other printer I own.Where has this technology been for the last few decades?  It's finally here and all other cartridge-based ink printers are now obsolete.I like this printer so much I retired an older Brother printer that ran on expensive cartridges

Sample received. This cable is very well designed.  It folds into itself for storage but it can also be used as an extension cable because you can plug in a second USB cable while this one is in use.  There is a small metal switch that switches between the Micro USB A output and the secondary output if you're using that.I have a 4" Lightning cable and together they make a very compact charging kit for both of my phones.This cable is very heavy duty.

Sample received.If you don't have three hands than a headlamp is the way to go.The LuxoLite headlamp is nice and bright with the CREE LED and runs on three AAA batteries (included).  When I compare it to my LED Lenser at about twice the price however; I can't justify the high price for an all plastic component.  This is a good product but the LED Lenser is a great product.

If you're old enough to remember the first Mad Max then you have something to compare this to.  This movie is almost without a plot and that's okay because we don't need one in a post-apocalyptic movie like this.  Basically there are no laws and Max is a man who lost everything and is haunted by his past.  Somehow he hooks up with the escaping Charlize and the concubines of some warlord and that's pretty much that.  The rest of the movie is just more and more people chasing them in these crazy exotic cars.  It's great!

This cable is perfect for charging my iPhone 6 Plus from my laptop.  It's so short that there is no extra cable to clutter up my desk.The cable is well made with strain reliefs on each end.  It isn't Apple quality but it doesn't cost Apple prices.

I'm not sure what other people use this cable for but I use it on my PS4 controller to provide continuous power.  My 55" 4K HDTV is over 10' away and even though I have 3 PS4 controllers running out of power in the middle of a game is not a good option.This cable is well built and spans the distance between my TV and my device.  I've used cables like this in the past and the only concern is line loss.  This manufacturer claims a 25 meter run is possible.  Personally, I'll believe it when I see it.  I think a USB booster is required for that distance,

These worked really good to hang a laminated world map.  I went with a 4x5 configuration and the next day only a couple of pieces had peeled away.  I pushed them back on and they haven't come loose again.

Sample received.These cables look good and seem better made than my all plastic cables.I recently went through an organizational period with all of my USB cables and these color coded aluminum-ended cables were key in my process.  I put in a USB charging station for many of my devices and a multi-port hub on my PC.  I actually used more than 4 of these to reach my goal and am very satisfied with the results.I think these cables are superior to the cheap plastic junk that comes with every other device I review.

This PowerGlide 1534 cordless vacuum cleaner from Bissell works better than I expected.  I'm using it with the brush spinning in high speed at all times.Unboxing and assembly was easy.  The directions consist of six steps and assume that you can figure out how to charge the battery and open the cover to insert it.  Here's the list...Pros:* Easy assembly* Fast charging battery* Bagless design - I WILL NOT buy a vacuum cleaner that uses bags ever again.  I have another cordless vacuum cleaner (the H brand) that takes bags and I NEVER use it.* Powerful suction - Worked well on carpets and hard floors* Swivel head - This is new to me and I really like it.  It make the unit easy to maneuver with a twist of the wrist.* Removable base - When using the wand; the base can be disconnected to reduce weight* Multi-purpose accessory attachment - Neat attachment that has both a slim tip and a brush tip in oneCons:* Manual switch between floor and wand - There is a switch on the side of the body that has to be rotated to direct the suction to either the wand or the floor.* No edge suction - None was expected* A piece of plastic fell out when I was assembling it.  I hope it wasn't important.* Has a consumer-feel; but, to be fair, it's a consumer product and it comes with a 2 year limited warranty (keep your receipt)All things considered; the PowerGlide 1534 is going to be my daily vacuum cleaner and I'll take out my heavy corded vacuum cleaner when needed.

I have been an owner of the Bose QC-15's since 2011 and couldn't be happier with the product. Personally, it doesn't bother me that they are battery powered. I was excited, however, to see that Bose had a cheaper, non-electronic, over-ear headphones. I have been in a pinch where I couldn't use my QC-15's because I didn't have batteries.These are really solid headphones! Though they are not electronic noise canceling headphones, they still suppress a lot of noise. The sound quality is solid and the bass is just as good as the QC-15. It is apparent, however, that the build quality is not as excellent as the QC-15's. I expected this with the price reduction, though. I don't feel that these headphones are overly cheap or lack significant quality, but it is worth noting that these are not powerless QC-15's.So far, I have used these for listening to music, making phone calls on my iPhone 6, and playing PlayStation. These function as a great headset for gaming because the sound is immersive and much of the external noise is suppressed. I am satisfied with this product and will continue to support Bose products if they continue to possess high-quality.

I have several dedicated USB chargers from 6-8 ports and I use them all the time but hey are not connected to my PC.  This charger is PC intelligent so it can not only charge your devices but it is also recognized by your PC as multiple devices.My Laptop has 4 USB 2.0 ports and 2 USB 3.0 ports and I have a lot of peripherals devices.  I took several of my US 2.0 devices and ran them through this device and freed up a couple of USB 2.0 ports.  Keep in mind that even with external power (like this has) not every USB device will work.  That's OK as long as it frees up more USB ports than it occupies and it does that really well.For charging, I have two dedicated charging stations with 6 and 8 USB ports retrospectively. Although this device will charge, the real vale is that is can transfer data to your USB device.

I don't expect every appliance to do everything and this one doesn't do that.  It works well as a steam mop but not as well as a steam wand. .  I guess you can't expect one thing to doe it all.As a mop it works but you need to replace to pads which cost more than nothing and are not easy to find/I like this mop but I would rather it drew the dirty water back in and didn;t need the pads.

Viva Labs is a name I trust when it comes to supplements and the TRIPLE STRENGTH Glucosamine, Chondroitin and MSM has been clinically proven to provide joint relief.The ample 240 pills is about a six-month supply so the cost is very reasonable.I'm careful about what supplements I take but I personally consider this one safe.  As always, I encourage you to decide for yourself or check with a medical professional before adding ANY supplement to your diet.I have found some joint relief taking similar products after several weeks to a couple of months so I expect this product to do better.

These labels are the best Avery Shipping tags because they have the double wires.They are reinforced where the wire meets the label and are very strong. If secured properly by twisting the double wires tightly the labels won't fall off. They may be ripped off by baggage handling machines but all hanging labels are subject to that risk.If possible, tape a second through sixth label to each side of your package or luggage

These labels are adequate Avery Shipping tags because they have string instead of wires.They are reinforced where the string meets the label and are very strong.  If secured properly by tying the string tightly the labels won't fall off.  They may be ripped off by baggage handling machines but all hanging labels are subject to that risk.If possible, tape a second through sixth label to each side of your package or luggage.

These labels are the best Avery Shipping tags because they have the double wires.They are reinforced where the wire meets the label and are very strong.  If secured properly by twisting the double wires tightly the labels won't fall off.  They may be ripped off by baggage handling machines but all hanging labels are subject to that risk.If possible, tape a second through sixth label to each side of your package or luggage.

Sample received.This brace fits either wrist and provides support for the wrist.  I like it but there are better supports that come sized specifically for left or right hands that fit better and provide more support that can be found.

This is a replacement for a controller whose USB port failed to accept a charging cable.  These controllers take a lot of abuse before they die but they do die eventually.  I've replaced them in the past for other reasons but this time it was the lack of the ability to insert a micro USB cable in to charge it.I don't really like the Darth Vader white but I put silicone skins on my controllers so I can change the color to anything I want.

Sample received.This kit contains everything you need to make field repairs to clothing so it's a great travel sewing kit.  I like the fact that everything is in a zippered nylon case so nothing falls out.I put this in with my toilet kit for travel and it will be a world traveler in a few weeks.

This was as easy to install as a light switch because it is but make sure you are comfortable working with house current before ordering if you plan on installing it yourself.I'm a simple person with simple needs and all I wanted from this switch was for it to turn on when I came into the room and turn off after I left.  In that regards: Mission accomplished.This switch monitors body heat and when it senses some, it turns on.  When the heat source leaves, it turns off after a pre-determined interval saving money by reducing electrical consumption.I'm very happy with this switch and I'm going to put a few more in key locations like my garage, attic and basement stairs.

I have to go by my cat's taste and as usual: one like them and one didn't.  My feeling is that "treats" should be irresistible and that the cats should be eager to get them when they see the bag.  (Cats aren't dumb.)  The Wellness Kittles Treats just don't excite my cats and one actually ate around them to get at his regular dry food leaving every single treat behind.

I like that it doesn't melt in my pocket and lasts on my lips.  Personally, I preferred the unflavored the best.  My wife liked the vanilla bean.  None of the flavors were overpowering and all tasted good.For me, the moisturizing properties of beeswax are as good as petrolium jelly but it lasts longer.

Sample received.When it comes to my screens I'm always worried about using commercial cleaners since they might contain chemicals like ammonia that will harm the clarity.  I was happy to receive a sample of the ROUGE DUO Screen Cleaner and test it since I didn't have any other product like this.I followed the directions and wet the included clothe and clean my 55" 4K HDTV, my iPad, my 17" laptop display and a couple of cellphones and monitors.  I even cleaned my eyeglasses and all everything came out sparkling clear.

I put one of these on every body I own because I'm a "better safe than sorry" kind of person.This tether kit doesn't look like much and depending upon your needs can be enough for two bodies.  The idea is that you attach the tethers where you would normally attach the shoulder strap.  The one on the left (from the back) is attached to the Black Rapid sling screwed into the tripod base of the camera.  If that base ever became unscrewed, the tether would save the camera.  If you didn't have a tether, your camera would go to ground.The second tether is optional and depends upon your shooting style.  I tend not to install this one unless I know I'm going to need it because it gets in the way of my gripping hand and if my camera is clipped to my belt, it isn't exactly "Rapid" to draw and shoot a picture because I have to unclip it first.  That said;  I just used the second tether yesterday because I was climbing on rocky terrain and I didn't want the camera swinging around but that's more of an exception for me.For what you get, I think this kit is overpriced so I taking off a star.  It's very well made and does its job perfectly and as insurance it's very cost-effective.

The nice thing about the pro lenses is that a lot of them take the same sized filters (77mm) so this was a case of do I but cheap or do I buy good.  I looked at it like this:  I have about five thousand dollars of camera and lens behind the polarizing filter and I wasn't going cheap on the last hundred dollars and putting in a piece of window glass.I've always liked B&W filters and the quality German optics.  I bought two of these for my wider lenses.  The 70mm-200mm f2.8 doesn't need one because it has a darkening effect on the sky around the edges.  I also learned not to use this filter when shooting people because it removes the shine from their skin and makes them look dull.This filter is a must-have for landscape photography below at 50mm or wider.

I am using this with a Lexar Professional Compact Flash 1066X in 25GB size plugged into a USB 3.0 port on my Dell XPS laptop and it work great.  I get transfer speeds of about 50Mb/s which is really fast (10X) compared to USB 2.0.My CF memory fit into my old USB 2.0 card reader but because it was so big (256G) my computer could read it and prompted me with a message to "Format my card before it could be used".  DON'T DO THAT EVER.  Always format your cards in the camera you will be taking the pictures in to ensure compatibility.The popup design is great and keeps the slots covered so dirt and dust stays out when the reader is not in use.  There is a mini USB 3.0 to USB cable included so it will work with any computer with a USB port but it won't be as fast if you use USB 2.0 or 1.0Compact Flash cards won't be around much longer but as long as the high-end DSLR cameras use this memory I still need a good reader,

I have this shoe in many colors. I also have this in the short bootie.They have a 'suede' surface and need to be brushed to remove soil.  They tend to show in the lighter colors.  They are inexpensive and colorful AND they are a fashion shoe. This means they aren't the very best construction or quality. For instance, the lace holes in the shoes aren't metal grommets but punched holes. Still, they are comfortable. I can wear these all day since I sit at work and stand in them for an hour but I doubt they will provide support to anyone wanting to wear them for 8-9 hours while standing.The colors are vibrant and I'll be ordering more as back up :)

SInce I love Evo's conditioner I thought this product would also be amazing. Nope! It's heavy, does not provide any curl, completely eliminates shine to the point of my hair looking like it hasn't been washed in four days. I've used it three times and wish I could return it but it's been opened. I switched back to the Garnier Hair gel in the spray bottle which worked wonderfully and is about 1/4 the price.
