I rarely write product reviews but the amount of money and shipping I paid for this item requires action.I fell for the line that Mayo Clinic endorsed this lotion and am now taking some of my very precious time to disclose that this product is useless. I should have been happy with the awesome Banana Boat Deep Dark Color Self Tanning lotion I've used for the past year but I read an online review and excitedly purchased this product. Now I feel like a chump, am 53.00 lighter, and my face broke out because this product contains oil. I used it for two weeks to test the color application and there wasn't a significant change in color or tone to my skin.I am editing my review for this morning I found myself wondering just how is it that Mayo endorsed this lotion? I'm such a chump! I KNOW BETTER: Non-profit organizations are not in the business of product endorsement. Notice how it reads as a Mayo endorsement? It doesn't quote a specific physician referral or reference a clinic test.I'm a former Director of a non-profit and know the ropes* so I went searching, landed on Mayo's site, and read this: "Mayo Clinic maintains a distinct separation between advertising content and editorial content. All advertising content on Mayo Clinic's health information website or in one of our newsletters is clearly labeled as an advertisement"Don't waste your money with this product and its disingenuous marketing and allow me to tell you how to achieve a great lotion tan. Use the Banana Boat product which you can buy at Target (where it's cheaper than Walgreens).  While in the shower use baking soda or a scrub brush to prepare your skin. Baking soda is a great exfoliate. I use it as a scrub for my face. I also use it under my arms because it absorbs orders and I'm at the gym everyday.Once dry, apply the Banana Boat Deep Dark Color. The lotion works better than the spray and it's more cost effective. I'm not orange, there's a very mild inoffensive odor, and the lotion is tinted which helps with application. I use it on my arms, neck, (don't neglect the back of your neck), chest, and face. I apply it to my legs in the summer. It seemed pointless to apply it to my legs this winter when everything was covered due to the severe cold. Allow the lotion to dry on your skin 5 mins (while brushing your teeth. Rinse your mouth with baking soda, it will make your breath fresh!)before putting on your socks or other tight clothing which will make the color uneven. Especially socks.I've never had a break out occur on my face when using this product. A light sheen presents which I remove with a oil control film. Clean and Clear makes the film product that I use to remove the sheen from my face and its a great product for oily skin. It doesn't remove makeup just the oil slick on your face. I also use a soapy nail brush on my palms and under my finger nails after I've applied the lotion. It will stain your hands if you don't scrub your palms and under your nails.I haven't worn makeup in years which is why I use the tanning lotion. My women friends, people at the gym, and strangers always tell me I look healthy.The difference in price is awesomeness. The Banana Boat Summer Color is in a 6 ounce tube, lasts for four to five months, and is less than 10.00 with tax.Choose wisely and follow my research. It's YOUR hard earned money. Ask yourself why you want to believe the hype. I've reflected on this and decided I really thought this would be better. Too bad for me since my system already worked really well. As my Mother used to say, If it isn't broke don't fix it. Also? You may want to consider those glowing reviews of this product were provided by those who have an investment in it.Loreal makes a bronzing lotion that has glitter in it. Avoid that too because as the lotion drys the glitter will be on your clothing. I had a small pile under my desk.* I've come back to edit my review because I've just read some comments from people wondering why I wrote about "cred". I didn't realize some many people weren't aware of how a non-profit organization operates. I hope this is easy to grasp for those who don't have any exposure or experience. Non-profits receive funding from various and often divergent sources. FOR THAT REASON they cannot endorse a product. This was my sole point for mentioning I'm a former Director of one: I knew better had I reflected.
I love it so much I ordered another for my physical trainer as a tip since he admired it. Easily assembled. Wider than my bench with the rack.
I loved that this rap was big and cooled quickly however the velcro straps will pill and snag on the surface quickly. With in three weeks. The other disadvantage was that it warmed while on my knee.

I've been purchasing Kind Bars for almost two years. They are my morning snack with coffee. Two months ago I was eating a Dark Chocolate Cherry Cashew Kind Bar when I chipped my front lower tooth of a piece of cherry pit.I wasn't expecting to encounter something rock hard in a chewy bar. An added complication - the chipped tooth was cutting my inside lower lip when eating - was that I had knee replacement surgery scheduled within two weeks of the tooth being chipped. I had to scramble to get a dentist appointment and have it fixed prior to surgery. I was told during my pre-surgery interview that any teeth issues had to be resolved prior to surgery. After knee replacement dental surgery is not an option for 1.5 years. Not even a teeth cleaning is allowed because of the risk of infection which can attack the implant in the knee.Six weeks after surgery I was eating another Kind bar when I bit down into a whole cherry pit. This bar (two different batch numbers) cracked a porcelain crown and I went back to the dentist. Luckily for me and Kind, the repair did not require dental surgery. My dentist was able to 'polish' the crown back into use.Driving to the Dentist five weeks after surgery was an anxious experience. I'm appalled was that Kind was not responsive to my email. Initially I wanted to return the wrapper with the pit to them. "Cherries aren't in season in Feb" I explained to the man at Kind who called me responding to my email (meaning I didn't get the pit from some place other than the Kind Bar and I wasn't trying to run a scam on Kind. Naomi from his insurance company (CNA) called me. Even though she taped the conversation her claim denial letter said I no longer had the pit in my possession so I couldn't be reimbursed for my trip to the dentist. I still have the pit. I have not been reimbursed for anything although Kind sent two replacement boxes. Two measly boxes. Unbelievable.Where was the real KINDness during this experience? It was from my dentist who understood I was having knee surgery and agreed to see me on short notice. Twice.Anyone have recommendations for other bars?

I bought this because I was having total knee replacement. So, if you've a taller person, you may want the height a seat like this offers. I just don't recommend THIS seat.

Amazing sound quality and very easy setup to both my bluetooth phone and my TV.  I don't really know what to say about this product other than it is amazing.  I have it set up to my TV right now as my sound system.  It was awesome for Sunday Football day!The set up was as easy as can be.  Held my phone up to the speaker and instantly set it up.  No problems at all.  I also set it up to my TV using a simple HDMI-ARC cord.  Couldn't be easier!The speaker is heavy, so don't look for this to be an easy carry along.  It is definitely portable, but it is heavier than I thought it would be and a bit larger than anticipated.  It doesn't have a remote, either, so make sure that you set it up somewhere where you can easily get to it to adjust the sounds.I love the way this sounds outside as well.  The sound resonates throughout the wind!  Classical music on the deck with a glass of wine for me and a cigar for my husband and a fire in the pit.  Perfect fall evening.Excellent Bluetooth sound speaker!

I love this projector!  It is very compact and super simple to use and set up.  All of the ports are simple to get too and all of the buttons, start, lamp, menu, home, etc. are on the face top.  I easily connected my BluRay player and my sound bar to watch a great movie with friends.  The color was amazing and even though the room wasn't  pitch black, the picture quality was perfect and everyone could easily see the picture.  The 3000 lumens Color Brightness and the 3000 White Brightness worked beautifully in a semi dark room.  I imagine in a dark room it is even more spectacular.  I do wish that this projector was equipped with an internal dvd player, but being so simple to set up the bluray player and my laptop, it isn't that much of a drag at all.  I did play around with the image adjustments and found them also easy to use.Honesly, this really is a plug and play theater system as well as a plug and play office projector.  It is so lightweight that carrying it from room to room and setting up to the office computer/laptop for display was quick.  I did a presentation for a group of people with this projector during the day...perfect.Right now, I am using it consistently as a home theater.  I have it set up to my Soundbar, my BluRay player and a screen that comes down from ceiling.  I'm planning on hosting a football party using this projector and my laptop and of course, Sunday Ticket!  Hopefully I win my fantasy football that day!  Seriously, this is an all around perfect projector for home or office, inside or outside.  Perfect!There is also a remote that does everything from wherever you are.  Love that.  There is also telephone and internet support services if needed.  So there are no worries at all if you have any problems with set up.

I need to first start out by saying that Lynn Cullen wrote a fascinating book.  Her writing style is unique in the fact that she is able to tell a story based on research and make it sound like a novel rather than a biography.  Her attention to detail and her descriptions of the era, people, places and the general tone of the times is impeccable.  Although, for me it was rather slow, being someone who prefers a quicker storyline, but  for a person who desires that type of attention it is perfect.  She obviously loves her craft.I wanted to read this book because I always found the differences between Samuel Clemens and Mark Twain disturbing.  Before Samuel became "Mark Twain" he was a small time newspaper writer who wrote a scathing editorial about a competitors editor and owner of another newspaper.  Apparently Mr. Clemens had a big mouth and loved to hide behind pen and paper.  However, this time the owner of the rival paper decided to take him to task and decided a duel would be best.  Long story short, Mr. Clemens ran away and became Mark Twain.  After reading about this I took an interest in Mr.Clemens and the duality of personalities he created.This book, Twain's End, takes place many, many years later after  fully becoming Mark Twain to the public while being Samuel Clemens while alone at home.  Towards  the end of his wife's life (sickly) and during a great financial crisis, Miss Lyons was brought in to be secretary to Olivia Clemens.  She became "family" thru thick and thin and more.  She was everything and more to the family...except she wasn't family.There is a bit of interest between the Helen Keller and Mary Sullivan and Mary's husband, but the story stays pretty close to Isabel Lyons and the relationship between her and Samuel as well as Samuel's daughter.  Isabel never seemed to catch a break from her young life until her death.  Tragic, in my opinion, the life of this poor woman who found herself caring for a narcissistic, egotistical "little man", his wife, his daughter and finally finding some sort of love with Mr Clemens associate.  Until of course, Mr. Clemens and his daughter decided to use pen and paper to destroy her.For me, It is a heartbreaking story.  Not because Isabel fell in love with a man that wouldn't be able to ever love her.  Not because his daughter, even though she hated the man, was a wretched human towards Isabel and not even because by the time she did find someone who would love her she was so betrayed by the "family" she believed she was part of.  No, this is heartbreaking because Samuel Clemens was a jerk.  A jerk in all sense of the word.  Samuel Clemens wasn't fit to be Mark Twain.  Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde hidden behind a Connecticut "Great American Author and Humorist."

There isn't really much to say about the benefits of coconut oil to someone who is looking at this product.  You already know or you wouldn't be looking.  What I can say is the quality of Nauture's Answer is outstanding.  I have tried many products which are all good, but this one seems to work better.  I sent some off to college with my 22 year old son to help him with the remaining few stress classes and he instantly felt better.  His hair and nails were finally healthy again.  His gums weren't bleeding and he ate less junk.  For me, I feel alive.  My menopause symptoms are reduced, my hair is full and my skin is gorgeous. I love coconut oil and this product is A+ with an A+ price.  Perfect

Outstanding book of wisdom and insight.  If you are always thinking or saying to yourself "why is this not working for me"? then this is the book for you.  Simple, easy and very thought provoking messages of compassion and love and "how to's" along the path of change and progress.  Excellent read.

This is an amazing book.  I am so taken away by the power of the message, the love in the words and the light in the story.  I realize that may sound very corny, but it is exactly how I feel about this book.  I admit that I didn't understand what this book was about when I picked it up, I thought that maybe it was a book about people's experiences when they return to the other side.  What it turned out to be is an amazing story about how the author began her journey into the "craziness" and spiral into the abyss of the other side, the unknown or whatever it is called.  It is about a young girl trying to fit in, a young women trying to understand and then crossing boundaries in experimenting with her gifts, running away from and then reconciliation of these spectacular gifts.I cried very often thru this book.  Her stories are very similar to mine.  Her anger and sadness, angst and fear as well as the successes and the elatedness of helping others.  I cried for her, the people, her family...everyone.  It touched me deeply.This is a story...not a self help book or a "wisdom from the other side" book.  It is a story/biography of sorts about opening up to what frightens us the most.  I loved this book and I know you will too.

This is a very quality blender.  It is much easier to get a mid or lower blend speed than the two other blenders I own.  The easy turn knob makes getting the perfect speed for delicate veggies like spinach and kale to blend without too much over blend and carrots and beets on a higher speed to blend quick and easily.  The Jamba blender is much better and giving me a super clean blend without any seeds, stems, etc.. simply smooth smoothies!  It will pulverize all the ice, fruits and veggies to perfection for your daily use. I love the looks of the blender.  It is a very nice color with a great tight look that blends easily on my counter.  It isn't huge.  I like that.  There are two different size jars.  32 oz and 16oz for easy use, both with their own blades.  That is awesome in my book.  Changing blades is a bear and this doesn't make me do that so yeah, AWESOME!  It has all the bells and whistles as much larger and more expensive blenders with a much nicer look and a much easier clean up.  Everything is removable and dishwasher safe for super easy cleaning especially when running out the door first thing in the morning.

I am so very disappointed in this device.  I was so excited to be able to test this out, but after a few days, I have decided that it isn't worth the annoyance.  The set up for me was easy, it synced just fine using my android phone.  I had no issues installing the battery or following the almost non existent instructions.  I didn't sync to a scale, but everything I did sync to was perfect so I can assume with confidence that syncing isn't a problem with my android phone.  I added my weight, desired steps, desired weight, sleep time, etc.. with ease.The watch itself is comfortable to wear, light weight and water proof.  I know it is waterproof because I forgot to take it off while power washing my house and it was just fine.All sounds great EXCEPT...  The user face is so ridiculous to use!  It is so very non responsive!  It takes at least 10 tries to get just the time to show on the face and when something finally displays it takes another ten swipes to get it to go to something different.  It is really an annoyance and for me, it doesn't matter how accurate the device is, (and it does seem to be very accurate), the fact that it is ridiculous to "turn on" is a real game breaker.  I find myself getting to the point where I want to toss the watch to get it to work.  If this problem can be fixed, then I will happily give it 5 stars.  Until then, it is mediocre at best.****UPDATE****I have used this watch daily for well over 3 weeks and I have found it to be extremely accurate.  Yes, I have two different meters to check for accuracy.  It is super comfortable and looks great.  However, I still just don't like the slow return on the userface.  I am constantly getting frustrated when trying to look at any of the information.  I think this is a top notch system, but needs to have something done about this one issue.****UPDATE***The company, Nuyu responded to this review with a fix to the user face.  On the app there is a reset button for the Touch Sensor and now the device is working very, very well.  As reviewed earlier, this is the only issue that was a problem/annoyance for me and now it is working perfectly.  Thanks, Nuyu, for caring about your product and your customers!

This game was a great time. The rules were clear and simple, so we were able to set up and play with very little delay. Each planeswalker and the squads they controlled had a very unique feel and flavor, surprisingly close to how the colors feel in magic two. White was all about strength in numbers and defensive tactics. Blue was battlefield manipulation and mind control effects. Black was straight murder, sacrifice, and reanimation. Red was very aggressive combat strategies, and green was simply making things big and optimized movement.We are looking forward to continue playing this game. Its customization options--choosing different characters and armies to play with, as well as the ability to create new maps and play with different glyphs--means that it is unlikely to get boring. Also, some of the wording on the cards hints that expansions are to come, leading to actual deck building and different strategies.This game is definitely worth it for any Magic the Gathering or tabletop game fan. As of now, it is a very simple game, and I can ever play with friends who have no previous Magic the Gathering knowledge, but as expansions are released, this game will be a blast to play for board game night consistently.On a final note, there was definitely a lot of thought and care put into the creation of this game.  This is not a quick "money maker" magic game that was put out for name only.  It is a great game.

This great water bottle has become my daily companion!  It holds a full 24oz, doesnt' leak and doesn't spill down your chin when you take a huge gulp!  I make it my goal to drink at least half of my body weight in ounces of water every day so having a really good water bottle is a necessity for me.  This one is perfect.  Easy to carry around either in my hand or purse or back pack without fear of it spilling everywhere thanks to the lock top.  It isn't flimsy and cheap feeling and as I've already stated, holds a good amount of water.  If you are looking for an all around water bottle, this is the one. I didn't feel that it was too heavy or bulky like some reviewers, but, I am not a huge hiker, so I don't know if it would be bothersome on a hike or not.For me and what I need it for I can say that I  Love it and I really love the color!

I can't believe I am not giving this bar 5 stars.  I LOVE Food Should Taste Good products.  I am a sesame and chocolate bar nut so seeing this new Food bar made me jump for joy.  Until I tasted it.  Not for me.  It didn't have that same "Oh my gosh, this is delicious" taste that all the other bars I eat do.  It has a funky aftertaste that lingered for a good 15 minutes or so.  Almost like a fake syrupy flavor. The nuts were very, very soft and the chocolate not at all rich and satisfying.  Usually these bars are crisp, tasty and filling, but this one, for me, didn't make the cut.  I asked my son to give it a taste and he said the same thing..not at all like the others.  We actually ended up not eating it all and throwing it away.  I don't know if I received a stale bar to try or what, but I have to admit that when I do see this one at the local foodie shop, I will definitely pass it by.

Outstanding.  Quality programming for the metaphysical, thoughtful student of life.  Yoga, Spirituality, Cooking, Health,  as well as numerous thought provoking documentaries and interviews.  One of the best subscriptions available.

The Lenovo C40 21.5 inch All-in-One Touchscreen is the first All in One I have ever used or owned and I have to say that I am overwhelmed by the shear brilliance of this design.  For the past few years I have been looking at All in One's and always opted for the laptop (Lenovo Yoga and Lenovo Flex as well as Lenovo Tablet) as well as a bulky tower desktop believing that the tower is the ONLY way to go for home and office use.  Yup, I'm an idiot.  A reformed idiot.This All-in-One is simply amazing.  I literally unpacked it, put it on my small home office desk and plugged it in.  I didn't even need a screw driver because Lenovo has brilliantly designed the back with screws that twist without any tools!  Yes!  Easy set up...no tools, no instructions, no worries!  When or if I need to update / upgrade, all I will have to do is take off the back, add the new equipment and pop the back piece back on and done.  It takes up very little space on my desk, and believe me, my personal work space is super small desk at the foot of my bed, so sleek and slim are exactly what I need.  The screen sits on a corner fitted foot and moves forward and back.  Perfect.This is a 10-point Multi-touch display which offers a simple and optimized way to use Windows 8, which I know very well and haven't had any issues with at all.It has Integrated AMD Radeon R series HD graphics, stereo speakers with Dolby Advanced Audio and HDMI-in.  I don't have a clue to what that really means in hard core computer talk, but I know that listening to Amazon Prime Stations while I work is incredible.  The sound is so crisp and clear.  I admit that my jaw dropped when I first heard James Taylor belt out "Sweet Baby James".  I also was totally fascinated by the picture quality of my Netflix fave "House of Cards".  Simply amazing.  I just turn the screen towards my bed and instant entertainment.  Hush...I know what you are thinking... It is equipped with a 6 in 1 Media Card reader which apparently supports tons of cards, but as I am not a gamer and don't know the first thing about this aspect I decided to call upon my  son,  who is a Digital Arts and Science Major, to the task of game playing and reviewing.  He easily downloaded a few of his games and played them for much longer than I thought necessary, but he claimed he needed to really get a good feel for the game play.  Please!  He loved the graphics, sound and the play itself.  No drag or hang ups that he could find.  He is also now hounding me to put this computer in our family office as it is "the ideal Family All-In-One PC".  Not happening.  Mine.It comes with a very receptive keyboard and mouse making this truly an All-in-One PC.The operating system is 8.1 and has 2 USB 3.0 ports.  It has a 2 TB Hard Drive, 8 GB DDR3 RAM and a 2.2 GHz A-Series Quad -Core A Processor.  Max Screen Resolution is 1920x1080 Pixels and the Graphics Coprocessor is Integrated.  There is also an DVDRW Optical Drive.It is also equipped with Bluetooth and a 720 webcam for pictures or video chat.  I use Skype and tried it out with my daughter and it worked perfectly.  I have also used an external DVD player which, not at all surprisingly, worked fantastic with the PC.  I have not been able to sync my bluetooth, but from everything I have read, it is a Windows 8.1 issue and just have to download a driver.  I'm not going to set it up because the Amazon Prime Stations and Pandora are perfect for my music needs and Skype works perfect for chat.Also, it does come with an Ethernet port for wired connections, but I use wireless.  Again, no issues.  Perfect execution of all of my sites and pages.I hope I was able to portray the ease, beauty and power that this All-in-One PC has.  It is truly the best PC I have used.  It replaces the bulky tower and my laptops.  Great addition to my Lenovo "family".

This is super fun!  I LOVE the beautiful wooden box that it comes in as well as the fun and colorful disks that double as can openers!  We immediately brought this to our friends house to test out and believe me, this is more fun than the bean bag game everyone plays.  I think it has something to do with the fact that we use them as beer openers!  :)  I also love the fact that you can bring them closer for the little ones to use and it is so much easier to play with them than horseshoes.  Seriously, this is majorly fun and really, really lovely to bring to parties.  High quality materials give it great beauty.  Very nice gift as well.
What can I say?  Jesus Christ Superstar is an amazing sound track and the 2012 digitally remastered soundtrack is perfect.  Really awesome!

Great book.  I love the strength and simplicity that this book brings to the table.  It is thought provoking, challenging and very surprisingly quite relevant in today's society.  History does seem to repeat itself!  If you are looking for serious research and serious action steps to further not only your money, but your life existence, then this is THE book for you.  Be prepared to read it 2 or 3 times in order for the information to really sink in and become of your normal thought behaviors and patterns.  Great book.

I really, really like this ring.  The platinum plating is gorgeous and the cubic zirconia is spectacular.  The stones are small which adds to the simplicity of the band.  Each stone is in its own separate prong lending to the detail put into the creation of this ring.  I purchased a size up because my fingers tend to swell and it fits perfectly.  It is very comfortable without any sharpness that the other reviewers have spoken of.  Overall, I feel this was a WONDERFUL purchase and a terrific addition to my travel and everyday rings.  Very happy with this item.
I think this is by far one of the best casted, best written and most entertaining shows on TV today.  Every season continues to be better than the last.

These earrings are simply gorgeous.  They shine and shimmer with pure elegance and grace.  They fit on my earlobe perfectly without any drooping or overhang.  The studs don't cause me any irritation, redness, itching, discomfort in any way.  They honestly look like and wear like extremely  expensive black onyx and diamond earrings.  I wore them recently to a play at our local theater and received many compliments on them and was asked quite a few times "where did you get those exquisite earrings"?!  I am a HUGE white gold and platinum fan so these earrings are exactly what I go for and based on the comments and compliments I receive while wearing them, they are what many people love!

My husband loves these pajamas!  It is very hot and sticky here in MA and these pajamas are perfect for relaxing in this weather!  They feel cool and almost non existent on the body, which is a huge plus for this type of weather!  The fit is perfect and the workmanship is beautiful.  Super, super silky and very attractive.  I highly recommend them to anyone who loves the feel of pajamas and lives where the humidity hits high!  I will add more when the weather cools down to see how they feel then, but I imagine that perfect is perfect no matter what!

There isn't really anything I can say about this set as a reviewer that anyone who knows Fisher-Price and Thomas doesn't already know but I will give it a shot.  I will say that Fisher-Price always makes quality toys and this set is more proof of that fact.  The Thomas is big enough for very little hands to hold, the track is sturdy enough for little hands to use and small enough of an out of the way corner so mom and dad don't trip over it every time they walk by.  Very cute set for the Thomas enthusiast!

How cute is this??  Soft cloth Anteater hats that you velcro on any size head and then you run to find the ants that you then capture on the snout.  So fun.  Basically this is an interactive memory game.  You collect matching picnic foods using the memory cards and then you race to find an ant, pick up the ant and run back to your picnic before the time runs out of the timer.  It is a great game that helps kids remember using the ever popular memory game, yet allows for running around and playing by the rules of the timer.  I like the concept very much.  The ants are made from cloth in primary colors and the anteater hats are adorable soft cloth with pink ears.  So funny!  Melissa and Doug have come up with another winner.  The age is 4 and up, but I think this would be fine for younger as well.  Great for indoor snow days and rainy days where the kids need to run, but can't go outside!

Outstanding.  I love the flavor and its soothing benefits on my throat.  I've always had severe throat issues during the winter months.  It seems the dry heat destroys my vocal cords.  I've tried everything possible to add water back into the air, but still my vocal cords always get trashed and I loose my voice for about 2 months.  Last year the Dr. told me if I didn't figure out a way to reduced the stress on my cords, I would possibly need surgery to remove polyps.  This Honey Elixir did the trick!  Using it daily, every day for this past year has proved to be most beneficial!  I can't tell you how many "cures" including keeping my heat down to next to nothing I've tried over the years with little to no results.  Comvita Manuka Honey Propolis Elixir is my relief.  My only relief.  Just love it.  I take a shot of it every day, faithfully and haven't lost a moment of voice this entire winter.

This is a really nice fragrance set.  The way in which it is packaged screams class and elegance so right off the bat you are already intrigued.  The smell is delicate citrus that doesn't overwhelm the nose.  I am so cautious about what I buy for my husband and myself because I get such headaches from strong scents, but this fragrance is subtle.  It is almost teasing in its smell.  Just enough to make someone notice, but not cough!  My husband loves the scent and so far his patients have all been complimentary on his new cologne.  For me, this is a keeper fragrance for him!
Great looking calendar.  Love the information, the art work and the whole feel of it.  Heavy stock paper and incredible colors make this calendar a true piece of artwork.  Just lovely!

I love the smell of Palo Santo Incense.  I don't like these sticks as much because they don't seem to stay lit for more than a minute, but the smell is amazing and the price was perfect and delivery exceptional.

This kit is incredible.  My husband shaves his head almost daily and this set has made his scalp, face and neck softer, smoother and so much more nourished looking.  He says that he can get really close to his skin without abrasions and after shaving he uses the after shave for a clean and healthy feel.  I can't really describe as well as I should, but I can tell you this.  Yesterday, he came down from getting ready for work and he looked great!  His skin had a nice glow.  It was soft and supple with almost what I would call a rejuvenated look.  He really loves this kit and will continually purchase it.

Go to vitamins.  I live in the Northeast and I need B vitamins to keep up my energy in the long winter and short dark days.  This is my brand...for all my gummy vitamins.  Can't go wrong with these vitamins.  They taste great and the work even better.

This is an outstanding self help book.  After years of reading everything I could get my hands on in the self help dept. I believe that this booked is the shining star.  I love self help.  I do because I love metaphysical everything and I love spiritual everything and I love helping myself as well as those who ask me for my help/advice.  This is the go to book for me now.  It is insightful, delightful and thoughtful.  Yes, I know, corny, but really accurate!  I am not saying don't read other books or love other books, I am saying read THIS book and you will love this book and love the changes that you make using the principles of this book!  Just surrender to the pathway!

This is fun.  This tiny piece of amazing plugs into your phone to show you what your eyes can't possibly see!  I do Energy Work as well as Space Clearing energies from homes, offices, land, barns and whatever have you.  I do this using my intuition and my "feeling and seeing" hands.  I've become pretty efficient at sensing the energies around me, but using this camera makes it so much more real for people to see.  I've taken before and after shots of places and people and before and after energy and clearing and believe me, there is a huge difference!  I tried for years to explain to my best friend how energy can stay somewhere without seeing it and she never believed me.  Now, I was able to take a picture of my feet and then the picture of the energy after I moved my feet.  That finally did it!  She saw first hand how energy (heat) stays in an area once the physical form leaves.  SO COOL!  I know that this camera is for many more tangible uses as in plumbing, heating, electrical, but for me it is energy all the way!  LOVE this camera!  A simple download of the app and a quick plug in with the camera and it is ready for use.  Awesomeness for under $300!

I truly enjoyed this book.  I don't have a great appreciation for the game of golf and I don't have an appreciation for the courses themselves, but I did appreciate the writing and love expressed of golf, the courses and the bond between son and father on those courses.  I loved living the feelings, good, happy and sad and anger and love that the author so eloquently described.  His writing, for me, was humble, truthful and eloquent.  I was able to capture both the intention and heart of this book and the journey in which he took to make the journey with his son even more poignant.  For me, this is a must read book for the pure grace of it.  I will lend it out with the stipulation of getting it back.

This is a really cool book.  The author is a psychic/medium who has taken great care to hone her craft and talk to those on the other side.  I enjoyed each interview, especially Henry Ford.  He seems like a real firecracker!  Susan Lander asks very  direct and poignant questions and gets very thoughtful and sometimes a bit edgy answers.  I will say that you MUST be open to receiving the information that you read.  If you don't believe that people can connect to the other side, the don't read this book.  She isn't writing to sway anyone, she is writing interviews from those on the other side.  I think the format and the people who came across to speak were wonderful.  Ben Franklin!  Really!  Gandhi?!  Yup!  Personally, I would like to hear from John Lennon...maybe in her next book.Please read this book if you enjoy hearing from those on the other side.  It is a fun, illuminating and joyous book to read.

I don't really know how to review a toothbrush to make it sound wonderful and interesting, but here goes!  I got this toothbrush for my husband, who brushes way to hard, in hopes that he will give his poor gums a break.  So far he is brushing longer and lighter.  His teeth look much whiter and his gums are getting the break they deserve.  He says that he can really feel the bristles get to the way back with ease.  Small head work well for way back tooth cleaning.  Very nice brush and it is accomplishing everything I had hope it would.

Holy Cow what a book!  This is the type of cookbook that I have been longing for.  The introduction teaches about oats, special diets, gluten-free, soy-free, oil, sweeteners and nutritional information. She writes of the different types of oats and how to cook them and what they taste like and where you can find them and when to use different types in the recipes.I adore the recipe for "Easy Oat Milk Yogurt" and live on the "Creamy Cashew-Oat Cream Cheese" that I use as a topping for her "Southern -Style Oat Biscuits".  These are simple and healthy...really HEALTHY foods that use basic at home ingredients (coconut oil) should be in everyone's cupboard and will be after getting this cookbook!The "Burgers of Beany Goodness" are incredible tasting.  Full of flavor and NO dryness with simple, in your cupboard ingredients and don't hesitate to try the "No-Knead Multigrain Pizza Crust".  It's a keeper.If for whatever reason I have tantalized your taste buds enough to run to the nearest book store to purchase this book then let me say these few little words...  "BOURBON OAT SHORTBREAD"...yup, you read that right...that, my friends, is enough said.

Overall, I really like Holi. It is undoubtedly a really cool product and an excellent party trick. You can use the mood lighting to provide ambiance to a room or use sync the light to your music, which actually looks and sounds almost seamless. However,  at least with my experience with my Android device, the music app is pretty bad. When a song ends, it does not simply play the next song. Rather, you have to manually select a new track. Furthermore, there is no shuffle feature. The functionality of the app, I find, really hinders the strength of the device.

Challenging and fun project for all ages.  Over this past weekend my son, a 21 year old senior in college, helped build this set with a few much younger kids and from what I could see all of them were challenged enough to make them focus, but also had a great time building it.  All remarked on how nicely made all of the pieces were. The all  were impressed with the the small characters that came with the aircraft and loved the finished product.  It seems that my son was able to do most of this without the use of the directions, but the younger ones did use that directions and they were very easy to follow and accurate.  The younger boys played with the aircraft without it breaking for the remainder of the weekend.  It has since been taken apart to be built again when everyone comes back to town.  Great fun was had by all.

I was quite happy to find these in the grocery store recently.  I purchased the Tavern pot roast just to give it a shot before shipping this variety pack up to my son in college.  He and his roommate are cooking most of their meals so these are the perfect crock pot blends for them.  So far they have both enjoyed them all, but the pulled pork is their favorite.  I will be sending more!

These models never get old for my son who has been building as early as Duplo  and Weebles!  He is now a Senior in college and still loves building Action figure models and buildings. Santa always finds a way to hide them under the tree for him!  I had originally thought that the Halo SpruKits were more similar to Lego.  More specifically to Lego's Bionicle series, but while the concept seems similar they aren't nearly the same. While SpruKits are pose able and are of high quality plastic and design, this particular model is much easier to build and less likely to loose pieces or break.  They have larger and less pieces and not quite as intricate. SpruKits Halo the Master Chief is also PERFECT in the look of the character.  Of the two, I believe that SpruKits would be much better for the novice builder/modeler or the modeler who is more into the gaming theme.  I think, however, that any fan of Halo, regardless of age or level will be quite impressed with this figure.  If you are thinking of getting this for a child 10 or younger I would recommend assisting.

E-Cubed, the follow up to E-Squared isn't a new concept to me.  I've been following this line of thinking now for 20 plus years starting when I first read Louise Hay's "You can heal your life" and continuing thru to the "Secret" and all of the Abraham-Hicks, etc...  This being said, Pam Grout has given us a new way of playing with these concepts.  She gives us little experiments that show us the Unconditional Love and Support that the Field of Potentiality has for us.  These simple and loving experiments serve as fun reminders that what we believe we see is what we will see.  As Dr. Wayne Dwyer reminds us "When I believe it I will see it", Pam Grout gives us the experiments that help create the constant thought processes to keep us seeing our own individual truths.  Just as much as "We are what we eat", we "are what we think" and we "believe what we see."  Let's all follow the advice Plautus, Roman Playwright; "Let us celebrate the occasion with wine and sweet words."

I am a deep tissue massage therapist and my hands and fingers as well as wrists and forearms take quite the beating.  I am a HUGE believer in eating proper foods for better health.  I love ginger, turmeric, black cherry, cayenne pepper and water for arthritis pain, reduction and elimination.  I also believe that for me, turmeric is the number one go to spice for my painful joints.  I take these tablets, Turmeric Curcumin Gold daily, without fail to keep me in tip top shape for my job.  There are a few  occasions that I may forget to take my two daily tablets (when on vacation) and boy do I know it.  My hands are important in my line of work and I need to make sure that they stay strong and healthy.  Turmeric Gold helps me do that.  I do think it important to state that the pills are rather large so if you have trouble taking pills, you should plan on breaking them open and pouring the contents into water for easier swallowing.

Bottom Line Up Top@  A nice introduction to stretch resistance band exercise, but my enthusiasm is dampened by non-adjustable band length, suggested exercises that have risk of minor injury, and slightly high price for what you get.  However, it's eminently portable, doesn't cost that much (even though I'd like to see them take a few dollars off), and definitely gives a workout.Before we get to the customary Amazon.com review PROs and CONs, let's dispense of one complaint right away:  The downloadable instruction video doesn't download. Gaiam, in a response to this complaint in another review, posted the URL: www.gaiam.com/barrebeginners.  And....repeat,  www.gaiam.com/barrebeginners.  GOOD!  (It is NOT www.gaiam.com/beginnersbarrekit.)  Thank you, Gaiam!PROs1. This is a relatively inexpensive introduction to resistance band exercise.  If you find an exercise you enjoy, with none of the negatives mentioned below, you will get a very good workout!2. It's portable, lightweight, easy to pack.  Get some strength and cardiovascular work done traveling.  For that matter, it doesn't take up much room in your home either.3. There are many resistance band  exercises that can be found on the web. You don't need to rely on the few (and generally not very good, in my opinion. exercises pictured on an insert that comes with the package.4.  Materials are strong, grips comfortable.5. The ball can be used either alone or in conjunction with the band.  Much like the blocks used in Hatha Yoga, it provides support, keeps your body in the proper position, and helps work targeted muscles.  Don't count on it to do a whole lot more than that, it's a small (5 inch diameter) rubber ball that Gaiam characterizes as mini."  However it's useful, and it may confer some transfer of training benefits if you ever decide to do Hatha Yoga.In-Between a Pro and a Con.You have to inflate the ball.  They provide the needle (HINT: Open your package very carefully so that you don't lose the needle); you provide the bicycle or ball pump (and eventually you'll need to pump it up again).  Yes, this is an inconvenience, but a blow-up ball (as in, you inflate it like a beach ball-with your mouth) would probably not be as durable, and could release air while you're using it.CONs:1. I think Gaiam should take a few dollars off the price.  The materials just aren't very expensive.  On the other hand, look at similar equipment:  A lot of it seems overpriced.2.  SNAP!  OK, I did an exercise pictured on the insert:  Put the handles in from of you, and the middle of the band behind the sole of one foot. Raise your foot and leg up for a great stretch against resistance.  Sounds fine until:  OUCH!  The band rolled off my foot and, like a rubber band, snapped against my butt. No injury, but it hurt a little, and made me think, 1) In what other exercises might this happen, and 2) Be careful using this around others.3. Non-Adjustable Band!  There's another exercise shown on the insert:  Wrap the middle of the band around your shins so that it is anchored there, then pull each handle with your hands (looks sort of like a rowing machine motion).  Two problems here:  You can't adjust the band length, so you have to fumble around trying to wrap it around and across your legs the right amount of times.  If you have to wrap it a few times, there's some pinching going on.  It still didn't give me a very good stretch; the band is just too long (for me) to use for this exercise.Let's be fair, an adjustable band, a SAFE adjustable band, that is, would cost much more.  Also, there are exercises in which I was able to adjust the band length (for example, doubling it around my back for one of the exercises worked well and didn't pinch my back).  However, you may find that you can't comfortably or efficiently perform some (or more) of the available exercises.CAUTIONS:  Gaiam states very responsibly that you should talk to your health care professional before starting this or any other program, and that any such program comes with inherent risks.  I would add that you should probably be very cautious about improvising; that is, making up your own exercises.  That seems risky to me as well.You get what you pay for (usually).  This is an inexpensive introduction to resistance bands,  I think there will be limits to the exercises that will work, and this will vary individually. If you find a few that you like and that work for you, great!  If this gets you up and around more, and encourages you do try other things, even better!  Again, please consult your health care professional about the use of this product.

"Bottom Line Up Top"@A sturdy, well-designed, multi-functional iron that I recommend highly.This iron works well, we expect that, but it's the extra, very thoughtful and useful features that make this product a standout over most irons.  Its performance, price, design, warranty, soleprint, and dimensions are similar to our current iron Black & Decker D3040 Allure Digital Iron, Blue. They're both excellent; I have a very slight preference for the B&D compared to the Rowenta. Although I won't cover *every* aspect of each iron, I include some comparisons here. I hope these will be helpful.  I'm also taking into account that the Rowenta, which seems like it *may* be losing a little heat, is at least 5 years old, and the Black and Decker is new.Similarities:  The irons are similarly sized, hefty without being bulky (don't buy if you want an iron that is lighter in weight than most),have 3-way auto shut-off, stainless steel ironing "plate," a sprayer and variable steam settings, a 360 degree pivoting power cord, self-cleaning capabilities, and customer service numbers (which I have not needed to use with the 5-year old Rowenta.Key differences: Advantage, Black and Decker1. The water tank is much easier to fill.  You can tip it upwards, and the container top functions somewhat like a funnel.  The Rowenta isn't that bad, but not as quick and easy to fill.2. A two-year warranty compared to one-year for the Rowenta; however, B&D states that you're responsible for shipping of parts.  Ridiculous.  I'd be really surprised if they insisted on this, especially if you have a defective or broken piece, but the product insert does state this.  I do not have warranty information from the Rowenta other than the one-year duration.3. The power cords are about the same length, but the Black and Decker cord is slightly more flexible, making it easier to use.4. The Black and Decker has a small front-light, convenient for seeing if you really got that wrinkle or crease out.Key differences: Advantage, Black and Decker1. The water tank is much easier to fill.  You can tip it upwards, and the container top functions somewhat like a funnel.  The Rowenta isn't that bad, but not as quick and easy to fill.2. A two-year warranty compared to one-year for the Rowenta; however, B&D states that you're responsible for shipping of parts.  Ridiculous.  I'd be really surprised if they insisted on this, especially if you have a defective or broken piece, but the product insert does state this.  I do not have warranty information from the Rowenta other than the one-year duration.3. The power cords are about the same length, but the Black and Decker cord is slightly more flexible, making it easier to use.4. The Black and Decker has a small front-light, convenient for seeing if you really got that wrinkle or crease out.Key Differences, Advantage Rowenta.1. The Amazon.com product page for the Rowenta has much more information than that for the B&D, even when one includes the instructions (and useful tips and safety instructions) that come with the Black and Decker.  Both irons have switches that let you adjust the amount of steam, but Rowenta lists quantitative information (!) about the amount of steam released at different steam setting.  I know also that the Rowenta goes up to 1,700 Watts; I couldn't find this specification on the B&D or its supporting material.2. The Rowenta has an anti-calcium mechanism in addition to the self-cleaning capability.  Unfortunately, I can't evaluate how much of an advantage this really is.  Same things goes for the 400 holes on the bottom of the Rowenta iron.  Perhaps this increases the efficiency of the steam bursts, or perhaps it makes little or no difference compared with the 20+ holes on the bottom of the B&D.  However, I appreciate the attention to detail and respect for the consumer shown by Rowenta.Tie/Personal Prefererence.Most of the above are, admittedly, minor differences.  Another difference, rotary vs. digital temperature may also seem trivial, or may be important to you.  The B&D temperature is set by pressing a button that takes you through five discrete settings denoted by fabric type, ranging fro the coolest setting, Silk/polyester, up through blends, wool, cotton, and to the hottest, linen. The instruction manual explains this well. The Rowenta has the more familiar dial.  This, of course, is continuous, but I really don't know if the temperature changes with each small dial turn.  The dial has dots at various intervals, between and under these dots are the labels "Min. (minimum)", "synthetics," "wool-silk," and"wool-cotton." This gives a feeling of more control, but I suspect most people will just turn the dial to the appropriate fabric setting.  Personally, It's a toss-up: The Black and Decker feels more "modern" and is easier to use; the Rowenta dial is familiar, appears to give more precise heat (even if it doesn't) but is somewhat harder to get to (it's located under the handle).I think both irons are superb.  I have just the slightest preference (assuming the prices of the two are still about the same) based on the ease of using the water tank, the somewhat more flexible cord, the two-year warranty (but call B and D and ask about those shipping fees!), and a slightly more appealing appearance.  I can easily see someone preferring the Rowenta, and do not feel that buying it would be a mistake.  Both excellent, both recommended, not just by me, but by most Amazon.com reviewers.  You might want to look at (trustworthy) negative reviews to help make your decision.

This relatively new model from Panasonic give a better shave than most others in its price class, but I doubt I'll be able to persuade rotary blade enthusiasts to the double rectangular foil used here.  This is one of the main design differences in electric razors.  I've tried both.  My personal feeling is that this type cuts closer but may be just a bit rougher on the skin.  For me, that was no problem: In fact; some rotaries seem like they glide so smoothly on the skin that they're not able to produce as close a shave.  Furthermore, the dual foils aren't rigid; they move up and down like tires following the contours of a road.The PROs:  The close shave mentioned above, and the following:It's relatively quiet compared to many others.It charges fast and holds a charge for a longer time than most (although you don't know when it's finished, you'll learn how after the first few).It really is a wet/dry shaver.  Go ahead, dunk it, run water over it...just don't drop it in the bathtub (Admittedly, I did not test this for you).It has a solid feel and a certain satisfying "heft" to it, unlike, say, the sleek and shiny Philips Norelco 6100 Shaver that I ultimately got tired of looking at.  This has a solid feeling and a classic black and silver color scheme.The head (that part of the device that contains the "foils" moves right and left, as well as up and down, but it still has enough rigidity that you can (comfortably) shave curvy parts of your face and neck closely. Most people will agree that a safety or disposable non-mobile blade can cut closer, but without shaving cream or hot water and soap, you're more likely to nick yourself.  And, aesthetically, unless you have a Merkur or other steel razor, the disposables do not inspire.CONs:This razor may be cleaned with either 1) pouring some included detergent (with perfume and sodium nitrate in it-ugh) and water over the blades, *trying* to get it to lather (it didn't) and rinsing, or 2) placing the razors down in a covered receptacle with that detergent, letting it soak, and rinsing.A few things I don't like about this:  Method 1 doesn't give you the lather pictured on  the enclosure (big deal), but it also seems like plenty of nothing:  The detergent pours out too quickly from a sealed metallic container, the perfume is too strong, you must rinse if you get detergent on your face, and I doubt it does much better than just taking the head off and rinsing it with plain soap and water. Method 2 has some of the disadvantages of method 1, plus you have to hang the razor from a very cheap looking and feeling holder.  The efforts of the Panasonic advertising department, the writers and package designers who want you to feel like you're enjoying a semi-luxury experience with a fine "instrument," might as well throw in the towel when that holder is standing on your sink.  Cheap and juvenile-looking, you really don't need it, nor the detergent.I see that most electric razors of this caliber sell for around $125.  That's not Amazon.com's fault; it appears that the price for electric razors has inexplicably gone up the past 5 or so years.  I advise you to wait until it's closer to $100, or to try one that regularly sells for that much that might be cheaper without the "cleaning system."  Bottom line, though, this works well and fast and the razor, at least, is designed very well.Disclosure:  This product was sent to me free in exchange for my honest review, and my donating (well, it's taxes, so it's not really a gift) about 1/3 of the price to the federal  government.  The next time you drive over a smooth interstate, just think Panasonic (and Amazon).

You would need an MD or other medical or scientific degree/expertise to sift through the many claims about medicinal mushrooms.  I thought I would try to summarize these, but the task is too daunting, and I would not want to mislead anyone: As they say, a little knowledge is a dangerous thing. If you're interested in mushroom medicine research, try Wikipedia as an introduction, or go to PubMed.gov and look up "medicinal mushrooms."  However, the literature is not easy to digest, so perhaps the best thing to do is to talk to your professional health provider about potential medical benefits and/or risks of this product.I'm going to focus, therefore, on the aesthetic qualities of the Medicinal Mushroom powder.  The label (and Amazon.com) lists the mushrooms:  Cordyceps, Reishi, Agaricus Blazei, Shiitake, Maitake, and Turkey Tails, with a "prebiotic fiber."  The powder has an acceptable color, either a mild or no discernible odor, and is ground to a fine consistency, making it very easy to scoop up and pour.  I have not tried this in water, but other reviewers have noted that it is on the sweet (sometimes too sweet) side, due to the addition of stevia.The product mixes very well in a blender; I add it to all kinds of smoothies. It does not appear to affect how they taste.  That, to me, is a big plus. When you open the container, you may be quite surprised to see that it's only about 25-40% full; however, you do get the promised 30-day supply.I've used this for the past several weeks, and simply hope it does some good. If I decide to continue, I would probably consult my doctor(s).  If you're already a medicinal mushroom user, and believe that it is beneficial for you, then you will appreciate the sensory and physical (i.e., it pours easily) properties of this product.

This has a simple, but well constructed, twist design that has a very nice "rose" gold tone.  It's gold-plated stainless steel, and the color is not glitzy cheap, but has a "tempered" bright appearance, with a *very* rose undertone.  That tone acts to give a less yellow gold hue, and I think it's very appealing.This would easily get a 5* rating, but the manufacturers didn't get the size right.  Advertised as a 7, it's bigger than any other size 7 that my spouse owns, and too easily slips off her ring finger. I can't recommend this unless you're willing to keep it from sliding off through some sort of arrangement, for example:1. Put a correctly-sized ring in front of it as a stacked ring.2. Tie a tiny piece of thread around one spot, effectively reducing its size,3, Wearing it on your middle finger.4. Attaching it as a decoration to a necklace.5. Your own creative solution.Of course, people's finger widths differ, and it's *possible* this will fit you. However, I think it will simply prove too big for most.  Too bad, because it's otherwise a beautiful ring for the money.

Yes, I lifted and twisted the title off a classic TV ad for Irish Spring soap, but it serves a purpose:  Apparently marketed to women, either gender will appreciate the superior design and cutting of this package of eight disposable razors.  Any men with a reluctance about pastels should just get over it, and here's why...A sharp, three-bladed cutting edge headlines this BIC razor, and, whatever they do, it's both sharper and holds that quality far longer than the cellophane-bagged BIC jumbles sold at most drugstores.  It's more expensive per razor, but the quality more than justifies any difference.  This thing is sharp, but comfortable; there's the usual lubricated strip above the blades that offers some softening qualities (without melting in the heat like some products), but if your skin is sensitive or you're taking anti-coagulants for your DVT, lather your face (or your legs, or whatever) with some cream or soap and water, and be cautious the first time.  You'll do fine.  Of course, for true safety concerns, you may wish to consult your Depillatory Health Specialist.OK, it's sharp, what else, Mr. Expert?  The design....  this razor fits your hand like a glove, if you used a glove to shave yourself.  IT has a nice *solid* feeling, like it's not gonna melt down the drain with the suds, or shatter if you drop it.  The curves, as the noir writers used to say, are all in the right places.  Furthermore, there's two grippy areas on the handle, one about halfway up for your thumb to rest on, one further down, near the end of the handle.  The first is for most shaving, and enables a degree of precision you won't find with cheaper models.  The second allows you to grip the razor by the end, so that you can reach further--convenient for shaving long legs, or other difficult-to-reach areas.The 3 razors are built-in, they don't  need insertion and removal. These last long enough that you may want to clean the blades after several uses, but that would be a little tricky since they're not removable.  Not impossible, just tricky.These feel anything but cheap, and work better than just about any other disposable out there, certainly better than any I'm aware of.  Go ahead, men (and women), give these a try.

With the continuing proliferation of electronic gadgets, and, really, the need to recharge them, consumers need multi-socket adapters such as this sturdy, well-design product.  It gives you 750 Joules of  protection (and we all remember from high school physics that a Joule is  the amount of energy transferred to an object when a force of one newton acts on that object through a distance of one meter, whatever a "newton " is. I'll explain that later.), so that a spike in voltage is either grounded or diverted.Although your parameters may differ, I found a source stating that power line surges inside a building can be up to 6,000 volts, 3,000 amperes, and deliver up to 90 joules of energy.  Please consult your electronics or engineering professional if you're unsure of what you need.Techno-speak aside, this device allow you to plug in several devices; as I said, I most often need that when recharging several gadgets at a time (e.g., electric toothbrush, shaver, mp3 player, etc.).  They've designed this so that it can plug into the top (or bottom) of something with two sockets, leaving the other one free for another device.  For example, I have a reading lamp plugged into the bottom socket; the top is reserved for this.  It's not permanently attached to the wall, use it whenever you need it.You can cover the openings that the plug goes into by sliding protectors across the openings.  A red light shines when it is plugged in, a nice reminder.  I had just a tiny bit of difficulty getting a plug to go into the sockets, but, personally, I'd rather have something that fits solidly then a plug than too loosely.  Not enough of a problem for me to lower the rating.  This feels solid, is an unobtrusive grey, and is relatively inexpensive.Now, what is a Newton.... Remember that ,Force = Mass * Acceleration.  In this case, that translates to1 Newton = 1 kilogram * meters/second squared.I just thought you might like to know; there will not be a test.750 Joules of protection, 3-outlet, wall tap/adapter plugs directly into the outlet- Works with computers, printers, household electronics, small home appliances, and internet modems- Built-in EMI / RFI noise filtration - Prevents circuit interference/degradation- Sliding safety covers protects users from accidental contact and keeps dust from unused outlets- $100,000 connected equipment warranty

Update:  This computer now WON'T connect to the internet!  It did for the first week or so, but then, nothing.  I have gone through troubleshooting (by the way, this internet connectivity, I found, is a fairly common complaint), and so far nothing has worked.  Toshiba customer support is VERY mixed.  I'm having a very difficult time reaching an agent, but there is a fairly good 'community support board.'Update 2:  Today the internet connection is working (with the exception of IE-I'm having no problems with Firefox).  I have no idea why it's working, but perhaps somehow it did download a fix. Although this remains very puzzling, I do have a few tips for prospective buyers.1.  Go to the customer support forums of several computers and compare the number and kind of complaints you read, and whether either a company rep. or a user answers the question.  I think most companies have something like this.  Although I'd bet every single computer has a fair number of complaints, look for patterns (for example, internet connectivity came up a lot for this model), see if the answers seem responsive, and investigate the complaints with company reps. or at a store.2. If at all possible, buy an extended warranty (unless you're an expert at repair).  In my area, the least expensive quote I got was $80 an hour, and I assume that was without parts-just labor.  (I'm using Square Trade right now to repair a 1 3/4 year old HP. ) Fortunately the Toshiba did not need repairs, but I'd still recommend buying an extended plan.  As k a lot of questions before you buy one, though.The Toshiba Satellite Fusion ("It's a Laptop!" "It's a detachable [but very big] tablet!") is a well-powered, well-designed laptop that is relatively light (all comparisons are to an HP Envy Touchsmart m6 Sleekbook and some Dell laptops from 5-10 years ago that I'd rather just forget about (SO easy to overhear). The most important specs: It's a 15.6-Inch convertible 2 in 1 touchscreen laptop, with a speedy 2.2GHz Intel Core i5-5200U processor and Mobile Intel HD graphics. It has 8GB RAM and 128GB solid-state drive, Windows 10 (for better or worse) is pre-loaded with this laptop. The Windows 10 is pre-loaded with this laptop (for better or worse).I'm very pleased with the I-5 CPU and the solid state build, definitely superior to the I-3. Download times are fast, game-playing is very good for the price, and I love the display (rich colors, very good resolution) and the large, easy-to-use keyboard: The keys light up on the dark, and are neither too close nor too far from each other. I have just a few hardware complaints: As with many laptops these days (at around this price), there's no disk drive for DVDs, CD, etc., you'll need to buy one . The touch pad is not-bifurcated for easy selection of right- and-left-clicking; in other words, it's one rectangular block with no separation of right vs. left. My experience with the HP is that this can get more and more difficult to use with wear: You may want to get a mouse, eventually. However, it's possible that the Toshiba will work better in the long run. Also, the touch screen works OK, but I wish it were a little more sensitive. Sound actually has some stereo imaging, but there's no equalizer (there usually isn't) to dampen the treble.The real test of the computer probably can't happen for another year, when it's full of cookies and assorted other garbage. I think Windows 10 is slightly better than Windows 8, with the exception of the search function it's a little easier to navigate through the essential setting controls (analogous to the great "Control Panel" that Windows 7 had, and the Microsoft got rid of with Windows 8).The initial set-up is especially annoying, with pop-ups (for example, when you want to download Java, which I still haven't done successfully) advertising free Windows scanning and repairing..only it's NOT free, the pop-up is difficult to close, and when I ran the scan (that's free, the repair is not), it found over 200 errors in a computer I had barely used. These are the annoyances that PC users have become used to seeing, and one reason many switch to Apple.Bottom line: You get a lot more for $700 or so then you used to! If the 15.6" screen size and resulting extra weight are ok with you (for example, I rarely take my laptop out traveling, so lightweight portability is not much of an issue) you get a really excellent monitor, a great solid-state build, and an I-5 CPU. Take a look at other laptops selling for under $800, and I think this is probably as good as any of them. It's not going to outperform a $1,200 computer, but you shouldn't expect that, of course. Also, consider getting an extended warranty from Square Trade or some other company (read the fine print always); it may be worth it in the long run. This review was written in exchange for a state and federally-taxed (no longer) free product sent for my evaluation.

What a great surprise from a company I had previously associated with fairly pedestrian products.This is a heavy-duty spiral notebook with some great features. I like the cloth covering over the metal spiral binding; it protects anything else you might have in a back pack, or in your hands. It serves a very useful purpose, and I imagine that in combination with the very solid covers, it will enhance the durability of the notebook, thereby justifying its cost.Plastic tabs guide you to five paper dividers, each with very solid and expandable plastic pockets. These kick it over others I have seen, and are another reason to spend the extra money. Of course, you can move the dividers anywhere in the notebook you'd like, leaving more paper for some topics than others.I recommend this over Five Star Advance Spiral Notebook, 5-Subject, 200 College-Ruled Sheets, 11 x 8.5 Inch Sheet Size, Green (72817) , a similar notebook but with tabs on the top section of the binding, rather than the much more convenient right-protruding tabs here. Moreover, the cloth-covering of the spiral binding on this notebook extends all the way up the side, for a more pleasing appearance and better gripping than the comparison notebook.With expandable plastic pockets on each solidly constructed divider, an innovative protective cloth over the spiral binding, and durable covers, this is a very well-designed notebook. If you prefer perforated spiral notebook sheets to the traditional 3-hold punch sheets, and, especially, you need the extra durability, this may be just what you need!

What a great surprise from a company I had previously associated with fairly pedestrian products.This is a heavy-duty spiral notebook with some great features.  I like the cloth covering over the metal spiral binding; it protects anything else you might have in a back pack, or in your hands.  Aesthetically, it's a bit awkward though:  It doesn't go all the way up, because the upper portion is reserved for the color-coded tab dividers (more on those later).  However, it serves a very useful purpose, and I imagine that in combination with the very solid covers, it will enhance the durability of the notebook, thereby justifying its cost.Those plastic tabs are your guide to the location of five paper dividers, each with very solid, multiple plastic pockets.  These kick it over others I have seen, and are another reason to spend the extra money.  Of course, you can move the dividers anywhere in the notebook you'd like, leaving more paper for some topics than others.The only thing I didn't particularly like was the placement of the tabs on the left side; they're harder to grab, and, again, the aesthetics of an otherwise nice-looking notebook seem questionable.  It's not a major drawback, though, as you can easily navigate to a divider when the notebook is open.With three nicely-designed plastic pockets per divider, an innovative protective cloth over the spiral binding, and durable covers, this is very well-designed notebook.  If you prefer perforated spiral notebook sheets to the traditional 3-hold punch sheets, and you need the extra durability, you may want to consider buying this notebook..

I didn't have a child to try this on, and the dog wasn't being very cooperative, so...I liked it!  It has a mostly pleasant, light scent, sort of lime with undertones of bubblegum. I know that may sound unappealing, but I don't think the fragrance is overdone; however, I can imagine others not liking it.  In addition, that scent did linger for a little while... Actually, I'm not sure how much I would like this in the long run.You don't need to use much, it's clear, has a light viscosity, and lathers without turning your hair into something like a washing machine with too much Tide in it. I don't think it's *completely* sting-free should you get some in your eyes, but I don't know if it's appreciably worse than products designed for kids.  I would ask friends with little kids what they use and then compare.  However, aside from the somewhat chemical-ridden list of ingredients (which also makes me suspect-though I don't know this-that a "simpler" ingredient list might be easier on the eyes of babe) trying this product out is a relatively expensive proposition.  This seems much too way over-priced to me. Lower it by 20-35%, and I might consider getting it again. However, even though I thought this was a pretty good product, the cost and the fact that I'm not totally pleased with it makes that unlikely.

If I was very pleasantly surprised by this blanket, you should hear what the dog thinks!  I'll translate, albeit loosely:Thank you, thank you, thank you, thank you, fellow person!  I love this ultra-soft thing you got for me.  I love it when you put it over me (keeps me warm, but not too hot), and under me...well, after eating, walking, flirting/standing my ground with other dogs, sleeping, and that weird squeaky owl you keep in the house, this is just one of my favorite things (even if you can't eat the fake bones someone drew on it).  It's also wonderful to lay down or sleep on, so SOFT and PLUSH, it is so much better than those other so-called blankets you've given me, and waaaaay better than the floor!  You think I sometimes don't listen to you, but I've heard you talk about how well it does in the laundry even after I *supposedly* get it dirty. (I am a very clean dog.)  This blanket does everything you and I had hoped it would; in fact, it exceeds our expectations.  I think you should get me another one for Christmas.  I think I'll go lay down now (but let me know if you need help with leftovers; you can even wake me for that).

That's some copy writer they hired over at European Soaps, LLC:"May in Provence, that special time of year when Rose de Mai blooms for five weeks only.... Each bloom is hand-picked early morning, ...placed into the harvest basket...captures the essence of its hundred, fragrant petals..."OK, let's assume that all of the above is true.  It's OK if it's not; the soap can stand on its own merits: A rich smell (Notez bien: do not purchase if you're sensitive to scents or don't adore roses), beautifully presented inside and out, and, a hundred petals or not, it really is from France. It's quad-milled too, which means that the ingredients are mixed around four separate times, resulting in less water and a longer-lasting product.So, you may wonder why this doesn't receive the coveted 5-star rating, the consumer products equivalent of the Palme D'or.It's the ingredients.  As you know, soap is a product of saponification, the mixture of a fat or oil with an alkali salt.  We can expect, therefore, that some sort of salt will be present (lye, for example, is an alkali salt).  However, there are many, many other chemicals to select from the (complete) ingredient list, not all of which sound so Gallic-ly romantic.These include:*Cl 73360 (D &C red 30 lake), Cl 17200 (D&C red 33 al lake).(Whoa, the color is apparently not completely from les roses de Mai...)There's also Sodium chloride, tetra-sodium etidronate, sodium hydroxide, tetrasodium EDTA, Sodium palmate, sodium palm kernelate (must be the salts).Also, benzyl alcohol, amyl cinnamyl alcohol, cinnamyl alcohol, methyl 2-octynoate hydroxyisohexyl, 3-cyclohexene carboxaldehyde, alpha isomethyl ionone, hexyl cinnamal, butyphenyl methylpropional, benzyl benzoate.The good-sounding stuff:rosmarinus officinalis (rosemary) leaf extract, helianthuus annuus (sunflower) seed oil,  botanical rose blend (rosa damascena flower wax & rosa centifolia flower wax), butyrospermum parkii (shea) butter extract, rosa damascena (rose) flower extract, aqua (water), parfum (fragrance).  And also...over 15 other ingredients including palm acid, glycerin, EDTA, citronellol, geraniol, benzyl salicylate, linalool, hydroxycityronellal, eugenol, citral, limonene, anise alcohol, cinnamal, benzyl cinnamate, coumarin, amy cinnamal, farnesol,and  isoeugenol.Now I'm not gonna go all flouride on you.  All of these may be completely natural, found in les jardins de Provence or on the stairwell of Le Tour Eiffel.  I'm not a chemist (apparently a requirement for really knowing your soaps), and it may be that a lot of these ingredients are pretty standard.However, it's a question of aesthetics.  They want to emphasize the hundred, fragrant petals; but I also see an ingredient list that reads like an order for Chem. 101.  Tom's of Maine, at least, tells you where the ingredients come from.  Now, all of this may be completely irrelevant.  It's a very good product; I just wish I knew a little more about what goes into the mill (x 4).

5* only if you need it, and you need it if you have spotty connections with certain websites, or the connection fades at unreasonably short distances.  SOrry to pass this on to others, but their reviews have much more on which of the newer computers are likely to benefit from this and for which this is less likely to improve performance.  For a 3-year old computer with an 8.1 Windows system and an old, old, router, I found that this increased reliability.HOWEVER (and, ye,s that's a big "however") this will NOT connect to Amazon's amazing Kindle line.  That is a big negative for me, because my laptop experiences very few problems at home.  When I go on a trip, however, I pack lightly, taking one of my Kindles with me.  Signal strength at hotels can vary greatly:  On a recent trip down the California coast, one hotel (in Monterey, FYI) had fine signal strength; the other (near UCSB), had a weak signal.  I opened up the TP-Link package for the first time, thinking how smart I was to bring it on the trip. BUt noooooooooooooooo, the USB connector will not fit into a KIndle (the TP-LINK connector is too big), only a laptop.  Maybe someone here knows of an adapter; I'd appreciate the information; otherwise, I'd rather buy a high gain device with a Kindle-fitting USB connector.

This oven towel--Excusez-moi!--SERVIETTE DE CUISINE!--is a large thick somewhat waffle-textured towel that is definitely better than one or two oven mitts or smallish oven towels for removing hot baking trays or casseroles (le cassoulet, je pense) from a hot oven.  That's because it's easier to use one cloth barrier than two smaller ones: It can be folded in more ways and covers more area  than something smaller or something that requires two separate heat buffers (e.g., two oven mitts).  It's a nice off-white, folds easily-it's not too think-and yet it's thick enough to protect your hands. No, it's not the next new thing, but if you're looking for a new barrier between your hands and that straight-from-the-oven delight, these are definitely worth considering.
